Title: Civil Actions - Child Sexual Abuse - Definition, Damages, and Statute of Limitations (The Child Victims Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "sexual abuse" for purposes relating to civil actions for child sexual abuse to include any act that involves an adult allowing or encouraging a child to engage in certain activities; establishing certain limitations on damages that may be awarded under the Act; repealing the statute of limitations in certain civil actions relating to child sexual abuse; repealing a statute of repose for certain civil actions relating to child sexual abuse; providing for the retroactive application of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The Child Victims Act of 2023 significantly revises Maryland laws on child sexual abuse civil actions by removing statutes of limitations, defining sexual abuse more broadly, and establishing caps on damages.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government agencies including the Courts, Education, and State Government departments.
stakeholders: Victims of child sexual abuse, legal system, educational institutions, and government agencies.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive legal overhaul, including the removal of statutes of limitations and retroactive application, representing a significant and innovative change in handling child sexual abuse cases.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily changes legal rules and does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Union Dues
Synopsis: Allowing a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for certain union dues paid during the taxable year; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill allows Maryland taxpayers to deduct union dues paid during the taxable year from their income for tax purposes, up to a maximum of $250 per year.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Union members and Maryland taxpayers
innovative_summary: This bill introduces a tax deduction for union dues, which is a standard tax policy approach, not employing new technologies or novel methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs aimed at reducing child poverty.

Title: Maryland State Police Gun Center – Firearms Surrendered Under Final Protective Orders
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the Maryland State Police Gun Center to include the tracking, screening, and vetting of all firearms surrendered under final protective orders in the State; and requiring each law enforcement agency to report to the Center the number and type of firearms surrendered, the jurisdictions where the firearms were surrendered, and certain information regarding the individual who surrendered each firearm under final protective orders.
bill_summary: The bill expands the purpose of the Maryland State Police Gun Center to include tracking, screening, and vetting firearms surrendered under final protective orders, and requires law enforcement agencies to report information on these firearms.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police Department
stakeholders: Firearm owners subject to final protective orders, law enforcement agencies, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a statewide database and systematic reporting to monitor firearms surrendered under protective orders, integrating tracking and vetting processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's direct impact on child poverty is minimal, focusing mainly on firearm tracking and law enforcement procedures.

Title: Criminal Law - Sexual Crimes - Repeal of Spousal Defense
Synopsis: Repealing a certain prohibition on prosecuting a person for rape or a certain sexual offense against a victim who was the person's legal spouse at the time of the alleged rape or sexual offense.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the legal prohibition on prosecuting a person for certain sexual crimes against their spouse, including rape, unless specific conditions apply such as living apart under certain agreements or divorce decrees.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or criminal justice agencies involved in prosecution
stakeholders: Victims of sexual offenses, legal and prosecutorial agencies, spouses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes legal rules related to prosecution of sexual offenses against spouses; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it addresses legal procedures for sexual offense prosecution.

Title: Department of General Services - Energy-Conserving Standards (Maryland Sustainable Buildings Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of General Services to establish and periodically update standards for State buildings to conserve energy and minimize adverse impacts on birds; requiring the Maryland Green Building Council to include the standards in certain requirements established for the Maryland High Performance Green Building Program; defining "State building" as one acquired, constructed, or renovated by the State or one for which 50% of the money for acquisition, construction, or renovation came from State funds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of General Services to establish and periodically update standards for state buildings to conserve energy and reduce bird collisions, including guidelines for lighting and construction. It also mandates inclusion of these standards in certain green building programs.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: State buildings, public taxpayers, environmental groups, and building occupants
innovative_summary: The program employs new standards focused on bird-friendly building designs and energy conservation, including lighting controls and updates every 5 years.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on sustainable and efficient government infrastructure could contribute to long-term savings, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Equity in Transportation Sector - Guidelines and Analyses
Synopsis: Requiring that equity be considered when State transportation plans, reports, and goals are developed; altering the membership of the advisory committee on State transportation goals; requiring the Maryland Department of Transportation to conduct transit equity analyses, cost-benefit analyses, and consult with certain communities before announcing or proposing any major service change or any reduction or cancellation of a certain capital expansion project in the construction program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland's Department of Transportation to incorporate equity considerations into transportation planning and decision-making processes. It mandates analyses and community consultation before implementing major service changes or reductions in transportation projects, emphasizes transparency through public reports, and establishes advisory committees.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Transportation riders, communities affected by transportation changes, low-income populations, persons with disabilities, minority and senior communities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive community engagement process with detailed equity analyses, public reporting, and recommendations, utilizing federal guidelines and best practices to promote equitable transportation policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty by ensuring transportation policies are equitable and community-inclusive, which can improve access to education and services.

Title: Correctional Officers’ Retirement System – Talbot County
Synopsis: Requiring membership in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System for certain local detention center officers of Talbot County in the event Talbot County becomes a participating governmental unit in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System; and providing that certain local detention center officers who join the Correctional Officers' Retirement System and receive certain service credit shall no longer be members of the Employees' Pension System and shall have no further rights to any benefit in the Employees' Pension System.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that Talbot County detention center officers become members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System if Talbot County joins it, and establishes rules for transferring their service credits and pension rights.
responsible_party: Talbot County government and Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Talbot County detention center officers and local government employees in Talbot County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for transitioning county detention officers into a designated retirement system upon local participation, with provisions for transfer of service credits and benefits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is minimal as the bill focuses on pension system membership for detention officers.

Title: Private Well Safety Act of 2023
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations by December 31, 2026, to identify additional standards for water quality testing; requiring the Department, subject to certain funding and in consultation with the Department of Information Technology, to utilize an online portal to receive and upload certain information and to provide public access to the information; requiring the Department of the Environment to consistently share the information collected with the Maryland Department of Health and local health departments; etc.
bill_summary: The Private Well Safety Act of 2023 establishes a program and fund to address private well water contamination in Maryland, including testing, remediation, data management, and property sale provisions.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Private well owners, residents in Maryland, local health departments, real estate buyers and sellers
innovative_summary: The bill employs an online portal to facilitate data sharing and public access to private well water testing results, integrating technology for environmental monitoring and transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could impact child poverty by ensuring access to safe drinking water, which is essential for health and well-being.

Title: Equitable and Inclusive Transit-Oriented Development Enhancement Act
Synopsis: Repealing the authority of the Secretary of Transportation to designate transit-oriented development; establishing the Transit-Oriented Development Capital Grant and Revolving Loan Fund to promote the equitable and inclusive development of transit-oriented developments; authorizing the Department of Transportation to use the Fund to provide financial assistance to local jurisdictions; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an amount sufficient to ensure a Fund balance of at least $5,000,000; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Transit-Oriented Development Capital Grant and Revolving Loan Fund to promote equitable and inclusive development around transit stations and corridors in Maryland, providing financial assistance to local jurisdictions for planning, infrastructure, and development projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Residents, local governments, transit agencies, private developers, and communities near transit stations and corridors
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated fund and structured program to incentivize transit-oriented development with an emphasis on equity and inclusivity, using targeted financial assistance and collaboration with various stakeholders.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by promoting equitable development, improving access to transit, and supporting affordable housing and community investments.

Title: Hate Crimes – Civil Remedy
Synopsis: Providing that a person who is the victim of an act that would constitute a violation of certain hate crime laws may bring a civil action against the person or persons who committed the act in a court of competent jurisdiction; and authorizing the court to impose an injunction and award certain economic and noneconomic damages.
bill_summary: This bill provides victims of acts that would violate hate crime laws in Maryland the right to file a civil lawsuit against the perpetrators, allowing for injunctions and damages including economic, noneconomic, and punitive damages.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and legal system
stakeholders: Victims of hate crimes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a civil litigation avenue for hate crime victims, expanding legal remedies beyond criminal prosecution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may support victims in vulnerable communities.

Title: Family Law - Grounds for Divorce
Synopsis: Repealing the authority of the court to decree a limited divorce; and altering certain grounds for an absolute divorce.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the authority to decree a limited divorce and makes comprehensive changes to grounds for absolute divorce, including eliminating certain grounds and modifying separation periods.
responsible_party: Maryland Family Law Courts
stakeholders: Married individuals and families in Maryland seeking divorce
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes legal divorce grounds and procedures, with no use of new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education – Title IX – Notice (Hear Our Voices Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each public school to provide information to students, faculty, staff, and parents regarding who serves as the Title IX coordinator for the school, the process in place for filing a sexual misconduct complaint, and the support measures that are in place for filing a sexual misconduct complaint and how to access the support measures.
bill_summary: The bill requires all public schools in Maryland to inform students, staff, and parents about their Title IX coordinator, the procedures for reporting sexual misconduct, and available support resources. It aims to improve awareness and accessibility related to sexual misconduct reporting and support.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, faculty, staff, and parents in public schools in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes the dissemination of information related to Title IX and sexual misconduct procedures across all public schools, employing a proactive informational approach to foster safer school environments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on information dissemination and policies regarding sexual misconduct.

Title: Maryland General and Limited Power of Attorney Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering a certain statutory form for a general power of attorney by including certain provisions informing the principal and agent of certain matters, granting general authority with respect to tangible personal property and trusts and estates, authorizing the principal to grant the agent certain specific powers relating to successor agents, compensation, gifts, or transfers and opening joint accounts and beneficiary designations, and clarifying the force and effect of the form; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's statutory forms for general and limited powers of attorney to include provisions related to governmental benefits, programs, and digital assets. It enhances the powers granted to agents in managing property, financial, trust, estate, and benefit-related matters, explicitly including authority over digital assets and government benefit eligibility.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Estates and Trusts
stakeholders: Individuals creating or using powers of attorney, estate planners, legal professionals, and beneficiaries involved in estate, trust, and benefit matters
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates provisions for digital assets and governmental benefits into Maryland's statutory powers of attorney, representing a modernization of estate planning tools that employs current technology and broadens governmental benefit access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill can potentially improve access to government benefits and manage resources effectively, which may help reduce child poverty, but it does not directly target child poverty reduction.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists - License and Registration Issuance and Renewals - Electronic Means
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists to issue electronic licenses and registrations, except under certain circumstances; requiring the Board, on an applicant's request, to print a paper copy of the verification of licensure or registration and send it by first-class mail to the address on the application; repealing the requirement that the Board include certain information on each license and registration; and requiring the Board to send renewal notices by first-class mail under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Examiners of Psychologists to issue electronic licenses and registrations, alters procedures for sending renewal notices, and mandates criminal history record checks for certain renewal applicants and reinstatements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners of Psychologists
stakeholders: Psychologists, psychology licensees, and the associated professional community in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs digital technology to issue and handle licenses and renewal notices, streamlining processes and reducing reliance on paper notices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily pertains to licensing procedures for psychologists.

Title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Notices and Payoff Amount for Redemption
Synopsis: Requiring that the holder of a certificate of sale include the e-mail address of certain persons in certain notices required to be sent to certain persons with an interest in a property that is sold at a tax sale; authorizing certain persons with an interest in owner-occupied property sold at a tax sale to request the current payoff amount to redeem the property; providing that the payoff amount to redeem the property provided by the holder of the certificate to the owner of the property is valid for 30 days; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises notice and payoff procedures for properties sold at tax sales in Maryland, including adding email notification requirements and establishing a process for owner–occupied residential property owners to request current payoff amounts before foreclosure.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation or the relevant local tax collector's office
stakeholders: Owners of owner–occupied residential properties sold at tax sales in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances communication by requiring email notices and formalizes a process for requesting current redemption payoff amounts, incorporating technology and formal procedures to aid property owners.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by helping owner–occupied families manage property tax sales and prevent losses that could impact children’s housing stability.

Title: Mobile and Manufactured Homes - Relocation Plans and Sales of Communities (Manufactured Housing Modernization Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Altering requirements relating to relocation plans for mobile home parks to require a plan for park residents who will be dislocated as a result of the change in land use; requiring the owner, 60 days prior to entering into a contract to sell the community, to provide notice of the terms of the offer to homeowners in the community and provide them the opportunity to purchase the housing community; requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to list certain agencies to assist homeowners with the purchase of a community; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes regulations concerning the sale and relocation of mobile and manufactured homes in Maryland. It establishes procedures for relocations due to land use changes, restricts certain sale conditions, and requires community owners to provide notices and allow homeowners to purchase communities.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homeowners in manufactured housing communities, mobile home park residents, community owners
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive legal framework that enhances homeowner protections and promotes community stability through notice requirements, purchase opportunities, and allowed restrictions on sales.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by protecting affordable housing for residents.

Title: Health Occupations - Psychologists - Licensure Qualification
Synopsis: Requiring an individual, in order to be licensed as a psychologist by the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists, to have a doctoral degree in psychology from a certain school or university, to have received a postdoctoral respecialization certificate from a certain department of psychology that included a minimum of 1,750 hours in supervised internship, and to have completed at least 1,500 hours postcertification advanced training hours or precertification hours of service as a registered psychology associate; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends the qualifications required to be licensed as a psychologist in Maryland, including updates to the definitions of doctoral degrees and the requirements for supervised experience and postdoctoral training.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners of Psychologists
stakeholders: Aspiring psychologists and licensing applicants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates educational and experiential licensing requirements and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Environment - On-Site Wastewater Services - Board, Fees, and Penalties
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the State Board of On-Site Wastewater Professionals; clarifying and altering the distribution of certain fees and penalties; and clarifying the application of certain license requirements and penalties.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for on-site wastewater inspection professionals, creating a licensing system, a state board, and a dedicated fund to support these initiatives. It sets licensing standards, fee structures, and penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: On-site wastewater service providers, local governments, environmental health departments, and property owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill employs a regulated licensing system and a dedicated fund, introducing systematic oversight and funding mechanisms for wastewater professionals, which is a structured approach but not highly innovative in technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on professional licensing and regulatory frameworks for wastewater services.

Title: Maryland Food System Resiliency Council
Synopsis: Establishing that the Maryland Food System Resiliency Council is in the Office of Resilience in the Maryland Department of Emergency Management; and altering the process for electing a cochair of the Council.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Food System Resiliency Council within the Office of Resilience in the Maryland Department of Emergency Management. It defines the membership, leadership, and operational procedures for the Council, including representation from various state agencies, industry groups, and experts, to improve food system resilience.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Food producers, food security organizations, local food councils, and Maryland residents impacted by food system issues.
innovative_summary: The program creates a comprehensive, multi-stakeholder council to coordinate food system resilience efforts, including public-private partnerships and expert input, which introduces a structured, collaborative approach to food security.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by strengthening local food systems and increasing food security for vulnerable populations.

Title: Real Property – Actions to Repossess – Proof of Rental Licensure
Synopsis: Requiring, in certain actions to repossess residential rental property, a landlord to submit to the clerk of the court evidence of compliance with local rental property licensure requirements and demonstrate that the landlord is compliant with the licensure requirements.
bill_summary: The bill requires landlords to prove their rental property is properly licensed when filing to repossess property for nonpayment or breach of lease, including demonstrating compliance with local licensing requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State or local housing authorities and courts
stakeholders: Landlords, tenants, and local housing authorities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal requirement for landlords to demonstrate compliance with local rental licensing laws during repossession proceedings, integrating licensing verification into legal process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is likely indirect and minimal, focusing on legal compliance and property management.

Title: Commercial Law - Consumer Protection - Telephone Solicitation (Stop the Spam Calls Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from making certain telephone solicitations to a certain called party in a certain manner by restricting the methods, times, and identifying information that the person making the call may utilize; providing that the Act does not apply to certain entities and circumstances; and making a violation of the Act an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice that is subject to enforcement and penalties under the Maryland Consumer Protection Act.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Stop the Spam Calls Act of 2023, establishes regulations and restrictions on telephone solicitations in Maryland, including bans on certain calling methods, hours, and identity concealment, and defines penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Utilities or Consumer Protection Agency
stakeholders: Maryland residents receiving telephone solicitations, telemarketers, and consumer protection agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs technological transparency measures such as caller identification and restrictions on caller identity concealment, representing a modern approach to telephone solicitation regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is minimal as the bill primarily addresses telemarketing practices and consumer protection.

Title: Courts - Judgments - Exemptions From Execution
Synopsis: Exempting up to $500 in a deposit account or other accounts of a judgment debtor held by a depository institution from execution on the judgment without an election by the debtor to exempt the money; establishing procedures a depository institution is required to follow on receipt of a writ of garnishment or other levy or attachment under certain circumstances; establishing a $6,000 limit on the cumulative value of property and cash that may be exempted; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises exemption rules for debtors against judgments, including increasing certain exemption limits for cash and property, and establishing procedures for garnishments and exemptions from executions.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Judicial Proceedings
stakeholders: Judgment debtors and creditors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new procedural rules and specific exemption limits, including caps on garnishable accounts and procedures for garnishments, but it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may tangentially protect debtor assets from garnishment.

Title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Payment of Balance After Foreclosure
Synopsis: Requiring each county to establish a process for a person entitled to  any balance over the amount required for the payment of taxes, interest, penalties, and costs of sale to claim the balance after a tax sale foreclosure; and requiring the collector of taxes for a county to notify the prior property owner, within 90 days after delivering a deed to a purchaser, of the amount of a certain balance and the process for claiming the balance.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland counties to establish a process for individuals to claim any remaining balance after a property tax sale foreclosure and mandates notification to the previous property owner about such balances.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and their tax collectors
stakeholders: Previous property owners and taxpayers involved in tax sales
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a standardized process for claiming remaining balances after tax foreclosures and mandates notification, enhancing transparency and fairness in property tax proceedings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may indirectly impact child poverty by improving property rights and potentially stabilizing communities, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program – Collaborative Care Model Services – Implementation and Reimbursement Expansion
Synopsis: Repealing the Collaborative Care Pilot Program; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to expand access to and provide reimbursement for services provided in accordance with the Collaborative Care Model under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Department of Health to implement and reimburse services in accordance with the Collaborative Care Model for somatic and behavioral health services in primary care settings under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, replacing the previous pilot program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients in Maryland, primarily those receiving primary care, behavioral health, or combined services
innovative_summary: The bill extends the implementation of a collaborative, integrated care approach that uses standardized measurement tools and proactive management, leveraging existing health models and data collection systems to improve behavioral health integration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access and quality of integrated health services for children and families, leading to better health and socio-economic outcomes.

Title: Human Services - Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council
Synopsis: Codifying the Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council as an instrumentality of the State to submit, monitor, implement, and evaluate the State Plan under the federal Rehabilitation Act in conjunction with Centers for Independent Living in the State; and requiring the Attorney General to be the legal advisor to the Council.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council as a formal entity of the state, with specified structure, duties, and oversight, to support independent living for individuals with disabilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council, with oversight and auditing by the designated State entity
stakeholders: People with disabilities in Maryland and community-based organizations dedicated to independent living
innovative_summary: The bill formalizes and clarifies the structure, governance, and responsibilities of the state council supporting independent living, but does not specify employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has some potential to impact child poverty by improving independence and support for individuals with disabilities, including children.

Title: Property Tax – Tax Sales – Requirement to Sell
Synopsis: Repealing certain limitations on the authority of certain local governments to set the time by which a property with taxes in arrears must be sold by the tax collector.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain limitations on the time local governments can set for selling properties with overdue taxes, making the rules for tax sale timings more flexible.
responsible_party: Local governments in Maryland (including county boards of commissioners and municipalities)
stakeholders: Property owners with overdue taxes and local government tax offices in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill mainly clarifies and expands existing rules for tax sales, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily affects tax sale procedures.

Title: Open Meetings Act - State Ethics Commission (Maryland State Agency Transparency Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing enhanced requirements under the Open Meetings Act for the State Ethics Commission; and requiring the Department of Information Technology to provide technical staff, support, and equipment necessary to livestream the open meetings of the State Ethics Commission.
bill_summary: The bill enhances transparency requirements under the Open Meetings Act for specific state agencies, including livestreaming open meetings, posting agendas and minutes online, and providing technical support for livestreaming.
responsible_party: Department of Information Technology and impacted agencies such as the State Ethics Commission, Maryland Transportation Authority, and Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: The public and entities involved in or affected by open meetings of the specified agencies
innovative_summary: The bill adopts technology-enhanced transparency measures like livestreaming meetings and digital recordkeeping, which represent a modernized approach to open government.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program primarily enhances transparency and accountability rather than directly addressing child poverty.

Title: Land Use - Public Service Companies - Pollinator-Friendly Vegetation Management and Utility-Designated Pollinator Areas
Synopsis: Prohibiting local jurisdictions from imposing any unreasonable limitations, including land use restrictions, on utility-designated pollinator areas maintained by a public service company under certain conditions; requiring certain public service companies to mow utility designated pollinator areas in a manner which minimizes disturbances to habitats; stating the intent of the General Assembly related to State and local laws regarding weed control and vegetation management by public service companies outside of pollinator areas; etc.
bill_summary: The bill restricts local jurisdictions from imposing limitations or restrictions on pollinator-friendly vegetation management activities of public service companies in designated pollinator areas, and sets rules for how these companies can mow and manage these areas to support pollinators.
responsible_party: Public Service Companies and relevant state agencies involved in land use and environmental management
stakeholders: Public service companies, environmental conservation organizations, pollinators, and local jurisdictions
innovative_summary: The program promotes environmentally sound and scientifically based vegetation management practices for pollinator habitats maintained by utility companies, incorporating integrated vegetation management and specific mowing schedules.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental and land use regulations.

Title: Certified Local Farm and Fish Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Altering the Certified Local Farm Enterprise Program to be the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program; expanding the purpose of the Program to include food from certified Chesapeake invasive species providers in the overall percentage goal of 20% of the unit's total dollar value for certain procurement contracts; and altering the Certified Local Farm Enterprise Food Aggregation Grant Fund to be the Certified Local Farm and Fish Food Aggregation Grant Fund.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the 'Certified Local Farm and Chesapeake Invasive Species Provider Fish Program' to promote procurement from local farms and certified Chesapeake invasive species fish providers, and creates a grant fund to support food aggregation, storage, and distribution sites.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation
stakeholders: Local farms, Chesapeake invasive species fish providers, state agencies, food procurement entities, and consumers
innovative_summary: The program encourages procurement from certified invasive species providers and establishes a food aggregation fund, integrating invasive species into local food systems with funding support; it employs a certification process and procurement targets.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve local food access and economic opportunities, which may help reduce child poverty.

Title: Circuit Courts and District Court - Dishonored Checks - Service Charges
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of the service charge from $10 to $30 that may be imposed by a circuit court or the District Court for a dishonored check.
bill_summary: The bill increases the service charge that a court can impose for dishonored checks from $10 to $30 in Maryland's circuit and district courts.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts (Circuit and District Courts)
stakeholders: Individuals who write checks that are dishonored, including those involved in court cases for motor vehicle, criminal, or civil matters.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes the legal limit for a service charge for dishonored checks, which is a standard legal adjustment without the use of new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly impacts legal fee structures.

Title: Safe Access for All (SAFE) Roads Act of 2023
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Transportation to implement all possible incremental near-term safety improvements as soon as practicable if a new approved pedestrian or bicycle safety construction or improvement project is projected to take more than 12 months to complete.
bill_summary: The Safe Access for All (SAFE) Roads Act of 2023 mandates the Maryland Department of Transportation and the State Highway Administration to incorporate proven safety measures for pedestrians and bicycles in road projects, report on safety improvements and staffing, and enhance pedestrian crossing safety in suburban centers, aiming to improve pedestrian and bicycle safety infrastructure across Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Pedestrians, bicyclists, local communities, transportation agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs data-driven safety measures, mandated reporting, and strategic planning to improve pedestrian and bicycle infrastructure, focusing on safety and accessibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by creating safer routes and infrastructure for children and families in high-density and transit-dependent areas.

Title: Business Regulation - Charitable Organizations
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "charitable contribution" to exclude an authorization for or a discount on the use of certain services or materials, equipment, or facilities for purposes of provisions of law regulating charitable organizations and charitable representatives; authorizing the Maryland Secretary of State to accept certain documentation in place of an audit or review in connection with a charitable organization's registration statement; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland laws regulating charitable organizations by redefining 'charitable contribution' to exclude certain property donations and service discounts, streamlining registration requirements, and allowing the Secretary of State to accept alternative documentation instead of audits or reviews under specific conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of State
stakeholders: Charitable organizations and the general public benefiting from charitable activities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new flexibility in documentation requirements for charitable organizations, allowing alternative proofs of compliance and financial health, which modernizes and simplifies registration processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for significant impact on child poverty through increased support for charitable activities and easier registration for organizations involved in social services.

Title: Public Schools - Anaphylactic Food Allergies - Guidelines
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education, before the start of the 2024-2025 school year, to adopt, implement, and publish guidelines in accordance with the State school health service guidelines to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic major food allergens in classrooms and common areas; requiring each public school to develop a system to disclose the major food allergens contained in the foods served in the school; requiring each county board to make a good faith effort to adopt certain guidelines; etc.
bill_summary: This bill mandates Maryland public schools to develop and implement guidelines to reduce the risk of anaphylactic food allergies, including required disclosures of major food allergens in school-served foods and establishing procedures for managing students with such allergies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Students with food allergies, parents, school staff, and food service providers
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining guideline development, food allergen disclosure, and collaborative management strategies to reduce food allergy risks.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve health and safety for children with allergies, indirectly benefiting children in low-income families by ensuring a safer school environment.

Title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Redemption
Synopsis: Requiring a tax collector to make certain attempts to contact a certain plaintiff or holder of a certificate of sale regarding certain expenses; and authorizing a collector to redeem certain property without a certain satisfaction letter if a plaintiff or holder of a certificate of sale fails to respond within 5 days after certain attempts by the collector to make contact.
bill_summary: This bill enhances procedures related to tax sales and the redemption process of properties sold for unpaid taxes in Maryland. It requires tax collectors to make contact attempts via phone and email for holders of certificates of sale and allows property redemption without a satisfaction letter if contacts are unsuccessful after a set period.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation (or relevant tax collection authority)
stakeholders: Property owners, holders of certificates of sale, local government tax offices
innovative_summary: The bill employs a more proactive contact approach, requiring phone and email outreach to holders of certificates of sale, streamlining the redemption process under certain circumstances.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on administrative procedures related to property tax sales and does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Disclosure of Tax Information – Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board – Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing, subject to certain limitations, the disclosure of a business entity's federal employer identification number, name, physical address, mailing address, contact name, e-mail address, and phone number to the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board and its authorized contractors for the purposes of administering the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Program and Trust.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the limited disclosure of certain tax information by the Maryland Comptroller to the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board and its contractors for the purpose of administering the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Program and Trust.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office and Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board
stakeholders: Small businesses and their owners in Maryland, state agencies, and contractors involved in the program
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted and secure approach to sharing tax information to enable a new retirement savings program for small businesses, utilizing existing governmental data with strict safeguards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to facilitate retirement savings for small business employees, possibly reducing child poverty indirectly by stabilizing family financial situations.

Title: Local Government - Regulatory Powers - Regulation of Invasive Bamboo
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing bodies of counties and municipalities to adopt ordinances to regulate invasive bamboo, including by prohibiting a person from selling, planting, and allowing invasive bamboo to grow on the property of the person without proper upkeep and appropriate containment measures.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local governments in Maryland to adopt ordinances regulating invasive bamboo, including prohibitions on selling, planting, and allowing it to grow or spread onto other properties or public areas.
responsible_party: Local government agencies in Maryland (counties and municipalities)
stakeholders: Property owners, local governments, and the general public concerned with invasive bamboo
innovative_summary: The bill employs local regulatory authority to manage invasive plant species through ordinances, which is a common approach but tailored to invasive bamboo.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Ground Leases - Collection of Rent, Interest, Fees, and Other Expenses - Registration Requirements
Synopsis: Establishing that ground leases or amendments that are not posted on the State Department of Assessments and Taxation's website are not considered registered or amended; prohibiting a ground lease holder from collecting or attempting to collect rent, late fees, interest, collection costs, and other expenses related to a ground lease unless the ground lease is registered with the Department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires ground leases and amendments to be registered on a state online registry for them to be considered valid. It prohibits ground lease holders from collecting rent, fees, or related expenses unless the lease is registered. The bill establishes a process for disputes related to improper collection efforts and allows tenants or leaseholders to seek judicial review.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Ground lease holders and leasehold tenants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs an online registry to verify lease registration status and a formal process for dispute resolution, including affidavits, notices, and court proceedings, which is a modern approach to managing ground lease enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could have an indirect impact on child poverty by aiding tenants in avoiding unlawful collection practices and securing their rights, which may improve housing stability.

Title: Residential Ground Leases - Redemption and Extinguishment - Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing the prohibition against a tenant who is seeking to redeem or extinguish ground rent providing certain documentation and payments to the State Department of Assessments and Taxation earlier than 90 days after an application for redemption or extinguishment has been posted on the Department's website.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the process for leasehold tenants to redeem or extinguish ground rents by allowing earlier documentation and payment to the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation, and provides clear procedures for posting notices and handling disputes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Leasehold tenants, ground leaseholders, property owners, Baltimore City property authorities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, transparent process for redeeming or extinguishing ground rents with specified timelines, posted notices, and dispute resolution, using a government-managed record system.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could help reduce burdens related to property costs, potentially impacting low-income families and communities by simplifying ground rent redemption procedures.

Title: Condominiums - Mandatory Insurance Coverage - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the types of elements and units for which a council of unit owners is required to maintain certain property insurance and altering certain requirements for the property insurance policy; and requiring owners of detached units to carry homeowners insurance on the entirety of the unit.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that owners of detached condominium units in Maryland carry homeowners insurance on the entire unit, and modifies the property insurance requirements and processes for condominiums, including the types of coverage the council of unit owners must maintain.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or equivalent
stakeholders: Owners of condominium units, including detached unit owners, and condominium councils of unit owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a clear requirement for detached unit owners to carry individual homeowners insurance and updates insurance processes for condominiums, combining regulatory updates with practical insurance coverage mandates.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill likely has a limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting property and liability insurance requirements for condominium owners.

Title: Real Property - Actions for Possession - Pet Protections
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Agriculture to publish a fact sheet on the protection of pets in the event of an eviction or any other loss of possession of real property; requiring a landlord to provide a link to the fact sheet on the Department's website at the execution of a lease on or after November 1, 2023; requiring the Maryland Judiciary to provide a link to the fact sheet at certain times; requiring a sheriff or any other official to return a pet to a tenant or certain other person or to contact an animal shelter or rescue organization; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Agriculture to develop and publish a fact sheet on pet care and protection during evictions or loss of property, and mandates landlords, the judiciary, and law enforcement to provide or display links to this fact sheet during relevant legal or eviction procedures. It also establishes rules for the safe return or handling of pets during evictions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture, Maryland Judiciary, law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Tenants with pets, landlords, animal shelters, animal rescue organizations, law enforcement, property owners
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach to protecting pets during eviction processes by mandating the creation and dissemination of an informational fact sheet and establishing protocols for the handling of pets during legal proceedings, employing informational and procedural innovations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has some potential to impact child poverty indirectly by supporting households with pets and preventing pet-related displacement issues within vulnerable families.

Title: Municipalities - Charter Amendments - Notice
Synopsis: Modifying the manner in which the chief executive officer of a municipality may fulfill certain notice requirements concerning proposed municipal charter amendments; and requiring the municipality to maintain certain records or receipts and make the records or receipts available to the public.
bill_summary: The bill modifies procedures for municipalities in Maryland to notify the public about charter amendments, including posting notices and distributing summaries through newspapers and other publications, and requires record-keeping of receipt of notifications.
responsible_party: Municipal governments of Maryland
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland municipalities, municipal officials
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and emphasizes record-keeping and public access for municipal notice procedures, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program, Maryland Children's Health Program, and Workgroup on Low-Income Utility Assistance
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to establish an Express Lane Eligibility Program by January 1, 2025, to enroll individuals, based on certain eligibility, in the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and the Maryland Children's Health Program; and requiring the Workgroup on Low-Income Utility Assistance to submit a final report to certain committees of the General Assembly by January 1, 2024, of its findings and recommendations, including recommended legislative and regulatory changes.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Department of Health to create an Express Lane Eligibility Program for enrolling individuals into the Maryland Medical Assistance and Children's Health Program based on SNAP eligibility and requires the Workgroup on Low–Income Utility Assistance to submit final reports with recommendations by January 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Low-income individuals and families eligible for Medicaid, Children's Health Program, and utility assistance programs in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an Express Lane Eligibility Program that uses SNAP eligibility to streamline enrollment in health programs, and establishes a dedicated workgroup to evaluate and improve utility assistance programs, employing coordinated eligibility approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has strong potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to health coverage and utility assistance for low-income families.

Title: Worcester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Ocean City Promoter's License
Synopsis: Establishing an Ocean City promoter's license in Worcester County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Worcester County to issue the license to a for-profit organization to sell and serve beer, wine, and liquor at an entertainment event that is held on premises located within the corporate limits of the Town of Ocean City, owned by the Town of Ocean City, and approved in writing by the Ocean City Police Department; and authorizing a license fee of $5,000 per entertainment event.
bill_summary: This bill establishes an Ocean City promoter's license in Worcester County, Maryland, allowing certain organizations to sell and serve alcohol at specific entertainment events within Ocean City, subject to regulations and approval.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Worcester County
stakeholders: For-profit organizations, event attendees, local businesses, residents of Ocean City
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized alcohol license for entertainment events in Ocean City, with regulation and oversight by local authorities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on alcohol licensing for entertainment events is unlikely to directly impact child poverty.

Title: Ground Leases – Notices and Billing – Forms and Requirements
Synopsis: Prohibiting a leasehold tenant of an unregistered ground lease from being required to hold more than 3 years of ground rent in escrow; requiring a ground lease holder to mail certain notices or bills to a leasehold tenant in a certain manner under certain circumstances; requiring the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to make available on its website the form a ground lease holder must use to provide a leasehold tenant bills or notices; etc.
bill_summary: The bill imposes new rules and requirements on ground lease holders, including notification, billing, and transfer processes, especially for unregistered and redeemable ground leases, with the aim of protecting leasehold tenants and promoting the redemption of ground rents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Ground lease tenants, property owners, and ground lease holders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill includes standardized notification and billing forms developed by the Department, employing technology for consistent communication, but largely updates regulatory procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on ground lease regulations; it does not directly target child poverty but could indirectly benefit tenants.

Title: Mental Health - Treatment Plans for Individuals in Facilities and Resident Grievance System
Synopsis: Requiring a treatment plan for an individual with a mental disorder admitted to a certain health care facility to include a discharge goal and an estimate of the probable length of the inpatient stay before the individual can be transferred to a certain setting; requiring certain facility staff to review and reassess a plan of treatment within certain time periods; requiring the Department of Health to report annually to the General Assembly on the Resident Grievance System and the grievances received related to State facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires mental health treatment plans for individuals in facilities to include discharge goals and estimated length of stay, establishes participation rights for family members, sets review and reassessment procedures, and creates an appeals process for treatment plans. It also mandates annual reporting on the Resident Grievance System.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals in mental health facilities, their families, and mental health providers
innovative_summary: The program introduces specific rights, review procedures, and an organized grievance system, incorporating a structured oversight process for mental health treatment in facilities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate; improved treatment plans and grievance systems can potentially reduce the mental health barriers that contribute to child poverty.

Title: Vehicle Laws – HOV Lanes – Plug–In Electric Drive Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing certain plug-in electric drive vehicles for which a permit has been issued by the Motor Vehicle Administration to use high occupancy vehicle (HOV) lanes regardless of the number of passengers in the vehicles; requiring the Administration to charge a fee, not to exceed $20, for issuing the permit; and requiring, on or before January 1 each year, a report to be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly on the effect of the use of the plug-in electric drive vehicle permits on the operation of HOV lanes.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain plug-in electric vehicles with permits to use high occupancy vehicle (HOV) lanes regardless of the number of passengers, and it establishes a permit fee and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration, State Highway Administration, Department of State Police
stakeholders: Owners of qualifying plug-in electric drive vehicles in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a permit system for electric vehicles to access HOV lanes regardless of occupancy, leveraging a new authorization method.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily involves transportation policy and vehicle permissions.

Title: Mandated Reports - Revisions
Synopsis: Modifying certain reporting requirements for practicability and efficiency; and repealing certain reporting requirements that are unnecessary, obsolete, duplicative, or inefficient.
bill_summary: This bill primarily revises reporting requirements across various Maryland state agencies and programs to improve efficiency, remove obsolete or unnecessary reports, and adjust deadlines for existing reports. It also consolidates and modifies some existing reporting mandates, often removing the need for duplicate reports or replacing specific reporting entities.
responsible_party: Maryland state agencies and departments as specified in each reporting requirement
stakeholders: Maryland residents, government agencies, program participants, higher education institutions, local governments, and specific populations affected by the programs (such as foster youth, homeless youth, and health care recipients)
innovative_summary: The bill employs a pragmatic approach to improve government transparency and efficiency by consolidating, removing, and updating reporting requirements rather than introducing new technologies or innovative initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect; by streamlining government operations, it may improve service delivery and resource allocation, but it does not specifically target child poverty reduction.

Title: District Court - Small Claims - Enforcement of Money Judgments
Synopsis: Prohibiting the District Court, in aid of enforcement or execution of a money judgment resulting from a certain small claim action, from ordering the appearance of an individual for an examination or ordering an individual to answer interrogatories.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the District Court in Maryland from ordering individuals to appear for examinations or answer interrogatories in aid of enforcing small claims money judgments.
responsible_party: Maryland District Court
stakeholders: Individuals involved in small claims lawsuits and courts
innovative_summary: This is a rule change restricting certain enforcement procedures in small claims cases, rather than employing new technology or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may make enforcement of judgments easier or harder, which could indirectly affect financial stability.

Title: Private Passenger Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance - Enhanced Underinsured Motorist Coverage - Opt-Out Option
Synopsis: Converting enhanced underinsured motorist coverage from an opt-in offering of coverage into an opt-out coverage option under provisions of law establishing requirements for private passenger motor vehicle liability insurance; requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration to conduct a study on the impact of converting enhanced underinsured motorist coverage to an opt-out coverage option and report its findings to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2026, and December 31, 2028; etc.
bill_summary: The bill converts the offering of enhanced underinsured motorist coverage from an opt-in to an opt-out basis for private passenger vehicle insurance policies in Maryland, establishing new requirements and procedures for notices, waivers, and coverage election. It also mandates a study on the impact of this change.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Private passenger motor vehicle owners and insured individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs an innovative approach by shifting from an opt-in to an opt-out default for insurance coverage, leveraging default options to increase coverage adoption.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by increasing coverage related to motor vehicle accidents, potentially reducing financial hardship for affected families.

Title: Criminal Law – Unnatural or Perverted Sexual Practice – Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the crime of unnatural or perverted sexual practice.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the criminal offense of "unnatural or perverted sexual practice" and removes references to it from Maryland law pertaining to sexual conduct and related crimes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or relevant judicial authorities
stakeholders: Individuals charged or convicted of past crimes related to unnatural or perverted sexual practices, legal and judicial bodies, advocacy groups interested in criminal law reform
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves the repeal of an existing criminal law provision, with no new technologies or approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty since it focuses on criminal law reform rather than social or economic programs.

Title: Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Services - Journeyman License - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering certain qualifications for a journeyman license to provide heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration services to require having held an apprentice license for 4 rather than 3 years and having completed at least 6,000 rather than 1,875 hours of training under the direction and control of a licensed contractor.
bill_summary: The bill alters the qualifications for a journeyman license in heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration services, specifically increasing the required training hours from 1,875 to 6,000 hours and changing the experience period from 3 to 4 years.
responsible_party: Maryland Board for Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Services
stakeholders: Individuals seeking a journeyman license in heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration services in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill does not introduce new technologies or approaches; it mainly updates licensing qualifications and training requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty as it primarily changes licensing standards for professionals.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Recovery of Benefits - Limitation and Methods
Synopsis: Limiting the percentage of the weekly benefits amount that the Secretary of Labor may deduct from weekly benefits payable to a claimant to recover certain overpayments of unemployment insurance benefits to 50% of the weekly benefit or 25% if the benefit is less than $100; and clarifying the circumstances under which the Secretary may use certain methods to recover overpayments of unemployment insurance benefits.
bill_summary: The bill limits the amount the Secretary of Labor in Maryland can deduct from a claimant's weekly unemployment benefits to recover overpayments. It clarifies methods for recovering benefits and adjusts the timing for the bill's implementation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Unemployment benefit claimants and the Maryland Department of Labor
innovative_summary: This bill mainly updates existing procedures and limits on benefit recovery, without employing new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill impacts unemployment benefit recovery, which can influence income stability for unemployed individuals, potentially affecting child poverty levels.

Title: State Government – Commission on LGBTQIA+ Affairs – Alterations
Synopsis: Renaming the Commission on LGBTQ Affairs to be the Commission on LGBTQIA+ Affairs; increasing the number of members of the Commission from 15 to 21; altering certain qualifications for members appointed to the Commission; staggering the terms of Commission members; and altering the duties of the Commission.
bill_summary: The bill renames and modifies the composition, qualifications, and duties of the Commission on LGBTQIA+ Affairs in Maryland, including staggering the terms of its members, and broadening its scope to better serve LGBTQIA+ communities.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Community Initiatives in Maryland
stakeholders: LGBTQIA+ communities and all residents affected by policies related to LGBTQIA+ issues in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill modernizes the LGBTQIA+ Commission by expanding its membership, scope, and data collection efforts, and establishes formal duties to promote inclusion and address discrimination using a structured, data-driven approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially impact child poverty indirectly by promoting inclusive policies and reducing discrimination, which may improve social determinants affecting children in LGBTQIA+ families.

Title: Real Estate Brokers - Inactive Licenses - Requirements After Expiration
Synopsis: Requiring a person who fails to reactivate a real estate broker license on inactive status within 3 years to comply with specified requirements to obtain a license.
bill_summary: This bill updates the rules regarding inactive real estate broker licenses in Maryland. It specifies requirements for reactivating a license that has been inactive for more than three years, including renewing through continuing education or fulfilling additional requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate brokers, associate brokers, and salespersons in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies existing licensing rules and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Public Hearing Ho. Co. 13-23
Synopsis: Exempting applications for changing certain resident agents from the requirement that the Board of License Commissioners for Howard County hold a public hearing on the applications; and authorizing the Board to hold a public hearing on certain applications if the Board determines there is good cause for the hearing.
bill_summary: This bill exempts certain applications for changing a resident agent for alcoholic beverage licenses in Howard County from the requirement of holding a public hearing, provided the applicant has previously been approved for the same license without violations. It clarifies procedures for posting notices of hearings for license applications.
responsible_party: Howard County Board of License Commissioners and Howard County Office of Public Information
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and the general public in Howard County
innovative_summary: The bill offers a procedural exemption for specific license changes in Howard County, reducing the need for repeated hearings, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on administrative procedures for alcohol licensing.

Title: Maryland Electricians Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the entity that must administer or approve an apprenticeship program for electricians; substituting the term "uninsured" for the term "inactive" in certain provisions of law relating to liability insurance requirements for certain electricians; prohibiting a certain electrician from contracting to provide electrical services unless the electrical work is covered by certain liability insurance; specifying who is authorized and required to purchase certain insurance; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises the Maryland Electricians Act by changing the administering entity for apprenticeship programs, updating liability insurance requirements for electricians, and clarifying licensing procedures, including the use of inactive and uninsured statuses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Electricians
stakeholders: Electricians, electrical contractors, licensing applicants, consumers
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates regulations and requirements within existing frameworks; it does not establish new programs or services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly affect child poverty but may improve electrical safety and workforce standards.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Adaptive Reuse
Synopsis: Establishing that adaptive reuse, retrofitting, and repurposing of existing buildings to develop new affordable multifamily housing is an eligible use of certain financial assistance provided by the Department of Housing and Community Development; requiring the Department to notify applicants for certain financial assistance that adaptive reuse is an eligible use of funds; and providing that the notice requirement does not apply to individuals applying for loans from the Department that are not focused on housing.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that adaptive reuse of existing buildings for the purpose of creating affordable multifamily housing is an eligible use of certain financial assistance from the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, and requires the department to notify applicants that this use is eligible.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Individuals seeking affordable multifamily housing and communities benefiting from increased housing options.
innovative_summary: The bill promotes innovative use of existing buildings through adaptive reuse to develop affordable housing, which is a creative approach to increasing housing supply utilizing existing infrastructure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By enabling more affordable housing, the bill has the potential to directly reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable living conditions.

Title: Real Property - Residential Leases - Notification of Rent Increases
Synopsis: Prohibiting a landlord from including a certain term in a lease pertaining to electronic delivery of the notice of a rent increase; requiring a landlord to notify a tenant in writing before increasing the tenant's rent through first-class mail or, if elected by the tenant, electronic delivery; requiring a county or municipality that adopts a certain local law related to limitations on rent increases to report annually certain information on building permits issued for multifamily dwellings intended as rental housing; etc.
bill_summary: The bill regulates rent increases in Maryland by requiring landlords to provide advance written or electronic notice before raising rent above 4%, with specific notice periods depending on the tenancy duration. It also prohibits certain rental lease provisions, including electronic notice acceptance and retaliation eviction notices, and mandates reporting on building permits for rental housing when local rent control laws are adopted.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Tenants and landlords in Maryland, especially those in long-term rental agreements
innovative_summary: The bill employs modern communication methods such as email, text, and electronic portals for tenant notices and requires reporting on rental housing development, integrating technology and data reporting into housing regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: While primarily focused on rental notice requirements and rent control reporting, the bill's protections could indirectly benefit children in rent-burdened households by promoting stability and information transparency.

Title: Department of Agriculture - Urban Agriculture Grant Programs - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose and contents of and the requirements and qualifications under the Urban Agriculture Grant Fund; requiring the Governor, in each of fiscal years 2025 through 2029, to include at least $100,000 for the Fund in the annual budget bill; establishing the Urban Agriculture Advisory Committee to recommend guidelines, policies, and practices for the implementation of the Grant Program; and requiring the Advisory Committee to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's urban agriculture grant programs, including the establishment of an advisory committee, changing eligibility and distribution criteria for grants, and increasing funding to support urban farming and food access.
responsible_party: Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Urban agricultural producers, nonprofit organizations, institutions of higher education, socially disadvantaged farmers, residents of low-income census tracts or food deserts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured advisory committee, prioritizes equity in grant distribution, and emphasizes community benefit and sustainability practices, employing a strategic approach to urban agriculture support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve food access and support economically disadvantaged urban farmers, thus potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners - Student Members and Task Force to Study Compensation and Student Members
Synopsis: Altering the voting rights of and the process for selecting a student member of the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners; prohibiting the student member from voting on matters before the board relating to personnel and collective bargaining decisions; establishing the Task Force to Study Compensation and Student Members of the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by April 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill alters the voting rights and selection process for student members of the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners and establishes a Task Force to study the compensation of board members, including students.
responsible_party: Office of the Mayor of Baltimore City and Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners
stakeholders: Students in Baltimore City Public Schools, Baltimore City residents, Baltimore City officials
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a student voting member on the school board and studies the possibility of increasing student representation and compensation, employing a participatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potentially high impact by increasing student engagement and representation, which could influence policies affecting student welfare and reduce child poverty.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Residency Requirements Ho. Co. 11-23
Synopsis: Providing that a resident of the State meets certain residency requirements for an applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Howard County.
