bill_summary: The bill changes residency requirements for alcohol license applicants in Howard County, Maryland, including allowing residents of the entire state to meet certain residency requirements for applying.
responsible_party: Howard County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board
stakeholders: Applicants for alcohol licenses in Howard County, residents, and businesses involved in the alcohol sales industry within the county
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and clarifies rules regarding residency for license applicants; it does not introduce new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses licensing requirements.

Title: Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority - Evaluation, Termination of Bond Authority, and Assumption of Functions, Employees, and Contracts (Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority Sunset Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority from issuing bonds beginning June 1, 2023; requiring the Department of Legislative Services to evaluate the Authority providing enough detail for the General Assembly to determine whether the Authority should continue in its current form; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority from issuing bonds starting June 1, 2023, and mandates a comprehensive evaluation of the authority to determine if it should be continued, merged into the Maryland Environmental Service, or discontinued. It also requires reviews of the authority's functions, operations, and contracts, and provides for the temporary assumption of its functions by the Maryland Environmental Service during the evaluation process.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services and Maryland Environmental Service
stakeholders: Residents and governments of Northeast Maryland jurisdictions, environmental agencies, contractors, and employees of the Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority
innovative_summary: The bill employs an innovative approach by conducting a comprehensive government agency sunset review and analysis to determine the future structure and operations of a regional waste disposal authority, including potential merger and transition strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal, as it primarily involves evaluation and restructuring of waste disposal authority functions.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Crisfield Police Department
Synopsis: Requiring membership in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for certain local law enforcement officers of the Crisfield Police Department under certain circumstances; providing that a certain individual is entitled to eligibility service and creditable service that was earned before the effective date of the Crisfield Police Department's participation in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System; providing for the transfer of creditable service for a certain individual; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates membership in the Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System for certain Crisfield Police Department officers, allows service credit transfer from previous employment, and clarifies the handling of assets and benefits related to this transition.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency or relevant pension system administrator
stakeholders: Crisfield Police Department officers, local government, pension beneficiaries
innovative_summary: The bill involves transitioning a department's pension system membership and managing transfer of service credits and assets, which is a standard administrative procedure rather than a new technological innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential to impact child poverty through improved police pension participation and stability.

Title: Sexual Offenses - Crime of Violence and Lifetime Supervision
Synopsis: Altering the list of crimes included within a certain definition of "crime of violence" to include sexual abuse of a minor if the offender is at least 21 years old and the victim is under the age of 16 years; and requiring a sentence for certain persons convicted of certain sexual abuse crimes to include a term of lifetime sexual offender supervision.
bill_summary: The bill enhances the supervision requirements for certain sexual offenders in Maryland by mandating lifetime sexual offender supervision for certain convictions involving minors and specific criteria.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Sexual offenders, minors, the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology such as GPS tracking and specialized conditions for monitoring offenders, representing a comprehensive approach to supervision.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves child safety through enhanced supervision.

Title: Public Utilities - Energy Efficiency and Conservation Programs - Energy Performance Targets and Low-Income Housing
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to procure or provide for electricity customers energy efficiency and conservation programs and services designed to achieve certain target annual incremental gross energy savings for the 2024-2026 program cycle; establishing the Green and Healthy Task Force to develop policy and statutory recommendations to eliminate barriers to low-income households achieving, energy-efficient, affordable, and low-emissions housing; requiring an annual report beginning July 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: This bill mandates the Maryland Public Service Commission and the Department of Housing and Community Development to enhance energy efficiency and conservation programs targeting low-income households, including establishing energy savings targets, developing coordinated funding sources, and creating a plan to provide energy efficiency retrofits to all low-income households by 2031.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development and Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Low-income households and communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated, multi-agency approach leveraging various funding sources and establishing long-term targets for energy efficiency upgrades, including comprehensive retrofitting plans for all low-income households, which is a relatively innovative approach to government energy programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to reduce child poverty by lowering energy costs and improving living conditions in low-income households through extensive retrofitting and conservation programs.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Athletic Trainers - Dry Needling Approval
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Physicians to approve licensed athletic trainers to perform dry needling, a certain type of intramuscular manual therapy involving the insertion of one or more solid needles into the muscle and related tissues to effect change in the muscle and related tissues, as a specialized task; requiring 80 hours of instruction in a certain continuing education course, including 40 hours of practical, hands-on instruction under the guidance of a certain licensed health care practitioner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Physicians to approve licensed athletic trainers to perform dry needling, a specialized intramuscular therapy, and sets requirements for training and certification.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Licensed athletic trainers, patients receiving dry needling, healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approved practice of dry needling for licensed athletic trainers, with specific training and certification requirements, employing targeted professional credentialing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially improve health outcomes and access for individuals requiring dry needling therapy, but the direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victims of Sexually Assaultive Behavior
Synopsis: Requiring a certain assistant State's Attorney with knowledge of the case to meet with a victim of sexually assaultive behavior or the victim's representative within 20 days after receiving a request from the victim regarding a decision by the Office of the State's Attorney  not to file a charging document or to dismiss charges against an alleged suspect; requiring the assistant State's Attorney, at the meeting, to explain the justification for a certain decision; and establishing certain requirements for the meeting.
bill_summary: This bill requires assistant State's Attorneys in Maryland to meet with victims of sexually assaultive behavior within 20 days if the case is dismissed or not filed by the office, and to explain the reasons for these decisions.
responsible_party: Office of the State's Attorney in Maryland
stakeholders: Victims of sexually assaultive behavior in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal requirement for prosecutors to meet with victims in specific cases and clarify decision-making, which enhances transparency and victim communication.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County Board of Education - Student Member - Voting and Training
Synopsis: Authorizing the student member of the Baltimore County Board of Education to vote on capital and operating budget matters; requiring certain members of the county board and the executive leadership of the Baltimore County public school system to develop a certain draft curriculum for budget training for student members of the county board and submit the draft curriculum to the county board for review; and requiring each student member of the board to complete the budget training within 2 months of the student's election to the board.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the student member of the Baltimore County Board of Education to vote on budget matters, requires development of a budget training curriculum, and mandates training completion within two months of election for voting eligibility.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of Education and Baltimore County Public School System
stakeholders: Students elected to the Baltimore County Board of Education, Baltimore County public school students, and school district officials
innovative_summary: The program introduces structured budget training for student board members, including curriculum development and mandatory completion for voting rights, enhancing student involvement and financial literacy in governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing primarily on student governance and educational processes.

Title: State Designations – State Spirit – Maryland Rye
Synopsis: Designating Maryland Rye or Maryland Rye Whiskey as the State spirit.
bill_summary: This bill designates Maryland Rye or Maryland Rye Whiskey as the State spirit of Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly and the Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, local distilleries, and the state's cultural heritage
innovative_summary: The bill employs a traditional approach to designating a state symbol, without introducing new technologies or novel government programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Estate Tax - Portability - Time Period for Election
Synopsis: Altering the period of time within which a person is required to file a Maryland estate tax return for the purpose of allowing a surviving spouse to take into account the deceased spousal unused exclusion amount to be consistent with the time for making a federal election; and applying the Act retroactively to any decedents dying on or after January 1, 2019.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland estate tax laws to change the time period within which a surviving spouse can make an election to take into account the deceased spousal unused exclusion amount. It retroactively applies to decedents dying on or after January 1, 2019, and establishes regulations for aligning the Maryland election time frame with federal standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Surviving spouses and estate executors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill aligns the Maryland estate tax election process with federal procedures to streamline estate planning and tax filings, but does not employ new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification for Adoption Expenses - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering eligibility for and the amount of a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for a taxpayer who adopts a child during the taxable year.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland income tax law to increase the subtraction modification for adoption expenses, allowing adoptive parents to subtract higher amounts from their income for tax purposes depending on the child's needs and residency status, effective from July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Adoptive parents in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill enhances tax benefits for adoptive parents, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a modest potential to reduce the financial burden of adoption, possibly supporting families at risk, which could indirectly impact child poverty.

Title: Real Property - Unlawfully Restrictive Covenants - Modification by Counties or Municipalities
Synopsis: Authorizing a county or municipality to execute and record a restrictive covenant modification to an unlawfully restrictive covenant for a property within the boundaries of the county or municipality after providing persons with an ownership interest in the property with 30 days' written notice; and providing that persons with an ownership interest in property that is subject to an unlawfully restrictive covenant may decline action by a county or municipality to execute and record a restrictive covenant modification.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to modify and record changes to unlawfully restrictive covenants, specifically those restricting ownership based on race, religion, or national origin, in properties within their boundaries. The process allows property owners or nonprofit entities to initiate modifications and details procedures for notice, review, and recording of these modifications.
responsible_party: Maryland County and Municipal Governments with oversight from the Administrative Office of the Courts and county attorneys
stakeholders: Property owners, residents in affected neighborhoods, local governments, nonprofit enforcement entities
innovative_summary: The program employs a legal process allowing local governments to modernize property covenants that are racially or religiously restrictive, potentially reducing barriers to fair housing through administrative modification of historic restrictions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to impact child poverty indirectly by improving equitable housing opportunities, but does not directly address child poverty.

Title: State Personnel - Education and Transportation - Grievance Procedures
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain employee or certain exclusive representative to initiate a grievance procedure under certain provisions of law; requiring certain decision makers in a grievance procedure in certain higher education systems to award certain damages under certain circumstances; requiring certain employee grievance procedures to include certain redress for certain violations; requiring the Secretary of Transportation to be consistent with certain provisions of law and include redress for certain violations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates and clarifies grievance procedures for employees in Maryland's state personnel, education, and transportation sectors. It establishes guidelines for initiating grievances, awarding damages, and redressing violations concerning wages and employment conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State agencies, including departments of Education, Transportation, and State Personnel and Pensions
stakeholders: State employees, including education and transportation employees, and their exclusive representatives or unions
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes clear grievance procedures, damages for violations, and includes modernized processes for handling employee disputes, but it does not employ new technologies or approaches—it's mainly rule updates.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily improves workplace grievance processes; it does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly impact employees' welfare.

Title: Nonpublic Schools and Child Care Providers - Corporal Punishment - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Board of Education from issuing a certificate of approval to noncollegiate educational institutions that do not have a policy prohibiting the administration of corporal punishment; requiring regulations adopted by the State Board for the registration of family child care homes and large family child care homes and the licensing and operation of child care centers to prohibit corporal punishment; and requiring the State Board to identify certain methods in a certain overall plan.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits corporal punishment in nonpublic schools, family and large family child care homes, and child care centers in Maryland. It requires the State Board of Education to find and eliminate instances of corporal punishment and restricts issuing certificates of approval to certain noncollegiate institutions that do not have policies prohibiting corporal punishment.
responsible_party: State Board of Education and related child care regulatory agencies
stakeholders: Students in nonpublic schools, children in family and large family child care homes, and children in child care centers in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory approach to eliminate corporal punishment across various educational and child care settings, including mandatory policies and oversight, which is a standard but comprehensive approach to disciplinary reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but promotes a healthier and more supportive environment for children, which can indirectly support families in poverty.

Title: Victim Services Programs – Supplementing Federal Funding and Support (Victim Services Stabilization Act)
Synopsis: Providing for the stable funding and support of trauma-informed, high-quality programs and services for victims of crime; requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to help support certain programs providing services for victims of crime; requiring the Office to consult with certain individuals and organizations regarding the allocation of certain funding; and requiring the Governor to include certain funding in the State budget.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program to support and stabilize funding for victim services programs in Maryland by supplementing federal funding, ensuring continuity and high-quality services for crime victims.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Victims of crime and related service providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program systematically supplements federal funding for victim services, promoting stability and coordination across multiple organizations and jurisdictions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to moderately impact child poverty by improving services for young victims and their families.

Title: Natural Resources - Wildlife Advisory Commission - Membership
Synopsis: Increasing the membership of the Wildlife Advisory Commission; requiring the Governor to appoint a member to the Wildlife Advisory Commission who is an academic researcher with expertise in wildlife biology, wildlife conservation, wildlife management, or ecology; and requiring the membership of the Commission to include representation from the farming, hunting, wildlife preservation, and passive wildlife recreation communities.
bill_summary: This bill increases the membership of the Maryland Wildlife Advisory Commission from 9 to 10 members, adds requirements for appointment of members with specific expertise and from various stakeholder communities, and makes adjustments to terms and appointments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Wildlife conservation communities, hunting and fishing communities, farming community, passive wildlife recreation community, and the general public interested in wildlife
innovative_summary: The bill focuses on expanding stakeholder representation and expertise on a traditional advisory commission, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Automatic Expungement - Clarification
Synopsis: Clarifying the language of provisions of law requiring the expungement of certain records maintained by the State or a political subdivision of the State relating to the charging of certain offenses under certain circumstances and notification of a certain right to expungement.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies the law regarding automatic expungement of certain police, court, and other records related to specific charges, ensuring records are expunged after 3 years if there are no disqualifying dispositions, and details the notification process for individuals and relevant agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and criminal justice agencies
stakeholders: Individuals with charges that qualify for automatic expungement, law enforcement agencies, courts
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies and streamlines the automatic expungement process, including notification and record keeping procedures, but does not employ new technology or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has low potential to directly impact child poverty as it primarily deals with criminal record expungement procedures.

Title: Currency - Campaign Finance Prohibitions - Disclosures by Financial Institutions
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain persons subject to campaign finance regulation from making or accepting monetary contributions or monetary donations using any currency other than United States currency; prohibiting a campaign finance entity or a person acting on behalf of a campaign finance entity from making a monetary expenditure using any currency other than United States currency; authorizing the State Administrator of Elections or the Administrator's designee to investigate certain potential violations of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the use, acceptance, or deposit of cryptocurrency funds and contributions in campaign finance activities in Maryland, and authorizes investigations and penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and Comptroller of Maryland
stakeholders: Candidates, campaign finance entities, political donors, and regulatory agencies involved in election campaign funding in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program incorporates regulation and enforcement on cryptocurrency in political funding, including investigation powers and penalties, involving modern digital currency regulation tools.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but enhances campaign finance regulation related to digital currencies.

Title: Probation Before Judgment - Probation Agreements
Synopsis: Authorizing a court to stay the entering of a conviction, defer further proceedings, and place a certain defendant on probation subject to reasonable conditions if the court finds facts justifying a finding of guilt; authorizing the State and a certain defendant to enter into a probation agreement under certain circumstances; providing that the entry of a probation agreement under the Act shall be considered a probation before judgment for all other purposes under State law; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes courts to enter into probation before judgment agreements, allowing defendants to avoid a conviction on their record if they comply with certain conditions. It establishes procedures for defining, approving, and monitoring alcoholism treatment programs related to probation before judgment, and clarifies rules for certain violations and evaluations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Administrative Office of the Courts
stakeholders: Individuals involved in criminal proceedings in Maryland, including courts, defendants, and treatment providers.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured probation before judgment process that emphasizes agreement, monitoring, and evaluation of treatment programs, incorporating technology for approval and oversight functions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by providing alternative, rehabilitative approaches that could improve long-term stability for offenders and their families.

Title: Budget Bill (Fiscal Year 2024)
Synopsis: Making the proposed appropriations contained in the State Budget for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2024, in accordance with Article III, Section 52 of the Maryland Constitution; etc.
bill_summary: The bill appropriates funds for various state departments and programs, including education, transportation, public safety, health, and infrastructure, for fiscal years 2023 and 2024, also authorizing transfers, supplemental budgets, and specific project funding. It includes detailed allocations for local and federal programs, grants, and initiatives, with provisions for reporting, transfers, and adjustments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management and other state agencies
stakeholders: Maryland residents, state agencies, local governments, educational institutions, and specific stakeholder groups impacted by funding allocations and program implementations
innovative_summary: The bill mainly focuses on budget allocations, transfer authorizations, and reporting protocols; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill distributes funds across various programs that could indirectly impact child poverty by supporting health, education, and social services, but it does not directly target child poverty reduction.

Title: Creation of a State Debt – Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2023, and the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, and 2022
Synopsis: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $1,218,639,000, the proceeds to be used for certain necessary building, construction, demolition, planning, renovation, conversion, replacement, and capital equipment purchases of the State, for acquiring certain real estate in connection therewith, and for grants to certain subdivisions and other organizations for certain development and improvement purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance of multiple series of bonds to fund various public infrastructure projects across the state, including construction, renovation, and improvement of government buildings, educational facilities, parks, transportation, health, and community service centers, with specific projects outlined and allocated funds. It also establishes rules for the expenditure, oversight, and repayment of these bonds, and includes preauthorization for future bond issues.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works and the Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: State and local government agencies, public schools, healthcare facilities, community organizations, historical sites, parks, and general public
innovative_summary: The bill primarily employs traditional bonding and funding mechanisms for public projects, with some provisions for expedited project commencement and federal fund integration, employing established government finance approaches rather than new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill allocates substantial funds toward educational, healthcare, and community development projects, which can help reduce child poverty indirectly by improving access to education, health services, and community resources.

Title: Budget Reconciliation and Financing Act of 2023
Synopsis: Authorizing or altering the distribution of certain revenue; repealing a certain required appropriation to the Revenue Stabilization Account; altering the areas in which certain faculty must specialize to be assigned to provide clinical care at the University of Maryland Capital Region Medical Center; reducing the budgeted Medicaid Deficit Assessment for fiscal year 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reallocates funds and resources for healthcare, education, and infrastructure projects, including funding for clinical care at the University of Maryland Capital Region Medical Center, property tax refunds, and site transfers from Bainbridge Naval Training Center to the Department of Natural Resources.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, including the University of Maryland Medical System and Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Patients, healthcare providers, homeowners, Maryland residents, natural resources, and local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs data-driven allocations and transfers, and involves technological aspects like property tax refund determinations and natural resource management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for impact on child poverty through healthcare and educational resource allocations.

Title: Early Childhood Education - Prekindergarten Programs - Montessori Schools and Programs
Synopsis: Altering the eligibility requirements for the Prekindergarten Expansion Grant Program and publicly funded prekindergarten programs to include certain operational requirements, staff credentials, and student-to-staff ratios; requiring Montessori schools and programs to maintain a student-to-classroom personnel ratio of no more than 10 to 1, with a maximum of 20 students if all the students are under the age of 5 years; requiring a classroom teacher to hold a bachelor's degree and be certified by certain organizations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands and clarifies rules around prekindergarten programs, including specific requirements for Montessori schools, such as staff credentials, student-teacher ratios, and program standards.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prekindergarten students, Montessori schools, early childhood educators, families of young children
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specialized standards for Montessori prekindergarten programs, including credential requirements and tailored student-teacher ratios, integrating Montessori methods into public funding mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to reduce child poverty through expanded access to high-quality early childhood education, especially through tailored standards for Montessori programs.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions governing the issuance of stock, convertible securities, and scrip; clarifying the authority of corporations to hold annual meetings by remote communication; clarifying the application of certain provisions of law to the conversion of a corporation; requiring a real estate investment trust that voluntarily dissolves to file a notice of termination with the State Department of Assessments and Taxation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland Corporations law, allowing remote meetings, clarifying rules for issuing stock, and streamlining dissolution procedures for real estate investment trusts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Corporations, Real Estate Investment Trusts, and their stakeholders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces modernized legal provisions, including remote communication for meetings and streamlined dissolution procedures, reflecting a more flexible and updated corporate legal framework.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct or high potential impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County - Board of Education - Member Elections and Appointments
Synopsis: Requiring the seven elected members of the Baltimore County Board of Education to be elected in gubernatorial election years; requiring the four appointed members of the Board to be appointed in presidential election years; providing for the termination of the terms of certain appointed members of the Board in 2024; and providing for the  appointment of certain members of the Board in 2028.
bill_summary: The bill restructures the election and appointment process for the Baltimore County Board of Education, changing the years in which members are elected or appointed, and extends the term expiration date for appointed members from 2024 to 2028.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of Education and Maryland Governor's Office
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore County, including students and their families
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes election and appointment schedules and extends terms; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may indirectly affect educational stability in Baltimore County.

Title: Commission on Public Health - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission on Public Health to make recommendations to improve the delivery of foundational public health services in the State; requiring the Commission to conduct an assessment of the foundational public health capabilities of the Maryland Department of Health and local health departments; requiring the Commission to submit to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly an interim report by December 1, 2023, and a final report by December 1, 2024, of the Commission's findings and recommendations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Commission on Public Health to assess and improve the delivery of foundational public health services in Maryland. It requires the commission to perform an assessment of public health capabilities, make recommendations, and report findings by specified deadlines.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the academic institutions that cochair the commission
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, public health departments, healthcare providers, public health professionals, and community organizations
innovative_summary: The program uses a collaborative approach with a new state-level commission, public engagement, and comprehensive assessment to reform public health services, employing data review and public comments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving public health services that affect maternal and child health outcomes.

Title: Real Property - Limitations on Summoning Law Enforcement or Emergency Services - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a landlord from using a lease or form of lease that contains a provision that limits a tenant's ability to summon, or penalizes a tenant or another individual solely for summoning, the assistance of law enforcement or emergency services; prohibiting a landlord from taking certain retaliatory actions because a tenant or another individual summons the assistance of law enforcement or emergency services for certain purposes; prohibiting a local jurisdiction from enacting certain laws; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits landlords from including lease provisions that limit tenants' ability to summon law enforcement or emergency services and prohibits retaliatory actions against tenants for doing so. It also restricts local jurisdictions from enacting laws that penalize tenants or landlords for summoning emergency services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Tenants, landlords, local governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces legal protections ensuring tenants can summon emergency services without fear of penalties or eviction, and restricts local laws from punishing such actions, employing legal and policy changes rather than technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for direct impact on child poverty by ensuring safe access to emergency services for vulnerable tenants and families.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Repeal of Petition of Support Requirement Ho. Co. 12-23
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement that an application for an alcoholic beverages license in Howard County include certain petitions of support signed by at least three residents who are owners of real property and registered voters in the district where the business is to be conducted.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the requirement in Howard County for alcoholic beverage license applicants to submit petitions of support signed by residents, and makes related changes to licensing procedures.
responsible_party: Howard County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and Howard County residents
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies licensing procedures by removing the petition of support requirement, reducing bureaucratic barriers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: St. Mary's County - Golf Carts on Public Highways - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the St. Mary's County Board of County Commissioners to produce a report recommending and describing the areas of St. Mary's County that the County Board considers appropriate for the operation of unregistered golf carts on public highways, subject to certain standards; and requiring the County Board to submit the report to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill allows St. Mary's County to establish a report and designated areas for the operation of unregistered golf carts on certain public highways, primarily on isolated island or peninsula areas with yacht facilities and tourist attractions, and provides standards for their operation including licensing and lighting requirements.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Board of County Commissioners and relevant Maryland state transportation agencies
stakeholders: Visitors, residents, and businesses in St. Mary's County, especially in island or peninsula areas with yacht facilities and tourist attractions
innovative_summary: The program employs a localized approach to allow unregistered golf carts on specific highways in a designated area, focusing on tourism and local transportation innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty appears minimal, as it mainly changes local traffic regulations and promotes tourism.

Title: Criminal Law - Person in a Position of Authority - Sexual Offenses With a Minor
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "person in a position of authority" applicable to sexual offense in the fourth degree; altering a certain prohibition against a certain person in a position of authority engaging in certain conduct to prohibit a person in a position of authority from engaging in a sexual act, sexual contact, or vaginal intercourse with a minor who is enrolled at a school or participating in a certain program for which the person in authority works; authorizing the imposition of a certain sentence;  etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to redefine the scope of sexual offenses involving persons in a position of authority, specifically clarifying the conduct prohibited and establishing the circumstances under which a person in such a position cannot engage in sexual acts or intercourse with minors, including students or participants in programs or activities where they exercise supervision.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or the Maryland State Police (not explicitly specified in the text)
stakeholders: Minors participating in educational, recreational, or religious programs supervised by persons in a position of authority in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces clearer legal definitions and specific restrictions related to sexual conduct between persons in authority and minors, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has low potential to directly impact child poverty, as it primarily changes legal definitions and restrictions regarding sexual conduct.

Title: Employment for Minors - Opportunities for Work
Synopsis: Requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to release certain personal information of a minor who has a work permit to employers and apprenticeship sponsors, educational programs and institutions, and local workforce development boards that have requested and have registered with the Maryland Department of Labor for the purpose of receiving the information, if a parent or legal guardian of the minor or the minor elects to allow the sharing of the information.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the employment rules for minors in Maryland, including provisions for online work permit applications, employment restrictions, and the release of minors' contact information to certain entities with consent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Minors seeking employment, employers, educational institutions, local workforce development boards
innovative_summary: The bill employs an online application process for work permits and introduces a regulated system for sharing minors' contact information with registered entities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by facilitating legal employment opportunities for minors.

Title: Department of the Environment - Zero-Emission Medium- and Heavy-Duty Vehicles - Regulations (Clean Trucks Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations on or before December 1, 2023, establishing requirements for the sale of new zero-emission medium- and heavy-duty vehicles in the State; defining a "heavy-duty vehicle" as one with a gross vehicle weight rating equal to or greater than 14,001 pounds; requiring the Department, in consultation with certain units of State government, to prepare and submit to the General Assembly a certain needs assessment and deployment plan by December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Department of the Environment to establish regulations for the sale of new zero-emission medium- and heavy-duty vehicles in Maryland, including preparation of a needs assessment and deployment plan, and makes changes to the existing vehicle grant program, increasing funding and preference for certain vehicles and equipment.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment, Maryland Energy Administration, and related state agencies
stakeholders: Commercial and industrial vehicle operators, environmental and public health advocates, communities impacted by pollution, vehicle manufacturers
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates regulated standards based on California's advanced clean trucks regulations and emphasizes a transition to zero-emission vehicles through regulation and incentivization, employing existing standards and increased funding mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could reduce child poverty indirectly through environmental benefits and health improvements, but it is primarily focused on vehicle regulation and grants.

Title: Child in Need of Assistance – Neglect – Cannabis Use
Synopsis: Providing that the use of cannabis by a parent or certain other individuals who care for a child does not qualify as neglect except in certain circumstances for purposes of provisions of law relating to children in need of assistance.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that the use of cannabis by a parent or caregiver does not constitute neglect unless it results in harm or risk to the child's health or mental well-being.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services or local child welfare agencies
stakeholders: Children and their caregivers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill provides a legal clarification that changes the criteria for neglect related to cannabis use, rather than creating new services or interventions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential impact on child poverty is minimal, focusing more on legal definitions and child welfare policies.

Title: State Board of Chiropractic Examiners - Disciplinary Actions
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Chiropractic Examiners to take disciplinary action against an applicant or a licensee for failing to comply with a Board order; authorizing the Board to grant a stay of enforcement of a Board order in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act; prohibiting a Board order from being stayed pending judicial review; authorizing the Board to reinstate a suspended or revoked license only in accordance with the terms and conditions of the order or an order of reinstatement issued by the Board; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates the disciplinary procedures for the State Board of Chiropractic Examiners, including clarifying the authority to take disciplinary actions such as suspending or revoking licenses, and establishing rules for appeals and stays of enforcement.
responsible_party: State Board of Chiropractic Examiners
stakeholders: Chiropractors and applicants licensed by the State Board of Chiropractic Examiners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill consolidates and clarifies disciplinary and appeal procedures for the Board, incorporating the Administrative Procedure Act provisions, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it primarily pertains to disciplinary processes for licensed professionals.

Title: Tax Sales - Owner-Occupied Property - Foreclosure, Notice, and Reimbursement of Expenses
Synopsis: Prohibiting in all counties, rather than Baltimore City only, a holder of a certificate of sale from filing a complaint to foreclose the right of redemption for owner-occupied residential property until 9 months from the date of sale; prohibiting in all counties, rather than Baltimore City only, a certain notice from being sent to certain persons with an interest in owner-occupied residential property sold at tax sale until 7 months after the date of sale; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends and clarifies the rules for tax sales of owner-occupied residential property in Maryland. It increases the time before a foreclosure complaint can be filed from 9 months to 6 months after the sale, adjusts notice timing, and modifies reimbursement rules for expenses related to redemption, applicable statewide, with some variations for Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners involved in tax sales, local government tax offices
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves rule changes regarding timing and procedures for tax sales and reimbursements, without introducing new technology or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly impact low-income homeowners by providing clearer and potentially more favorable rules for redeeming property, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Tax Sales - Homeowner Protection Program - Outreach
Synopsis: Expressing the intent of the General Assembly that at least 2% of the balance in the Homeowner Protection Fund be spent each year to conduct outreach in a certain manner to homeowners in tax sale to encourage the homeowners to enroll in the Homeowner Protection Program; authorizing the State Tax Sale Ombudsman to conduct outreach using State employees and resources or to contract with a private vendor; requiring that certain State and local government agencies provide certain information to facilitate outreach efforts; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Homeowner Protection Program that conducts outreach campaigns to homeowners at risk of losing their homes through tax sales, informing them of available assistance and encouraging enrollment. It creates a dedicated fund for funding these activities, specifies procedures for conducting outreach, and mandates reporting and collaboration with local agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation, supported by the Homeowner Protection Fund
stakeholders: Homeowners at risk of tax sale, local government agencies, community organizations, social service providers
innovative_summary: The program employs a proactive outreach approach utilizing live human calls and collaboration across state and local agencies, with a dedicated fund and annual reporting, representing an innovative combination of targeted outreach and inter-agency cooperation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by helping homeowners retain their homes and access assistance programs.

Title: Sales and Use Tax Exemption - Redevelopment Areas in Baltimore County - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending, until July 1, 2036, the termination date applicable to an exemption from the sales and use tax for certain construction material or warehousing equipment purchased for use in a certain target redevelopment area in Baltimore County.
bill_summary: The bill extends the expiration date of a sales tax exemption for certain construction materials and warehousing equipment used in a targeted redevelopment area in Baltimore County from 2026 to 2036.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Businesses involved in construction and warehousing within the redevelopment area in Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill mainly extends a tax exemption program; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or specify impacts on it.

Title: Massage Therapy - Discipline
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners to grant a stay of enforcement of a Board order in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act; prohibiting an order of the Board from being stayed pending judicial review; authorizing the Board to appeal a decision that reverses or modifies its order; altering the grounds for disciplining massage therapists and procedures related to the discipline of massage therapists, including appeals procedures and reinstatement procedures; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations concerning the practice of massage therapy in Maryland, including definitions, licensing procedures, disciplinary actions, and enforcement measures.
responsible_party: State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Massage therapists, licensing applicants, and the general public seeking massage therapy services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies existing licensing and disciplinary rules; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and disciplinary processes for massage therapy.

Title: Accessory Dwelling Unit Policy Task Force
Synopsis: Establishing the Accessory Dwelling Unit Policy Task Force to survey and document a representative sampling of the variety of ordinances, laws, codes, and policies regarding the development and operation of accessory dwelling units in areas zoned for single-family residential use; and requiring the Task Force to report to the Governor and General Assembly on its activities on or before November 1, 2023, and its findings and recommendations on or before June 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Accessory Dwelling Unit Policy Task Force to study and recommend policies to promote the development of accessory dwelling units on land zoned for single-family residential use in Maryland.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: Homeowners, local governments, housing advocates, and residents in Maryland, especially in areas considering or permitting accessory dwelling units.
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative, policy-focused approach by forming a dedicated task force to analyze and recommend best practices for accessory dwelling unit development, including streamlining permits and addressing local law barriers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing affordable housing options and supporting stable family living arrangements.

Title: Correctional Officers' Retirement System - Special Death Benefits - Applicability
Synopsis: Authorizing an application for special death benefits to be made for the death of certain members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes a process for the surviving spouse of a correctional officer who was killed by homicide while performing their duties to request a special death benefit from the Maryland Correctional Officers’ Retirement System, including retroactive payments with interest.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Surviving spouses of correctional officers who died by homicide in the line of duty after June 1, 2001
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a special death benefit process for line-of-duty homicide cases, including retroactive payments with interest, which is a targeted intervention for this specific situation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Massage Therapy - Definition, Registration, and Reimbursement
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "massage therapy"; altering the date after which the option to be registered by the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners to practice massage therapy in a setting that is not a health care setting will no longer be available; and repealing a provision of law that provides that certain provisions of law do not require a nonprofit health insurance plan, an insurer, a health maintenance organization, or a person acting as a third party administrator to reimburse certain individuals for services rendered.
bill_summary: The bill updates the definition of 'massage therapy', establishes a timeline for when individuals can practice or register as massage therapists without a license, and requires the Maryland State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners to adopt regulations by 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Massage therapists, massage therapy students, and consumers of massage therapy services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: This bill mainly involves updating regulations and timelines, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City Young Readers Program and Young Readers Matching Grant Program - Alterations (Young Readers Program Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Transferring the Baltimore City Young Readers Program and the Young Readers Matching Grant Program to the Maryland State Library Agency;  requiring program grant applicants to include the distribution of books to children in low-income zip codes within the applicants' areas of service; requiring the Governor to include $350,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program; requiring the State Library Board, beginning December 1, 2024, to report every other year to the General Assembly on the effectiveness of the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the statewide Young Readers Program and the Young Readers Matching Grant Program, aimed at distributing free, high-quality books to children, especially in low-income areas, via public libraries and nonprofit organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Library Agency
stakeholders: Children in Maryland, especially those in low-income areas, public libraries, and nonprofit organizations involved in literacy and books distribution.
innovative_summary: The bill creates a coordinated approach to distribute books to children through public libraries and nonprofit partners, with monitoring and reporting requirements, employing a partnership model.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by providing resources and access to educational materials.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Registers of Wills - Electronic Filing and Signatures
Synopsis: Requiring a register of wills to accept certain documents filed electronically through a system established by the register of wills; and prohibiting a register of wills from refusing to accept a document based on the manner in which it was signed.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Register of Wills to accept electronic filings of documents (except original wills) and prohibits refusing documents based on the signing method.
responsible_party: Maryland Register of Wills
stakeholders: Individuals and entities filing documents with the Register of Wills
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the acceptance of electronic filings and signatures in estate and trust documents, integrating digital technology into legal document processing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on legal document filing procedures.

Title: Minority Business Enterprise Program - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to include an attestation that all units required to report are represented in its annual report beginning December 31, 2023; requiring the Office to conduct a certain periodic audit to ensure the accuracy of the attestation; requiring a certain annual report to be submitted to the Joint Committee on Fair Practices and State Personnel Oversight; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state agencies to report annually on their minority business enterprise participation, including detailed contract and compliance data, and to include attestations in these reports. It also mandates audits of agencies to verify which units are reporting and establishes procedures for addressing non-compliance.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and Office of State Procurement in the Department of General Services
stakeholders: Minority business enterprises, state government agencies, contractors interested in minority business participation
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive reporting, auditing, and compliance mechanisms, including attestations and audits, to improve minority business participation in government contracts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to help reduce child poverty by promoting economic inclusion and opportunities for minority-owned businesses.

Title: St. Mary's County - Transfer Tax - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending to October 1, 2028, the authority of the County Commissioners of St. Mary's County to impose a transfer tax on certain instruments of writing.
bill_summary: The bill extends the authority of St. Mary's County to impose a transfer tax on certain documents from October 1, 2024, to October 1, 2028.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Government
stakeholders: Residents and entities involved in property transfers in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches; it primarily extends an existing local tax authority.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County - Class B-ECF/DS (Education Conference Facility/Dining Service) License - Towson University
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County to issue a Class B-ECF/DS (Education Conference Facility/Dining Service) license for use at certain Towson University events.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore County to issue a special license allowing Towson University to sell and serve beer, wine, and liquor at designated university events on campus, with profits going to the university's auxiliary services, starting from July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County
stakeholders: Towson University students, staff, and event attendees in Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized alcohol license for university events, linking alcohol sales directly to university-controlled facilities and profits, which is a tailored regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it pertains mainly to licensing for alcohol sales at university events.

Title: Baltimore City - Property Tax - Retroactive Exemption
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who applies for certain property tax exemptions for real property in Baltimore City to request that the exemption be applied retroactively for up to 3 taxable years, subject to certain requirements; requiring Baltimore City and the State to pay a refund of excess real property taxes paid due to a retroactive exemption that is granted; and requiring the Baltimore City Department of Finance to submit a report on the number of requests made and the amounts refunded by December 1 each year from 2023 to 2027.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes property owners in Baltimore City to request retroactive exemption of certain property taxes for up to three years, with the city and state required to refund any overpaid taxes resulting from the exemption.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Finance and the Maryland State government
stakeholders: Property owners in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The program employs a retroactive application process for property tax exemptions, allowing for corrections of prior taxes paid, which is a novel approach to property tax relief.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may indirectly benefit residents by reducing property tax burdens, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Class A-7 Licenses
Synopsis: Repealing certain geographic and temporal restrictions on the issuance of Class A-7 beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Baltimore City.
bill_summary: This bill removes certain geographic and time restrictions on issuing Class A–7 alcohol licenses in Baltimore City, allowing more flexibility in where and when licenses can be issued and used.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol retailers and consumers in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill modernizes licensing by repealing restrictions that limited geographic and temporal scope, enabling a broader alcohol sales environment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Environment - On-Farm Composting Facilities - Permit Exemption
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations to exempt an on-farm composting facility from the requirement to obtain a permit if the on-farm composting facility uses 10,000 square feet of area or less for active food scrap composting, composts only certain materials, records the amount and source of off-site type 2 organics composted and the date and time the off-site type 2 organics arrived on the farm, retains the records for 5 years, provides records on request, and meets any other condition for a permit exemption; etc.
bill_summary: This bill permits on-farm composting of certain organic materials without needing a permit, provided specific conditions are met, including size limits and types of materials handled. It requires the Department of the Environment to regulate and monitor these activities and to report on their impact.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Farmers and farm operators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program adopts a tiered permit exemption system for on-farm composting, incorporating reporting and operational standards to promote sustainable practices and waste diversion.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but contributes to sustainable agriculture and waste reduction.

Title: Caroline and Queen Anne's Counties - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Residency Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring that a certain applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Caroline County be a resident of the State rather than a resident of the county; and requiring that a certain applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Queen Anne's County be a resident of the State rather than a resident of the county.
bill_summary: The bill removes the residency requirement for applicants for alcoholic beverage licenses in Caroline and Queen Anne's counties, allowing applicants to be residents of the entire state instead of the specific county.
responsible_party: Maryland State Alcoholic Beverages Regulatory Authority
stakeholders: Applicants for alcoholic beverage licenses in Caroline and Queen Anne's counties, residents of the state, local businesses involved in alcohol sales in these counties
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy change that shifts from county-specific residency requirements to a statewide residency requirement for license applicants, simplifying the licensing process and potentially increasing competition.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty since it mainly changes licensing rules for alcohol sales.

Title: Maryland Sign Language Interpreters Act
Synopsis: Establishing a licensing and regulatory system for sign language interpreters under the State Board of Sign Language Interpreters in the Office of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing; establishing the Sign Language Interpreters Fund to be used exclusively to cover the documented direct and indirect costs of fulfilling the Board's duties, including development of programs to assist licensure of marginalized interpreters, development of certain mentorship programs, and financial assistance for certain applicants; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing and regulatory system for sign language interpreters in Maryland, including creation of a State Board of Sign Language Interpreters, licensing requirements, a new Sign Language Interpreters Fund, and public awareness efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Sign Language Interpreters within the Office of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing
stakeholders: Deaf and hard of hearing individuals, sign language interpreters, legal and medical settings, educational institutions
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured licensing system and a dedicated fund to professionalize sign language interpretation, increasing regulation and oversight with technological components like a website database and remote interpreting standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to services and communication for deaf and hard of hearing children.

Title: Eligible Projects - Procurement of Construction Materials (Buy Clean Maryland Act)
Synopsis: Requiring producers of any cement or concrete mixture used in the construction of an eligible project to submit environmental product declarations to the Department of General Services by December 31, 2024; requiring the Department to establish a maximum acceptable global warming potential for certain categories of eligible materials by January 1, 2026; establishing an Environmental Product Declaration Assistance Fund to support the development of certain environmental product declarations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for the procurement of construction materials with a focus on reducing global warming potential, including submitting declarations, assessing and setting maximum acceptable global warming potential for materials, and ensuring environmentally friendly practices in public construction projects.
responsible_party: Department of General Services and Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Producers of construction materials, state government agencies, contractors, and environmental groups
innovative_summary: The bill employs new standards and evaluations for assessing and limiting the global warming potential of construction materials in government projects, encouraging transparency and sustainability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's direct impact on child poverty is moderate, as it aims to reduce environmental impact and promote sustainable building practices, indirectly benefiting communities.

Title: Abandoned Vehicles - Secured Parties - Electronic Notification
Synopsis: Authorizing a police department that takes an abandoned vehicle into custody to notify any secured party electronically if that form of notice is agreed to by the police department, the tower, and the secured party in a certain manner; and altering the application of a provision of law authorizing a police department to provide certain alternative public notice of custody of an abandoned vehicle to include circumstances where electronic notice is unacknowledged or undeliverable.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes police departments in Maryland to notify secured parties electronically if they take abandoned vehicles into custody, replacing or supplementing existing notification methods, and specifies the process for alternative public notices if electronic notification fails.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant police agencies
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, secured parties, police departments, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of electronic notification systems for securing parties in abandoned vehicle cases, enhancing communication efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves administrative procedures related to vehicle abandonment and notification.

Title: St. Mary's County - Gaming - Senior Activity Centers
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain senior activity center to conduct gaming events, bunco games, and card games in St. Mary's County; prohibiting a senior activity center in St. Mary's County from awarding prize money in excess of $50 to a winner in each session or charging a participant more than $25 to play one session; requiring any money that remains after prizes are awarded to be used to support future programming at the senior activity center; etc.
bill_summary: The bill legalizes gaming events, bunco games, and card games at senior activity centers in St. Mary's County, Maryland, allowing them to conduct such activities with specific prize and fee limits and to use remaining funds to support future programming. It also clarifies the legal definitions related to gaming devices and events.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Aging
stakeholders: Senior citizens and senior activity centers in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new, localized form of gaming activity at senior centers, allowing for organized social gaming with specific rules and support for future activities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty indirectly through community engagement and support programs at senior centers.

Title: Family Law - Maryland Child Abduction Prevention Act
Synopsis: Authorizing a court to order child abduction prevention measures if the court finds there is a credible risk of abduction of the child; authorizing certain parties to petition the court for child abduction prevention measures; requiring a petition to be verified, include a copy of any existing child custody determination, and specify the risk factors for abduction; requiring the court to consider certain evidence of a credible risk of abduction; establishing requirements for an abduction prevention order; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Child Abduction Prevention Act, which authorizes courts to require notice of international travel with a child, order child abduction prevention measures, and issue warrants in custody proceedings where there is a credible risk of abduction. It also details procedures for petitions, risk assessment, and enforcement to prevent international child abduction.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system
stakeholders: Children involved in custody proceedings, parents, legal guardians, and law enforcement
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive legal framework with risk assessment, detailed procedures, and law enforcement enforcement measures to prevent child abduction, including use of warrants and international cooperation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could indirectly support child welfare and stability in custody arrangements.

Title: 9–8–8 Trust Fund – Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2025 an appropriation of $12,000,000 to the 9-8-8 Trust Fund for the purpose of designating and maintaining 9-8-8 as the universal telephone number for a national suicide prevention and mental health crisis hotline and for developing and implementing a statewide initiative for the coordination and delivery of behavioral health crisis response services in the State.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a 9-8-8 Trust Fund in Maryland to reimburse costs associated with the national suicide prevention and mental health crisis hotline, including the development and coordination of behavioral health crisis response services. It mandates an annual appropriation of $12 million for the fund starting in fiscal year 2025.
responsible_party: Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals needing mental health crisis and behavioral health services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a dedicated state trust fund specifically for behavioral health crisis response services, supporting the nationwide 9-8-8 hotline implementation and coordination of crisis services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by improving mental health crisis response, which can benefit vulnerable populations including children and families experiencing mental health crises.

Title: Health Occupations - Environmental Health Specialists - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the education requirements for an applicant for licensure as an environmental health specialist; altering the grounds for which the Board may take disciplinary action against an applicant or a licensee to include misfeasance and malfeasance while performing the duties of an environmental health specialist; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises the requirements, examination procedures, disciplinary actions, and review processes for environmental health specialists in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Environmental Health Specialists
stakeholders: Environmental health specialists and the public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates educational, examination, and disciplinary rules for environmental health specialists; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Education - Libraries - Funding
Synopsis: Providing certain funding for each county public library system for fiscal year 2028 and each fiscal year thereafter.
bill_summary: The bill provides increased funding to county public library systems in Maryland from fiscal year 2024 onward, with specific per-resident funding amounts and a requirement that the state covers at least 20% of the minimum library program costs.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public libraries and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily increases funding levels for libraries and sets a predictable funding schedule, which is a standard approach; it does not employ new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is limited but could be positive by improving access to informational resources and educational programs.

Title: Montgomery County – Alcoholic Beverages – Holders of Class B–BWL (Clubhouse/Lodge) License and Class 7 Micro–Brewery License MC 16–23
Synopsis: Providing that the restriction on holding or having a financial interest in other retail alcoholic beverages licenses for holders of a Class 7 micro-brewery license does not apply to a holder of a Class B-BWL (clubhouse/lodge) license in Montgomery County who is issued a Class 7 micro-brewery license.
bill_summary: The bill allows holders of a Class B–BWL (clubhouse/lodge) license in Montgomery County to also hold a Class 7 micro–brewery license without restrictions applied to other micro–brewery license holders.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Revenue Authority
stakeholders: Clubhouse, lodge, and micro–brewery license holders in Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The bill modifies licensing rules to allow cross-licensing for specific clubs and micro-breweries, streamlining operations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Health Occupations - Clinical Nurse Specialists - Prescribing
Synopsis: Defining "clinical nurse specialist" and "practice as a clinical nurse specialist" for the purpose of authorizing clinical nurse specialists to prescribe drugs and durable medical equipment under regulations adopted by the State Board of Nursing; designating a clinical nurse specialist as an "authorized prescriber" under the Maryland Pharmacy Act; and authorizing a licensed physician to personally prepare and dispense a prescription written by a clinical nurse specialist.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes clinical nurse specialists in Maryland to prescribe drugs and durable medical equipment, integrating their prescriptive authority into state regulations and the Maryland Pharmacy Act, and allows physicians to dispense prescriptions written by these specialists.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Clinical nurse specialists, physicians, patients needing complex care, healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill extends prescriptive authority to clinical nurse specialists, enhancing their role in patient care and interdisciplinary collaboration, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may improve healthcare access and outcomes for vulnerable populations, potentially reducing child poverty by improving overall health and reducing medical expenses.

Title: Prescription Drug Affordability Board - Upper Payment Limits
