Synopsis: Reestablishing the requirement that the Prescription Drug Affordability Board, under certain circumstances, draft a plan of action for implementing a process to set upper payment limits for certain prescription drug products; reestablishing the authority of the Board to set upper payments limits, under certain circumstances, for prescription drug products that are purchased or paid for by or through certain State or local government entities, plans, or programs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reestablishes and expands the authority of the Maryland Prescription Drug Affordability Board to set upper payment limits for prescription drugs in certain circumstances, including creating a process for doing so, establishing an appeals process, and requiring a report on broader authority.
responsible_party: Maryland Prescription Drug Affordability Board
stakeholders: State and local government entities, health care programs, and residents affected by prescription drug pricing
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured approach for setting drug payment limits through a formal plan, review, and appeals process, with a focus on affordability and shortages, which is a relatively systematic method.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce drug costs and improve access, which may help lower child poverty indirectly.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Gender-Affirming Treatment (Trans Health Equity Act)
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning on January 1, 2024, the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide gender-affirming treatment in a nondiscriminatory manner; requiring that the gender-affirming treatment be assessed according to nondiscriminatory criteria that are consistent with current clinical standards; prohibiting the issuance of an adverse benefit determination related to gender-affirming treatment unless a certain experienced health care provider has reviewed and confirmed the appropriateness of the determination; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that the Maryland Medical Assistance Program provide medically necessary gender–affirming treatment in a nondiscriminatory manner, with assessments based on current clinical standards, starting January 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Transgender, nonbinary, intersex, two-spirit, and other gender diverse individuals receiving Medicaid
innovative_summary: The program incorporates comprehensive access measures including provider reporting, geographic access assessments, and nondiscriminatory coverage based on current clinical standards, employing data transparency and monitoring.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve health access and reduce disparities for vulnerable populations, which can indirectly impact child poverty.

Title: Grocery Stores and Restaurants - Automated External Defibrillator Program (Joe Sheya Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the owners and operators of grocery stores with annual gross incomes greater than $10,000,000 or restaurants with annual gross incomes of more than $1,000,000, beginning on January 1, 2024, to place an automated external defibrillator in a prominent, accessible area and maintain the functionality of the defibrillator; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems jointly to adopt certain regulations.
bill_summary: The bill requires owners and operators of certain grocery stores and restaurants in Maryland to develop and implement automated external defibrillator (AED) programs, place AEDs in accessible areas, maintain their functionality, and register with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems. It also provides immunities from liability for these establishments and individuals acting in good faith to provide AED aid.
responsible_party: Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Grocery stores, restaurants, employees, customers, and individuals at risk of sudden cardiac arrest in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program uses established AED technology and focuses on legal protections and public registration to promote widespread AED availability, with an emphasis on emergency response and liability immunity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily enhances emergency medical response infrastructure and does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Maryland Forestry Education Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Forestry Education Fund to expand and enhance the Maryland Forestry Foundation's capacity to provide certain education and resources to forest landowners, the ability of district forestry boards and the knowledge of local governments to achieve healthy and sustainable forests, and the ability of businesses to test innovative best management practices in forestry; and requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill $250,000 for the Fund in fiscal years 2025 and 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Forestry Education Fund to support forestry education, outreach, and innovative management practices, managed by the Maryland Forestry Foundation with annual appropriations.
responsible_party: Maryland Forestry Foundation
stakeholders: Forest landowners, district forestry boards, local governments, and forestry-related businesses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program includes grants for testing innovative forestry management practices and building capacity for sustainable forest management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty through environmental and educational improvements.

Title: Public Health - Dental Services - Access
Synopsis: Altering the Maryland Dent-Care Program; establishing a requirement regarding the reimbursement of dental-related services under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program; establishing requirements on the Maryland Department of Health regarding the creation and distribution of plain language materials related to dental services; requiring the State Board of Dental Examiners to publish a searchable list of licensed providers who provide mobile dental services or portable dental services in the State; etc.
bill_summary: This bill improves access to dental services in Maryland by requiring proof of dental screenings for children in schools, child care, and family care homes, establishing the Maryland Dent–Care Program to support dentists and hygienists serving Medicaid recipients through loans, and enhancing public education and provider registries about dental health and services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Children, pregnant women, Medicaid recipients, dental providers, underserved communities
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches like a statewide mobile dental service registry, a loan program targeting underserved areas, and the creation of plain language educational materials to improve public health communication and access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential for reducing child poverty by increasing access to dental care for children and underserved populations, thus preventing health disparities.

Title: Health Occupations - Clinical and Graduate Alcohol and Drug Counselors - Licensure
Synopsis: Altering the educational requirements that individuals must meet to be licensed as clinical or graduate alcohol and drug counselors.
bill_summary: The bill amends the educational and licensing requirements for clinical and graduate alcohol and drug counselors in Maryland, including provisions for licensure waivers and supervised practice.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Alcohol and Drug Counselors or appropriate Maryland health licensing authority
stakeholders: Aspiring and current clinical and graduate alcohol and drug counselors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates licensing requirements and introduces some regulations for supervised practice, but it does not employ new technologies or fundamentally new approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting professional licensing standards.

Title: Child Care Providers - Registration and Licensing - Exemptions
Synopsis: Exempting certain family child care homes, large family child care homes, and child care centers that serve only dependent children of military personnel and are located on a military base or federal property or are certified as a family child care provider by a branch of the U.S. Department of Defense or the Coast Guard from certain registration and licensing requirements; authorizing certain entities to assume responsibility for approving or determining which children may be served by exempted child care providers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain family child care homes, large family child care homes, and child care centers that serve only dependents of military personnel and are located on federal property or certified by the U.S. Department of Defense or U.S. Coast Guard from specific registration and licensing requirements in Maryland. It also authorizes military and federal agencies to approve or determine which children are served by these exempted providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health, local health departments, Department of Human Services, military and federal agencies responsible for child care approval
stakeholders: Family child care homes, military families, children of military personnel, child care providers, federal military and governmental agencies
innovative_summary: The program is moderately innovative, as it establishes a partnership between Maryland state agencies and federal military and defense agencies to manage child care exemptions and approvals on federal property, integrating government agencies to streamline child care oversight for a specific population.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly by removing barriers for military-dependent children to access child care, which can support stability for military families.

Title: Criminal Law - Victims of Child Sex Trafficking and Human Trafficking - Safe Harbor and Service Response
Synopsis: Altering procedures that a law enforcement officer and a court are required to follow when the law enforcement officer or court has reason to believe that a child who has been detained is a victim of sex trafficking or a victim of human trafficking; providing that a minor may not be criminally prosecuted or proceeded against under certain provisions of law for a certain offense if the minor committed the offense as a direct result of being a victim of sex trafficking or being a victim of human trafficking; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures and legal protections for children who are victims of sex trafficking and human trafficking, including prohibiting prosecution of minors for crimes they committed as a result of trafficking, and establishing service and reporting protocols for law enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Child victims of sex trafficking and human trafficking, law enforcement, child welfare agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a trauma-informed approach by providing protections against prosecution and establishing a coordinated service response for trafficking victims, including the use of regional navigators.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to directly reduce child poverty by providing targeted support and protection to victims of trafficking, who are often vulnerable and marginalized.

Title: Public Health - Rare Disease Advisory Council
Synopsis: Establishing the Rare Disease Advisory Council to study and make recommendations on matters relating to individuals with rare diseases in the State; requiring the Council to convene public hearings, make inquiries, and solicit comments from the public on the needs of rare disease patients, caregivers, and health care providers; requiring the Council to report to the Governor and General Assembly by December 1 each year beginning in 2024 and to provide recommendations on ways to address the needs of persons with rare diseases in the State; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Rare Disease Advisory Council in Maryland to study and make recommendations on issues related to individuals with rare diseases, including access to care, research, and education.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with rare diseases, caregivers, healthcare providers, researchers, policymakers
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative advisory council with diverse stakeholders, public engagement, and ongoing research and resource dissemination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to treatment and healthcare resources for children with rare diseases.

Title: State Employee Rights and Protections - Personnel Actions and Harassment - Complaints
Synopsis: Authorizing an applicant for State employment or a State employee to file a complaint alleging harassment by an employer within 2 years after the alleged violation that is the basis of the complaint; and increasing, from 30 days to 1 year, the period of time for an applicant or employee to file a complaint alleging certain prohibited personnel actions.
bill_summary: The bill extends the time period in which an employee can file a complaint alleging harassment by an employer from 30 days to 2 years, and also clarifies the rights and protections for state employees regarding harassment and personnel actions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the State Personnel and Pensions department
stakeholders: State employees and applicants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly changes existing rules and extends complaint filing periods, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Income Tax Checkoff - Maryland Veterans Trust Fund
Synopsis: Establishing a certain income tax checkoff for voluntary contributions to the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund; requiring the Comptroller to include certain information in each individual income tax return package; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a voluntary income tax checkoff for contributions to the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund, allowing taxpayers to donate part of their refund or owed tax to the fund through their income tax forms.
responsible_party: Comptroller of Maryland
stakeholders: Veterans and their families in Maryland, and organizations supporting veterans and their families
innovative_summary: The program employs a simple voluntary checkoff via income tax forms, which is a common method for fundraising but not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program directly supports veterans and their families, which may include children, but does not specifically target child poverty.

Title: Pesticides - PFAS Testing - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Agriculture, in consultation with certain State and federal agencies, to study the use of perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) in pesticides in the State; and requiring the Department to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor, the Senate Committee on Education, Energy, and the Environment, and the House Health and Government Operations Committee on or before November 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits registration of pesticides against mosquitoes unless the distributor submits PFAS test results and an affidavit, and mandates a study on PFAS use in pesticides with a report due by November 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Department of Agriculture in consultation with the Department of the Environment, Maryland Department of Health, and EPA
stakeholders: Pesticide manufacturers, public health agencies, environmental agencies, and residents affected by pesticides in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs innovative testing and regulatory requirements for PFAS in pesticides, including setting thresholds and study mandates.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has indirect potential to impact child poverty through environmental and health protections.

Title: Maryland Longitudinal Data System - Definition of Student Data - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "student data" for purposes of the Maryland Longitudinal Data System to include student disability data by specific disability category.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'student data' in the Maryland Longitudinal Data System to explicitly include data on student disabilities by specific disability categories, starting from July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center
stakeholders: Students with disabilities in Maryland and educational agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more detailed and specific categorization of student disability data within the existing data system, enhancing data specificity for research and policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly supports addressing child poverty by improving data collection on students with disabilities, who are a vulnerable population.

Title: Cigarette Restitution Fund - Payments for Sale and Marketing of Electronic Smoking Devices - Use
Synopsis: Requiring the Cigarette Restitution Fund to include a separate account consisting of payments received by the State from certain enforcement actions related to the sale and marketing of electronic smoking devices; and providing that distributions from the separate account may be used, consistent with any other State law, to supplement General Fund appropriations designated for certain programs with the purpose of reducing the use of tobacco products by individuals under 21 years of age.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a separate account within the Cigarette Restitution Fund for payments received from enforcement actions related to electronic smoking devices. It mandates that funds from this account be used to support programs aimed at reducing tobacco use among individuals under 21, including prevention, cessation, education, enforcement, and health initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland State government, specifically the agency managing the Cigarette Restitution Fund and related programs
stakeholders: Individuals under 21, public health organizations, tobacco control advocates, and youth populations across Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated funding stream from litigation related to electronic smoking devices specifically for youth tobacco reduction programs, integrating legal enforcement results into preventive health strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's focus on reducing tobacco use among youth can indirectly impact child poverty by promoting healthier communities and reducing health-related financial burdens.

Title: Public Health - Home- and Community-Based Services for Children and Youth
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to expand access to and provide reimbursement for intensive in-home services, case management, and wraparound services; requiring, beginning in fiscal year 2024, the Behavioral Health Administration to fund 100 slots in the mental health case management program for children or youth at risk of out-of-home placement who are not eligible for program services; requiring the Governor to include funding in the annual budget bill for customized goods and services for certain youth; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Department of Health to expand access to and reimburse for intensive mental health services for children and youth, including wraparound and in-home services, and allocates funding for these programs, with ongoing reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children and youth with mental health needs and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a pilot program employing value-based purchasing for case management services and encourages expansion of evidence-based, family-centered care models using structured coordination and reimbursement incentives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By providing targeted mental health services to vulnerable children and youth, the bill has high potential to reduce child poverty through improved well-being and stability.

Title: Social Services Programs - Eligibility and Enrollment
Synopsis: Requiring the Office of Home Energy Programs to enroll households, based on certain eligibility, in any fuel and utility assistance program; and altering the eligibility requirements for the electric universal service program to provide assistance to customers with annual incomes at or below 200% of the federal poverty level.
bill_summary: The bill modifies eligibility and enrollment rules for social services programs in Maryland, including the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, energy assistance programs, and the electric universal service program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and Public Utilities Commission
stakeholders: Low-income residents, elderly, households with children, and vulnerable populations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates eligibility rules and enrollment procedures for existing programs, with some streamlined processes to improve access for vulnerable populations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by expanding access to nutrition and energy assistance programs, thereby supporting low-income families.

Title: Provision of Veterinary Services - Practice of Veterinary Medicine and Rabies Vaccines
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners to issue a license to an animal control facility to administer rabies vaccines; requiring the Board to establish an expedited process to authorize a veterinary practitioner who holds a current, valid license to practice veterinary medicine in another state or jurisdiction to become licensed to practice veterinary medicine in the State; requiring the Secretary of Health to allow certain veterinary technicians or other clinical staff to administer rabies vaccines; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners to issue licenses to animal control facilities to administer rabies vaccines and establishes an expedited process for out-of-state licensed veterinary practitioners to provide routine medical care to shelter animals in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Animal shelters, veterinary practitioners, animals in shelters, and the public health community
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an expedited licensing process for out-of-state licensed veterinary practitioners and broadens the administration of rabies vaccines to shelter staff and animal control personnel, employing streamlined regulatory approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill can have an indirect impact on child poverty by supporting animal welfare and public health, but it does not directly target child poverty issues.

Title: State Finance and Procurement - Grants - Prompt Payment Requirement
Synopsis: Establishing invoicing and prompt payment requirements for certain State grants; requiring the State to make payment under certain grant agreements within 37 days of the payment becoming due under the agreement or after receiving a proper invoice; and authorizing interest accrual at the rate of 9% per year on any amount that is due and payable but remains unpaid after a certain time.
bill_summary: The bill establishes invoicing and prompt payment requirements for certain state grants in Maryland, including deadlines for payments and penalties for late payments.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management or equivalent state agency responsible for grants
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations and entities receiving Maryland state grants
innovative_summary: The bill implements a structured, timely payment process with interest penalties for late payments, which is a more formalized approach to grant disbursement and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is limited but could be positive by ensuring timely funding for programs benefiting children.

Title: Hospitals - Financial Assistance - Medical Bill Reimbursement Process
Synopsis: Establishing requirements related to the reimbursement of out-of-pocket costs paid by certain hospital patients who were eligible for free care, including requirements related to the consideration of data and the reporting and disclosure of certain information; authorizing the Commission to impose a fine of up to $50,000 per violation if a hospital fails to provide refunds to qualifying patients; making a violation of the Act an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to penalties under the Maryland Consumer Protection Act; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a process for hospitals to reimburse patients who paid out-of-pocket costs for services during 2017-2021 and who qualified for free care, including use of tax and eligibility data, reporting requirements, and penalties for non-compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission, Office of the Attorney General, Maryland Department of Health, Maryland Department of Human Services, Maryland Department of Education, Office of the Comptroller
stakeholders: Hospital patients who paid out-of-pocket costs, hospitals, State government entities, advocacy organizations
innovative_summary: The program employs data sharing between multiple government agencies and hospitals to identify and reimburse eligible patients, leveraging tax and social service data for presumptive eligibility determination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly reduce child poverty by reimbursing costs for low-income families who received hospital care and qualified for free services.

Title: Maryland Lynching Truth and Reconciliation Commission - Reporting and Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the time for the submission of the final report of the Maryland Lynching Truth and Reconciliation Commission to December 1, 2025; and extending the termination date for the Commission to June 30, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill extends the timeframe for the Maryland Lynching Truth and Reconciliation Commission to submit its final report and lengthens the commission's duration, delaying its termination date.
responsible_party: Maryland Lynching Truth and Reconciliation Commission
stakeholders: Public interested in racial justice and historical reconciliation in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends existing timelines and does not introduce new technologies or approaches; it is a procedural extension.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Montgomery County - Alcohol Beverage Services - Advisory Board MC 04-23
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Advisory Board of the Alcohol Beverage Services of Montgomery County to include a designee of the Director of the Services and a designee of the Director of the Montgomery County Department of Police.
bill_summary: The bill amends the composition of the Advisory Board for Alcohol Beverage Services in Montgomery County to include designees of the Director of the Services and the Director of the Montgomery County Department of Police.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Alcohol Beverage Services and the Montgomery County Department of Police
stakeholders: Montgomery County residents, Alcohol Beverage Services, Montgomery County Police Department, applicable regulatory agencies
innovative_summary: The bill updates the advisory board membership to include representatives from the county's Department of Police and the Service Director, facilitating better collaboration and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may improve local alcohol service oversight.

Title: Tax Clinics for Low-Income Marylanders - Funding - Repeal of Sunset
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date of certain provisions of law requiring the Comptroller to distribute a certain amount of certain abandoned property funds to the Tax Clinics for Low-Income Marylanders Fund which provides grants to the University of Maryland School of Law, the University of Baltimore School of Law, and the Maryland Volunteer Lawyers Service to operate tax clinics for low-income Maryland residents.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset provision for funding from abandoned property proceeds to support low-income tax clinics operated by Maryland law schools and legal services, ensuring ongoing funding for these clinics.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Comptroller and related agencies managing abandoned property funds and grants for low-income tax clinics.
stakeholders: Low-income Maryland residents who benefit from tax clinics, legal service providers, and Maryland law schools involved in operating the clinics.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily maintains existing programs and funding mechanisms; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by providing legal and tax assistance to low-income families, helping them improve financial stability.

Title: Baltimore County - School Board Nominating Commission - Vacancy Procedures
Synopsis: Requiring the Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission to hold a public hearing on the selection of a nominee for a single vacancy on the Baltimore County Board of Education in a certain manner under certain circumstances; requiring the Commission to make publicly available on its website live video streaming of certain public hearings and certain archived video recordings; and authorizing the Commission to retain and reactivate the applications of certain candidates for certain vacancies on the county board.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission to hold public hearings, including live streaming and archiving videos, when selecting nominees for the Baltimore County Board of Education. It also details the composition and appointment process for the Commission and allows reactivation of candidate applications for up to two years.
responsible_party: Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore County, Baltimore County Public Schools, prospective school board candidates
innovative_summary: The bill introduces live streaming and archiving of public hearings for the school board nominations, increasing transparency and public engagement through modern technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve governance and transparency but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Maryland School for the Blind - Public School Construction Program - Eligibility
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date on the eligibility of the Maryland School for the Blind for funding under the Public School Construction Program.
bill_summary: The bill removes the termination date for the Maryland School for the Blind's eligibility for funding under the Public School Construction Program, allowing it to continue receiving funding.
responsible_party: Interagency Commission on School Construction
stakeholders: Students and staff at the Maryland School for the Blind, and the broader educational community involved in school construction and capital improvements.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends existing funding eligibility and establishes regulations for school construction funding, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion Day
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor annually to proclaim March 9 as 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion Day in recognition of the service of the women of the 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion during World War II.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Governor to annually proclaim March 9 as 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion Day to honor the service of women in the battalion during World War II.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents, historians, members of the military, particularly those interested in World War II and women's military history
innovative_summary: The bill mainly establishes a commemorative day through a proclamation, which is a common government practice and not an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Recordation Tax - Indemnity Mortgage Exemption - Threshold Amount
Synopsis: Altering the threshold amount for certain indemnity mortgage transactions that are exempt from the recordation tax from less than $3,000,000 to less than $12,500,000; and applying the Act to instruments of writing recorded on or after July 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the threshold amount for exemptions from the recordation tax on indemnity mortgages, allowing local governments in Maryland to set exemptions for mortgages securing guarantees of repayment of loans that are at least $3,000,000 but less than $12,500,000. It also requires reporting on these exemptions and the associated lost revenue.
responsible_party: Local governments in Maryland, specifically the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing bodies of counties
stakeholders: Lenders, borrowers, and local governments involved in recording large indemnity mortgages in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new flexible exemption threshold for recordation taxes based on the size of indemnity mortgages, and includes reporting requirements to monitor revenue loss, which is a relatively innovative approach for local tax exemption policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential for the program to impact child poverty is minimal as it primarily concerns mortgage tax exemptions for large loans.

Title: Higher Education – Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship – Altering Name of Scholarship
Synopsis: Altering the name of the Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship to be the Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship.
bill_summary: The bill officially names the Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship as the Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship, and outlines the management and funding of the scholarship fund.
responsible_party: Maryland State Commission on Higher Education
stakeholders: Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq conflicts and their families
innovative_summary: The bill mainly rebrands a scholarship fund and details its administration; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly pertains to scholarship naming and fund administration.

Title: Health Insurance – Pharmacy Benefits Managers – Audits of Pharmacies and Pharmacists
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Health to adopt regulations for pharmacy benefits managers that contract with managed care organizations that establish requirements for conducting audits of pharmacies or pharmacists; establishing requirements and prohibitions regarding audits by certain pharmacy benefits managers, including provisions related to audit limits, acceptance of certain documents as proof, recoupment of funds or charging of fees for prescriptions of unbreakable package sizes, and access to financial documentation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands regulations on pharmacy benefits managers (PBMs), including establishing rules for conducting audits of pharmacies and pharmacists, registering auditing entities, and setting standards for audit processes, notifications, dispute resolution, and reimbursements. It aims to increase transparency and fairness in PBM audits through detailed rules and protections.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pharmacies, pharmacists, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs detailed regulatory oversight, including registration of auditing entities, mandatory notification processes, internal appeals, secure communication mechanisms, and detailed documentation requirements, representing an integrated approach to audit transparency and fairness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on fair pharmacy audits could indirectly improve access to affordable medication, potentially reducing child poverty related to health costs.

Title: Health Insurance - Diagnostic and Supplemental Examinations and Biopsies for Breast Cancer - Cost-Sharing
Synopsis: Prohibiting, except under certain circumstances, insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations that provide coverage for diagnostic and supplemental breast examinations from imposing a copayment, coinsurance, or deductible requirement for the examination; and requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to study and report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by October 1, 2023 on the financial impact of eliminating cost-sharing for diagnostic image-guided biopsies for breast cancer.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits insurers and health plans in Maryland from charging copayments, coinsurance, or deductibles for diagnostic and supplemental breast examinations, including certain biopsies, to reduce financial barriers for breast cancer diagnosis.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Individuals requiring breast cancer diagnostic and supplemental examinations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a health policy approach to eliminate cost-sharing for specific breast health services to improve early detection and care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on insurance coverage rules for breast examinations.

Title: Montgomery County - Village of Friendship Heights Special Taxing District - Procurement MC 15-23
Synopsis: Increasing the threshold amount above which the Friendship Heights Village Council is prohibited from entering into a certain contract without a competitive bidding process; and authorizing the village council, by majority vote, to enter into a certain contract that exceeds the $20,000 threshold amount without a competitive bidding process if the procurement is in response to an emergency.
bill_summary: The bill increases the threshold amount for the Friendship Heights Village Council to enter into contracts without a competitive bidding process from $5,000 to $20,000, and allows the council to bypass bidding and enter into contracts exceeding $20,000 in response to emergencies.
responsible_party: Friendship Heights Village Council in Montgomery County
stakeholders: Residents and businesses within the Friendship Heights Village district
innovative_summary: The bill adopts a typical procurement rule update, not employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Commissioner of Financial Regulation - Name and Organization of Office
Synopsis: Establishing the name of a certain office under the Commissioner of Financial Regulation in the Maryland Department of Labor as the Office of Financial Regulation; designating a certain appointee of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation as the Deputy Commissioner for Depository Activities; requiring the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to appoint a Deputy Commissioner for Non-Depository Activities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill renames the office under the Maryland Department of Labor's Commissioner of Financial Regulation as the Office of Financial Regulation, and establishes two deputy commissioners for depository and non-depository activities, with specified experience requirements and responsibilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Office of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Financial institutions, consumers, and businesses in Maryland involved in depository and non-depository financial activities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured leadership with specialized deputy commissioners for distinct areas, employing a clear organizational model within the existing financial regulation framework.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to strengthen financial regulation, which could indirectly impact economic stability.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Prescription Drug Affordability Board - Managed Care Organizations and Prescription Drug Claims - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health and the Prescription Drug Affordability Board jointly to study certain information regarding the payment of prescription drug claims under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program during calendar years 2021 and 2022 and how to address certain inconsistencies; and requiring the Department and the Board to report the findings of the study to the Maryland Medicaid Administration and certain committees of the General Assembly by October 31, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health and the Prescription Drug Affordability Board to study prescription drug claim reimbursements by managed care organizations and pharmacies, comparing them to Medicaid rates, to address inconsistencies and improve the reimbursement methodology.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Prescription Drug Affordability Board
stakeholders: Managed care organizations, pharmacies, state agencies, and public health programs
innovative_summary: The bill employs data analysis and systematic study to evaluate and address reimbursement inconsistencies in prescription drug claims, representing an evidence-based approach to healthcare policy reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by potentially reducing medication costs and improving healthcare access.

Title: Institutions of Higher Education - Transcripts - Prohibition on Punitive Measures Related to Student Debt
Synopsis: Prohibiting an institution of higher education from refusing to provide a current or former student with a transcript or taking other punitive measures regarding a student's transcript request because the student owes a debt to the institution of higher education.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits higher education institutions in Maryland from refusing, delaying, or charging extra fees for transcripts or using transcript requests as a debt collection tool for students who owe debts.
responsible_party: Institutions of Higher Education in Maryland
stakeholders: Current and former students of higher education institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal safeguard ensuring students' access to transcripts without punitive measures related to debt, promoting equitable treatment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses transparency and fairness in transcript issuance.

Title: Natural Resources - Blue and Flathead Catfish Finfish Trotline License - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing a licensing and regulatory scheme to allow the commercial fishing of blue and flathead catfish in the tidal waters of the State using a finfish trotline.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing scheme for the commercial fishing of blue and flathead catfish in Maryland's tidal waters using a finfish trotline. It creates a new one-year license with a fee of $15.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Commercial fishers interested in catching blue and flathead catfish, regulatory agencies, and the local fishing industry
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific license for blue and flathead catfish trotline fishing, which is a targeted regulatory approach to manage this fishery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns fishing regulations and licensing.

Title: Bond Sales - Notification of the Public
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Public Works and the State Treasurer to provide public notice of a public sale of State bonds by The Municipal Market Monitor (TM3) or a similar service or such other method deemed appropriate by the State Treasurer.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Board of Public Works and the State Treasurer to provide public notice of State bond sales via a service or method they consider appropriate, such as the Municipal Market Monitor (TM3). It specifies the timing and methods for notifying the public about bond sale dates and any postponements.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works and the State Treasurer
stakeholders: Public and investors interested in Maryland State bonds
innovative_summary: The bill allows the use of digital and third-party notification services like TM3 for bond sale notices, modernizing and streamlining the notification process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal as it primarily changes notification procedures for bond sales.

Title: Department of Agriculture - State Specialist for Value-Added Agriculture
Synopsis: Establishing the State Specialist for Value-Added Agriculture as a position in the Department of Agriculture to serve as the primary point of contact for individuals engaging in, or interested in engaging in, value-added agriculture in the State; and requiring the Specialist to provide information regarding State and federal regulations related to value-added agriculture and to act as a liaison between State and federal partners involved in value-added agriculture.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the position of the State Specialist for Value–Added Agriculture within the Maryland Department of Agriculture. The role involves serving as the primary contact for value-added agricultural businesses, providing regulatory information, liaising with federal partners, and supporting related activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Farmers, producers, processors involved in value-added agriculture in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated state specialist position focused on value-added agriculture, which is a targeted approach to support this specific sector of the agricultural industry.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The programs could indirectly impact child poverty by supporting local agriculture and economic development, but the bill does not specify direct impacts on child poverty.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Parking Enforcement - Citations
Synopsis: Requiring a parking citation issued by a political subdivision, a State agency, or a third-party contractor to include a box that the person issued the citation may check to indicate that the registration plates cited were not issued for the vehicle described in the citation; requiring a political subdivision, State agency, or third-party contractor that receives a parking citation from a person with the box checked to perform a certain verification process and dismiss the citation under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires parking citations issued by government entities or third-party contractors to include a checkbox allowing the recipient to indicate if the registration plates cited do not belong to the vehicle. If checked and returned, the issuing authority must investigate and potentially dismiss the citation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant parking enforcement authorities
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, parking enforcement agencies, and government entities responsible for parking regulations in Maryland
innovative_summary: Introducing a verification step within parking citations that allows vehicle owners to dispute citations based on registration mismatches, leveraging a simple, self-service verification process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's impact on child poverty is likely minimal as it primarily focuses on parking citation procedures.

Title: Maryland Tort Claims Act - Denial of Claims - Notice
Synopsis: Altering the means by which the State Treasurer may send notice of a denial of a claim made under the Maryland Tort Claims Act to authorize notice by e-mail or, if it is the only available means, by regular mail.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Tort Claims Act to allow the State Treasurer to send denial notices to claimants via e-mail or, if that is not available, by regular mail.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer's Office
stakeholders: Claimants under the Maryland Tort Claims Act
innovative_summary: The bill introduces digital communication (email) as an approved method for notifying claim denials, streamlining the process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Government - State Facilities Changes and Closures - Procedures
Synopsis: Requiring a principal department of the Executive Branch to give certain notice to the public, the General Assembly, and any exclusive representative with certain bargaining unit employees, hold a public hearing, submit a certain report, make the report publicly available, and allow the submission of certain comments before changing the use, purpose, or function of a State facility or closing a State facility.
bill_summary: The bill sets new procedures requiring a principal department of Maryland's Executive Branch to hold public hearings and provide notices before changing the use, purpose, or function of, or closing, a State facility, including establishing timelines and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government Department overseeing State facilities (unspecified)
stakeholders: Residents, employees, and communities around State facilities, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, formal process with specific notice, hearing, and reporting requirements for changes to State facilities, emphasizing transparency and public participation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting transparency and procedural rules for state facility changes.

Title: State Investment Portfolio - Investment Thresholds - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing the limitations on investment in certain commercial paper in which the Treasurer may invest or reinvest certain unexpended or surplus funds; requiring the Treasurer to adopt regulations to establish a State investment policy with certain thresholds; and requiring the Treasurer to notify certain officials and governing bodies of certain local governmental units about the provisions of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill modifies investment rules for the Maryland State Treasury, including repealing restrictions on commercial paper investments, establishing new regulations and thresholds for investment types, and requiring the Treasury to develop a state investment policy.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer's Office
stakeholders: State and local government entities, taxpayers, minority business enterprises, and investment management firms
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by establishing formal regulations and thresholds for state investments, promoting minority business participation, and requiring a comprehensive state investment policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns investment policies and procedures.

Title: Maryland Audiology, Hearing Aid Dispensing, Speech-Language Pathology, and Music Therapy Act - Definitions and Application
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "hearing aid dispensary" to include certain actions taken for the purpose of ordering certain hearing instruments and specifying that certain hearing instruments include prescription hearing aids; altering the definition of "practice audiology" for the purposes of certain provisions of law governing the licensure of audiologists; and providing that certain provisions of law do not apply to certain actions taken with respect to certain over-the-counter hearing aids.
bill_summary: The bill updates the definitions and regulations concerning audiology and hearing aid dispensing in Maryland. It explicitly includes prescription hearing aids in the definition of hearing aid dispensing and clarifies that certain provisions do not apply to over-the-counter hearing aids. It also sets licensing requirements for practitioners.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists
stakeholders: Audiologists, hearing aid dispensers, speech-language pathologists, individuals who need hearing aids, and the general public in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal definitions and regulations; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Low direct potential for impact on child poverty, as the bill focuses on professional regulations and definitions.

Title: Kent County - Board of Education - Student Member
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Kent County Board of Education to include a student member; providing for the initial term of the student member of the county board; requiring the student member to attend the Maryland Association of Boards of Education new student board orientation and all regular meetings of the county board; prohibiting the student member's attendance at an executive session of the county board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Kent County Board of Education to include a student member who is a junior or senior at the county high school, elected by students, to serve a one-year term starting July 1, 2024. It details the election process, responsibilities, and qualifications of the student member, and also updates board member terms and compensation.
responsible_party: Kent County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students in Kent County public high schools, Kent County residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a student representative into the county education board to provide student perspectives directly in governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is limited, as it primarily focuses on governance and representation.

Title: Property Tax - Local Homeowners' Credit Supplement - Limitation on Combined Gross Income
Synopsis: Authorizing counties and municipal corporations to alter a certain limitation on the combined gross income of a homeowner for purposes of a local supplement to the homeowners' property tax credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local governments in Maryland to grant property tax credits or supplements to homeowners with incomes over $60,000 who have suffered hardships, allowing them to receive property tax relief under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation, local governments (cities and counties)
stakeholders: Homeowners with higher incomes who have experienced hardships
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tailored approach to property tax relief by enabling local entities to modify eligibility criteria and provide supplements or credits for specific hardship cases, which is a flexible and customizable government approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may moderately impact child poverty by providing targeted relief to homeowners facing hardships, potentially reducing financial stress in households.

Title: Hunting - Snares, Traps, and Other Similar Devices - Identification Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring a person who is not required to be licensed or permitted under certain provisions of law to obtain a free Department of Natural Resources identification number before using a snare, a trap, or another similar device to capture wildlife; and requiring a person who uses a snare, a trap, or another similar device to capture wildlife to ensure the person's Department identification number is stamped on the device or on a metal tag affixed to the device.
bill_summary: The bill requires individuals who are not licensed or permitted under Maryland law to obtain an identification number before using snares, traps, or similar devices to capture wildlife. It also mandates that this identification number be stamped on the device or a attached tag, and outlines regulations regarding the placement of traps.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Wildlife enthusiasts, hunters, trap owners, and the general public concerned with wildlife conservation and humane trapping practices.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a digital identification system and requires physical tagging of trapping devices, which improves traceability and accountability in wildlife trapping.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing instead on wildlife management and safety.

Title: Elections - Polling Place Plan, Prohibited Acts, and 2024 Primary Election Date
Synopsis: Prohibiting a local board of elections from voting to change the location of a polling place without first holding a meeting to discuss the proposed change and providing an opportunity for individuals and organizations to testify; requiring each local board to submit a polling place plan to the State Board of Elections at least 6 months prior to each statewide primary election; altering the date of the 2024 statewide primary election and the primary election for municipal offices in Baltimore City to the second Tuesday in May; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates election procedures in Maryland, including requirements for local election boards to hold public meetings before changing polling locations, submitting detailed polling place plans for approval, and clarifying rules to prevent voter influence and election interference.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters in Maryland, election officials, and communities affected by polling place changes
innovative_summary: The bill introduces enhanced transparency and community involvement in polling place decisions, with detailed plans and public notice requirements, utilizing data analysis to maximize voter participation and protect access, especially for historically disenfranchised communities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill’s focus on ensuring accessible polling places and community engagement has potential to reduce barriers to voting, which can help mitigate barriers faced by low-income and disenfranchised children and families.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Violation of Pretrial or Posttrial Condition by Incarcerated Person - Victim Contact
Synopsis: Prohibiting a certain incarcerated person from violating a condition of pretrial or posttrial release or other pretrial or posttrial condition prohibiting the person from contacting, harassing, or abusing an alleged victim or going in or near an alleged victim's residence or place of employment.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits incarcerated persons from violating certain conditions of pretrial or posttrial release related to contacting or harassing victims, especially in cases involving minors, violent crimes, or certain other offenses, with penalties including up to 90 days of imprisonment.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Corrections
stakeholders: Victims of crime, incarcerated persons, criminal justice system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific restrictions on contact and harassment for incarcerated persons during pretrial and posttrial periods, focusing on protecting victims.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on criminal law enforcement and victim protection, with no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Mental Health - Workforce Development - Fund Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Behavioral Health Workforce Investment Fund to provide reimbursement for costs associated with educating, training, certifying, recruiting, placing, and retaining behavioral health professionals and paraprofessionals; and requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission, in coordination with certain entities, to conduct a comprehensive behavioral health workforce needs assessment on or before October 1, 2024, and submit the assessment to certain committees of the General Assembly by October 15, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Behavioral Health Workforce Investment Fund, a dedicated fund to support training, recruitment, and retention of behavioral health professionals. It requires a comprehensive workforce needs assessment and allocates interest earnings from the fund for these purposes.
responsible_party: The Department of Health and the Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Behavioral health professionals, paraprofessionals, and individuals requiring behavioral health services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated, nonlapsing fund with interest earnings specifically allocated for workforce development, coupled with a comprehensive, data-driven workforce needs assessment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a significant impact on child poverty by increasing access to mental health services for children and families through a strengthened workforce.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Hospital Rates - All-Payer Model Contract
Synopsis: Requiring that the Health Services Cost Review Commission exercise its authority to consider certain standards when determining the reasonableness of certain rates in a manner that is consistent with the all-payer model contract.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission to consider standards consistent with the all-payer model contract when determining the reasonableness of hospital rates. It also gives the Commission new authority to establish hospital rate levels, approve alternative payment methods, and assist in federally approved model programs.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Hospital facilities, healthcare purchasers, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new authorities to the Commission to establish rate levels, promote alternative payment methods, and support federally approved programs, reflecting an innovative approach to hospital rate regulation within an all-payer model.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited direct impact on child poverty but could contribute indirectly through improved healthcare cost management.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Nonvested Accounts - Regular Interest
Synopsis: Requiring a certain rate of interest on certain member contributions in active members' nonvested accounts in the State Retirement and Pension System if the members have not withdrawn contributions from the nonvested accounts and are not eligible to receive a certain vested allowance; providing for the retroactive application of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires a minimum annual interest rate of 4% or 5% on certain member contributions in the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, specifically for members who are active but not eligible for vested allowances and have not withdrawn contributions. It applies retroactively and aims to ensure accrued interest on nonvested member contributions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System who are active, nonvested contributors and have not withdrawn their contributions
innovative_summary: This bill introduces a new interest accrual requirement on member contributions in the retirement system, ensuring minimum interest rates for specific active members, which is a regulatory change rather than a new technological or service innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a low potential for direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects retirement contributions of individual members.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Medical Emergency - Immunity
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions relating to immunity from criminal arrest, charge, or prosecution for a person experiencing a medical emergency after ingesting or using alcohol or drugs.
bill_summary: This bill provides immunity from criminal arrest, charge, or prosecution for persons who seek, provide, assist with, or receive medical assistance during a medical emergency involving alcohol or drugs. It aims to encourage individuals to seek help without fear of legal repercussions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Criminal Justice Agencies
stakeholders: Individuals experiencing medical emergencies related to alcohol or drug use, and their friends or helpers
innovative_summary: The bill strengthens protections for emergency responders and victims by legally immunizing those involved during medical emergencies, which supports public health and safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly supports vulnerable populations by encouraging timely medical assistance, potentially reducing health crises among at-risk groups.

Title: University System of Maryland - Board of Regents - Student Member Grant
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland to authorize a certain grant for the student member serving in the first year of the student's term on the Board of Regents.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the University System of Maryland's Board of Regents to provide a financial grant to student members serving on the Board during their first year, and a tuition waiver during their second year, of a two-year term.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland Board of Regents
stakeholders: Students serving on the University System of Maryland Board of Regents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a financial aid program specifically for student members of the Board of Regents, which is a targeted support initiative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's impact on child poverty is likely minimal, as it is targeted at student governance members rather than at a broad or vulnerable child population.

Title: Procurement Improvement Council - Membership and Duties
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Procurement Improvement Council to include the Comptroller and the Attorney General; authorizing certain members to send a designee to attend certain meetings under certain circumstances; and clarifying the duties of the Council to include discussion of strategies to increase the participation of small, minority-owned, and women-owned businesses in procurement contracts.
bill_summary: The bill changes the membership, duties, and operations of the Maryland Procurement Improvement Council, including adding a new focus on increasing participation of small, minority, and women-owned businesses in procurement.
responsible_party: Maryland Procurement Improvement Council, led by the Chief Procurement Officer
stakeholders: State procurement officials, small businesses, minority-owned and women-owned businesses, taxpayers, government agencies
innovative_summary: Includes a new focus on strategies to increase participation of small, minority–, and women–owned businesses in procurement contracts, which is an innovative approach to promoting diversity and inclusion in government contracting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill’s focus on increasing participation of minority and women-owned businesses in procurement has the potential to economically benefit disadvantaged communities and reduce child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Office of the Sheriff - Deputy Sheriffs and Labor Organizations PG 308-23
Synopsis: Increasing from four to five the number of full-time assistant sheriffs provided to the Sheriff of Prince George's County; and providing that the Fraternal Order of Police will negotiate on behalf of deputy sheriffs in benefit matters not related to salary.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of full-time assistant sheriffs in Prince George's County, adjusts procedures for their benefits and employment, and specifies their law enforcement duties, including investigation protocols for domestic violence calls.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Office of the Sheriff
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, sheriff's deputies, county government
innovative_summary: The bill formalizes duties, employment conditions, and investigation protocols for sheriff's deputies, including their role in domestic violence calls, aligning law enforcement practices within the county.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's primary focus is on law enforcement staffing and procedures, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 210 (Indian Head Highway) PG 304-23
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum number of speed monitoring systems that may be placed and used on Maryland Route 210 (Indian Head Highway) in Prince George's County from three to six; requiring the State Highway Administration in conjunction with a certain entity to report annually its recommendations for solutions to address accidents, injuries, and fatalities on the highway; extending the termination date for a provision of law granting the authority to place speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 in Prince George's County; etc.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum number of speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Indian Head Highway) in Prince George's County, extends the authority for their placement, and modifies procedures for examining safety issues on the highway, including financial reporting related to violations.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Department of Public Works and Transportation and State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Residents, drivers, and local government in Prince George's County, particularly along Maryland Route 210
innovative_summary: The bill enhances traffic safety monitoring with more speed cameras and increased program oversight, employing existing technology in a more expanded and systematic way.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program primarily focuses on traffic safety and infrastructure, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Licensing PG 305-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County, notwithstanding a certain prohibition on the transfer of a license with an off-sale privilege, to approve the transfer of a Class A beer, wine, and liquor license to a premises located in a certain alcoholic beverages district under certain circumstances; authorizing the Board to issue a Class B-DD beer, wine, and liquor license with an off-sale privilege to certain restaurants in certain areas; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies alcohol licensing rules in Prince George's County, allowing transfers of certain licenses in specific districts, creating new types of licenses for restaurants with off-sale privileges, and expanding available license numbers in designated development districts, including on Central Avenue.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Restaurants, alcohol licensees, residents, and visitors in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new licensing approach for restaurants, with specific requirements for off-sale privileges and designated districts, utilizing location-based licensing strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing regulations for businesses.

Title: Prince George's County Public Schools - Alterations to Title of Chief Executive Officer and Establishment of Office of Integrity and Compliance PG 501-23
Synopsis: Changing the title of the Chief Executive Officer of the Prince George's County public school system to the County Superintendent of the Prince George's County public school system; establishing the Office of Integrity and Compliance in the Prince George's County public school system to evaluate, examine, investigate, report on, and make recommendations on certain issues related to the Prince George's County public school system; requiring the County Council of Prince George's County to appoint an Integrity and Compliance officer; etc.
bill_summary: This bill changes the title of the chief officer of Prince George's County Public Schools to County Superintendent and establishes the Office of Integrity and Compliance to oversee investigations, ensure accountability, and evaluate the effectiveness of the school system. It also sets procedures for selection, duties, and oversight of the superintendent and the Office.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Council and Prince George's County Public Schools
stakeholders: Students, staff, vendors, and residents of Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an independent Office of Integrity and Compliance employing new oversight and investigative approaches within the public school system.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has strong potential to improve school system integrity and accountability, which can positively impact child poverty by ensuring efficient resource use and better educational outcomes.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B-Stadium (Baseball Stadium) Beer, Wine, and Liquor License PG 306-23
Synopsis: Altering the alcoholic beverages that may be sold under a certain stadium license in Prince George's County; authorizing the holder of a Class B-Stadium (baseball stadium) beer, wine, and liquor license to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption; altering a provision of law providing that the profit from the sale of certain alcoholic beverages under the license may accrue to the use of the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission or the concessionaire; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland law to modify the types of alcoholic beverages sold under a specific stadium license in Prince George's County, allowing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption at a baseball stadium, and clarifying how profits are allocated. It also updates license naming and counts within the county.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Alcoholic Beverages Board or relevant local licensing authority
stakeholders: Baseball stadium operators, concessionaires, and patrons in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing rules and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty or socioeconomic issues.

Title: Child Custody - Relocation of Child - Expedited Hearing (Assurance of Child's Safety Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a court to schedule a hearing on a certain petition regarding the proposed relocation of a child who is the subject of a custody or visitation order on an expedited basis under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill enhances child custody laws by requiring courts to hold expedited hearings on relocation petitions and prohibits considering a child's time with a party who relocates in violation of notice requirements as an advantage in subsequent custody hearings.
responsible_party: Maryland courts/Family Law Department
stakeholders: Children and parents involved in custody disputes
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an expedited judicial process for relocation cases and restricts the use of violations of notice requirements as an advantage, employing procedural reforms in family law.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions primarily affect legal processes and custody arrangements; its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Prince George's County - Payment in Lieu of Taxes Agreements - Low-Income Housing PG 403-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Prince George's County to enter into a payment in lieu of taxes agreement with an owner of real property that is used for low-income housing that is financed through the county's Right of First Refusal program or acquired, constructed, or rehabilitated for the purposes of operating the low-income housing.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Prince George's County to enter into agreements with owners of low-income housing for payment in lieu of property taxes, specifically for housing financed through the county's Right of First Refusal program or used for operating low-income rental housing.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government
stakeholders: Owners of low-income housing, low-income residents in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tax agreement approach to support low-income housing, including use of payment in lieu of taxes for housing financed through a specific county program, which is a tailored approach to housing finance supporting low-income residents.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to enable more low-income housing, which can help reduce child poverty by increasing affordable housing options.

Title: Nonpublic Education - Placements of Children With Disabilities - Teacher Salaries (Teacher Pay Parity Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to adopt regulations to ensure that children with disabilities who need special education and related services that cannot be provided in a public county, regional, or State program be placed in an appropriate nonpublic educational program that offers these services; requiring the State and certain counties to pay for costs of salaries for teachers at certain nonpublic schools in a certain amount and proportion; etc.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Teacher Pay Parity Act, aims to rename the nonpublic educational placement program to the 'special education placement' program and mandates that the State and counties pay for teacher salaries at these placements, ensuring salary parity with public school teachers and providing funding for wraparound services for children with disabilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Children with disabilities, teachers at nonpublic schools, local education agencies, and families of children with disabilities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured phased-in approach to ensure salary parity between teachers in nonpublic special education schools and public school teachers, integrating funding mechanisms and regulatory standards, which is a notable approach to addressing wage disparities.
