child_poverty_direct_summary: High; improving teacher salaries and funding for special education placements can directly enhance educational access and quality for children with disabilities, thereby reducing child poverty.

Title: State Board of Physicians - Inactive and Emeritus Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board to place a licensee on emeritus status under certain circumstances; requiring the Board, under certain circumstances, to reinstate the license of an individual who is on inactive or emeritus status; exempting licensees who are on inactive status or emeritus status from continuing medical education requirements; repealing the requirement that the Board issue a license to an individual who is on inactive status under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Physicians to place physicians on emeritus status after specific qualifications, makes provisions for reinstating licenses, and clarifies rules regarding inactive and emeritus licensees including practice restrictions and use of titles.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physicians in Maryland, particularly those seeking emeritus or inactive status, and the general public seeking medical services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program introduces the concept of emeritus status for physicians, offering an official recognition of retirement status and associated practice rules, which is a relatively innovative approach in professional licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns licensing status and regulations for physicians.

Title: Health Occupations - Licenses, Certificates, and Registrations - Lawful Presence and Identification Numbers
Synopsis: Prohibiting a health occupations board from requiring that an applicant provide proof that the applicant is lawfully present in the United States or have a Social Security number or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number as a condition for licensure, certification, or registration; requiring each health occupations board to require each applicant for a license to disclose the Social Security number or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number of the applicant or, as permitted by federal law, provide alternative documentation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits health occupations boards in Maryland from denying licenses to immigrants who meet certain requirements, such as providing proof of lawful presence in the U.S. or having a Social Security or Taxpayer Identification Number. It also mandates that applicants disclose these numbers or provide alternative documentation, and it updates record-keeping and reporting procedures accordingly.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and related health occupations licensing boards
stakeholders: Immigrants seeking health occupational licenses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a process to ensure immigrants are eligible for licensure without discrimination, employing new record-keeping requirements and allowing for alternative documentation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly improve access to health services for immigrant populations, potentially reducing barriers associated with poverty.

Title: Video Lottery Terminal Proceeds - Purse Dedication Account - Ocean Downs Race Course Operating Loss Assistance
Synopsis: Altering the authority of the Ocean Downs Race Course to use certain Purse Dedication Account funds generated from video lottery terminal proceeds for operating loss assistance to support a certain minimum number of live racing days at the racecourse.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Ocean Downs Race Course to use proceeds from video lottery terminals to help cover operational losses, supporting at least 40 live racing days annually, with funds calculated at up to $30,000 per racing day.
responsible_party: Maryland State Racing Commission
stakeholders: Horse racing industry, local communities around Ocean Downs, bettors, and racing fans
innovative_summary: The bill employs a financial assistance model using lottery proceeds to bolster a traditional industry, supporting operational stability and race scheduling.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is not directly aimed at reducing child poverty but supports the horse racing industry and associated communities.

Title: State Board of Pharmacy - Accessible Prescription Labels, Bag Tags, and Medical Guides for Blind, Visually Impaired, and Print Disabled Individuals - Regulations
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Pharmacy to adopt regulations necessary to ensure that individuals who are blind, visually impaired, or otherwise print disabled have appropriate access to prescription labels, bag tags, and medical guides; requiring the Board to give visually impaired individuals an opportunity to comment on the regulations; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report by December 1, 2023, to the General Assembly on the implementation process for providing accessible labels for visually impaired persons.
bill_summary: This bill requires pharmacies to inform customers about the availability of accessible prescription labels for individuals who are blind, visually impaired, or print disabled, and to provide such labels upon request. It also mandates the Maryland State Board of Pharmacy to establish regulations ensuring proper access to accessible labels, bag tags, and medical guides, and to include input from visually impaired individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Blind, visually impaired, and print disabled individuals who use prescription services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs new regulations and standards to improve accessibility of prescription information through labeling and technology integration, including accessible formats and prescription readers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to essential medication information for vulnerable populations, including children with disabilities.

Title: Public School Construction - Programs, Approvals, and Administration - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing the School Safety Grant Program and the Aging Schools Program as of June 30, 2026; altering provisions relating to school construction approvals by the State Superintendent of Schools; altering provisions related to a public-private partnership agreement in Prince George's County; establishing that the Interagency Commission on School Construction is an independent unit of State government; repealing the requirement for the Board of Public Works to approve grants awarded under a certain capital grant program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the School Safety Grant Program and the Aging Schools Program, makes various changes to school construction approval processes, establishes the Interagency Commission on School Construction as an independent agency, and modifies funding and financing mechanisms for public school projects, including the creation of a new Public–Private Partnership Fund in Prince George's County.
responsible_party: Interagency Commission on School Construction and related Maryland state agencies
stakeholders: Public school students, school districts, Maryland State government, Prince George's County residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new independent commission for school construction, expands public-private partnership models, and utilizes innovative financing streams, including the establishment of dedicated funds and evaluation standards for energy efficiency and lifecycle costs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving school infrastructure, which can enhance educational environments and opportunities for students in need.

Title: State Board of Architects - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Architects in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2028, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination date of the State Board of Architects from 2023 to 2028.
responsible_party: State Board of Architects in the Department of (unspecified department, likely Consumer Affairs or similar)
stakeholders: Architects and related professionals in Maryland, as well as the public who are served by licensed architects
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches; it primarily extends an existing regulatory body's statutory lifespan.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unrelated to child poverty and unlikely to have a direct impact.

Title: Natural Resources - Recreational Crabbing Gear - Individuals Under the Age of 16 Years
Synopsis: Authorizing an individual under the age of 16 years to use a collapsible trap, net ring, handline, or dip net when catching or attempting to catch crabs in the waters of the Chesapeake Bay and its tidal tributaries without a recreational crabbing license.
bill_summary: The bill exempts individuals under 16 from the requirement to get a recreational crabbing license and allows them to use specific gear when catching crabs recreationally in the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Individuals under 16 years old recreational crabbers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies access to recreational crabbing for minors by removing licensing requirements and specifying allowable gear, but it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Worcester County - Natural Resources - Hunting
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to allow a person in Worcester County to hunt game birds and game mammals on a Sunday, subject to certain time restrictions, during the open season for that game bird or game mammal; authorizing the Department to allow a person in Worcester County to hunt on public land designated for hunting on Sundays, subject to certain time restrictions; and altering the safety zone from 150 to 50 yards from certain buildings occupied by human beings within which archery hunting may not take place.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Worcester County to allow hunting on Sundays during certain seasons, modifies safety zones for archery hunting, and clarifies regulations for hunting on public lands and with different methods within the county.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunters and residents of Worcester County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted approach to Sunday hunting regulations and safety zones, but does not employ new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly focusing on hunting regulations.

Title: Environment - Fire-Fighting Training - Oriented Strand Board - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting the setting on fire or burning of oriented strand board for certain fire-fighting training; and establishing an administrative penalty not exceeding $500 for a first violation of the Act and a civil penalty not exceeding $1,000 for a second or subsequent violation of the Act.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits setting fire to or burning oriented strand board for the purpose of fire-fighting training in Maryland, with penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Environment
stakeholders: Fire departments and training organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory approach to prevent environmental and health hazards associated with burning oriented strand board during fire-fighting training.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but promotes environmental health and safety.

Title: Economic Development – Regional Institution Strategic Enterprise Zone Program – Alterations and Financing
Synopsis: Altering the period of time that an area may be designated as a Regional Institution Strategic Enterprise (RISE) zone from 5 to 10 years; increasing the number of RISE zones that the Secretary of Commerce may approve in Baltimore City to not more than four; extending the termination date of the RISE Program to January 1, 2030; and authorizing a political subdivision to pledge certain revenues to secure the payment of obligations to the Maryland Economic Development Corporation for infrastructure improvements located in a RISE zone.
bill_summary: The bill extends the designation period of the Regional Institution Strategic Enterprise (RISE) zones from 5 to 10 years, allows the renewal of these zones for an additional 5 years, increases the number of RISE zones that can be approved in Baltimore City to four, and extends the program's termination date to 2030. It also authorizes political subdivisions to pledge revenues to secure infrastructure improvement obligations related to RISE zones and mandates a study on the program's effectiveness with a report due in December 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce and Maryland Economic Development Corporation
stakeholders: Economic development agencies, local governments, institutions, and communities within or near RISE zones, including Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill enhances existing economic zones by extending durations and increasing approval limits, and introduces a recommendation study to improve program effectiveness, reflecting a proactive approach utilizing existing zones with potential for innovative impacts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potentially significant impact due to targeted economic development incentives in zones that may promote job creation and community investment.

Title: Public Senior Higher Education Institutions - Reproductive Health Services Plans - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring, on or before August 1, 2024, certain public senior higher education institutions, in consultation with students, to develop and implement a reproductive health services plan to provide at the institution or to refer students to a comprehensive range of reproductive health services; requiring the University of Baltimore, in lieu of developing and implementing a reproductive health services plan, to provide students with access to over-the-counter contraception through certain on-campus means; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain public higher education institutions in Maryland to develop and implement reproductive health services plans for students, which include access to contraception, STI prevention, and reproductive health education, by August 1, 2024, in consultation with students. It also allows some institutions to provide over-the-counter contraception directly.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and public higher education institutions
stakeholders: Students at Maryland public higher education institutions, reproductive health service providers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, student-inclusive approach to reproductive health services in higher education, including plans and referral networks, with assistance from the Department of Health.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce barriers to reproductive health services among students, which may help mitigate factors contributing to child poverty.

Title: Department of Veterans Affairs - Burial in State Veterans' Cemeteries - Spouses and Dependents
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Veterans Affairs to bury the eligible spouse or dependent of a veteran in a State veterans' cemetery without charge.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that the Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs provide burial plots at no charge for the spouses and dependents of veterans in state veterans' cemeteries, and prohibits charging for opening and closing the burial plots for these family members.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Veterans and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill formalizes free burial benefits for spouses and dependents of veterans in state cemeteries, ensuring access without charge, which is a standard benefit for veterans now extended to their families.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has low direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns burial benefits for spouses and dependents which are not specifically targeted at reducing child poverty.

Title: Grossly Negligent or Drunk or Drugged Operation of Vehicle or Vessel - Prior Convictions
Synopsis: Establishing that certain previous convictions for drunk or drugged operation of a vehicle or vessel and grossly negligent manslaughter by vehicle or vessel under certain provisions of law constitute prior convictions for the purpose of determining certain enhanced subsequent offender penalties.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that previous convictions for drunk or drugged operation of a vehicle or vessel, and for grossly negligent manslaughter by vehicle or vessel, are considered prior convictions for the purpose of determining enhanced penalties for repeat offenders.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Individuals operating vessels or vehicles under the influence or impaired, law enforcement agencies, legal system
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal clarification to enhance the enforcement and sentencing process for repeat offenders by explicitly considering certain previous convictions as prior offenses for penalty enhancements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Task Force to Study Nonpublic Student Bus Transportation
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Nonpublic Student Bus Transportation to collect information from each local board of education on nonpublic school student busing programs other than for the transportation of students in special education; and requiring the Task Force to report by December 15, 2023, to certain committees of the General Assembly any recommendations as to how the State may support a reduction in the use of passenger vehicles for nonpublic school students and policies for certain busing programs.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Task Force to study nonpublic student bus transportation and recommend methods for supporting transportation reduction and funding. It also creates a refundable income tax credit for parents or guardians paying for nonpublic school bus transportation expenses, capped at $1,500 per student, applicable for one year starting July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Parents of nonpublic school students, nonpublic school students, transportation agencies, state government
innovative_summary: The bill combines a study on nonpublic school transportation with a new tax credit, employing a dual approach of research and financial support to address transportation issues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty through financial support for transportation, reducing barriers to access to education.

Title: Anne Arundel County - School Vehicles - Duration of Operation
Synopsis: Altering the number of years that a school vehicle may be operated in Anne Arundel County from 12 years to 15 years.
bill_summary: This bill amends the operating lifespan of school vehicles in Maryland, increasing the standard duration from 12 years to 15 years in several counties, including Anne Arundel.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: School transportation agencies, students, parents, and school district administrators in affected counties.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a standardized 15-year operational limit for school vehicles that includes detailed maintenance and inspection procedures, with potential for technology-based inspections and maintenance tracking.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for a moderate impact on child poverty through improved safety and extended access to school transportation, which can support low-income students.

Title: Early Childhood Development - Child Care Scholarship Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Department of Education from increasing the copayment levels, reducing the reimbursement rates, reducing the income eligibility requirements, or implementing an enrollment freeze for the Child Care Scholarship Program in effect as of January 1, 2023, unless certain conditions are met.
bill_summary: The bill makes alterations to the Maryland Child Care Scholarship Program, including program funding, reimbursement rates, eligibility criteria, copayment levels, and the conditions under which the program can be frozen or altered.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Children, families, and child care providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a biannual analysis of market rates and adjusts reimbursement levels accordingly, with strict conditions for program freezes, which reflects a data-driven and carefully regulated approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a significant potential to impact child poverty by supporting access to child care for low-income families and maintaining program stability.

Title: Rural Health Collaborative Pilot Repeal and Mid Shore Health Improvement Coalition Funding
Synopsis: Repealing the provisions of law establishing and governing the Rural Health Collaborative Pilot; and requiring the Governor to provide an appropriation in the State budget for fiscal year 2024 and each fiscal year thereafter to fund the operations of the Mid Shore Health Improvement Coalition.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Rural Health Collaborative Pilot and establishes funding for the Mid Shore Health Improvement Coalition, a new initiative aimed at improving health care access and outcomes in the mid-shore region of Maryland.
responsible_party: State of Maryland through the Department of Health (implied, as part of the budget and collaborative structure)
stakeholders: Residents, healthcare providers, local governments, and organizations in the mid-shore region of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill develops a regional health improvement coalition and a strategic approach to establish rural health complexes, utilizing coordinated regional planning and stakeholder engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potentially high, as improved health care access and services can reduce barriers to health and well-being among children and families in the region.

Title: Board of Public Works Public Comment Act
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Public Works, for meetings held on or after October 1, 2024, to allow members of the public to submit certain public comments electronically except under certain circumstances; requiring public comments to be included in certain meeting materials and posted and retained online; and requiring an additional staff position at the Board to carry out requirements of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Board of Public Works to allow the public to submit comments electronically for meetings starting October 1, 2024. These comments must be included in meeting materials, posted online at least 24 hours before meetings, and retained online. The bill also mandates an additional staff position for the board to meet these requirements.
responsible_party: Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Members of the public interested in Board meetings and decisions
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an electronic public comment system for government meetings, enhancing transparency and public participation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Department of Human Services - Electronic Benefits Transfer Cards - Theft of Benefits (Prevent Electronic Benefits Theft Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Human Services to restore to a beneficiary any benefits lost due to theft; authorizing certain households to request a hearing within 90 days after a certain determination; requiring the State to give preference to certain vendors in the procurement process for electronic benefits distribution or administration; authorizing the Department to restore certain benefits; requiring the Department to take certain actions to reduce the vulnerability of Electronic Benefits Transfer cards to theft; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Human Services to reimburse beneficiaries for benefits lost due to theft of Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) cards, establishes procedures for reporting and resolving theft, and enhances security measures to prevent fraud, including the use of embedded microchips, alerts, and transaction monitoring.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Medicaid beneficiaries and Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) recipients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs new technological approaches such as microchips, two-way fraud alerts, and transaction analytics to improve security and reduce theft of benefits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to reduce child poverty by ensuring families retain their benefits and reducing financial instability due to benefits theft.

Title: Natural Resources - Greenspace Equity Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Greenspace Equity Program in the Department of Natural Resources to provide grants to eligible applicants for enhancing the public health and livability of overburdened and underserved communities by implementing projects to preserve, create, and enhance community greenspace; requiring the Department to submit certain grant applications to the Maryland State Clearinghouse for Intergovernmental Assistance; requiring certain grant applications to be subject to approval by the Board of Public Works; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Greenspace Equity Program in the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to fund projects that improve greenspace in overburdened and underserved communities, including land acquisition and community greenspace development, and creates a Greenspace Equity Advisory Board to assist with its implementation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Overburdened communities, underserved communities, land trusts, local governments, and residents in these areas.
innovative_summary: The program uses a dedicated advisory board and mandates inter-agency coordination, with a focus on land acquisition, partnership, and community engagement, which are common approaches but organized in a new dedicated program structure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to have a meaningful impact on child poverty by improving neighborhood livability, access to greenspace, and health outcomes in disadvantaged areas.

Title: Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council as an independent unit of State government with the authority to conduct and support advocacy, systems change, and capacity-building efforts to promote inclusive communities and equity in services for individuals with disabilities in the State, research best practices and provide related training and technical assistance to communities in the State, and inform State and local leaders about disability issues.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council as an independent entity of the state government, responsible for advocacy, research, policy advice, and program support for individuals with developmental disabilities, including developing a 5-year strategic plan.
responsible_party: Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council, an independent unit of State government
stakeholders: Individuals with developmental disabilities, their families, and related advocacy organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a new independent council directed to promote inclusivity and equity through advocacy, systems change, research, and policy advice, employing a comprehensive and collaborative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving services, supports, and inclusive opportunities for children with developmental disabilities.

Title: Elevator Safety - Privately Owned Single-Family Residential Elevators - Inspection and Registration Requirements
Synopsis: Establishing that an elevator installed in a privately owned single-family residential dwelling on or after October 1, 2023, is subject to certain inspection and registration requirements; prohibiting the Commissioner of Labor and Industry from disclosing to the public any information regarding a registered elevator unit installed in a privately owned single-family residential dwelling; and requiring the Commissioner to delete certain registration information on the completion of the final acceptance inspection on a certain unit.
bill_summary: The bill requires that elevators installed in privately owned single-family homes on or after October 1, 2023, must be inspected and registered with the Maryland public safety authorities. It outlines procedures for registration, inspections, and the scope of application.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety or related safety authority
stakeholders: Homeowners with private single-family residential elevators
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing safety inspection and registration processes for a specific category of residential elevators but does not introduce new technological approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but improves safety regulations for residential elevators.

Title: Property Tax Credit - Disabled Law Enforcement Officers and Rescue Workers - Definition and Eligibility
Synopsis: Requiring a county or municipal corporation to define, by law, who is a law enforcement officer or rescue worker; altering eligibility for the tax credit to include certain disabled law enforcement officers or rescue workers who were domiciled in the State as, or any time within the 5 years before the officer or worker died or was determined to be disabled; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland counties and municipal corporations to define who qualifies as a law enforcement officer or rescue worker for tax credit purposes. It extends property tax credits to disabled officers and rescue workers, as well as to the surviving spouses and cohabitants of fallen workers, with specific eligibility rules including domicile and ownership conditions.
responsible_party: County or municipal governments of Maryland
stakeholders: Disabled law enforcement officers, rescue workers, their spouses, cohabitants, and local governments
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to tax credits for a specific group, with definitions and eligibility criteria tailored by local governments. It also incorporates provisions for defining eligible personnel and relationships, but does not include new technologies or novel methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly provides property tax relief to specific individuals and families.

Title: State Board of Elections - Municipal Elections - Publication of Results on Website
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections to publish municipal election results on its website immediately after a municipality submits its election results; and requiring, within 30 days after the results of a municipal election are certified, the municipality to submit to the State Board an electronic copy of the election results for each office or question voted on at the election.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Elections to create and maintain an online portal where municipalities submit and the public can view election results for municipal elections. Results are published immediately after submission, organized by year and municipality.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Municipal governments and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The program innovates by establishing a centralized electronic portal for municipal election results, improving transparency and accessibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate impact potential for increasing transparency, which may indirectly help marginalized populations, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Investor-Owned Utilities - Prevailing Wage - Enforcement
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to enforce certain prevailing wage requirements for contractors and subcontractors working on projects involving and traffic control activities related to underground gas or electric infrastructure of an investor-owned gas company, electric company, or gas and electric company; requiring certain contractors and subcontractors to request from the Department a copy of a certain wage determination and ensure that employees are paid in compliance with existing prevailing wage rates; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to enforce prevailing wage laws for contractors working on projects related to underground gas or electric infrastructure of investor-owned utilities, and sets procedures for determining and enforcing these wages.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Contractors, subcontractors, and employees working on underground utility infrastructure projects in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured enforcement mechanism for prevailing wage laws, including process guidance, wage determinations, and penalties waivers, which enhances compliance and transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited and indirect potential to impact child poverty through improved wages for workers involved in infrastructure projects.

Title: Agriculture - Use of Antimicrobial Drugs - Reporting Deadlines
Synopsis: Altering the date from February 1, 2020 and each February 1 thereafter, to July 1 each year, on which the Department of Agriculture must submit to the General Assembly a certain annual report regarding the use of medically important antimicrobial drugs in cattle, swine, and poultry to the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill modifies reporting deadlines for the Maryland Department of Agriculture regarding the use of medically important antimicrobial drugs in cattle, swine, and poultry, including the timing of annual reports and the submission date for data collected from veterinarians.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Farmers, veterinarians, and residents in Maryland concerned about antimicrobial use in livestock.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing reporting deadlines and procedures; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns agricultural reporting procedures.

Title: City of Annapolis - Alcoholic Beverages - Art Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing an art establishment beer and wine license in the City of Annapolis; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners to issue the license to sell or serve beer and wine for on-premises consumption to a nonprofit organization primarily engaged in certain arts-related activities; and providing for a license fee of $1,000.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new art establishment beer and wine license in the City of Annapolis, allowing nonprofit organizations primarily engaged in art display, instruction, or live performances to sell or serve beer and wine for on-site consumption.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners of Annapolis
stakeholders: Nonprofit art organizations, artists, performers, and patrons in Annapolis
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized license tailored to support nonprofit art-based activities, integrating alcohol service with the arts sector.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill mainly supports arts organizations and does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Maryland Stadium Authority - Camden Yards Sports Facilities Funds and Bus Rapid Transit Fund
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Stadium Authority; establishing the Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Supplemental Financing Fund and the Camden Yards Baseball Sports Facility Supplemental Financing Fund to enable the Maryland Stadium Authority to take certain actions; requiring the Authority to administer the funds; altering the amount the Comptroller is required to distribute from the State Lottery Fund to certain funds; establishing the Bus Rapid Transit Fund to provide grants to eligible grantees; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes dedicated funds and modifies the membership structures for the Maryland Stadium Authority to support financing and management of sports facilities at Camden Yards, including specific funds for football and baseball sports facilities, and a Bus Rapid Transit Fund, along with related funding and investment rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority and Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Sports teams, sports facility developers, public transit users, and residents of Prince George's County and other parts of Maryland impacted by sports facilities and bus rapid transit systems.
innovative_summary: The bill employs structured dedicated funds and revolving financing mechanisms for sports and transit infrastructure, including specific investment and interest credit provisions, which shows an innovative approach to public financing and infrastructure management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal, as it mainly focuses on infrastructure funding and organizational structure for sports and transit facilities.

Title: Outdoor Preschool License Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Outdoor Preschool License Pilot Program in the State Department of Education to license outdoor, nature-based early learning and child care programs to expand access to affordable, high-quality early learning and child care programs and investigate the benefits of outdoor, nature-based classrooms; requiring the Department to submit a final report to the Governor and General Assembly by December 1, 2027, with recommendations for modifying or expanding the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Outdoor Preschool License Pilot Program in Maryland to promote outdoor, nature-based early childhood education by licensing programs, and to study their benefits. It involves creating regulations, selecting programs to participate, and assessing their quality and effectiveness over five years.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Children, families, early childhood programs, educators, and providers interested in outdoor, nature-based early learning
innovative_summary: The program employs a novel approach by licensing and promoting outdoor, nature-based early learning and childcare settings, which is a relatively new approach to early childhood education in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to affordable, high-quality early learning opportunities, especially in underserved areas.

Title: St. Mary's County - Transfer of Child Support Unit and Personnel to the Child Support Administration
Synopsis: Transferring all the functions, powers, and duties of the Child Support Unit of the Office of the State's Attorney for St. Mary's County and certain personnel to the Child Support Administration of the Department of Human Services.
bill_summary: The bill transfers the responsibilities, personnel, and functions of the Child Support Unit of the Office of the State's Attorney for St. Mary's County to the Department of Human Services' Child Support Administration, effective October 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Child support recipients and the local support enforcement personnel in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The bill consolidates child support enforcement functions into the Department of Human Services, streamlining administration and managing personnel transfers, which is a standard government restructuring approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve child support enforcement efficiency, which could help reduce child poverty by ensuring more consistent child support payments.

Title: Correctional Officers’ Retirement System – Transfer of Membership – Modifications
Synopsis: Making certain members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System eligible to receive creditable service at retirement for unused sick leave accrued by the member in the State Employees' Retirement System or State Employees' Pension System; and requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to transfer certain individuals' Employees' Retirement System or Employees' Pension System service to the Correctional Officers' Retirement System on June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System to receive credit for unused sick leave from other Maryland state pension systems when they retire, and it facilitates the transfer of service credits between these systems.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Correctional Officers and state employees in Maryland involved in retirement systems
innovative_summary: The program uses an administrative process to transfer service credits and credit sick leave, but it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may indirectly benefit families of service members through improved retirement benefits.

Title: Gaming - Video Lottery Terminals - Local Impact Grants and Pimlico Community Development Authority Membership - Baltimore City
Synopsis: Altering the distribution of certain funds from local impact grants to Baltimore City; and altering the appointment process for certain members of the Pimlico Community Development Authority.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the distribution of funds from video lottery terminal proceeds and impact grants in Maryland. It changes the allocation to Baltimore City, particularly the Pimlico Community Development Authority, and sets new rules for funding distribution, including specific amounts for certain counties and communities.
responsible_party: State Lottery Agency and Baltimore City Government
stakeholders: Baltimore City residents, neighborhoods near Pimlico Race Course, counties with video lottery facilities, and community development initiatives in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a change in the distribution model of lottery funds, including targeted community development and impact grants, and requires ongoing reporting and oversight, reflecting a structured approach to community investment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty through targeted community development and impact grants, especially in underserved neighborhoods.

Title: Election Law - Ballot Issuance, Processing, and Reporting Procedures and 2024 Primary Date
Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to send, not later than 43 days before an election, a ballot to voters who have made a request and qualify to vote by absentee ballot; altering the procedures for the canvassing of and curing of errors on absentee and provisional ballots; prohibiting the tabulation of absentee ballot vote totals before the polls close; requiring that the statewide primary election and the primary election for the municipal offices of Baltimore City in 2024 be held on the second Tuesday in May; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland election procedures including ballot issuance, processing, reporting, and the primary election date in 2024. It specifies when ballots must be sent to voters, details on canvassing and curing ballots, and reporting of election results.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections or local boards of elections
stakeholders: Voters, election officials, and political candidates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates logistical and procedural election rules; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on election administration.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Earnable Compensation, Nonvested Former Members, and Immediate Vesting
Synopsis: Specifying that the definition of "earnable compensation" does not include certain payments requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to pay a nonvested former member's accumulated contributions to the nonvested former member's designated beneficiary or estate if the nonvested former member dies before withdrawing the member's contributions; and providing a list of individuals who immediately vest on taking certain offices.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies the definition of 'earnable compensation' within the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, mandates the payment of nonvested former members' contributions to their beneficiaries or estates upon death, specifies which officials immediately vest in the retirement system upon taking certain offices, and makes technical updates to related laws.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System and relevant state agencies
stakeholders: State employees, former members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, and beneficiaries
innovative_summary: The bill involves policy clarifications and updates to existing pension laws, with no new innovative technologies or approaches employed.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it pertains primarily to pension policies for state officials and employees.

Title: State Procurement - Small Procurement - Definition
Synopsis: Increasing certain dollar thresholds of spending for the purposes of defining "small procurement" for State procurement contracts.
bill_summary: The bill updates the dollar thresholds for what constitutes a 'small procurement' in Maryland, increasing the limits from $50,000 to $100,000 for most categories and from $100,000 to $200,000 for construction and capital projects.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly and the relevant state procurement departments
stakeholders: State agencies, contractors, and vendors involved in state procurement processes
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates existing procurement thresholds without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is minimal as it pertains to procurement thresholds.

Title: Family Prosperity Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering the percentage of the federal earned income tax credit used for determining the amount that an individual may claim as a refund under the Maryland earned income tax credit under certain circumstances; repealing a certain limitation on the amount certain individuals may claim as a refund under the credit; altering the definition of "qualified child" and income eligibility requirements for purposes of qualifying for a certain credit against the State income tax for certain dependent children; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland earned income and child tax credits, increasing the income eligibility for the child tax credit, removing certain limitations, and extending the eligibility for the earned income tax credit. It also introduces changes to refund amounts and credit calculations to better support low-income residents, with a focus on families with children.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Low-income families and children in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to expand tax credits for low-income families, including continuous eligibility extensions and increased refundability, but does not introduce new technologies or radically different methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by increasing the financial support available to families with children.

Title: Financial Regulation - Maryland Community Investment Venture Fund - Establishment (Access to Banking Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Community Investment Venture Fund as an instrumentality of the State for purposes of developing opportunities for banking institutions and credit unions to better serve the needs of low- to moderate-income tracts; providing for certain assessment offset credits for certain banking institutions and credit unions in certain areas; authorizing the use of the Banking Institution and Credit Union Regulation Fund for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Community Investment Venture Fund, which aims to promote financial services and innovation in low- to moderate-income areas through investments and incentives for banking institutions and credit unions. It also modifies assessment rules for these financial institutions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Banking institutions, credit unions, low- to moderate-income residents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new venture fund that employs public-private partnership, investment, and innovation strategies to improve banking access in underserved communities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to financial services in low-income areas.

Title: Maryland Energy Administration – Energy Programs – Modifications (Clean Transportation and Energy Act)
Synopsis: Altering the Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment Program by extending the duration of the Program through fiscal year 2026, repealing the rebates that may be issued to retail service station dealers, and increasing the limitation on the total amount of rebates that the Maryland Energy Administration may issue in each fiscal year; altering the Medium-Duty and Heavy-Duty Zero-Emission Vehicle Grant Program by altering the definition of "grant"; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's energy programs by extending the Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment Program and the Medium–Duty and Heavy–Duty Zero–Emission Vehicle Grant Program, increasing funding limits, and establishing priorities for low-income and underserved communities. It also allocates funds for electric vehicle support and renewable energy initiatives, including grants and rebates for electric vehicle infrastructure and zero-emission vehicles.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Residents, businesses, and government entities in Maryland seeking electric vehicle infrastructure, zero-emission vehicles, and renewable energy programs.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach by integrating rebates, grants, and allocated funds to prioritize environmentally beneficial projects, with specific incentives for low-income and underserved communities, using strategic funding allocations to accelerate the adoption of clean transportation and energy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has significant potential to impact child poverty positively by supporting low-income communities through targeted grants, rebates, and energy assistance programs that promote cleaner transportation and energy equity.

Title: Office of Statewide Broadband - Study of Broadband Expansion Incentives
Synopsis: Requiring the Office of Statewide Broadband within the Department of Housing and Community Development to conduct a study as to how the State can incentivize broadband service providers to expand broadband infrastructure to communities that are unserved or underserved; and requiring the Office to submit its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a study by the Maryland Office of Statewide Broadband to recommend incentives for expanding broadband infrastructure, and exempts specified broadband equipment from sales and use tax, as well as includes a tax deduction for broadband grants.
responsible_party: Office of Statewide Broadband within the Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Internet service providers, unserved and underserved communities in Maryland, and broadband consumers
innovative_summary: The bill combines a state-led study and recommendations with tax incentives to stimulate broadband infrastructure expansion and investment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to broadband in underserved communities, which can help reduce child poverty impacts.

Title: Economic Development - Build Our Future Grant Pilot Program and Fund (Innovation Economy Infrastructure Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing the Build Our Future Grant Pilot Program in the Department of Commerce to provide funding for certain costs for infrastructure projects in eligible technology sectors; requiring certain grantees to provide matching funds and to demonstrate certain abilities; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the projects funded through and the economic impact of the Program by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Build Our Future Grant Pilot Program and Fund to provide grants for infrastructure projects supporting innovation in designated technology sectors within Maryland, including requirements for matching funds and reporting.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Private companies, nonprofits, local governments, colleges, and universities in Maryland involved in eligible technology sectors
innovative_summary: The program introduces a targeted approach to funding infrastructure projects in specific advanced technology sectors, leveraging public-private collaboration and matching funds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The impact on child poverty is indirect; the program aims to boost innovation and economic development, which could lead to job creation and economic growth beneficial to families.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification for Military Retirement Income (Keep Our Heroes Home Act)
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of a certain subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for certain military retirement income received by individuals under the age of 55 years to $12,500 and individuals at least 55 years of age to $20,000 during the taxable year for certain military service; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: This bill increases the amount of military retirement income that is tax-exempt under Maryland income tax law, with the exemption amount gradually rising over the coming years.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller or Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Military retirees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward tax exemption adjustment to support military retirees, which is a standard approach, not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County - Circuit Court Judgeships
Synopsis: Increasing the number of resident judges of the Circuit Court for Baltimore County from 20 to 21.
bill_summary: This bill increases the number of resident judges in the Baltimore County Circuit Court from 20 to 21.
responsible_party: Maryland Judicial Branch or Baltimore County Circuit Court
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore County, legal community, justice system participants
innovative_summary: The bill employs straightforward legislative action without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Cannabis Reform
Synopsis: Renaming the Alcohol and Tobacco Commission to be the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission; establishing the Maryland Cannabis Administration as an independent unit of State government; establishing a regulatory and licensing system for adult-use cannabis; imposing a sales and use tax of 9% on the sale of cannabis; requiring the Administration, by July 1, 2023, to convert medical cannabis licenses to licenses to operate a medical and adult-use cannabis business; etc.
bill_summary: This bill overhauls Maryland's cannabis regulatory framework by establishing a new Maryland Cannabis Administration, expanding licensing, creating social equity programs, reforming existing laws on medical cannabis, imposing taxes on adult-use cannabis, and providing protections and support for industry participants.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis industry participants, medical cannabis patients, social equity entrepreneurs, law enforcement, and the general public
innovative_summary: The program employs comprehensive new regulations, social equity initiatives, racial and economic justice measures, and technological improvements, including testing labs and online systems, making it highly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has significant potential to reduce child poverty through social equity programs, community reinvestment, and economic opportunities, particularly targeting historically impacted communities.

Title: Carroll County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Residency Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring at least one applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Carroll County to be a resident of the State, rather than the county, when an application is filed and to remain a resident of the State for the license to remain valid; etc.
bill_summary: The bill changes the residency requirements for applicants seeking alcoholic beverages licenses in Carroll County, Maryland, requiring at least one applicant to be a resident of the entire state rather than just the county, and maintaining that the license remains valid as long as this resident remains a resident of the state.
responsible_party: Carroll County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board or relevant county authority
stakeholders: Applicants for alcoholic beverage licenses in Carroll County, residents of Carroll County and Maryland, local businesses, and the general public interested in alcohol licensing policies
innovative_summary: This bill employs a new approach by shifting the residency requirement from county-based to state-wide for alcohol license applicants, broadening the pool of eligible applicants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on licensing requirements and is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Carroll County - Alcoholic Beverages - Modification of Seating Requirements
Synopsis: Modifying the seating requirements for Class B, Class BR, and Class C beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Carroll County.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the seating requirements for certain beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Carroll County, Maryland, including licenses for hotels, restaurants, and clubs.
responsible_party: Carroll County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Hotels, restaurants, clubs, and consumers in Carroll County
innovative_summary: The bill adjusts existing licensing rules but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is likely negligible as it mainly changes licensing rules.

Title: Carroll County - Alcoholic Beverages - Multiple Event Entertainment Licenses
Synopsis: Establishing an annual fee of $2,000 for a multiple event entertainment alcoholic beverages license where the number of events number 41 or more per year in Carroll County; and repealing the limit on the total number of days for which a multiple event entertainment license may be used.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new fees and eliminates restrictions on the number of days a multiple event alcohol license can be used in Carroll County, allowing for more flexible licensing at events held by fire departments or arts centers.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Board in Carroll County
stakeholders: Fire departments, arts centers, event organizers, alcohol licensees in Carroll County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tiered fee system based on the number of events, and removes previous limits on days of license use, allowing more flexibility for event organizers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may facilitate community events that could benefit local populations.

Title: Town of Mount Airy (Carroll County and Frederick County) - Urban Renewal Authority
Synopsis: Granting the Town of Mount Airy in Carroll County and Frederick County the authority to exercise urban renewal powers within an urban renewal area under Article III, Section 61 of the Maryland Constitution; and authorizing the municipality to levy certain taxes and issue general obligation bonds and revenue bonds to carry out urban renewal powers.
bill_summary: The bill grants the Town of Mount Airy in Maryland the legal authority to undertake urban renewal projects aimed at slum and blight clearance. It authorizes the town to establish urban renewal plans, use eminent domain, and issue bonds to fund redevelopment efforts within designated blighted or slum areas.
responsible_party: Town of Mount Airy Government
stakeholders: Residents and property owners in Mount Airy's designated urban renewal areas
innovative_summary: The program employs traditional urban renewal strategies, including bond issuance and eminent domain, but does not incorporate new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving living conditions and revitalizing neighborhoods, but it primarily focuses on urban renewal processes.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class 9 Limited Distillery License - Self-Distribution
Synopsis: Authorizing a holder of a Class 9 limited distillery license to apply for and obtain a Class 8 liquor wholesaler's license with certain privileges.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes holders of Class 9 limited distillery licenses to sell and deliver their products in bulk to authorized entities and outside the state, and allows these licensees to apply for and obtain a Class 8 liquor wholesaler's license to distribute their own liquor. It also modifies licensing rules and limits related to distilleries and wholesalers in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Commission
stakeholders: Distillery licensees, liquor distributors, retailers, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new self-distribution approach for small distilleries through licensing and inter-state sales, representing a modernized regulatory approach for craft distilleries.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes licensing and distribution rules for alcohol producers.

Title: Opioids - Opioid Restitution Advisory Council and Fund and Overdose Response Program
Synopsis: Authorizing the Attorney General to direct that an Opioid Restitution Fund Advisory Council committee be formed if required by a court or administrative order or settlement agreement entered into by the Attorney General; requiring the Maryland Department of Health, subject to the limitations of the State budget, to allow certain entities to choose the formulation or dosage of an opioid overdose reversal drug approved by the Food and Drug Administration with which the entity is provided through the Overdose Response Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the formation of a committee for the Opioid Restitution Advisory Council if required by legal agreements, enables the Maryland Department of Health to allow entities to choose the formulation or dosage of FDA-approved opioid overdose reversal drugs, and establishes rules for the disbursement and use of funds from the Opioid Restitution Fund for opioid-related settlements, including supporting overdose prevention programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Attorney General
stakeholders: Individuals at risk of opioid overdose, public health organizations, state and local governments involved in opioid settlement agreements
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates flexibility for entities to select specific formulations and dosages of overdose reversal drugs and establishes a structured fund management system tied to opioid settlement agreements, representing a coordinated approach to opioid overdose prevention and response.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to impact child poverty indirectly through improved public health measures and overdose prevention efforts, but it is not specifically targeted at child poverty.

Title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Access to Mental Health Advisory Committee - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Access to Mental Health Advisory Committee within the Maryland Higher Education Commission to study the provision of and access to mental health services in institutions of higher education; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Access to Mental Health Advisory Committee within the Maryland Higher Education Commission to study and recommend improvements in mental health services for students in higher education institutions in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: College students, higher education institutions, mental health providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated advisory committee to evaluate and improve mental health access using best practices and technology such as telemedicine, and to make policy recommendations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by improving mental health access for students, which may influence their overall well-being and socio-economic prospects.

Title: State Employee and Retiree Health Benefits - Creditable Service
Synopsis: Requiring the inclusion of all State service while an individual was employed by the State in the Executive, Legislative, or Judicial Branch of government for the purpose of determining eligibility for State retiree health benefits.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to require that all service an individual has employed with the State, including service while employed by the Historic St. Mary's City Commission and in the Judicial Branch, be counted towards eligibility for retiree health benefits, regardless of whether the employment was before or after certain dates.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Retired State employees and their spouses or dependents, especially those with service in the Historic St. Mary's City Commission or Judicial system
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to retroactively include all State service in calculating eligibility for retiree health benefits, eliminating previous exclusions based on employment date or system.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly reduce child poverty by supporting the health and economic stability of retired State employees and their families.

Title: Income Tax Credit - Food Donations by Qualified Farms - Sunset Repeal and Alterations (Farmers Feeding Families Act)
Synopsis: Repealing certain termination provisions for a tax credit against the State income tax for fresh farm and organic fresh farm food donations; altering the amounts of the tax credit from 50% to 100% of the value of an eligible food donation and from 75% to 100% of the value of the donated certified organic produce a qualified farm is eligible to receive under certain circumstances; applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022; etc.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the sunset clause on the Maryland state income tax credit for food donations made by qualified farms, extending the program until 2026 and increasing the maximum tax credit from 50% to 75% (or 100% for certified organic produce). It also updates the program's administration and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Qualified farms that donate food, local farmers, consumers benefiting from food donations
innovative_summary: The program primarily enhances existing food donation tax credits with increased benefits, administrative updates, and ongoing funding support for transportation costs, rather than employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program can potentially reduce child poverty by increasing food donations for human consumption and supporting local farms, but it is a tax incentive program rather than a direct food aid initiative.

Title: State Procurement - Purchasing - Compost, Mulch, and Soil Amendments and Aggregate
Synopsis: Requiring each unit of State government to include certain specifications for certain products produced from recycled or organic materials when establishing procurement specifications for compost, mulch, or other soil amendments or aggregate; requiring the Maryland Green Purchasing Committee to establish certain specifications for purchasing of compost, mulch, or other soil amendments or aggregates produced from certain materials and publish and maintain the specifications online for use by State agencies.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state government units to include specifications for purchasing compost, mulch, and soil amendments made from recycled or organic materials in their procurement processes. It mandates the Maryland Green Purchasing Committee to establish, publish, and maintain these specifications online.
responsible_party: Maryland Green Purchasing Committee
stakeholders: State government agencies and suppliers of compost, mulch, and soil amendments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a procurement preference for environmentally friendly products made from recycled or organic materials, and mandates the online publication of technical specifications, promoting sustainable purchasing practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly support child poverty reduction by promoting environmentally sustainable practices that could lead to healthier communities, but it does not specifically target child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - 41st District - Alcoholic Beverages - Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing, for a certain period of time, the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to exchange a Class B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area for a Class A-7 beer, wine, and liquor license under certain circumstances; repealing certain geographic and temporal restrictions on the issuance of Class A-7 beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Baltimore City; and altering a certain period of time during which a certain alcoholic beverages license may be issued.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to exchange certain alcohol licenses and repeals geographic and temporal restrictions on issuing certain licenses, allowing for broader sale of beer, wine, and liquor in Baltimore City. It also creates a new 'marketplace' license that permits multiple establishments within a designated marketplace to sell alcohol for on- and off-premises consumption.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, Baltimore City businesses, consumers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new marketplace license allowing multiple establishments to sell alcohol within a designated marketplace, utilizing a coordinated approach to alcohol licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is limited but could include economic benefits from increased business activity.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Restitution Orders - Recording Fees
Synopsis: Altering a certain provision to prohibit a court from assessing certain costs on a certain person or governmental unit for recording and indexing an order of restitution issued by any court in the State instead of the court in which the judgment of restitution was entered.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits courts from assessing costs on individuals or government units for recording and indexing restitution orders issued by any court in Maryland, in order to reduce financial burdens related to restitution enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland courts or judicial system
stakeholders: Individuals ordered to pay restitution, government units responsible for recording restitution orders, and the court system
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and simplifies the recording process for restitution orders across all courts in Maryland, reducing costs for involved parties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly affects court recording fees for restitution orders.

Title: Health and Human Services Transportation Improvement Act of 2023
Synopsis: Repealing the $500,000 cap on grants that may be awarded by the Maryland Transit Administration under the Maryland Senior Rides Program; repealing the $400,000 cap on the Job Access and Reverse Commute Program; establishing the State Coordinating Committee for Health and Human Services Transportation to examine transportation needs of the elderly, persons with disabilities, and residents requiring transportation assistance to jobs, appointments, citizen programs, and other engagements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Rural Nonemergency Medical Transportation Program to coordinate transportation for individuals in rural areas who need medical services, creates a State Coordinating Committee for Health and Human Services Transportation, and allocates funding to support these initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and the Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals in rural areas requiring medical transportation, hospitals, non-profit transportation providers, and state agencies involved in health and human services
innovative_summary: The program employs coordinated efforts among hospitals, non-profits, and state agencies to improve access to healthcare transportation, utilizing a dedicated committee and strategic planning at the state level.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce barriers to healthcare access for low-income individuals in rural areas, thereby potentially reducing child health disparities associated with poverty.

Title: State Police Retirement System, Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System, and Judges’ Retirement System – Surviving Spouse Benefit – Same–Sex Spouses
Synopsis: Authorizing the correction of the designated beneficiary election for certain retirees of the State Police Retirement System, Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, or Judges' Retirement System who retired on or before December 31, 2012, if the retiree named an individual of the same sex to be a designated beneficiary and the retiree married the designated beneficiary on or after January 1, 2013.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain retirees of Maryland's State Police, Law Enforcement Officers', and Judges' Retirement Systems who married same-sex spouses after retirement to update their beneficiary designation and receive survivor benefits accordingly, including retroactive adjustments and payments.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Retirees of Maryland's State Police, Law Enforcement Officers', and Judges' Retirement Systems and their surviving spouses or beneficiaries
innovative_summary: The program employs retroactive adjustments and payments to address past beneficiary designations, including electronic submissions and tax-compliant benefit recalculations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Human Relations - Housing Discrimination - Service Dogs
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from discriminating in the sale or rental of, or otherwise making unavailable or denying, a dwelling to an individual with a disability who has, obtains, or retains a certain service dog.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits discrimination in housing based on disability related to service or guide dogs, requiring accessible design in new multifamily housing and clarifying protections for individuals with service dogs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, service dog owners, housing providers, landlords, tenants
innovative_summary: This bill enhances protections for service dog owners and incorporates accessibility standards in new multifamily housing, aligning housing design with disability access requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Nursing – Sunset Extension, Licensure Exceptions, and Board Operations and Membership
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Nursing in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; altering the exceptions to the registered nurse and licensed practical nurse licensure requirements; providing that, for a certain period of time, the Secretary of Health, rather than the Board, has authority over the infrastructure operations of the Board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the operation of the Maryland State Board of Nursing, modifies licensing exceptions, transfers some infrastructure authority to the Secretary of Health, mandates an independent evaluation of the Board, and sets terms for the Board members, with certain provisions expiring in 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Nursing professionals, nursing students, and the general public relying on nursing services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach including independent evaluation, process improvements, and structural reforms to modernize the Board of Nursing's operations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may improve healthcare services that impact child health indirectly.

Title: Department of Aging - Long-Term Care and Dementia Care Navigation Programs
