Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Aging to oversee long-term care and train the staff of long-term care and dementia care navigation programs; requiring each area agency to establish a long-term care and dementia care navigation program; and requiring the Department to submit a report by October 1, 2024, and each year thereafter, to the Governor, the President of the Senate, the Speaker of the House, and certain committees of the General Assembly about the services provided by the program and to publish the report on its website.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Aging to oversee and facilitate long-term care and dementia care navigation programs. Each area agency must establish a program, and the Department will report on various service metrics and allocate funding to support these programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults with dementia and long-term care needs, caregivers, healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated approach to dementia and long-term care navigation, integrating best practices, data collection, and statewide oversight, with ongoing reporting and funding allocation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has moderate potential to impact child poverty indirectly by improving elder and caregiver support systems, though it is primarily focused on elder care.

Title: Workgroup on Black, Latino, Asian American Pacific Islander, and Other Underrepresented Behavioral Health Professionals - Extension of Dates
Synopsis: Extending the reporting and termination dates, to July 1, 2024, and June 30, 2025, respectively, for the Workgroup on Black, Latino, Asian American Pacific Islander, and Other Underrepresented Behavioral Health Professionals.
bill_summary: The bill extends the duration of the Workgroup on Underrepresented Behavioral Health Professionals, which studies the shortage of minority behavioral health professionals and recommends ways to increase their numbers in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Black, Latino, Asian American Pacific Islander communities, behavioral health professionals, social service providers, underserved communities
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a dedicated workgroup focusing on increasing diversity among behavioral health professionals, which is a targeted initiative to address mental health disparities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to reduce child poverty through improved behavioral health services for underserved populations.

Title: Economic Development - Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Program in the Department of Commerce to provide grants to certain small and medium-sized manufacturing enterprises to assist those manufacturers with implementing new Industry 4.0 technology or related infrastructure for certain purposes; establishing the Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; and requiring the Governor to include in the budget bill for fiscal years 2025 through 2028 an appropriation of $1,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Program in Maryland to provide grants to small and medium-sized manufacturing enterprises for implementing new Industry 4.0 technologies, with funding allocated annually from 2024 to 2028.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Small and medium-sized manufacturing enterprises in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to modernize manufacturing using Industry 4.0 technologies, with structured grants and matching funds for innovative manufacturing improvements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve economic prospects for manufacturing workers and communities, but its direct impact on child poverty is indirect and moderate.

Title: Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Expanding the forms of financial assistance available under the Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program; altering eligibility requirements for projects that may receive financial assistance under the Program; altering the time period when applications may be submitted under the Program; repealing certain restrictions on the amount of financial assistance that may be provided under the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Maryland Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program to include more types of financial aid, alter eligibility and application processes, and better support affordable housing projects in historically redlined neighborhoods, especially in low-income census tracts and sustainable communities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Affordable housing developers, residents of low-income census tracts and sustainable communities, potential homebuyers in redlined neighborhoods.
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach to facilitating affordable housing by expanding types of financial assistance and streamlining application processes, with a focus on historically redlined neighborhoods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to affordable housing in underserved areas.

Title: Animal Testing and Research - Human-Relevant Research Funding and Animal Testing and Research Contributions
Synopsis: Establishing the Human-Relevant Research Fund under the administration of the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to provide grants and loans to promote State-funded research intended to develop human-relevant alternatives to using nonhuman animals in medical and product testing and research; requiring, beginning January 15, 2024, research facilities that engage in animal testing or research to pay a contribution, based on a certain number of animals, to the Secretary of Health; providing a civil penalty for a violation of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Human-Relevant Research Fund to promote research on alternatives to using nonhuman animals in medical testing, introduces licensing and contribution requirements for research facilities engaged in animal testing, and sets up administrative procedures and reporting obligations for funding and regulation.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Public health researchers, animal research facilities, animal welfare advocates, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by creating a dedicated fund and a grant/loan program to specifically support development of human-relevant animal testing alternatives, with oversight and evaluations based on scientific, medical, and ethical considerations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly impact child poverty through its support of advanced research and innovation, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Higher Education – Edward T. Conroy Memorial Scholarship Program – Surviving Spouses of Service Members
Synopsis: Specifying that a certain surviving spouse of a member of the armed forces is eligible to apply for a scholarship under the Edward T. Conroy Memorial Scholarship Program if the service member died, suffered a service connected disability, or was declared to be a prisoner of war or missing in action under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Edward T. Conroy Memorial Scholarship Program to expand eligibility to surviving spouses of armed forces members who died, were disabled, or were declared missing in action, under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education or relevant postsecondary institutions
stakeholders: Surviving spouses and children of armed forces members, veterans, and victims of acts of violence in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly expands existing eligibility criteria for a scholarship program and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited or indirect impact on child poverty, focusing on educational support for children and spouses of military and public safety personnel.

Title: Utility Account Holders - Victims of Abuse - Protections
Synopsis: Authorizing an account holder who is the victim of abuse to terminate, and requiring a utility to allow for the termination of, the account holder's future liability under a utility contract if the account holder provides the utility with certain written notice requesting termination of the account holder's future liability under the contract; requiring a utility to allow an account holder who terminates a utility contract under the Act to open a new utility account notwithstanding a certain account balance or arrearage; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires utilities to allow account holders who are victims of domestic violence to terminate their utility contracts without penalty, and to open new accounts at a new premises regardless of existing balances. It also enables victims to be released from utility contracts with no fees by providing a written attestation or documentation, and emphasizes confidentiality.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Utilities Commission and utility companies
stakeholders: Victims of domestic violence who are utility account holders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach that allows domestic violence victims to delete their connection to abusive situations by removing their utility contracts without penalties, using attestations or documentation, and emphasizing confidentiality.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly help victims of domestic violence, some of whom are children, by providing safety and stability, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Hospital Credentialing - Reappointment Process for Physician Staff - Modification
Synopsis: Requiring that the credential reappointment process for physician staff included in certain minimum standards for hospitals licensed in the State be conducted in accordance with standards of the accreditation body that accredits a hospital, rather than every 2 years.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the credential reappointment process for hospital physician staff in Maryland, requiring that it be conducted in accordance with the standards of the hospital's accreditation body rather than at a fixed frequency.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Hospital physicians and hospital administration in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a performance-based reappointment process aligned with accreditation standards, moving away from fixed time intervals, which is a more modern, competency-based approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly aim to reduce child poverty, but improving hospital credentialing can enhance healthcare quality and safety.

Title: Public Information Act - Inspection of E-Mail Addresses and Telephone Numbers
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "personal information" for purposes of certain provisions of the Public Information Act to include an individual's personal e-mail address; requiring certain custodians to deny inspection of certain records of personal e-mail addresses and telephone numbers except under certain circumstances; and requiring certain custodians to allow inspection of certain records of business e-mail addresses under the same circumstances as inspection of certain records of business addresses and telephone numbers.
bill_summary: The bill updates the Public Information Act to include e-mail addresses within the definition of personal information and modifies the rules regarding the inspection of public records that contain personal e-mail addresses and telephone numbers. It establishes restrictions on access to these records, with certain exceptions for specific entities and circumstances, and clarifies the conditions under which inspection is permitted.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Information Technology or relevant custodian agencies
stakeholders: Public agencies, government officials, and citizens seeking access to public records, especially those concerning personal contact information of individuals
innovative_summary: The bill employs digital information control policies and modernizes data privacy protections specifically for electronic contact information, integrating new legal provisions for data privacy into existing public records laws.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on privacy and access to personal information.

Title: Washington County - Deputy Sheriffs and Correctional Deputies - Employment Conditions and Collective Bargaining
Synopsis: Altering the grounds on which a deputy sheriff having a rank of major or below in Washington County may be discharged after 2 years of continuous employment; providing that a special deputy sheriff in Washington County is not a State employee for certain purposes; authorizing sworn deputy sheriffs at the rank of sergeant and below and correctional deputies at the rank of sergeant and below to engage in collective bargaining with the Washington County Sheriff and the County Administrator; etc.
bill_summary: This bill allows deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies in Washington County, Maryland, at the rank of sergeant and below, to form labor organizations, engage in collective bargaining over wages and benefits, and enter into collective bargaining agreements. It also specifies rules for certification, negotiations, and prohibits strikes.
responsible_party: Washington County Sheriff's Office and Washington County Government
stakeholders: Deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies in Washington County at the rank of sergeant and below
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal system for law enforcement and correctional officers in a county to unionize and negotiate collectively, which is a significant change in employment relations for these officers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty appears minimal, as the bill mainly addresses employment conditions for law enforcement and correctional deputies.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Golf Simulator Facility
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue a Class B-GSF (golf simulator facility) license to a golf simulator facility under certain circumstances; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under certain circumstances; requiring the license holder to submit an annual gross sales report to the Board before a license may be renewed; and establishing an annual license fee of $1,500.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Frederick County to issue a new license type for golf simulator facilities, allowing them to sell alcoholic beverages if specific conditions are met, including premises size and sales proportions.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Golf simulator facilities and their customers in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized license for golf simulators, integrating alcohol service into recreational golf activities with specified sales and operational conditions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Garrett County - Tax Sales - Auctioneer Fees
Synopsis: Increasing, from $8 to $10, the auctioneer's fee for the tax sale of property in Garrett County for each property sold.
bill_summary: The bill increases the auctioneer fee for tax sales of property specifically in Garrett County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Garrett County government or its tax sale authorities
stakeholders: Property owners, potential buyers, Garrett County government, local auctioneers
innovative_summary: This bill primarily updates fees for existing tax sale procedures and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns administrative fees for property tax sales.

Title: Baltimore City – Alcoholic Beverages Districts – Legislative Districting Plan References
Synopsis: Updating certain provisions of law regarding Baltimore City alcoholic beverages districts to refer to the Legislative Districting Plan of 2022; and requiring the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to grant a certain exemption to certain persons under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill updates the legislative district boundaries for Baltimore City's alcoholic beverages districts to align with the latest 2022 legislative districting plan, and it provides exemptions to certain license holders from new restrictions if they had approval and ownership prior to February 1, 2022.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents, and businesses in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates district boundaries and exemption rules, without employing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily involves regulatory boundary updates and license exemptions.

Title: Talbot County - Board of Education - Election of Officers
Synopsis: Altering the timing of the annual election of the officers of the Talbot County Board of Education to be at its last meeting at the end of each calendar year, or at the meeting in December each year.
bill_summary: This bill changes the timing of the annual election of officers (president and vice president) for the Talbot County Board of Education, specifying that it shall occur at the last meeting at the end of each calendar year or in December.
responsible_party: Talbot County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students and residents of Talbot County involved with or impacted by the local education board
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a change to the timing of existing election procedures, with no new technology or innovative approach employed.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Real Estate Brokers, Salespersons, and Associate Brokers - Continuing Education Courses - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for the subject matter of continuing education courses for licensees issued an initial license by the Real Estate Commission.
bill_summary: The bill updates the requirements for continuing education courses for real estate licensees in Maryland, specifying the topics and hours needed for license renewal and initial licensing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate licensees, prospective home buyers and sellers, real estate industry professionals
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates educational requirements and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Comptroller and State Department of Assessments and Taxation - Enhancing Access to Property Tax Benefits - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller and the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to confer to identify ways the Comptroller could collaborate with the Department to enhance access to certain property tax benefits administered by the Department; and requiring the Comptroller and the Department to submit a joint report of their findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Comptroller and the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to collaborate during the 2023 legislative interim to find ways to improve access to property tax benefits, raise awareness, and simplify application processes. They must submit a joint report with recommendations by December 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller and State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Taxpayers eligible for property tax benefits in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes inter-agency collaboration to improve access and simplify application processes for property tax benefits, which is a strategic government efficiency initiative but does not involve new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to indirectly impact child poverty by improving access to tax benefits that could support low-income families, but not a direct initiative targeted at child poverty.

Title: Real Estate Appraisers - Licensing and Certification - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for a real estate appraisal license and for a certificate for residential or general real estate appraisal to include completion of certain criteria in the Practical Applications of Real Estate Appraisal program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the qualifications for obtaining a real estate appraisal license and certificates in Maryland by including completion of the Practical Applications of Real Estate Appraisal program as an alternative to other training requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate appraisers and aspiring appraisers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces recognition of a specialized educational program as an alternative qualification pathway for real estate appraisers, reflecting a recognition of blended educational approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Garrett County - Board of County Commissioners - Meetings
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of County Commissioners for Garrett County to meet at least twice a month; authorizing the Board to hold public meetings in person or through live video streaming; and prohibiting the Board from meeting solely through live video streaming for more than two consecutive meetings without a formal declaration of a state of emergency.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Garrett County Board of County Commissioners to meet at least twice a month, allows meetings to be held in person or via live video streaming, and restricts the use of live streaming alone for more than two consecutive meetings without declaring a state of emergency.
responsible_party: Garrett County Board of County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents of Garrett County, local government officials
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates modern technology by allowing live video streaming of meetings and limits remote-only meetings to ensure in-person participation, reflecting an approach to modernize government transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration – Fare Price Requirements – Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain requirements that the Maryland Transit Administration increase fares for certain transit services according to the Consumer Price Index; and repealing certain provisions prohibiting the Administration from increasing fares under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain requirements that mandated the Maryland Transit Administration to increase fares in specific ways and modifies rules regarding fare adjustments and public hearings for fare changes, taking effect on July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Transit riders and the general public using mass transit services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill largely simplifies fare-setting rules and removes specific mandated fare increase procedures, with no implementation of new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target or significantly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Historic Trust - Historic Preservation Loan Fund - Qualified Cooperating Nonprofit Organizations - Transfers
Synopsis: Altering the uses of the Historic Preservation Loan Fund; and authorizing the Maryland Historic Trust to transfer funds from the Fund to a qualified cooperating nonprofit organization to pay for the acquisition, restoration, or rehabilitation of certain historic properties, to provide loans for the acquisition, rehabilitation, restoration, or refinancing of certain properties, and for necessary administrative and programmatic expenses.
bill_summary: The bill reorganizes the Maryland Historic Trust's funding by dissolving the Historic Preservation Loan Fund and establishing the Historic Preservation Partnership Program and Fund. It transfers existing funds from the Loan Fund to the new Partnership Fund, which supports preservation projects through grants, loans, and other assistance, and involves qualified nonprofit organizations in managing and implementing these efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland Historic Trust
stakeholders: Historic property owners, preservation nonprofits, local governments, and communities interested in historic preservation
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new partnership model where qualified nonprofit organizations will administer preservation funds and projects, employing a collaborative and community-focused approach with a revolving fund structure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially impact child poverty indirectly by preserving culturally significant historic properties and revitalizing communities, but its direct influence on child poverty is limited.

Title: Commission to Study Trauma Center Funding in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Study Trauma Center Funding in Maryland to study the adequacy of trauma center funding across the State for operating, capital, and workforce costs; and requiring the Commission to reports its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Commission to Study Trauma Center Funding in Maryland, with aims to evaluate the adequacy of funding for trauma centers' operating, capital, and workforce costs, and to make recommendations.
responsible_party: Maryland Institute for Emergency Medicine Services Systems (MIEMSS) and Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Trauma centers, healthcare providers, trauma patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill sets up a dedicated commission for in-depth analysis and recommendations on trauma center funding, employing a specialized review approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may indirectly impact child health outcomes by improving trauma care funding, but its primary focus is on trauma centers.

Title: Cemeteries - Interment - Pet Remains
Synopsis: Making certain provisions of law governing cemeteries applicable to pet cemeteries; providing that a certain registered cemeterian, registered crematory operator, or permit holder who sells or offers to sell to the public certain services for pet remains owes a duty of perpetual care for the cemetery in which certain pet remains are interred; and requiring the Director of the Office of Cemetery Oversight to adopt regulations to enforce certain provisions of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill extends laws governing cemeteries to include pet cemeteries, establishing that persons involved in selling pet burial services owe a duty of perpetual care for pet remains interred in these cemeteries. It also mandates regulations to enforce these provisions.
responsible_party: Office of Cemetery Oversight (Maryland Department of Health)
stakeholders: Pet owners, pet cemeteries, crematories, and related service providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new legal obligation for pet cemeteries to ensure perpetual care, employing legal regulations to extend existing cemetery laws to pet remains, thus formalizing and standardizing pet burial care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves pet burial care standards.

Title: Pride of Baltimore II - Appropriations - Extension
Synopsis: Extending until fiscal year 2028 the appropriation of $500,000 from the Transportation Trust Fund that the Governor is required to include in the annual budget bill for the operation of the replica sailing vessel known as the Pride of Baltimore II.
bill_summary: The bill extends the appropriation for the operation of the Pride of Baltimore II from 2023 to 2028, increasing the annual funding from $500,000 to $600,000, and requires annual reporting and strategic planning for the vessel's operation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or designated maritime authority
stakeholders: Maryland citizens, maritime enthusiasts, tourism industry, maritime education community
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends funding and enhances transparency requirements; it does not introduce new technological approaches or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty, but promotes maritime education and tourism which can have indirect economic benefits.

Title: Frederick County – Alcoholic Beverages Licenses – Display of License
Synopsis: Requiring in Frederick County a license holder to frame and conspicuously display an alcoholic beverages license on the licensed premises.
bill_summary: The bill alters the procedures for how alcohol license holders in Frederick County must frame and display their licenses on their premises, requiring the license to be conspicuously displayed.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Department
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders and customers in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new requirement for the physical framing and conspicuous display of licenses, which is a straightforward regulatory change rather than an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Income Tax - Student Loan Debt Relief Tax Credit - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing the total amount of credits against the State income tax that the Maryland Higher Education Commission may approve in a taxable year for certain individuals with certain student loan debt amounts; requiring the Commission to reserve a certain amount of the tax credits that the Commission is authorized to approve for certain graduates; extending, from 2 years to 3 years, the period of time that an individual who claims the credit has to prove that they used the credit to repay the individual's student loan debt; etc.
bill_summary: The bill increases the total amount of student loan debt relief tax credits available, extends the period for using the credit, and requires the Office of Student Financial Assistance to inform scholarship recipients of this credit; it also reserves a portion of credits for graduates of historically Black colleges and universities and outlines application and reporting procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Individuals with student loan debt, especially graduates of Maryland higher education institutions and historically Black colleges and universities
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted tax credits to incentivize student loan repayment and prioritizes certain populations for relief, integrating tax policy with education and social equity efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by alleviating parental student debt burdens, but it is not directly targeted at child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources – Apprentice Hunting License – Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to issue an apprentice hunting license to a person under the age of 17 years who has previously been issued an apprentice hunting license under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Department of Natural Resources to issue a second apprentice hunting license to persons under the age of 17 who have previously been issued an apprentice license, provided they re-take the hunter safety course. It updates rules about hunting licenses, including types, fees, and special provisions like discounted licenses for Purple Heart recipients.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunter applicants and licensees in Maryland, especially youth and former apprentice licensees
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy to allow a second apprentice hunting license for youth under 17 who have already held one, with re-qualification requirements. It modernizes licensing rules but does not employ new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could influence youth engagement and access to outdoor activities.

Title: Financial Regulation - Modernizing Licensing of Non-Depository Institutions and Elimination of Branch License Requirements
Synopsis: Eliminating requirements for collection agencies and certain non-depository financial institutions to maintain separate licenses for branch locations and authorizing them to conduct business at multiple licensed locations under a single license; and altering certain other requirements and provisions governing the licensing and regulation of collection agencies and certain non-depository financial institutions, including applications, assessments, and bond requirements.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes Maryland's licensing process for non-depository financial institutions such as collection agencies, mortgage lenders, sales finance companies, money transmitters, and debt management services providers. It consolidates licensing procedures, removes the requirement for separate branch licenses, streamlines application and renewal processes through the NMLS system, adjusts bond and fee requirements, and creates a dedicated non-depository special fund for regulatory costs.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Non-depository financial institutions, consumers, and regulatory agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs the nationwide NMLS platform for licensing, application processing, and record-keeping, improving efficiency and transparency through technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but aims to regulate financial institutions to protect consumers and promote fair practices.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Trusts - Decanting (Maryland Trust Decanting Act)
Synopsis: Establishing rules governing the exercise of the decanting power to distribute the property of a first trust to one or more second trusts or to modify the terms of a first trust; and providing for the retroactive application of the Act.
bill_summary: This bill, known as the Maryland Trust Decanting Act, establishes rules and procedures for a trustee or authorized fiduciary to distribute or modify a trust's property by transferring it to a new trust or changing its terms, including special provisions for trusts benefiting persons with disabilities and charitable interests.
responsible_party: Maryland State Courts or the Office of the Attorney General (depending on implementation details)
stakeholders: Trust beneficiaries, including persons with disabilities, charitable organizations, and trust settlors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured legal framework allowing for flexible trust decanting with considerations for various special interests and potential tax implications, representing an innovative approach to trust management and estate planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily deals with trust law and estate planning.

Title: Pathways in Technology Early College High (P–TECH) School Program – High School Diplomas
Synopsis: Requiring that each memorandum of understanding establishing a school in the Pathways in Technology Early College High (P-TECH) School Program ensures that each P-TECH student receives a high school diploma immediately following completion of high school graduation requirements.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that students in P–TECH schools receive a high school diploma immediately after completing graduation requirements, regardless of pathway completion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and participating county boards
stakeholders: P–TECH students, local school systems, industry partners, colleges, and underserved student populations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a model integrating high school and college credentials with industry partnerships, ensuring immediate graduation and career opportunities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to positively impact child poverty by providing targeted educational pathways and industry engagement for underserved students.

Title: Maryland African American Museum Corporation - Board of Directors - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Board of Directors of the Maryland African American Museum Corporation.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership structure of the Board of Directors of the Maryland African American Museum Corporation, including changes to the number of members, their appointment process, and diversity considerations.
responsible_party: Maryland African American Museum Corporation
stakeholders: African American community, museum visitors, cultural institutions, residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes diversity and geographic representation in the museum board, including provisions for appointees from outside the state if needed.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Public Service Commission – Certificates of Public Convenience and Necessity – Local Permits
Synopsis: Establishing that a county or a municipal corporation has the authority to approve or deny any local permit required under a certificate of public convenience and necessity issued by the Public Service Commission for generating stations, transmission lines, and qualified generator lead lines; requiring a county or municipal corporation to approve or deny the local permits in a certain manner; prohibiting a county or municipal corporation from conditioning the approval of the local permits on certain approvals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that counties and municipal governments in Maryland have the authority to approve or deny local permits required for certain energy projects under certificates of public convenience and necessity, and prohibits conditioning permit approvals on certain reviews or findings. It aims to streamline local permit processes for energy infrastructure projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and local governments (counties and municipal corporations)
stakeholders: Energy project developers, local governments, and communities affected by energy infrastructure projects in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory harmonization approach to streamline the permitting process, ensuring local governments cannot unduly delay or condition approvals on discretionary reviews, which is a strategic regulatory reform rather than a technological innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's potential to directly impact child poverty is limited as it mainly involves permitting regulations for energy projects.

Title: State Board of Pharmacy - Board Membership, Delegated Pharmacy Acts, and Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the State Board of Pharmacy to include a registered pharmacy technician; authorizing a licensed pharmacist, under certain circumstances, to delegate the entry of certain data into databases or patient charts to be performed at a remote location to a registered pharmacy technician and a registered pharmacy intern; prohibiting registered pharmacy technicians and pharmacy technician trainees from making decisions requiring the professional judgment of a pharmacist; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the membership and authority of the Maryland State Board of Pharmacy, including adding a pharmacy technician to the Board, expanding delegation of pharmacy acts including remote data entry, and allowing technicians to administer certain vaccinations. It extends the sunset date for the Board's authority to 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Pharmacists, pharmacy technicians, healthcare providers, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces remote delegation of pharmacy acts and allows technicians to administer certain vaccinations, employing technological and expanded scope approaches in pharmacy practice.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty through improved healthcare access and pharmacy services.

Title: Rural Maryland Prosperity Investment Fund - Allocation of Grants (Rural Communities Improvement Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Authorizing the allocation of grants from the Rural Maryland Prosperity Investment Fund for certain business and workforce development activities.
bill_summary: The bill revises the allocation and disbursement rules of the Rural Maryland Prosperity Investment Fund, authorizes grants for business, workforce, infrastructure, and community development activities in rural areas, and extends the fund's program through 2024 with a mandated minimum annual appropriation of $1 million.
responsible_party: Rural Maryland Council with the assistance of the Board
stakeholders: rural communities in Maryland, regional councils, local governments, nonprofits, educational institutions, and rural residents
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured, multi-category grant allocation process with oversight and reporting, utilizing existing regional councils and a competitive grant system to promote rural development, which can be seen as an organized approach with integrated oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential high impact on child poverty by supporting economic development, health care, and community services in rural areas.

Title: Natural Resources - Black Bass Conservation Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Black Bass Conservation Fund in the Department of Natural Resources to further black bass management; requiring the Department to administer the Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; requiring interest earnings of the Fund to be credited to the Fund; and requiring the Department to establish a process through which an individual who purchases a certain license online to make a voluntary donation to the Black Bass Conservation Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Black Bass Conservation Fund as a nonlapsing fund to support black bass management, including stocking, habitat enhancement, tournaments, and scientific research. It creates a voluntary donation process for license buyers and allocates interest earnings to the fund.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Black bass populations, anglers, natural resource managers, and the general public interested in aquatic conservation
innovative_summary: The bill leverages voluntary donations through an electronic licensing system and earmarks interest earnings for conservation efforts, incorporating modern technology and financial management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on aquatic habitat conservation.

Title: Talbot County – Speed Monitoring Systems – Intersection of Maryland Route 333 (Oxford Road) and Bonfield Avenue
Synopsis: Authorizing the placement and use of a speed monitoring system at the intersection of Maryland Route 333 (Oxford Road) and Bonfield Avenue in Talbot County, subject to placement and signage requirements; requiring the fines collected by the Town of Oxford as a result of the speed monitoring system to be used to assist in covering the cost of roadway and pedestrian safety improvements in and around the intersection; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of a speed monitoring system at a specific intersection in Talbot County, Maryland, and directs that fines collected from violations enforced by this system be used to fund roadway and pedestrian safety improvements in and around that intersection.
responsible_party: State Highway Administration and local government of Talbot County
stakeholders: Motorists and pedestrians in Talbot County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs speed monitoring systems coupled with real-time speed display to enhance traffic safety, and directs revenue use for safety improvements, representing an integrated approach to traffic enforcement and safety funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on traffic safety infrastructure funding.

Title: Maryland Community Health Resources Commission and Offices of the Comptroller, Treasurer, and Attorney General - Compensation and Pay Scales of Employees
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission, in consultation with the Secretary of Health, to set the compensation of certain Commission employees; requiring the Secretary of Budget and Management, in consultation with the Secretary of Health, to determine the positions for which the Commission may set compensation; and authorizing the Comptroller, the Treasurer, and the Attorney General, in consultation with the Secretary of Budget and Management, to set the pay scale of certain positions in their offices.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission to set the pay of certain unique and specialized employees in consultation with the Secretary of Health, and it clarifies the authority of various state agencies (Office of the Comptroller, Treasurer, Attorney General) to set pay scales for their unique staff in consultation with the Secretary of Budget and Management.
responsible_party: Maryland Community Health Resources Commission and Offices of the Comptroller, Treasurer, and Attorney General in consultation with the Secretary of Budget and Management and the Secretary of Health.
stakeholders: Employees of the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission and various state agency employees with specialized positions.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach to tailored employee compensation by allowing agencies to set pay for specialized staff in consultation with the Secretary of Budget and Management, a departure from usual fixed pay scales.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly affect it by enabling better compensation and staffing of health programs.

Title: Health Care Facilities - Nursing Homes - Acquisitions and Licensure
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to provide certain information regarding the acquisition of a nursing home to the Office of Health Care Quality; requiring the Secretary of Health to consider the information before taking action regarding licensure to operate a nursing home; and requiring the Commission, in consultation with certain stakeholders, to study and make recommendations regarding the expansion of the certificate of need program over acquisitions of nursing homes and report by December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill enhances the oversight and regulation of nursing home acquisitions in Maryland by requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to provide detailed findings to the Office of Health Care Quality and to study the expansion of the certificate of need program regarding nursing home acquisitions. It also updates licensure and acquisition procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and the Office of Health Care Quality
stakeholders: Nursing home residents, nursing home owners, healthcare regulators, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a detailed review process for nursing home acquisitions, including better data collection, oversight, and a study on expanding the certificate of need program, employing systemic regulatory improvements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve overall healthcare quality and oversight, indirectly benefiting vulnerable populations.

Title: Declaration of Rights - Right to Reproductive Freedom
Synopsis: Establishing that every person, as a central component of an individual's rights to liberty and equality, has the fundamental right to reproductive freedom; and prohibiting the State from, directly or indirectly, denying, burdening, or abridging the right unless justified by a compelling State interest achieved by the least restrictive means.
bill_summary: The bill proposes an amendment to the Maryland Constitution to establish that every person has a fundamental right to reproductive freedom, including decisions to prevent, continue, or end a pregnancy, and prohibits the state from denying or burdening this right unless justified by a compelling state interest achieved by the least restrictive means.
responsible_party: Maryland State voters (via constitutional referendum)
stakeholders: All residents of Maryland, particularly individuals seeking reproductive health services
innovative_summary: This bill primarily amends the state constitution to explicitly recognize reproductive rights, which is a major legislative change; it does not employ new technologies but enacts a fundamental legal change.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly supports reproductive rights, which can influence economic stability and potentially reduce child poverty, but it does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Community Development - Sustainable Communities - Business Facade Improvement Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Business Facade Improvement Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development to assist qualified businesses located in sustainable communities with improving the outside appearance of the qualified businesses' buildings or facilities; requiring the Department to develop an application process for political subdivisions seeking to participate in the Program; and requiring the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2025, to include $5,000,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Business Facade Improvement Program in the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development. The program provides funds to counties with sustainable communities to help qualified local businesses improve their building exteriors.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Businesses located in sustainable communities within Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces targeted grants to improve business exteriors in sustainable communities, leveraging local government involvement and prescribed criteria for funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to enhance local economic development and business vitality, which could help reduce child poverty indirectly.

Title: Office of the Comptroller - Taxpayer Advocate Division
Synopsis: Establishing the Taxpayer Advocate Division in the Office of the Comptroller to assist taxpayers and their representatives in resolving certain taxpayer problems and complaints and represent taxpayers' interests in a certain manner.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Taxpayer Advocate Division within the Maryland Office of the Comptroller to assist taxpayers in resolving problems, improve communication, and suggest system improvements.
responsible_party: Office of the Maryland Comptroller
stakeholders: Taxpayers and their representatives in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a dedicated division with a web portal and systemic problem resolution, employing a structured approach to taxpayer assistance and government transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is primarily administrative and does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Modernization of State Financial Systems - 21st Century Financial Systems Enterprise
Synopsis: Requiring the Office of the Comptroller, the Office of the State Treasurer, the Department of Budget and Management, the Department of Information Technology, and the Department of General Services, in consultation with a representative of the Modernize Maryland Oversight Commission, to develop, implement, manage, and oversee the 21st Century Financial Systems Enterprise; and requiring the Office of the Comptroller to periodically report to the General Assembly on the status of the 21st Century Financial Systems Enterprise.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the 21st Century Financial Systems Enterprise to modernize and consolidate Maryland's state financial management systems into a cloud-based infrastructure, led by a designated director and overseen by a council including key state departments.
responsible_party: Office of the Comptroller in partnership with the Office of the State Treasurer, Department of Budget and Management, Department of Information Technology, and Department of General Services.
stakeholders: State government agencies involved in financial management and technology infrastructure, and ultimately the citizens relying on efficient government services.
innovative_summary: The program employs modern cloud-based technology and a coordinated, enterprise-wide approach to overhaul Maryland's financial systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve efficiency and transparency in financial systems, which may indirectly benefit children through better government services.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Residential Districts
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions of law authorizing the use of speed monitoring systems in certain residential districts apply in Anne Arundel County.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of speed monitoring systems in residential districts within Anne Arundel County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government
stakeholders: Residents and drivers in Anne Arundel County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs automated speed monitoring technology to enhance traffic law enforcement in residential areas.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Managed Care Organizations - Retroactive Denial of Reimbursement - Information in Written Statement
Synopsis: Altering the information that must be included in a written statement provided by a managed care organization to a health care provider when retroactively denying reimbursement as a result of coordination of benefits.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that managed care organizations in Maryland are not required to provide certain information when retroactively denying reimbursement due to coordination of benefits, and modifies the information that must be included in written denial statements to healthcare providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Healthcare providers and managed care organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs clarifications and administrative adjustments to existing requirements; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on administrative procedures related to insurance reimbursements.

Title: State Board of Nursing - Peer Advisory Committees, Scopes of Practice, and Licensure Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Nursing to appoint peer advisory committees to provide advice related to midwifery; authorizing registered nurses certified as nurse-midwives and licensed certified midwives to personally prepare and dispense a starter dosage of certain drugs under certain circumstances; altering the exceptions to the certified midwifery licensure requirement and the qualifications required for a license; etc.
bill_summary: This bill expands the roles and privileges of nurses, nurse-midwives, midwives, and other health care practitioners in Maryland, including appointing peer advisory committees, allowing certain controlled substances to be prescribed and dispensed, and developing recommendations to expand birthing center access.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Nurse practitioners, nurse-midwives, midwives, medical professionals, birthing centers, pregnant women, families, healthcare providers
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates the expanded use of prescriptive authority and delegated tasks among non-physician healthcare providers and establishes advisory committees, representing a collaborative and modern approach to healthcare delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact on child poverty through expanded access to birthing and maternal health services.

Title: Natural Resources – Forest Preservation and Retention
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "qualified conservation" for purposes of provisions of law related to forest mitigation banks; altering certain  methods of calculating forest afforestation, reforestation, and preservation requirements; authorizing local jurisdictions to adopt certain alternative afforestation, reforestation, and preservation requirements; requiring the Department of Natural Resources to establish a workgroup to evaluate and recommend incentives for private landowners to conserve forest; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's forest conservation laws, expanding requirements for forest retention, reforestation, and mitigation, establishing incentives for private landowners, and creating a workgroup to evaluate private conservation efforts. It also adjusts procedures for local forest programs and updates technical guidance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Landowners, local governments, private property owners, environmental organizations, and communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches such as establishing local alternative afforestation requirements, using mitigation banks, and creating a workgroup to evaluate incentives for private forest conservation and management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty through environmental and community benefits, but it is primarily focused on land and forest management.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Autism Waiver - Military Families
Synopsis: Requiring, unless the child's family requests that the child be removed, that a child on the registry for the Autism Waiver remain on the registry if the child's family relocates out of the State for military service; and providing that if a child on the registry for the Waiver becomes eligible for services while the child's family is out of the State for military service, the child shall be eligible for services through the Waiver if the family relocates to the State.
bill_summary: This bill requires children who are on the Autism Waiver registry in Maryland to remain on the registry if their family relocates out of state due to military service, unless the family requests removal. It also allows children who become eligible for services while their family is out of state to receive services if they relocate back to Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Military families with children on the Autism Waiver registry in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill provides specific provisions for military families, ensuring continuity of autism services despite relocation, which is a targeted policy adjustment rather than a new technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate impact on child poverty through improved access to autism services for military families.

Title: University System of Maryland - Facilities - Bonding Authority and Sale
Synopsis: Approving certain projects for the acquisition, development, and improvement of certain academic facilities for the University System of Maryland; approving the issuance of bonds by the University System of Maryland in a total principal amount of $25,000,000 for financing the projects; providing that the bonds are not a debt or obligation of the State or any of its subdivisions; and authorizing the Board of Regents to approve the use of money received from the sale of certain property for operating expenses at certain campuses.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the University System of Maryland to issue bonds totaling $30 million to finance and refinance certain academic facilities and renewal projects at the University of Maryland, College Park. It also allows the university, with approval, to use proceeds from the sale of property for operating expenses at nonresidential campuses.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Students, faculty, staff, and administration at the University of Maryland and its campuses
innovative_summary: The bill employs bonding to fund campus facilities and allows flexible use of sale proceeds for operating expenses, including at nonresidential campuses, which is somewhat innovative in financial management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by improving campus facilities and operations, but it is indirect.

Title: Criminal Law - False Statements - Emergency or Commission of Crime (Antiswatting Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from making or causing to be made a false statement, report, or complaint to a governmental emergency report recipient with reckless disregard of causing bodily harm to an individual as a direct result of a response to the statement, report, or complaint; and providing that a person who violates the Act, in addition to any penalties imposed, is civilly liable to an individual harmed by the violation.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Antiswatting Act of 2023, which makes it illegal to knowingly or recklessly make false emergency reports or statements that cause law enforcement or emergency services to respond, with penalties including fines, imprisonment, and civil liability. It also specifies that first-time violations by minors are civil offenses.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Public safety officials, law enforcement, emergency responders, minors, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal framework specifically targeting false emergency reports, including criminal and civil penalties, and clarifies jurisdiction and enforcement measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses legal penalties for false emergency reports.

Title: Juvenile Court - Concurrent Jurisdiction - Juvenile Offenses on Military Installations
Synopsis: Establishing that the jurisdiction of the juvenile court is concurrent with that of a federal court sitting in the State over certain proceedings involving violations of federal law by a child on a military installation if the federal court waives exclusive jurisdiction and the violation of federal law is also a crime under State law.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that juvenile court has concurrent jurisdiction with federal courts over certain offenses committed by children on U.S. military installations, including violations of federal law that are also crimes under Maryland law.
responsible_party: Maryland judicial system and the U.S. Department of Defense (through agreements)
stakeholders: Children involved in juvenile offenses on military installations, military authorities, Maryland legal system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a collaborative jurisdictional approach between Maryland state courts and federal courts, specifically for juvenile cases involving military installations, which is a novel legal coordination strategy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill focuses on legal jurisdiction for juvenile offenses and does not directly impact child poverty, but could indirectly improve juvenile justice outcomes.

Title: Public Safety – Officer and Community Wellness Training Grant Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the Officer and Community Wellness Training Grant Fund to provide grants to local law enforcement agencies for Mental Health First Aid for Public Safety training and Critical Incident Stress Management peer support training; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill for the Fund in fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter; and requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to report annually to the Governor and General Assembly on the uses of the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Officer and Community Wellness Training Grant Fund to provide grants to local law enforcement agencies for mental health first aid and critical incident stress management peer support training, with at least $1 million appropriated annually starting in fiscal year 2025.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Local law enforcement agencies and communities they serve
innovative_summary: The bill introduces targeted mental health and stress management training grants for law enforcement, emphasizing mental health and peer support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may have an indirect impact on child poverty by improving community interactions with law enforcement and enhancing safety.

Title: Sexual Assault Evidence Collection Kits - Preservation and Storage
Synopsis: Altering requirements for the storage and preservation of sexual assault evidence collection kits; requiring sexual assault evidence collection kits collected before January 1, 2000, to be retained and transferred in a certain manner; and requiring the Maryland Sexual Assault Evidence Kit Policy and Funding Committee, by December 1, 2023, to issue a report to the Governor and the General Assembly on certain recommendations, in consultation with the Consumer Protection Division of the Office of the Attorney General.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland's policies on the storage, preservation, and handling of sexual assault evidence collection kits, including new timelines for retention and procedures for older kits, and establishes reporting and guidelines for transfer and testing.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Attorney General and Maryland Sexual Assault Evidence Kit Policy and Funding Committee
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault, law enforcement agencies, healthcare providers, hospitals, and child advocacy centers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive, statewide standardized process for storage, testing, and disposal of sexual assault evidence kits, including establishing protocols for older kits and improving coordination among agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's focus on improving the handling of sexual assault evidence may have an indirect impact on child victims and their access to justice, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services - Sexual Assault Evidence Collection Kit Reporting Program
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to establish and administer a certain reporting program relating to sexual assault evidence collection kits; requiring a law enforcement agency and a person with control or possession of a sexual assault evidence collection kit to report certain information to the program and comply with certain regulations; and clarifying the uses for the Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a reporting program for tracking the location, status, and chain of custody of sexual assault evidence collection kits in Maryland. It requires law enforcement agencies and others with control of such kits to report specific information to the program, and creates a grant fund to support testing of these kits.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault, law enforcement agencies, forensic laboratories, and related service providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a technological tracking and reporting system for sexual assault evidence kits, enhancing transparency, victim support, and law enforcement accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have an indirect positive impact on child poverty by improving justice and support services for victims, but the primary focus is on evidence management.

Title: Montgomery County - Collective Bargaining for Sheriff's Office Employees - Binding Arbitration Procedures MC 13-23
Synopsis: Requiring that the procedures for declaring an impasse and submitting a dispute to binding arbitration be conducted in accordance with certain provisions of the Montgomery County Code if the Sheriff of Montgomery County and a bargaining representative are unable to reach agreement during negotiations on matters applicable to employees of the Montgomery County Sheriff's Office.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies and establishes procedures for collective bargaining and binding arbitration between the Montgomery County Sheriff's Office and a bargaining representative, including disputes over matters related to employees of the Sheriff's Office.
responsible_party: Montgomery County government and the Montgomery County Sheriff’s Office
stakeholders: Employees of the Montgomery County Sheriff's Office and the Montgomery County government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for binding arbitration specifically for disputes involving the Sheriff's Office, integrated with the county's collective bargaining framework, ensuring streamlined dispute resolution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on labor relations procedures and does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Montgomery County Housing Opportunities Commission - Collective Bargaining Agreement Implementation - Impasse Arbitration MC 10-23
Synopsis: Altering the terms and conditions of a certain final offer that the Executive Director of the Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County is required to submit to the Montgomery Commission; authorizing the parties to a collective bargaining agreement for employees of the Montgomery Commission to request the services of a mediator-arbitrator during a term of a collective bargaining agreement under certain circumstances; and establishing the process for mediation-arbitration.
bill_summary: This bill revises the procedures for collective bargaining and impasse resolution between the Montgomery County Housing Opportunities Commission and its employees, including mediation and arbitration processes for determining final contract offers.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Housing Opportunities Commission
stakeholders: Employees of the Montgomery County Housing Opportunities Commission and their union representatives
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured mediation–arbitration process with specific timelines, criteria, and cost-sharing mechanisms, modernizing dispute resolution in public employment contracts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill directly impacts worker wages and benefits, which could influence economic stability for employees and potentially reduce child poverty in affected households.

Title: Economic Development - Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and Senator George C. Edwards Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board; establishing an Executive Director for the Board; and altering the manner in which decisions are made regarding certain proposals for funding.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board with specific structures for vetting and voting on regional economic development projects. It creates the Senator George C. Edwards Fund to provide grants and loans for infrastructure and business projects in Allegany, Garrett, and Washington counties, with annual funding of at least $10 million from fiscal year 2024 to 2026.
responsible_party: The Council, with the administration of the Fund managed by an Executive Director appointed jointly by the Vetting and Voting Boards
stakeholders: Residents, businesses, and government entities in Allegany, Garrett, and Washington counties
innovative_summary: The program employs a regional coordination approach with structured vetting and voting processes, and aims to strategically allocate funding to regional economic projects, integrating regional representation and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by stimulating regional economic development, creating jobs, and supporting local businesses.

Title: Blueprint for Maryland's Future - Various Policies and Prekindergarten Enrollment and Funding - Alterations
Synopsis: Delaying the school year by which a public school is required to collect a certain alternative income eligibility form until after the State Department of Education has adopted the form; altering the duties of an assistant principal on the career ladder; delaying the date on which county boards of education must select certain experts to write curriculum; altering the definition of a "Tier I child" who may be enrolled in a full-day prekindergarten program beginning in a certain school year to include children who are homeless; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands and enhances full-day prekindergarten programs in Maryland by increasing participation, specifying program quality standards, and establishing a coordinating consortium involving multiple stakeholders to improve early childhood education and support services.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and Maryland Consortium on Coordinated Community Supports
stakeholders: 3- and 4-year-old children, families, prekindergarten providers, schools, and community organizations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to early childhood education with standards, increased provider involvement, and a new state-level consortium to coordinate efforts and resources, integrating health, social, and educational services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to quality prekindergarten for disadvantaged children and providing support services.

Title: Assisted Living Programs - Unlicensed Programs - Resident Abuse, Exploitation, and Neglect (The Senator Delores Kelley Residents of Unlicensed Programs Protection Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health or the Office of Health Care Quality to investigate whether residents in an assisted living program have been subject to neglect, exploitation, or abuse, if the assisted living program is operating without a license; subjecting certain assisted living programs operating without a license to immediate prosecution under a certain provision of law under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances regulations against unlicensed assisted living programs by requiring investigations into resident abuse, increasing penalties, allowing for injunctive relief, and setting licensing enforcement rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or Office of Health Care Quality
stakeholders: Residents of assisted living programs, especially those in unlicensed facilities
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates legal and enforcement procedures; it does not introduce new or innovative technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but improves protection for vulnerable residents in assisted living facilities.

Title: Public Safety - Emergency Management - Consumer Protections Against Price Gouging
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from selling an essential good or service for more than a certain increase in price during and for a certain time after a certain state of emergency; and requiring the Secretary of State to establish an electronic notification system by which a person may register to receive information on whether a state of emergency has been declared and an executive order issued, that the provisions of the Act are in effect, and which categories of essential goods and services are covered by the executive order.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the sale or offer to sell essential goods and services at a price 10% to 15% above the highest actual sales or rental price from the past 60 days before a declared state of emergency, and restricts price increases during and for 90 days after the emergency unless justified by increased costs or seasonal pricing. It also establishes a notification system for the public.
responsible_party: Secretary of State of Maryland
stakeholders: Consumers and businesses selling essential goods and services during emergencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a mandatory electronic notification system for public awareness on emergency declarations and related provisions, which is a modern approach to government communication.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill mainly addresses price gouging and consumer protections during emergencies; its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Cigarettes - Wholesalers - Disclosure of Information
Synopsis: Requiring each licensed cigarette wholesaler to submit complete and accurate information in the form and manner the Comptroller requires to facilitate compliance with certain provisions of law relating to cigarettes.
bill_summary: The bill requires licensed cigarette wholesalers to submit complete and accurate quarterly information about their cigarette sales to the Maryland Comptroller. It also details enforcement measures, including license revocation and civil penalties, for violations of reporting requirements or sale restrictions.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller and Attorney General
stakeholders: Cigarette wholesalers and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates existing regulations on reporting requirements and enforcement procedures for cigarette wholesalers, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to improve regulation and enforcement regarding cigarette sales.

Title: Montgomery County - Bicounty Agencies - Commissioner Discipline, Disclosures, Training, and Ethics MC/PG 105-23
