Synopsis: Authorizing a bicounty commissioner and an applicant for the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission to submit certain financial statements to the Montgomery County Council electronically; authorizing the Council to discipline a Montgomery County commissioner under certain circumstances; prohibiting a Montgomery County commissioner from engaging in certain political activities while serving on the Commission; prohibiting the chair of the Montgomery County Planning Board from engaging in certain employment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the appointment, discipline, financial disclosure, training, and meeting transparency requirements for Montgomery County representatives on the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission, and enhances public access to Montgomery County Planning Board meetings.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Government and the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission
stakeholders: Residents of Montgomery County and Prince George’s County, public officials, and stakeholders involved in the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches such as electronic submission of financial disclosures, increased transparency through online publishing of meeting agendas and recordings, and enhanced training requirements for commissioners.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate to high potential to impact child poverty positively by improving transparency and accountability in county planning and service delivery.

Title: Tax Sales – Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to file a motion with a court to request that a certain certificate of sale be assigned to the governing body of the county or municipal corporation in a certain foreclosure action under certain circumstances; providing that, on a grant of the motion by the court, the holder of the certificate of sale forfeits certain rights and the amount paid to acquire the certificate of sale; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland laws regarding tax sales, allowing local governments to request the assignment of certificates of sale for properties undergoing foreclosure, to withhold certain vacant or blighted properties from sale, and to streamline the transfer of property titles to local governments to facilitate demolition or redevelopment.
responsible_party: Maryland state and local tax authorities or courts involved in tax sale proceedings
stakeholders: County and municipal governments, property owners, communities with vacant or blighted properties
innovative_summary: The bill introduces mechanisms for local governments to more proactively acquire and manage vacant and blighted properties through foreclosure and title transfer procedures, employing legal and procedural innovations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential to reduce blight and promote redevelopment can support community stability and economic development, which may lower child poverty indirectly.

Title: Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Equitech Growth Fund and Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Equitech Growth Fund in the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to support the economic competitiveness and inclusive growth of emerging and advanced industries in the State through the creation of supporting infrastructure assets, resources, and a diverse workforce that builds the strengths of the State's economy; establishing the Equitech Growth Commission to create a strategic plan; requiring the Governor in each of fiscal years 2025 through 2033 to include $5,000,000 in the annual budget bill; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Equitech Growth Fund to support economic competitiveness and inclusive growth in Maryland's emerging and advanced industries, and creates the Equitech Growth Commission to develop a 10-year strategic plan for the state's innovation economy.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Emerging and advanced industries, workforce, minority communities, and the broader Maryland economy.
innovative_summary: The program incorporates strategic planning, private sector leverage, community participation, and aims to significantly boost the state's innovation economy through targeted investments and inclusive policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by promoting economic growth, creating high-paying jobs, and increasing opportunities for minority communities.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission – Minority Business Enterprise Utilization Program – Revisions and Extension MC/PG 101–23
Synopsis: Revising the minority business enterprise utilization program within the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, including altering the definition of "minority business enterprise", altering the duties of the Office of Supplier Diversity and Inclusion, and merging the program for design/build and construction contracts with the program for the procurement of goods and services; extending until July 1, 2028, provisions relating to procurement from minority business enterprises by the Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises and extends the minority business enterprise utilization programs within the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, including updates to definitions, procedures, and certification requirements aimed at remedying discrimination against minority and women-owned businesses.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission (WSSC)
stakeholders: Minority-owned and women-owned businesses, contractors, and the local communities served by WSSC
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining race-neutral programs with targeted race-conscious measures, including certification, monitoring, and reporting, to address ongoing discrimination and disparities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by supporting minority and women-owned businesses, creating jobs, and promoting economic equity.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B and Class C Beer, Wine, and Liquor Licenses, Inspections, Penalties, and Workgroup PG 302-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license, a Class C (fraternal/sororal/service organization) beer, wine, and liquor license, or a Class C (veterans' organization or club) beer, wine and liquor license in Prince George's County to serve beer, wine, and liquor by the glass or by the bottle for on-premises consumption; establishing the Workgroup to Study Best Practices for Safe Event Promotion and the Leveraging of Alcoholic Beverages Licenses in Prince George's County; requiring a certain report by December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates alcohol licensing regulations in Prince George's County, including authorized services and inspections, establishes a workgroup to study safe event promotion and license leveraging, and sets program periods and funding.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners and county government agencies
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, event promoters, residents, and local government in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated workgroup to explore best practices for safe event promotion and how to leverage licenses for revenue, combining regulatory updates with strategic assessment and recommendations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for impact on child poverty, as safer events and revenue generation could benefit community welfare.

Title: Health Insurance - Step Therapy or Fail-First Protocol and Prior Authorization - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to establish a certain process for requesting an exception to a step therapy or fail-first protocol; prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from requiring more than a certain number of prior authorizations for a prescription for different dosages of the same prescription drug; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises rules regarding step therapy protocols and prior authorization processes for prescription drugs under health insurance plans in Maryland. It limits certain restrictions, establishes processes for requesting exceptions, and sets timeframes for approval.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Insured individuals, healthcare providers, health insurance companies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill implements clearer processes and timeframes for exception requests and limits on prior authorizations, aligning with current healthcare needs but introducing no new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly benefits insured individuals by improving access and reducing barriers to necessary medications, which could have a positive impact on child health and well-being.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Membership - Emergency Medical Technicians
Synopsis: Authorizing membership in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for certain emergency medical technicians under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill expands membership eligibility for the Maryland Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System to include certain emergency medical technicians (EMTs) employed by participating governmental units.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency / Board of Trustees for the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System
stakeholders: Emergency medical technicians, law enforcement officers, firefighters, participating governmental units in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted policy change to include EMTs in a pension system traditionally for law enforcement, which is a novel approach to broadening public pension coverage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns pension benefits for public safety personnel.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System – Frostburg City Police Department
Synopsis: Requiring membership in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for local law enforcement officers of the Frostburg City Police Department under certain circumstances; providing that an individual is entitled to eligibility service and creditable service that was earned before the effective date of the Frostburg City Police Department's participation in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System; etc.
bill_summary: This bill mandates that members of the Frostburg City Police Department automatically join the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System when the department begins participating, and allows certain prior service credits to be transferred to this pension system.
responsible_party: Maryland State Personnel and Pensions Department
stakeholders: Frostburg City Police Department officers and the local government
innovative_summary: The bill mainly changes pension transfer rules and mandatory membership, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting police pension arrangements.

Title: Baltimore Regional Transit Commission - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Baltimore Regional Transit Commission to review and comment on annual budget requests of the Maryland Transit Administration, updates to the Central Maryland Transportation Plan, and certain annual reports and to perform other oversight and advocacy duties related to Baltimore region transit services; and requiring the Commission, by December 1 each year, to report its findings and recommendations on the Baltimore region transit systems to the Administration, the Governor, and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Baltimore Regional Transit Commission to oversee and provide input on transit services, budgets, plans, and policies for the Baltimore region.
responsible_party: Baltimore Metropolitan Council
stakeholders: Transit riders, residents, businesses in the Baltimore region
innovative_summary: The program creates a new regional transit oversight body with formal evaluation, planning, and public engagement functions, integrating comprehensive oversight and strategic planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by improving transit access and quality for underserved communities.

Title: Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission - Collective Bargaining Agreement Implementation - Dispute Arbitration MC/PG 103-23
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that economic provisions of a certain final collective bargaining agreement for employees of the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission be subject to funding by the Montgomery County Council and the Prince George's County Council to instead require that certain terms and conditions of the final agreement be subject to approval by the Montgomery County Council and the Prince George's County Council; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the collective bargaining process for employees of the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission by establishing a mediation–arbitration process, outlining how disputes are handled, and specifying the involvement of county councils in funding certain terms.
responsible_party: Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission and the county councils of Montgomery and Prince George’s County
stakeholders: Employees of the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission and their employee organizations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured mediation–arbitration process for resolving disputes in collective bargaining and involves county approval for economic terms, employing a formalized approach to dispute resolution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns labor negotiations and dispute resolution processes.

Title: Execution on a Judgment - Child Support Arrearages - Workers' Compensation
Synopsis: Specifying that 25% of the net recovery by the debtor on a claim for workers' compensation is subject to execution on a judgment for a child support arrearage.
bill_summary: The bill specifies that 25% of a debtor's net recovery from workers' compensation insurance benefits or personal injury claims can be automatically used to pay child support arrears through legal execution.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Judicial Proceedings Department
stakeholders: Children owed child support, debtors receiving workers' compensation benefits, child support enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward legal approach to better enforce child support payments by allocating a portion of workers' compensation and injury claim recoveries to child support arrears.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to directly improve child support collection, thereby possibly reducing child poverty among affected families.

Title: Institutions of Higher Education – Sports Wagering Contracts – Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting institutions of higher education from entering into a contract with a certain regulated gaming entity or a certain agent of a regulated gaming entity if the institution of higher education receives certain compensation for student participation in certain sports wagering; prohibiting institutions of higher education from entering into a contract with a sports marketing entity if the entity or the institution receives certain compensation for student participation in certain sports wagering; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits Maryland higher education institutions from entering into contracts with regulated gaming entities or sports marketing entities if they receive incentives based on student participation in sports betting or online sports wagering. It also makes such contracts subject to public inspection.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Students at higher education institutions, higher education institutions, sports betting companies, sports marketers, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific restrictions on contracts between higher education institutions and sports betting entities, emphasizing transparency and preventing incentives based on student participation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses contractual restrictions and transparency regarding sports wagering in higher education.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Administrative Fees
Synopsis: Altering the method by which administrative fees for participants in the State Retirement and Pension System are calculated by and remitted to the State Retirement and Pension System; and requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to provide certain notice to local participating employers.
bill_summary: The bill changes how administrative fees for the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System are calculated and reimbursed, including notice requirements for local employers and state agencies, starting from June 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, specifically the Board of Trustees and the State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Participants in the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including state and local government employees and employers
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies administrative and financial procedures for the pension system, with no new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Amortization of Unfunded Liabilities and Surpluses
Synopsis: Altering the amortization periods to be used for certain unfunded liabilities or surpluses of the State Retirement and Pension System.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the amortization periods for unfunded liabilities and surpluses of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, extending the timelines and allowing adjustments to mitigate volatility.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency (implied)
stakeholders: State employees and retirees, pension fund beneficiaries
innovative_summary: The bill mainly changes funding rules and amortization periods; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on pension funding.

Title: Vehicle Laws – Autonomous Vehicle Converters – Sale of Autonomous Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing an autonomous vehicle converter to sell, transfer, lease, offer for sale, or resell a converted autonomous vehicle or a motor vehicle purchased with the intent to convert the motor vehicle into a converted autonomous vehicle; establishing that certain portions of the Act apply only to motor vehicles intended for commercial or industrial use; and prohibiting an autonomous vehicle converter from holding certain occupational vehicle licenses issued under the Maryland Vehicle Law.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes autonomous vehicle converters to sell, transfer, lease, and resell converted autonomous vehicles, specifically targeting vehicles for commercial or industrial use, and clarifies their legal status and restrictions in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Autonomous vehicle converters and companies, commercial vehicle operators, and policy regulators in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill introduces a new legal category for autonomous vehicle converters, enabling them to participate in vehicle sales and resales, which is a novel approach in vehicle regulation and autonomous technology deployment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on vehicle regulation and commercial transportation.

Title: Reproductive Health Protection Act
Synopsis: Prohibiting a judge from requiring a person to give certain testimony or a statement or to produce evidence for a case involving an alleged violation of the criminal law of another state relating to health care that is legally protected in the State; prohibiting a judge from issuing an ex parte order to intercept certain communication for the purpose of investigating or recovering evidence related to legally protected health care, subject to a certain exception; etc.
bill_summary: The Reproductive Health Protection Act establishes protections for legally protected health care (such as abortion and reproductive services) in Maryland, restricting interstate legal actions, subpoenas, investigations, and extraditions related to such health care, unless acts would be a crime in Maryland. It also prevents Maryland state agencies and private parties from assisting in interstate investigations that seek to impose liability or sanctions for legally protected health care activities not considered crimes in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State government and relevant health and judicial agencies
stakeholders: Individuals seeking or providing legally protected health care, including reproductive health services and abortion, within Maryland, and potentially those involved in interstate legal proceedings affecting such health care practices.
innovative_summary: The bill largely employs new legal protections and restrictions to shield Maryland's health care activities, especially concerning interstate legal efforts over legally protected health care, emphasizing legal sovereignty and privacy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate; by protecting access to reproductive health care, it may support health and economic stability for affected populations.

Title: State Procurement – Minority Business Enterprise Program – Extension and Reports
Synopsis: Altering to July 1, 2025, the termination date for certain provisions of law governing the Minority Business Enterprise Program and its application to offshore wind projects and video lottery terminals; and altering the date by which certain reports, studies, and guidelines must be submitted.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination dates of certain laws and regulations related to the Maryland Minority Business Enterprise Program, modifies reporting deadlines, and mandates studies and reports on the program's compliance and effectiveness, particularly concerning offshore wind projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and certification agencies
stakeholders: Minority-owned businesses, policymakers, and contractors involved in offshore wind projects
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes evaluating and improving minority business programs through updated studies, race-neutral approaches, and ongoing assessments, using data-driven and analytical approaches to address disparities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potentially moderate, as the program aims to increase minority business participation, which can contribute to economic growth and poverty reduction among minority communities.

Title: Hospitals - Testing for Fentanyl (The Josh Siems Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a hospital to include testing for fentanyl as part of a urine drug screening; and requiring the hospital, if a urine drug screening detects fentanyl, to report the deidentified test results  to the Maryland Department of Health through the State-designated health information exchange.
bill_summary: The bill requires hospitals in Maryland to include fentanyl testing in urine drug screenings for patients with known or suspected drug overdoses if a toxicology report is requested, starting October 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Hospitals in Maryland (healthcare providers)
stakeholders: Patients with known or suspected drug overdoses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a mandated fentanyl test as part of routine drug screenings in hospitals for overdose cases, utilizing toxicology reports and health information exchange systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves medical response to overdose cases.

Title: Health - Reproductive Health Services - Protected Information and Insurance Requirements
Synopsis: Regulating the disclosure of certain information related to legally protected health care by custodians of public records, health information exchanges, and electronic health networks; requiring that the regulations adopted by the Maryland Health Care Commission regarding clinical information to be exchanged through the State-designated exchange restrict data of patients who have obtained legally protected health care; establishing the Protected Health Care Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill regulates the privacy and disclosure of protected health information related to reproductive health and abortion services, establishes a Protected Health Care Commission, and sets rules for health information exchanges and insurance coverage for abortion care.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Patients seeking reproductive health and abortion services, healthcare providers, health information exchanges, and insurers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new regulations for data privacy, cross-state data exchange restrictions, and imposes penalties for violations, reflecting a comprehensive and technology-focused approach to health data privacy and security.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's primary impact is on health data privacy and insurance regulations, with indirect effects on access to reproductive health services, including abortion, which may influence child poverty outcomes.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the termination date of certain provisions of law that establish and govern the funding for the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program; and requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange, in consultation with the Maryland Insurance Administration, to conduct a study on available federal and State subsidies and report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the Maryland Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program, establishes a study on federal and state subsidies and policy options, and requires reporting on findings and recommendations.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Young adults aged 18-40 with income between 133% and 400% of the federal poverty level
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted subsidies and a comprehensive study to evaluate their impact on young adult health insurance coverage, also tracking and reporting on market effects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing health coverage amongst young adults, thus supporting families.

Title: Cancer Screening - Health Insurance and Assessment of Outreach, Education, and Health Disparities
Synopsis: Requiring insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for certain lung cancer diagnostic imaging and limiting the copayment, coinsurance, or deductible that the entities can require for lung cancer screening and diagnosis; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to conduct an assessment on certain outreach, education, and health disparities in cancer screening and report the results to the General Assembly by January 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Breast and Lung Cancer Screening Awareness Program under the Maryland Department of Health to educate communities and assist individuals with transportation costs for screenings. It mandates insurance coverage for breast and lung cancer screening and diagnostic imaging, limits out-of-pocket costs, and requires assessments on outreach and disparities in cancer screening.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals eligible for breast and lung cancer screening, especially those from underserved communities
innovative_summary: The program combines education, outreach, and coverage mandates with an assessment of disparities and community engagement, employing a comprehensive approach to improve cancer screening rates.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has moderate potential to directly reduce child poverty by increasing access to cancer screening and related healthcare services for underserved populations.

Title: Procurement - Minority Business Enterprises and Veteran-Owned Small Business Enterprises - Participation Goal Scorecard
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to develop a scorecard to evaluate units of State government on the units' performance toward meeting certain participation goals under the Minority Business Enterprise Program and the Veteran-Owned Small Business Enterprise Program; establishing a certain grading scale for the scorecard; and requiring grades achieved by each unit to be published each year on the Office's website.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to create a scorecard to evaluate state government units on their performance in meeting specific participation goals for Minority Business Enterprises and Veteran-Owned Small Business Enterprises. The scorecard assigns grades based on achievement levels and will be included in annual reports and published on the Office's website.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs
stakeholders: State government units, minority businesses, veteran-owned small businesses
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new grading scorecard to evaluate and publicly report the performance of government units in minority and veteran business enterprise participation, adding transparency and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly supports minority and veteran small businesses, which could help reduce child poverty by promoting economic opportunities within underserved communities.

Title: State Government - Regulation Procedures and the Maryland Register
Synopsis: Requiring the Division of State Documents to make at least the 15 most recent issues of the Maryland Register available to the public for online searching; altering the requirements for a unit of State government to submit certain proposed or emergency regulations, work plans, and evaluation reports to the Joint Committee on Administrative, Executive, and Legislative Review, the Department of Legislative Services, and the Administrator of the Division of State Documents; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the procedures for submitting, reviewing, and publishing regulations by Maryland state agencies, including the development of an electronic filing system for regulation submissions and tracking.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services and Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Maryland state government agencies, Joint Committee on Administrative, Executive, and Legislative Review, Department of Legislative Services, Division of State Documents, and the public interested in regulations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new electronic filing system for regulation submissions, tracking, and publication, which enhances transparency and efficiency in government regulatory processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on regulatory procedures and technological improvements.

Title: Public Safety - Regulated Firearms - Possession and Permits to Carry, Wear, and Transport a Handgun
Synopsis: Altering the penalty for a violation of the prohibition on wearing, carrying, or transporting a handgun; requiring the State Commission on Criminal Sentencing Policy to annually report certain information to the Governor and General Assembly; requiring the Department of State Police to transmit a certain summary of certain laws relating to firearms to certain persons; requiring the Secretary of State Police, in consultation with the Attorney General and the Maryland Department of Health, to develop a certain curriculum; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's firearms laws by changing penalties, reporting requirements, firearm storage and safety education initiatives, and regulations around permits and disqualifiers for firearm possession.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Mary Maryland residents, firearm owners, youth, law enforcement, health professionals, and families
innovative_summary: The bill includes comprehensive firearm safety education, a youth suicide prevention guide, and regular reporting and review processes, employing technology and inter-agency collaboration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The initiatives aim to promote safe storage and mental health awareness, which can help reduce youth firearm injuries and suicides, thus potentially lowering child poverty impacts.

Title: Town of Forest Heights (Prince George's County) - Urban Renewal Authority for Blight Clearance PG 410-23
Synopsis: Granting the Town of Forest Heights in Prince George's County the authority to exercise urban renewal powers in areas zoned for commercial use for blight clearance and redevelopment under Article III, Section 61 of the Maryland Constitution; and authorizing the municipality to levy certain taxes and issue general obligation bonds and revenue bonds to carry out urban renewal powers.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Town of Forest Heights in Prince George's County to exercise urban renewal powers to clear blighted areas and undertake redevelopment projects, including the ability to issue bonds and levy taxes for these purposes.
responsible_party: Town of Forest Heights in Prince George's County
stakeholders: Residents and property owners in blighted areas of Forest Heights, Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill employs established urban renewal strategies including bonding and tax powers; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by reducing blight and promoting redevelopment in affected neighborhoods, thus improving living conditions.

Title: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority in Prince George's County to support and develop a certain neighborhood revitalization plan in coordination with certain residents; and requiring the Authority to report its comprehensive neighborhood revitalization strategy to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly on or before October 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Prince George's Gateway Arts Development Authority to support neighborhood revitalization in select communities within Prince George's County, including planning, economic development, and transportation improvements, with a reporting deadline in 2025.
responsible_party: Prince George's Gateway Arts Development Authority
stakeholders: Residents and communities within the Target Area of Prince George's County, including Mount Rainier, Brentwood, Cottage City, Bladensburg, Colmar Manor, and North Brentwood.
innovative_summary: This bill creates a new local authority dedicated to neighborhood revitalization, engaging community residents and coordinating efforts across multiple agencies, which represents an innovative approach to comprehensive community development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving neighborhood conditions, housing, and economic development, but specific impacts are not detailed.

Title: Residential Construction - Electric Vehicle Charging
Synopsis: Establishing and altering certain requirements related to the installation of equipment for the charging of electric vehicles during the construction of certain housing units; clarifying that a county or municipal corporation may require a greater number of electric vehicle parking spaces; requiring the Maryland Energy Administration to study certain issues related to the installation of electric vehicle parking spaces at multifamily residential buildings and submit a report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2023; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for installing electric vehicle supply equipment and infrastructure in new residential construction and significant renovations, including provisions for parking spaces in single-family, multifamily, and other residential buildings, and mandates a study on EV infrastructure costs and implementation strategies in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Residents, prospective homebuyers, and developers of residential housing and multifamily buildings in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs comprehensive standards for EV infrastructure integration in residential construction and mandates detailed future planning and studies, representing a forward-thinking approach to sustainable transportation infrastructure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may have a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to sustainable transportation options and potentially lowering living costs.

Title: Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure - Requirements (Electric Vehicle Charging Reliability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to expand the EV Pilot Program to allow participating electric companies to install EV charging stations in multifamily dwellings in underserved communities; requiring the Commission to terminate the expansion of the EV Pilot Program on December 31, 2025; requiring an electric company operating an EV charging network to ensure the EV charging stations in the EV charging network maintain certain uptime standards, subject to certain exceptions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands Maryland's Electric Vehicle (EV) Pilot Program to include incentives for installing EV charging stations in multifamily dwellings in underserved communities, establishes standards for station uptime and maintenance, and requires reporting and staffing standards for electric companies operating EV charging networks. It sets deadlines for program expansion and termination, and aims to improve the reliability and accessibility of EV charging infrastructure.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric vehicle users, underserved community residents, electric utility companies, policymakers
innovative_summary: The bill employs strict uptime standards, detailed reporting requirements, and targeted expansions into underserved communities to improve EV infrastructure reliability and accessibility, utilizing data-driven oversight and program expansion.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially reduces barriers to EV adoption in underserved communities, which might improve economic opportunities and reduce transportation costs, thus potentially lowering child poverty.

Title: Baltimore Regional Water Governance Task Force
Synopsis: Establishing the Baltimore Regional Water Governance Task Force to study approaches to water and wastewater governance in the Baltimore region; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Mayor of Baltimore City, the County Executive of Baltimore County, the Governor, and the General Assembly on or before January 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Baltimore Regional Water Governance Task Force to study and recommend improved governance frameworks for water and wastewater systems in the Baltimore region. The task force will review existing models, analyze costs and efficiencies, and recommend the best governance structure to enhance management, operations, and affordability.
responsible_party: Baltimore City and Baltimore County governments (jointly)
stakeholders: Residents and ratepayers of Baltimore City, Baltimore County, and surrounding counties serviced by the regional water system
innovative_summary: The bill proposes to evaluate and potentially implement new governance frameworks by analyzing various models and best practices nationally, with a focus on improving efficiency, cost management, and service quality through regional cooperation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve water service management and affordability, which can indirectly benefit child poverty by ensuring reliable and affordable water access for families.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Common Ownership Community Website
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to establish and maintain a website that provides certain information on the rights and responsibilities of individuals living in a common ownership community.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development to create and maintain a website that provides information on the rights and responsibilities of individuals living in common ownership communities, such as condominiums, cooperatives, and homeowners associations, including links to local programs and recent legislation.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents of common ownership communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a government website to centralize and disseminate information about residents' rights, local programs, and legislation, leveraging digital tools for better knowledge sharing and transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, but improving residents' understanding of their rights and responsibilities may indirectly support family stability.

Title: Drinking Water - Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program in the Department of the Environment for the purpose of authorizing the regulated use of reclaimed water as a source for drinking water treatment facilities; providing for the issuance of potable reuse permits under the Pilot Program; applying certain public participation requirements to potable reuse permits; requiring the Department to submit a report on the status of the Pilot Program to the Governor and General Assembly on or before December 31, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program in Maryland to regulate the use of reclaimed water as a source for drinking water, including permitting, public participation, and safety standards.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Public water systems and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs advanced water treatment technologies such as reverse osmosis and UV disinfection to safely reuse reclaimed water for drinking purposes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving water quality and safety, which can benefit all residents including children.

Title: Public Health - Chief Medical Examiner - Corrections to Autopsy Findings and Conclusions
Synopsis: Altering, from 60 days to 180 days, the time period after a medical examiner files findings and conclusions resulting from an autopsy during which a person in interest may request the medical examiner to correct findings and conclusions on the cause and manner of death recorded on a certificate of death.
bill_summary: The bill extends the time period for a person in interest to request corrections to autopsy findings from 60 days to 180 days after the medical examiner files the findings.
responsible_party: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of Maryland
stakeholders: People in interest who have had autopsies conducted and want to request corrections
innovative_summary: This bill primarily changes legal procedures and time frames related to autopsy corrections, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty, as it concerns autopsy procedures and legal processes.

Title: Division of Rehabilitation Services and Developmental Disabilities Administration - Memorandum of Understanding
Synopsis: Requiring the Division of Rehabilitation Services in the State Department of Education and the Developmental Disabilities Administration in the Maryland Department of Health to enter into a memorandum of understanding, the terms of which shall include a data sharing agreement for the medical and psychological records of mutual clients in order to expedite decisions regarding eligibility for services.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education's Division of Rehabilitation Services and the Maryland Department of Health's Developmental Disabilities Administration to enter into a memorandum of understanding that includes a data sharing agreement for medical and psychological records of mutual clients, to streamline eligibility decisions for services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities who are clients of both the Division of Rehabilitation Services and the Developmental Disabilities Administration
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal data sharing agreement between two government agencies to improve decision-making process for service eligibility, employing a collaborative and data-driven approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce barriers to accessing services for disabled individuals, which can indirectly impact child poverty by increasing support and independence.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Service Near Regional Transit Districts and Neighborhood Centers in Prince George's County - Contracts MC/PG 111-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to enter into contracts with the District of Columbia or the District of Columbia Water and Sewer Authority for the construction, maintenance, and operation of a water supply, sewer, or drainage system for certain property located within a certain distance of a certain mass transit rail station and a regional transit district or neighborhood center in Prince George's County; and requiring that a contract entered into under the Act include and address certain items.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to enter into contracts with the District of Columbia and other agencies to provide water, sewer, or drainage services for properties near transit stations in Prince George's County, including setup, maintenance, and operation.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
stakeholders: Property owners and residents near transit stations in Prince George's County, and the District of Columbia Water and Sewer Authority
innovative_summary: The bill facilitates cross-jurisdictional contracts for water and sewer services, improving infrastructure collaboration for transit-oriented development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly supports community development, which can contribute to reducing child poverty by improving infrastructure near transit and neighborhoods.

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit of the Office of the Attorney General to investigate and prosecute cases against persons that violate State criminal environmental and natural resources laws; and requiring the Attorney General, by November 30 each year, to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on all the activities of the Unit and any actions taken by the Department of the Environment or the Department of Natural Resources in response to the findings and recommendations of the Unit.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit within the Office of the Attorney General in Maryland. The unit is responsible for investigating and prosecuting criminal violations of environmental and natural resources laws, providing assistance to other governmental agencies, and collaborating across state and federal boundaries. It also includes provisions for reporting activities and issuing subpoenas for ongoing investigations.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Environmental agencies, law enforcement, natural resources, and the general public affected by environmental crimes
innovative_summary: The program employs a specialized unit within the Attorney General's office focused on criminal environmental law enforcement, using full state government powers including grand jury operations, and fostering inter-agency and interstate collaboration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty but could contribute indirectly through environmental protection and enforcement.

Title: Baltimore City - Insurance - Certificates of Guarantee for County Bond Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing Baltimore City to honor certificates of guarantee that are issued by certain associations or on behalf of certain contractors in order to satisfy certain county bond requirements; and providing that Baltimore City is not required under certain provisions of law to honor certain certificates of guarantee.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Baltimore City and certain counties to honor certificates of guarantee issued by specific associations or contractors to meet county bond requirements, but they are not required to do so.
responsible_party: Baltimore City and specified Maryland counties
stakeholders: Contractors and associations involved in public improvement projects in Baltimore City and certain Maryland counties
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal clarification and authorization approach rather than introducing new technologies or services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting infrastructure project procedures.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Related Event Promoter's Permit
Synopsis: Clarifying that the defined term "related event" as it applies to a related event promoter's permit in Baltimore City includes events for which tickets are sold in advance or at the door or cover charges are imposed; reducing the number of days within which a person must apply for a permit, the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City must take certain actions relating to the permit, and alterations may be made to the permit; and altering the standards for determining the permit fee.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies regulations related to 'related event' permits in Baltimore City, including the process for application, fees, standards, and violations. It primarily updates requirements for events associated with the CIAA Basketball Tournament and similar social events involving alcohol and ticket sales.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Event organizers, alcohol license holders, Baltimore City residents and visitors, event attendees
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and clarifies existing regulations and procedures for related event permits, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on event permitting regulations.

Title: Baltimore City - 40th District - Alcoholic Beverages
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area of the 40th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City to the holder of a Class C beer and light wine license under certain circumstances; prohibiting certain license holders in certain areas of the 40th alcoholic beverages district from selling alcoholic beverages at certain times of day; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue specific new alcohol licenses in the 40th district, modifies rules about license issuance near places of worship and schools, and sets local rules for sale hours.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, local businesses, community members in Baltimore City, especially in the 40th district
innovative_summary: The bill introduces localized licensing rules and conditional licenses in Baltimore City, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct potential for impacting child poverty appears minimal, as it mainly deals with licensing regulations.

Title: St. Mary’s County – Metropolitan Commission – New Facilities
Synopsis: Requiring the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to obtain the approval from the Commissioners of St. Mary's County before submitting a loan application where the Commission seeks to incur debt upon the full faith and credit of the county; requiring the Commission to cause studies, plans, and estimates to be made for new facilities in certain portions of the county; requiring any excess revenue made by the Commission in the sale or transfer of certain debt to be exempt from taxation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new procedural requirements and oversight for water and sewerage projects in St. Mary's County, including studies, notifications, and hearings for new facilities, and clarifies funding and taxation rules related to these projects.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission and the St. Mary's County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and landowners in St. Mary's County who are affected by water and sewerage infrastructure projects.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates procedures for infrastructure projects with increased public notice, hearings, and oversight, but does not employ new technologies or radically new approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to local water and sewer infrastructure processes.

Title: Homeowners' Property Tax Credit - Qualified Homeowner - Application and Certification Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the application requirements for the homeowners' tax credit to allow homeowners with certain types of income to file an application every 3 years, subject to a certain certification requirement; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the application and certification process for the Maryland homeowners' property tax credit, allowing homeowners with certain income sources to file less frequently and providing specific certification options for those with limited income sources.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners with limited income sources, particularly those relying on Social Security, pensions, or annuities
innovative_summary: The program introduces a simplification in the application process for eligible homeowners by allowing triennial applications and certifications, reducing paperwork and administrative burden.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily benefiting low-income homeowners, which may indirectly support household stability but does not specifically target children.

Title: Labor and Employment - Workers' Compensation - Hernia
Synopsis: Establishing that a hernia caused as a result of repetitive trauma may be considered an occupational disease and be compensable subject to certain provisions of the workers' compensation law.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's workers' compensation laws concerning hernia claims, establishing that hernias resulting from repetitive trauma can be considered occupational diseases and clarifies the reporting and filing requirements for hernia claims.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Employers, employees, workers' compensation claims processors, and injured workers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new provision recognizing hernias from repetitive trauma as occupational diseases, which is a notable change in workers' compensation classification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly benefit injured workers including those who are parents.

Title: Garrett County Alcoholic Beverages Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering a certain condition under which the Board of License Commissioners of Garrett County may issue a certain alcoholic beverages license to a hotel or motel; authorizing a gift basket permit holder to purchase certain alcoholic beverages from a wholesaler; authorizing a holder of a Class C multiple day beer license, beer and wine license, or beer, wine, and liquor license to hold another license that is issued by the Board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates alcohol licensing regulations in Garrett County, Maryland. It modifies licensing conditions for hotels and motels, authorizes various license holders to purchase alcohol from wholesalers, allows licensees to hold multiple types of licenses, and adjusts sale hours on Sundays. It also establishes license expiration rules, including new provisions for license expiration and extensions after business closure or hardship.
responsible_party: Garrett County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, hotels, motels, and the general public consuming alcohol in Garrett County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific local licensing conditions and detailed rules for license expiration and renewals, but it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches to government.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily concerns licensing rules and hours for alcohol sales; direct impact on child poverty is minimal or indirect.

Title: Electricity - Community Solar Energy Generating Systems Program and Property Taxes
Synopsis: Making permanent the Community Solar Energy Generating Systems Pilot Program; requiring a community solar energy generating system to serve at least 40% of its kilowatt-hour output to low-income and moderate-income subscribers under certain circumstances; authorizing a subscription coordinator to act on behalf of a subscriber organization; altering requirements related to the siting and size of certain community solar energy generating systems projects; authorizing the use of consolidated billing for certain charges; etc.
bill_summary: This bill makes permanent the Community Solar Energy Generating Systems Pilot Program in Maryland, expands access to low- and moderate-income subscribers, establishes regulations for program operation including consolidated billing, and authorizes property tax exemptions for qualifying community solar projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Low-income, moderate-income, renters, solar developers, electric utility companies, environmental groups
innovative_summary: The program employs new approaches such as consolidated billing, income verification methods, and targeted subsidies for low- and moderate-income subscribers, with a focus on environmental and climate resilience considerations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to directly reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable solar energy for low-income households.

Title: State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2026, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Commission; and requiring an independent evaluation of the Commission to be conducted in consultation with the Office of Program Evaluation and Government Accountability in the Department of Legislative Services.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors to July 1, 2026. It requires an independent evaluation of the Commission to assess adherence to diversity, equity, and inclusion standards and mandates a report on the evaluation by January 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, with the Office of Program Evaluation and Government Accountability in the Department of Legislative Services conducting the evaluation
stakeholders: Real estate appraisers, appraisal management companies, home inspectors, and related industry professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs an independent evaluation process to assess diversity, equity, and inclusion adherence, which is a standard governmental review approach; it does not incorporate new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly involves regulatory oversight and evaluation of a professional licensing board.

Title: Energy Storage - Targets and Maryland Energy Storage Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to establish certain targets for the deployment of new energy storage devices in the State; requiring the Commission to establish and implement the Maryland Energy Storage Program to meet certain energy storage goals and develop a certain energy storage system in the State; and requiring the Commission to submit a certain report to the General Assembly by December 31, 2023, regarding the implementation of the Maryland Energy Storage Program and any needed statutory changes.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Public Service Commission to establish targets for deploying energy storage systems in the state, create a Maryland Energy Storage Program to meet these goals, and develop energy storage infrastructure by 2033, with specific capacity milestones and mechanisms to promote cost-effective storage deployment.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric utilities, energy storage providers, Maryland residents, and the broader energy market in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a market-based approach with competitive procurement, storage credits, and incentives, and integrates energy storage into the utility and energy markets, representing a comprehensive and modern approach to energy infrastructure development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for direct impact on child poverty through advancement of clean energy and potential economic development.

Title: Financial Institutions - Student Financing Companies - Required Registration and Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring student financing companies to register with the Commissioner of Financial Regulation before providing services in the State; requiring a student financing company to renew its registration on an annual basis; authorizing the Commissioner to adopt registration procedures for student financing companies, which may include certain fees; and requiring student financing companies to annually report certain information, to be made publicly accessible on a certain website, to the Commissioner beginning March 15, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires student financing companies to register with the Maryland Commissioner of Financial Regulation, report detailed information about their operations annually, and provides enforcement powers for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Students in Maryland who use or are affected by student financing products, student financing companies, and regulators
innovative_summary: The bill employs detailed reporting and public disclosure requirements for student financing companies, aiming for transparency and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for improved oversight could indirectly benefit student borrowers and reduce financial hardships, but direct impact is limited.

Title: Public Service Commission – Judicial Review – Proceedings
Synopsis: Clarifying that a certain proceeding for judicial review of a final decision or order by the Public Service Commission may be instituted in a circuit court for a county in which the public service company that is a party to the proceeding provides service or in the Circuit Court for Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that judicial review of final decisions or orders by the Public Service Commission can be initiated in the circuit court of the county where the public service company operates or in Baltimore City, and details the procedures and eligible parties for such reviews.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Public service companies, consumers, legal entities seeking review of PSC decisions
innovative_summary: This bill primarily clarifies jurisdictional procedures for judicial review, with no new technological innovations introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Violation Procedures and Fines
Synopsis: Establishing procedures for the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City, in the case of an alleged complaint against a licensed establishment or license holder, to make an offer of a monetary penalty as a compromise in lieu of a hearing before the Board under certain circumstances; and altering the maximum penalty for certain alcoholic beverages violations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new procedures and fines for alcohol license violations in Baltimore City, including offering a monetary penalty as a compromise in some cases, and modifies penalty limits for violations.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol establishments and license holders in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a compromise process allowing licensees to settle violations with monetary penalties without a hearing, representing a new approach to enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 46th Alcoholic Beverages District - Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to approve a license expansion to a noncontiguous property with a second separate use permit issued by the City if a certain condition is met; authorizing the establishment and conversion of various alcoholic beverages licenses in the 46th alcoholic beverages district; extending for 1 year the expiration of an alcoholic beverage licenses issued for  certain areas for certain transferal and renewal purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends alcohol licensing laws in Baltimore City, including license expansion approvals, establishment and conversion of various licenses in the 46th district, and temporary extensions of license expiration dates for specific premises, along with municipal policing contracts.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners and Baltimore City Government
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, Baltimore City residents and businesses, local communities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces temporary license extensions and specific licensing provisions, including targeted law enforcement patrols, but mainly focuses on regulatory adjustments rather than new technology or innovative government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may influence community safety and local economy indirectly.

Title: Consumer Protection - Motor Vehicle Glass Repair or Replacement - Advanced Driver Assistance System Recalibration
Synopsis: Establishing consumer protections related to the repair or replacement of motor vehicle glass on motor vehicles equipped with an advanced driver assistance system; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice.
bill_summary: The bill establishes consumer protections for the repair or replacement of motor vehicle glass on vehicles with advanced driver assistance systems, including requirements for informing customers about recalibration and providing written assurances that work will meet manufacturer specifications.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant motor vehicle safety authorities
stakeholders: Consumers with vehicles equipped with advanced driver assistance systems, motor vehicle glass repair shops
innovative_summary: The program introduces specific requirements for recalibration of advanced driver assistance systems during glass repair, including mandatory customer notification and adherence to manufacturer specifications, employing a targeted quality assurance approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on consumer protection regulations for vehicle repairs.

Title: Economic Development - Program Participation - Cannabis Business Establishments
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Department of Commerce from denying certain cannabis business entities conducting business in the State certain economic development program benefits under certain circumstances; clarifying the eligibility of certain cannabis business entities conducting business in the State under the Job Creation and One Maryland programs; authorizing certain cannabis business entities to reapply for benefits under certain economic development programs; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the Maryland Department of Commerce from denying cannabis businesses, such as cultivators, processors, or dispensaries, benefits under economic development programs solely because they are cannabis establishments. It clarifies that these businesses are eligible to participate in programs like Job Creation, One Maryland, and More Jobs for Marylanders, and allows businesses that were previously denied benefits or certification before July 1, 2023, to reapply.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Cannabis business entities, economic development programs, local governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill innovatively integrates cannabis businesses into existing economic development programs, removing legal barriers and expanding opportunities for cannabis-related businesses to participate in state economic initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By enabling cannabis businesses to access economic development benefits, the program could support job creation and economic activity, indirectly helping to reduce child poverty.

Title: Higher Education - Appointment of Secretary and Student Financial Assistance - Accommodations at Public Institutions for Religious Beliefs
Synopsis: Providing that the Secretary of Higher Education is appointed by and serves at the pleasure of the Governor; requiring each institution of higher education to adopt a written policy that provides reasonable academic accommodations for students to practice sincerely held faith-based or religious beliefs; altering eligibility criteria for and the process for awards from the Delegate Howard P. Rawlings Program of Educational Excellence Awards; altering the administration of the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates laws related to higher education in Maryland, including establishing policies for religious accommodations at public universities, restructuring financial aid programs, including scholarships and grants, and clarifying administrative appointments and responsibilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students attending Maryland public institutions, including low-income and religious minority students
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach integrating federal standards and state-specific programs for student financial aid, with emphasis on targeted outreach, data verification, and coordination among institutions and state agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The programs have a significant potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to higher education through scholarships and targeted support for low-income students.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Sunday Sales
Synopsis: Altering the hours during which a licensee may sell alcoholic beverages on Sundays in Frederick County.
bill_summary: The bill amends alcohol licensing laws in Frederick County, Maryland, to change the hours during which licensed establishments can sell alcoholic beverages on Sundays, generally allowing sales starting at 6 a.m. instead of 10 a.m., with some variations depending on the license type.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Authority or equivalent
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol establishments and consumers in Frederick County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies existing alcohol sales hours and does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches to government or public service delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily pertains to alcohol sales hours.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Main Street Laurel Development PG 404-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue up to five Class B-DD (Development District) beer, wine, and liquor licenses for restaurants located within the Main Street Laurel development.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance of up to five development district liquor licenses for restaurants within Main Street Laurel, Prince George's County, and increases the number of such licenses available in several other designated areas.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Restaurants and businesses within the development districts in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted licensing approach specific to development districts to promote local economic development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Charles County - Property Tax - Credit for Volunteer Emergency Responders
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Charles County to grant, by law, a  tax credit against the property tax imposed on the owner-occupied residence of certain emergency responders and their surviving spouses if the federal adjusted gross income of the emergency responder or the unmarried surviving spouse for the immediately preceding taxable years is $150,000 or less; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Charles County to grant a property tax credit to owner-occupied residences of emergency responders and their surviving spouses, subject to income and other eligibility criteria.
responsible_party: Charles County governing body
stakeholders: Emergency responders, their spouses, and property owners in Charles County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a local property tax credit program targeted at volunteer emergency responders and their families, which is a common approach but may incorporate new eligibility criteria or specifics.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily provides property tax relief to emergency responders and their families.

Title: Maryland Native Plants Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Native Plants Program to respond to the increasing demand for, use of, and sale of native plants at retail garden centers and wholesale nurseries and to educate the public on native plants; requiring the Department of Agriculture to administer the Program in coordination with the University of Maryland Extension and to establish the "Maryland Natives" marketing program; requiring the University of Maryland Extension to hire an extension agent to serve as a native plant specialist for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Native Plants Program to promote the use and sale of native Maryland plants, including public education and certification efforts, coordinated by the Department of Agriculture and the University of Maryland Extension.
responsible_party: Department of Agriculture and University of Maryland Extension
stakeholders: Nurseries, retail garden centers, landscapers, and the general public interested in native plants in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining education, certification, marketing, and online resources to promote native plants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for direct impact, primarily through environmental and educational benefits that can indirectly aid communities.

Title: Tax Sales - Data Collection - County Funding
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Department of Assessments and Taxation from disbursing or authorizing the disbursement of certain funds to a county if the county has not provided certain information concerning its tax sales; altering the taxable year for which the Department is required to obtain certain information concerning county tax sales; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation to collect detailed data from counties about their tax sales, including information on properties, liens, and procedures, and links funding disbursement to the provision of this data.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Counties, property owners, low-income, elderly, disabled residents
innovative_summary: This bill primarily involves data collection and oversight; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Direct impact on child poverty is minimal, focusing on tax sale data collection and county funding disbursement.

Title: General Provisions - Commemorative Days - Dashain Day
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor annually to proclaim October 5 as Dashain Day, a festival originating in Nepal that celebrates and symbolizes victory of good over evil.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Governor of Maryland to annually proclaim October 5 as Dashain Day, a festival originating in Nepal that celebrates victory of good over evil.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Nepalese community and South Asian communities in Maryland, and the general public
