innovative_summary: The bill formalizes recognition of a cultural festival through a government proclamation, which is a traditional practice and not technologically innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Public Service Commission – Cybersecurity Staffing and Assessments (Critical Infrastructure Cybersecurity Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to include on its staff one or more employees that are experts in cybersecurity to perform certain duties; requiring the Commission to establish, in coordination with the Office of Security Management, cybersecurity standards and best practices for regulated entities; requiring each public service company to report a cybersecurity incident to certain entities; requiring the State Security Operations Center to immediately notify certain agencies of a certain reported cybersecurity incident; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Public Service Commission to hire cybersecurity experts, establish cybersecurity standards and a zero-trust approach for public service companies, and conduct assessments. It also mandates reporting of cybersecurity incidents and coordination with cybersecurity agencies, aiming to bolster cybersecurity defenses among utilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission (PSC) and Department of Information Technology (DoIT) for implementation and assessments
stakeholders: Public service companies in Maryland, including electric utilities, water, and gas companies, and their customers
innovative_summary: The bill employs an integrated approach involving hiring cybersecurity experts, setting cybersecurity standards, conducting assessments, and coordinating with federal agencies, including adopting a zero-trust cybersecurity model, which reflects innovative strategies in government regulation and cybersecurity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve overall community resilience and safety, indirectly benefiting vulnerable populations.

Title: Workgroup on Mold Standards and Remediation
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Mold Standards and Remediation to study information on mold assessment and remediation to determine the best practices for identifying mold, preventing the development of mold within indoor environments, and remediating indoor molding conditions harmful to public health; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by October 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup on Mold Standards and Remediation in Maryland to study and recommend best practices and standards for identifying, preventing, and remediating indoor mold, and requires the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations establishing uniform standards for mold assessment and remediation.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Indoor environment occupants, property owners, remediation professionals, public health agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach by forming a workgroup with various agencies and industry experts to develop new standards and guidelines for mold assessment and remediation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce health issues caused by mold, which can lessen financial and health burdens on affected families, thereby potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Office of the Chief Medical Examiner
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner in the Maryland Department of Health to advance forensic science and carry out other duties as provided by law; renaming the State Postmortem Examiners Commission to be the Postmortem Examiners Advisory Committee; requiring and authorizing the Department and the Office to perform certain duties and powers previously performed by the Commission; authorizing the Department to contract with a physician for employment with the Office on a per diem basis; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner in the Maryland Department of Health, outlines its duties, and redefines related committees, staffing, autopsy procedures, and employment rules for medical examiners.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health - Office of the Chief Medical Examiner
stakeholders: Deceased individuals, families of the deceased, medical examiners, law enforcement, hospitals, public health agencies, and community members involved in death investigations.
innovative_summary: The program modernizes and formalizes the forensic death investigation process, including oversight, staffing, and autopsy procedures, but does not employ emerging new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on death investigation protocols and office structure.

Title: State Employees – Programs and Scholarships for Human Services Careers and Probation Agents and State Contributions to Supplemental Retirement Plans
Synopsis: Establishing the Pilot Program for Human Services Careers; altering the eligibility criteria for the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Police Officers and the Maryland Police Officers Scholarship Program to include probation agents who work for the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services; establishing the Pilot Program for Human Services Careers Scholarship; requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to make awards from the Human Services Careers Scholarship Pilot Program in fiscal year 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes several new programs and scholarships to encourage careers in human services, probation, law enforcement, and related fields in Maryland. It also modifies existing loan repayment and scholarship programs for police officers and probation agents, and sets up state contributions to retirement plans for certain employees.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students, current and prospective employees in human services, probation, and law enforcement in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach including scholarships, mentorships, and collaboration with local schools, along with targeted program structures for career development and retention, showcasing a holistic, innovative approach to workforce development in public service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The programs aim to increase employment and professional development in sectors that directly impact child and family welfare, potentially lowering child poverty levels.

Title: Hunting, Wildlife Conservation, and Outdoor Recreation - Funding, Promotion, Management, Licenses, Permits, and Stamps
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the Heritage Conservation Fund to include acquiring interests in land that can be used by the general public for hunting; establishing the Wildlife Conservation, Education, and Outreach Program to provide outreach and foster an interest in outdoor recreation and stewardship, hunting, and wildlife conservation; establishing a stamp for hunting sika deer; authorizing a nonresident attending a college or university in the State to purchase a resident hunting license; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises regulations and funding related to hunting, wildlife conservation, and outdoor recreation. It establishes a new program to promote outreach and interest in outdoor activities, modifies license and permit fees, creates a new stamp for hunting sika deer, and sets plans for managing deer overpopulation and funding for land acquisition that can be used for public hunting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources in coordination with the Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Hunters, outdoor recreation enthusiasts, conservation organizations, farmers, and the general public interested in outdoor activities and wildlife conservation
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches such as a dedicated outreach program to engage diverse communities and veterans, and introduces specific funding and land acquisition strategies for wildlife management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential to impact child poverty through increased outdoor recreation and educational programs, supporting community engagement and youth activities.

Title: Public Employee Relations Act
Synopsis: Consolidating and altering certain laws governing collective bargaining for certain public employees, including laws related to the establishment of bargaining units, election and certification of exclusive representatives, employee and employer rights, unfair labor practices, and strikes and lockouts; establishing the Public Employee Relations Board to oversee collective bargaining activities for certain public employees; etc.
bill_summary: This bill consolidates and modernizes Maryland's laws governing collective bargaining for public employees, establishing the Public Employee Relations Board to oversee these activities, and repealing previous labor boards. It sets new rules for elections, certification, negotiations, and rights of employees and employers.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Employee Relations Board
stakeholders: Public employees, public employers, and their employee organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive, modern legal framework for public sector labor relations, including electronic voting, confidential information handling, and a unified oversight body, employing updated technologies and procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty by improving public employee working conditions and stability, which can lead to better public service delivery and economic stability for families.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages – Use of Alcoholic Beverages for Educational Purposes
Synopsis: Authorizing certain students who are at least 18 years old and under the age of 21 years to taste certain alcoholic beverages while participating in a course or program in enology, fermenting, brewing, or hospitality and tourism offered by a qualified institution of higher education without criminal penalty to the student, instructor, or institution of higher education under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain students under the legal drinking age at Maryland higher education institutions to taste alcoholic beverages for educational purposes during approved courses, under specific conditions, without facing criminal penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or relevant higher education institutions (not explicitly specified)
stakeholders: Students enrolled in higher education programs in enology, fermenting, brewing, or hospitality and tourism, and educational institutions of higher education in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new educational approach by legally permitting underage students to taste alcohol as part of their coursework, which is a novel integration of educational activities and alcohol laws.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential for a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily pertains to educational activities involving alcohol tasting.

Title: Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program - Modifications
Synopsis: Modifying the Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program by clarifying and altering certain provisions relating to the administration of the Program; establishing the employer and employee shares of the total rate of contribution; prohibiting the total rate of contribution from exceeding 1.2% of an employee's wages; requiring the State to pay for certain contributions for certain covered employees; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to reimburse certain community providers for certain employer contributions in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program, clarifies provisions related to benefits, contributions, and appeals, sets contribution rates, and details program administration and employer responsibilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Employees taking leave, employers, self-employed individuals, community providers, and Medicaid providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a combination of state funding, technology-enabled claims processing, and partnerships with community providers to administer paid family and medical leave benefits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by providing paid leave for parental bonding, foster or adoption care, and family health needs.

Title: Frederick County – Alcoholic Beverages – Miniature Golf Course License
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue a Class B-MGC (miniature golf course) beer, wine, and liquor license to a miniature golf course under certain circumstances; authorizing a license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under certain circumstances; requiring a license holder to submit an annual gross sales report for alcohol, golf games and food to the Board before a license may be renewed; and providing an annual license fee of $1,500.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Frederick County to issue a new type of alcoholic beverage license for miniature golf courses that meet specific criteria, allowing them to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Miniature golf courses, alcohol consumers at these venues, and the local community in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized license for miniature golf courses to sell alcohol, combining recreational and alcohol services in a new way for licensed venues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program does not directly target child poverty but could indirectly impact the local economy and community well-being.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Basket of Cheer
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement in Frederick County that alcoholic beverages in a basket of cheer be produced in Maryland.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the requirement that alcoholic beverages in a basket of cheer in Frederick County be produced in Maryland, and allows certain license holders to provide and raffle baskets of cheer containing specified quantities of beer, wine, and liquor at benefit performances.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Event organizers, license holders, and participants at benefit events in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill modernizes alcohol gifting and raffle practices during benefit events by removing the Maryland production requirement and clarifying the types and quantities of alcohol permitted.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has low potential to directly impact child poverty as it mainly modifies licensing rules for benefit event alcohol gifts.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Consumption Permits
Synopsis: Altering the quantity of certain alcoholic beverages an individual may consume under certain consumption permits issued in Frederick County.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance of new permits in Frederick County that allow on-premises consumption of beer, wine, and liquor, with specific limits on quantities and conditions for use, starting July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Certified alcohol license holders and consumers in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific permits for on-premises alcohol consumption with regulated quantities and restrictions, including new allowance for certain beverage samples.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's direct impact on child poverty is limited, focusing on licensing and consumption regulations.

Title: Corporations - Filing Requirements for Dissolution and Termination of Registration or Qualification - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing certain provisions of law applicable to the State Department of Assessments and Taxation that prohibit the acceptance of articles of dissolution and issuance of a certificate of termination for certain corporations unless certain reports on personal property are filed with the Department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain requirements that prevented the State Department of Assessments and Taxation from accepting articles of dissolution or issuing certificates of termination for corporations unless specific reports on personal property had been filed. It streamlines the process for dissolving corporations and terminating registration or qualification.
responsible_party: State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Corporations registered or qualified to do business in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies and streamlines existing procedures without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes administrative procedures for corporations.

Title: Commercial Vehicles - Police-Initiated Towing - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions related to the rates the Department of State Police sets for tow companies involved in certain police-initiated towing; establishing the Committee on Rate Setting and Complaint Resolution for Police-Initiated Medium-Duty and Heavy-Duty Towing and Recovery; and requiring the Committee, on or before December 1, 2023, to recommend approved rates to the Department of State Police that should be charged for police-initiated towing and recovery services.
bill_summary: The bill modifies regulations around police-initiated towing of commercial vehicles in Maryland, establishes a committee to set rates and resolve complaints, and sets procedures for payment and vehicle access.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police
stakeholders: Commercial vehicle owners, towing companies, law enforcement agencies, and vehicle operators involved in police-initiated towing
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured committee to set towing rates and streamline complaint resolution, and updates procedures for towing and payment dispute handling, employing a formal rate-setting approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring fair towing practices and reducing financial disputes for vehicle owners.

Title: Wicomico County - Sanitary District - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Wicomico County to create a sanitary district.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the governing body of Wicomico County to create a sanitary district and establish a sanitary commission to govern it.
responsible_party: Wicomico County governing body
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Wicomico County needing sanitation services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the creation of a new sanitary district and commission, a specialized local governance structure for sanitation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on sanitation district creation.

Title: Howard County – Archery Hunting – Safety Zone and Position of Archery Hunter Ho. Co. 15–23
Synopsis: Reducing from 150 yards to 50 yards the size of the safety zone for archery hunters in Howard County who are under the authority of a deer management permit or who are actively participating in a hunting program administered by the county within which archery hunting may not take place except under certain circumstances; and requiring certain archery hunters in Howard County to be in an elevated position when hunting any wild bird or mammal within 50 to 150 yards of certain buildings.
bill_summary: The bill modifies regulations concerning archery hunting in Howard County, setting specific safety zones, and requiring hunters to be in an elevated position when hunting near buildings, especially under a Deer Management Permit or county-administered programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: archery hunters, residents near hunting areas, landowners in Howard County
innovative_summary: This bill employs targeted regulations for safety in hunting zones and requires elevated positioning for hunters, focusing on safety and management rather than introducing new technologies or entirely new programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, mainly focusing on hunting safety regulations.

Title: Public Safety – Refrigerants – Limitations on Use
Synopsis: Providing that, notwithstanding any other provision of law, except for regulations issued by the Department of the Environment, no provision of the State building code or other law or regulation may prohibit or otherwise limit the use of a refrigerant if the refrigerant is designated as acceptable for use under federal listing requirements and any appliance containing the refrigerant meets federal safety standards and use conditions.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland state building code and regulations from restricting the use of certain federally approved refrigerants in appliances, unless specifically regulated by the Department of the Environment.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Consumers, appliance manufacturers, environmental agencies
innovative_summary: The bill facilitates the use of environmentally approved refrigerants by removing state-level restrictions, aligning regulations with federal standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Land Use - Development of Neglected Property PG 406-23
Synopsis: Authorizing Prince George's County to exercise powers of eminent domain to acquire and develop or redevelop, for a public purpose, certain neglected property located in the county that has been designated as a transit-oriented development and is located within a business improvement district; and prohibiting land or property taken by the county through the use of eminent domain under the provisions of the Act to be taken without just compensation, as agreed on between the parties, or awarded by a jury.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to use eminent domain to acquire and develop neglected property within transit-oriented development areas located in a business improvement district, for public or economic development purposes.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government
stakeholders: Property owners, residents, businesses, and potential developers in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The program employs the use of eminent domain specifically targeting neglected properties within transit-oriented development zones to facilitate urban redevelopment and economic growth.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by promoting urban development and economic growth in transit-rich areas, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Juvenile Services Education Program - Transfer of Locally Employed Educational Professionals
Synopsis: Requiring educational professionals employed by a county board of education, the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners, or a county public library system who transfer to the Juvenile Services Education Program to be given credit as State employees for certain years of service for the purpose of establishing leave accrual rates; authorizing an individual who transfers to the Program to transfer leave balances in excess of a certain limit under certain circumstances; and applying the Act retroactively.
bill_summary: This bill requires that educational professionals transferring from local school employment to the Juvenile Services Education Program be placed in comparable positions at the same salary rate, retain their accumulated leave, and have their years of service recognized for leave purposes. It also details that individuals transferring directly from local schools can retain their leave balances without a lapse, provided the transfer occurs within 90 days.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Locally employed educational professionals, juvenile justice system, local school systems
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured transfer process ensuring fairness and recognition of service for educational professionals moving to juvenile justice education programs, including retention of leave and comparable position placement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by supporting educational continuity for youth in juvenile programs through qualified and experienced staff.

Title: Transportation – Assaults on Public Transit Operators – Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to submit a report by December 1, 2023, and each year thereafter on assaults on public transit operators to each local executive authority, the State's Attorney for each county, and certain committees of the General Assembly; and requiring the report to include information on the nature of each assault, the mode of transit involved, the location of the assault, whether the police were involved, and the outcome of any investigation.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to submit an annual report on assaults on public transit operators, including details of each assault, comparisons with other states, and industry best practices. The first report is due December 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Public transit operators and transit riders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces standard reporting and comparison on transit assault data, along with evaluations of prevention technologies and practices, and considers establishing a statewide transit safety officer.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on safety reporting and policy review for transit workers.

Title: Public Information Act - Decisions of the State Public Information Act Compliance Board - Appeals
Synopsis: Authorizing an applicant to appeal a certain decision issued by the State Public Information Compliance Board; authorizing a party aggrieved by a final judgment of a circuit court in a proceeding for judicial review of a certain decision of the Board to appeal to the Appellate Court of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Public Information Act to allow an applicant to appeal decisions of the State Public Information Act Compliance Board and to provide a pathway for judicial review of those decisions by the Maryland courts.
responsible_party: Maryland courts, specifically the circuit courts and the Maryland Public Information Act Compliance Board
stakeholders: Public record requesters, governmental units, and officials involved in public information access processes in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill enhances legal procedures for public information disputes by formalizing appeals and judicial review, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions do not directly impact child poverty, as they mainly modify legal processes related to public information disclosures.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Performing Arts Theater License
Synopsis: Establishing in Harford County a performing arts theater beer and wine license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer and wine in certain performing arts theaters at retail for on-premises consumption; and establishing an annual license fee of $500.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a new performing arts theater beer and wine license in Harford County that allows nonprofit-run theaters to sell beer and wine during performances, intermissions, and receptions, with specific sale times and conditions.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Performing arts theaters, patrons of theaters, nonprofit organizations, local alcohol vendors, and the general public attending performances in Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized alcohol license tailored for performing arts theaters, allowing on-site alcohol sales during performances with specific conditions, which is a targeted approach to support arts venues and align alcohol regulations with entertainment events.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but could indirectly benefit community and cultural development.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Alteration of License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota used to determine the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverages licenses that the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may issue from one for every 3,000 individuals to one for every 4,000 individuals.
bill_summary: This bill alters the license quota in Harford County for certain alcoholic beverage licenses, increasing the population basis from 3,000 to 4,000 individuals per license issuance limit.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and businesses involved in alcohol sales in Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill updates licensing policies based on population thresholds, which is a standard regulatory adjustment without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it pertains solely to licensing regulations.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class HC (Health Club) License
Synopsis: Establishing a 6-day and a 7-day Class HC (health club) beer and wine license in Harford County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue the license to a person who sells health club services; exempting the holder of the license from certain distance requirements related to places of worship and schools; establishing an annual fee of $1,300 for a 6-day license and $1,400 for a 7-day license; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new alcohol licenses for health clubs in Harford County that allow the sale of beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Health clubs with swimming pools or pickleball courts in Harford County and their patrons
innovative_summary: The program creates a specialized alcohol license for health clubs that serve members, integrating alcohol sales with health club services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal since it primarily deals with licensing for health clubs.

Title: Hate Crimes - Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention to develop strategies to prevent and respond to hate crime activity and evaluate State laws and policies relating to hate crimes; and requiring the Commission to report to the General Assembly on or before December 1 each year, beginning in 2024, on legislative recommendations to address hate crimes in the State.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention within the Maryland Office of the Attorney General, comprising various community representatives and stakeholders. The commission's responsibilities include developing strategies to prevent and respond to hate crimes, evaluating laws and policies, and reporting annually on school policies and legislative recommendations.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Communities impacted by hate crimes, including minority groups, law enforcement, educational institutions, and advocacy organizations.
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated commission with diverse stakeholder representation to systematically address hate crimes through strategy development, law evaluation, and legislative recommendations, integrating community voices and policy review.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit affected communities.

Title: Criminal Law and Procedure - Cannabis - Fines for Smoking in Public, Stops, and Searches
Synopsis: Altering the maximum fines for smoking cannabis in a public place; prohibiting a law enforcement officer from initiating a stop or a search of a person, a motor vehicle, or a vessel based solely on certain factors; prohibiting, under certain circumstances, a law enforcement officer from conducting a search of a certain area of a motor vehicle or vessel; providing that evidence obtained in violation of certain provisions of the Act is not admissible in certain proceedings; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reduces fines for smoking cannabis in public, states that evidence obtained solely from the smell or small possession of cannabis cannot justify stops or searches, and prohibits law enforcement from initiating stops or searches based solely on certain cannabis-related factors.
responsible_party: Maryland State Law Enforcement agencies and Judiciary
stakeholders: Individuals accused of cannabis possession or use, law enforcement, judiciary system, general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces stricter rules on what can justify police stops and searches related to cannabis, and limits the use of smell and possession of small amounts as grounds for suspicion.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily impacts law enforcement procedures and fines; its direct impact on child poverty is likely low.

Title: Income Tax - Automated External Defibrillator Tax Credit
Synopsis: Allowing an individual or a business entity to claim a credit against the State income tax for the first $500 of the purchase price of an automated external defibrillator purchased for use at a restaurant location in the State with annual gross income of at least $400,000; prohibiting the credit from being claimed more than once by any individual or business entity for each restaurant location; and providing certain other limitations.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals or business entities that own restaurants in Maryland to claim a tax credit of up to $1,500 (or the amount of their Maryland income tax, whichever is less) for purchasing an automated external defibrillator (AED) for use at their restaurant. The credit applies once per restaurant location, with specific eligibility criteria and a limit of a $500 credit per purchase.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Restaurant owners and businesses in Maryland, especially those with locations earning at least $400,000 annually.
innovative_summary: This bill introduces a tax credit program as an incentive to promote the adoption of AEDs at restaurants, employing tax policy as a tool to encourage health and safety investments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly promotes health safety measures at restaurants.

Title: Prince George's County - Board of Education and School System Revisions PG 502-23
Synopsis: Altering the duties and responsibilities of the Prince George's County Board of Education and certain officers of the county board; altering the voting authority of the student board member; requiring the county board to retain counsel and pay certain counsel fees and expenses incurred for defending a member in litigation involving a member's service in the member's official capacity on the county board under certain circumstances; altering certain procedures for the election of the student member of the county board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various revisions to the governance, election procedures, and oversight of the Prince George’s County Board of Education, including establishing an Office of Accountability and Compliance, creating a system for public campaign financing for county officials (excluding student members), and updating the roles and responsibilities of board members and the county superintendent.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County Board of Education and County Government
stakeholders: Students, parents, teachers, county residents, and public school system personnel in Prince George’s County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an independent Office of Accountability and Compliance and sets up a new oversight and evaluation framework, including a dedicated Inspector General, which is a relatively innovative approach for school system governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve school governance and oversight, which can indirectly benefit children in poverty, but does not directly target child poverty reduction.

Title: Natural Resources - Oyster Inspection and Severance Taxes - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of the inspection tax levied on marketable oysters shipped in the shell to any place outside the State from 30 cents to $1 per bushel; increasing the amount of the severance tax levied on oysters caught within certain natural oyster bars from $1 to $2 per bushel; repealing a certain requirement that a certain tax increase be used for the oyster seed program; and requiring that $1 of each $2 of the severance tax levied be used by certain county oyster committees for the repletion of natural oyster bars.
bill_summary: The bill increases the inspection tax on oysters shipped out of Maryland from 30 cents to $1 per bushel and doubles the severance tax on oysters caught in natural oyster bars from $1 to $2 per bushel. It also changes the allocation of the severance tax funds, removing the requirement that previous tax increases be used specifically for the oyster seed program and directing funds to oyster committees in various counties for oyster bed repletion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Oyster fishers, oyster industry workers, natural oyster habitats, Chesapeake Bay communities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves tax rate increases and redistribution of existing taxes; it does not introduce new technologies or novel government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on oyster industry taxation and habitat repletion; it does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Wicomico County - Sunday Hunting and Archery Hunting Safety Zones
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to allow a person to hunt game birds and mammals on each Sunday of the game bird and game mammal seasons from 30 minutes before sunrise until 10:30 a.m. in Wicomico County; authorizing the Department to allow Sunday hunting in Wicomico County on public land, subject to certain time restrictions; and adding Wicomico County to the list of counties in which the safety zone for archery hunters extends 50 yards from certain structures occupied by human beings.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Sunday hunting in Wicomico County and adjusts safety zones for hunting near structures, including allowing hunting on certain Sundays for game birds, mammals, and deer, with specific restrictions and time limitations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunters, residents, and landowners in Wicomico County
innovative_summary: The program introduces limited Sunday hunting opportunities and modifies safety zones, employing existing technologies but applying new regulations within the county.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County - Property Tax Exemption - Real Property Owned by Fire Company or Rescue Squad
Synopsis: Altering a certain exemption from property tax for real property that is located in Baltimore County that is owned by an incorporated, nonprofit fire company or rescue squad by providing that the exemption applies only if the property is used or will be used exclusively for the purposes of the fire company or rescue squad; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: This bill modifies property tax exemptions for real property owned by nonprofit fire companies and rescue squads in Baltimore County, clarifying the conditions under which the exemption applies, particularly focusing on property use and future use.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Tax Office or relevant local tax authority
stakeholders: Nonprofit fire companies, rescue squads, and property owners in Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and restricts existing tax exemption rules rather than creating new innovative programs or services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Economic Development - Business Improvement Districts PG 407-23
Synopsis: Authorizing Prince George's County to create certain business improvement districts intended to promote the general welfare of the residents, employers, employees, property owners, tenants, consumers, and general public with the geographic area of the districts; requiring the county to adopt certain local laws to provide for the creation and organization of a district; removing Prince George's County from the scope of law governing the establishment of business improvement districts; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to create and establish Business Improvement Districts, including the organization, governance, funding, and expansion of these districts, along with procedures for oversight and renewal.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Government
stakeholders: Property owners, business owners, residents, and commercial tenants within the district
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, transparent process for establishing and expanding business improvement districts with governance, taxation, and oversight mechanisms, but employs existing government and legal frameworks.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to indirectly impact child poverty through improved community environment and services, but not explicitly designed for this purpose.

Title: Baltimore County - Insurance - Certificates of Guarantee for County Bond Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing Baltimore County to honor certificates of guarantee that are issued by certain associations or on behalf of certain contractors in order to satisfy certain county bond requirements; and providing that Baltimore County is not required under certain provisions of law to honor certain certificates of guarantee.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes multiple Maryland counties to honor certificates of guarantee issued by certain associations or on behalf of contractors to meet bond requirements for public improvements, but states that counties are not required to do so.
responsible_party: Baltimore County and other listed Maryland counties
stakeholders: Contractors and associations issuing guarantees for public improvement projects in Maryland counties
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies the counties' ability to honor certificates of guarantee but does not introduce new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily addresses county bond procedures and guarantees.

Title: Libraries – Regional Resource Centers – Governance Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for governance of libraries designated as regional resource centers; and establishing a governing board for each regional resource center.
bill_summary: The bill revises governance requirements for regional resource centers in Maryland, establishing a governing board and clarifying roles, responsibilities, and funding oversight for these centers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Library Board and governing boards of regional resource centers
stakeholders: Public library users, library staff, participating library systems, and regional communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a formal governance structure for regional resource centers, promoting coordinated cooperation among libraries, but does not employ new technologies or groundbreaking approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has some potential to impact child poverty indirectly by improving library services and access through better regional cooperation.

Title: Transit - Grant Funding for Local Service - Alterations
Synopsis: Establishing the Locally Operated Transit System Grant Program in the Department of Transportation; and authorizing program funds to be sourced from federal and State public transportation programs.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Locally Operated Transit System Grant Program to provide funding for transit systems operated locally within Maryland. It sets guidelines for funding levels, sources, and adjustments for inflation, and includes provisions for performance monitoring and audits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Locally operated transit systems, commuters, residents in Maryland counties of Montgomery and Prince George’s
innovative_summary: The program employs inflation-adjusted funding levels and performance indicators, and includes independent audits to improve transit efficiency and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve transit accessibility and reliability, which can help reduce barriers for low-income families and potentially impact child poverty positively.

Title: Harford County - Advisory Plumbing Board
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Harford County to enact a local law providing for the membership and terms of the Harford County Advisory Plumbing Board.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Harford County to create a local law to establish and define the membership and terms of the Harford County Advisory Plumbing Board, which will assist in the drafting, adoption, and enforcement of plumbing codes.
responsible_party: Harford County governing body
stakeholders: Plumbers, building officials, and residents of Harford County who are affected by plumbing standards and enforcement
innovative_summary: This bill allows local government to establish a specialized advisory board for plumbing regulation, utilizing local governance to tailor plumbing policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Health Care Commission - Dental Services - Survey and Regional Needs Assessment
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with the Maryland Hospital Association, to conduct a survey of hospitals to identify the availability of hospital operating resources for dentist use; requiring the Department and the Maryland Health Care Commission, in consultation with the Maryland Hospital Association, to develop regional plans to ensure the availability of appropriate operating space for the performance of dental procedures for Maryland Medical Assistance Program recipients; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to review and revise reimbursement rates for adult and pediatric dental services provided under the Medicaid program, ensuring they are sufficient for access to care. It also mandates surveys and regional needs assessments to improve hospital capacity and operating room availability for dental procedures requiring anesthesia or sedation, and requires the development of regional plans to ensure space availability.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Maryland Medical Assistance Program recipients, dental providers, hospitals, anesthesia providers, and patients needing dental procedures with anesthesia or sedation
innovative_summary: The program employs data analysis, surveys, regional assessments, and planning to improve access to dental care through reimbursement rate adjustments and capacity expansion, utilizing existing healthcare data and collaborative planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to dental care for low-income populations, which can help reduce child poverty by improving health and access to essential services.

Title: Behavioral Health Care - Treatment and Access (Behavioral Health Model for Maryland)
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to make recommendations to provide appropriate, accessible, and comprehensive behavioral health services that are available on demand to individuals in the State; establishing the Behavioral Health Care Coordination Value-Based Purchasing Pilot Program in the Maryland Department of Health; requiring the Department to apply for certain federal planning grant funds; requiring the Department to apply to participate in a certain demonstration program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to assess and improve behavioral health services across Maryland, introduces a pilot program for value-based care coordination, expands telehealth services including audio-only phone services, and creates standards for community behavioral health clinics, with plans for federal funding applications and annual reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with behavioral health conditions, including mental health and substance use disorder patients, providers, and underserved populations in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs innovative approaches such as a value-based purchasing pilot for care coordination, expansion of telehealth including audio-only services, and creation of certified community behavioral health clinics with federal matching funds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty through improved access to mental health and substance use treatment services, especially for vulnerable populations.

Title: Medicaid Waiver Programs - Waitlist and Registry Reduction (End the Wait Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain Medicaid funding to be used to provide community services to individuals waiting for services through waiver programs; authorizing certain Medicaid funding to be used for expanding provider capacity in certain waiver programs; and altering the uses of certain funding appropriated to the Dedicated Purpose Account in the fiscal year 2023 budget bill.
bill_summary: The bill aims to reduce waiting lists for various Medicaid waiver programs by 50% starting in fiscal year 2024. It allocates funds for expanding provider capacity, recruiting and retaining providers, and improving access to community services for individuals waiting for Medicaid services, including those on the autism registry.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals waiting for Medicaid waiver services, including individuals with autism and other disabilities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach using strategic funding to significantly reduce Medicaid service waitlists through capacity expansion, provider recruitment, and targeted community services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to vital health and community services for children with disabilities and their families.

Title: Commercial Law and Financial Institutions - Credit Regulation - Shared Appreciation Agreements
Synopsis: Making certain shared appreciation agreements subject to the Maryland Mortgage Lender Law and other provisions of law that regulate certain loans of single extensions of closed end credit and revolving credit plans; and authorizing the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to adopt certain regulations regarding the enforcement of and compliance with provisions of law that regulate shared appreciation agreements.
bill_summary: The bill expands the regulation of shared appreciation agreements (SAAs) by making them subject to existing Maryland law governing certain loans, including the Maryland Mortgage Lender Law. It authorizes the Maryland Financial Regulation Agency to adopt regulations for enforcement and compliance regarding SAAs, and clarifies definitions related to these agreements and applicable loan types.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Consumers, mortgage lenders, and borrowers involved in shared appreciation agreements
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulatory framework for shared appreciation agreements, integrating them into existing mortgage and loan law, and authorizes new regulations for enforcement, representing a moderate level of innovative regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly regulates specific financial agreements and loans.

Title: Health Insurance - Reimbursement for Services Rendered by a Pharmacist
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children's Health Program, and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for all services rendered to an enrollee by a licensed pharmacist within the pharmacist's lawful scope of practice to the same extent as services rendered by any other health care practitioner; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed by January 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill requires health insurance programs and government health services in Maryland to reimburse licensed pharmacists for all services they are legally allowed to perform, matching the coverage given to other healthcare providers. It also mandates coverage for contraceptive devices without prior authorization and streamlines access to contraceptives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Maryland residents, pharmacists, health insurance companies, state health programs, and enrollees
innovative_summary: The bill modernizes and expands the role of pharmacists in healthcare delivery and insurance reimbursement, aligning pharmacists' scope of practice with reimbursement policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve healthcare access and reduce barriers, which may contribute to alleviating child poverty marginally.

Title: Behavioral Health Programs - Residential Programs - Food Service Facility Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to adopt regulations that establish certain food service facility standards that are appropriate to residential programs that have less than 17 residents.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies and modifies regulations regarding behavioral health programs in Maryland. It states that certain residential programs with fewer than 17 residents are exempt from adopting specific food service facility regulations. It also outlines licensing, oversight, and safety requirements for behavioral health programs, with some adjustments to existing rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Behavioral health programs, residents of residential programs, providers, and staff involved in mental health and substance use treatment in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes regulatory clarifications and exemptions, and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly involves regulation adjustments for health programs.

Title: Pharmacists - Therapy Management Contract - Form
Synopsis: Providing that a therapy management contract may be entered into in writing or orally; requiring, if a therapy management contract is entered into orally, the parties to the therapy management contract to reduce the contract to writing within 30 days after entering into the therapy management contract; and providing that a therapy management contract may be in electronic form.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to specify that therapy management contracts between pharmacists, prescribers, and patients can be entered into in writing, orally (with a requirement to reduce to writing within 30 days), or electronically, and clarifies related procedures and requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Pharmacists, prescribers, patients, healthcare providers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces flexibility in the formation of therapy management contracts by allowing oral and electronic agreements, which is a modern approach to healthcare agreements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it mainly updates contractual procedures for healthcare providers.

Title: State Board of Dental Examiners - University of Maryland School of Dentistry Faculty - Qualifying for Examination
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which a dentist who is a faculty member at the University of Maryland School of Dentistry and was trained at a foreign dental school must be qualified by the State Board of Dental Examiners to take an examination offered by the American Board of Dental Examiners, Inc., or its successor organization.
bill_summary: The bill enables certain foreign-trained faculty members at the University of Maryland School of Dentistry to qualify for dental licensing examinations more easily, provided they meet specific teaching and experience criteria.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Foreign-trained dentistry faculty at the University of Maryland School of Dentistry and the students they teach
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined qualification process for foreign-trained faculty members, facilitating their pathway to becoming licensed practitioners, which employs targeted licensing eligibility adjustments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects licensing procedures for dental faculty.

Title: Study on the Utilization of the Expedited Licensing Process for Service Members, Veterans, and Military Spouses
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs, to conduct a study on the utilization of the expedited licensing process for service members, veterans, and military spouses for certain occupational and professional licenses in the State; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs, to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to conduct a study on the use and effectiveness of the expedited licensing process for service members, veterans, and military spouses in the state. The study will gather data on application processes, existing outreach, best practices, and compare with other states, with a report due by June 30, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, and military spouses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a research-based approach to improve licensing processes and increase access for military-connected populations, integrating data analysis, outreach, and best practices, but does not introduce new technologies or novel interventions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily focuses on licensing processes for military populations.

Title: Alcohol and Tobacco Commission – Technical Corrections and Clarifications
Synopsis: Correcting certain references to the Comptroller of Maryland to be the Executive Director of the Alcohol and Tobacco Commission, as appropriate; and clarifying certain powers and duties of the Executive Director of the Commission relating to alcoholic beverages regulation and enforcement.
bill_summary: The bill makes technical corrections and clarifications to the Alcohol and Tobacco Commission, including updating references to the Executive Director, clarifying powers and duties, and regulating licensing, enforcement, and confiscation of contraband related to alcoholic beverages and tobacco in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol and Tobacco Commission
stakeholders: Alcohol and tobacco licensees, enforcement agencies, and the public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal references and clarifies existing regulatory procedures; it does not introduce new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct or significant potential impact on child poverty.

Title: Calvert County - Civil Infractions - Prosecutorial Designations
Synopsis: Authorizing the State's Attorney of Calvert County to designate county attorneys or assistant county attorneys to prosecute civil infractions; and authorizing the designated attorneys to exercise the powers of the State's Attorney when prosecuting civil infractions.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the State’s Attorney of Calvert County to designate a county attorney or assistant county attorney, with approval from the County Commissioners, to prosecute civil infractions and exercise associated powers.
responsible_party: Calvert County State's Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Residents and entities in Calvert County involved in civil infractions
innovative_summary: The bill allows for more flexible prosecution of civil infractions by enabling designated attorneys to exercise prosecutorial powers, potentially improving enforcement efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect and minimal, focusing on civil enforcement processes.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Hunting Offenses - Expungement
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to file a petition for expungement of certain criminal records based on a conviction for certain hunting offenses.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals convicted of certain hunting offenses to petition for expungement of their criminal records, with specific waiting periods based on the type of offense.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary (or specified local authorities for record expungement)
stakeholders: Individuals with hunting offense convictions seeking record expungement
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a pathway for expungement specific to hunting offenses, potentially modernizing criminal record management for these cases.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns legal record procedures for hunting offenses.

Title: Calvert County - Length of Service Award Program - Benefits
Synopsis: Altering a certain benefit amount for certain fire and rescue volunteers; and authorizing the board of commissioners to approve an increase in benefit payment for certain fire and rescue volunteers.
bill_summary: The bill increases the benefit amounts for Calvert County volunteer fire and rescue volunteers, allowing for higher death and burial benefits, and authorizes increased benefits based on cost-of-living adjustments.
responsible_party: Calvert County Board of County Commissioners
stakeholders: Calvert County volunteer fire, rescue, and dive team members and their families
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a cost-of-living adjustment mechanism to benefit payments for volunteers, which is a new approach to adjusting benefits periodically.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or related issues.

Title: Public Utilities - Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity and Meter Aggregation
Synopsis: Defining "generating station" as it relates to the requirement to obtain a certificate of public convenience and necessity or approval from the Public Service Commission for a person who constructs a generating station that has the capacity to produce more than 2 but not more than 14 megawatts of electricity from a solar photovoltaic system; requiring an electric company to provide meter aggregation for certain eligible customer-generators under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill simplifies regulations for solar photovoltaic systems by redefining 'generating station' to exclude small-scale and certain multi-unit solar facilities, and requires electric companies to provide meter aggregation for specific eligible customer-generators, primarily for non-profit, governmental, and agricultural users.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and electric utilities
stakeholders: Solar energy developers, government agencies, non-profit organizations, agricultural entities, and eligible public institution users
innovative_summary: The bill enhances existing net metering practices by expanding meter aggregation options and streamlining approval processes for solar projects, especially smaller and multi-unit systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by enabling broader access to solar energy savings for public and nonprofit service providers, thus supporting socio-economic improvement.

Title: Task Force on Preventing and Countering Elder Abuse
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on Preventing and Countering Elder Abuse to study existing laws, policies, and practices relating to elder abuse and crimes commonly committed against older adults; and requiring the Task Force to submit a final report by December 31, 2024, to the Governor and the General Assembly with its findings and recommendations regarding changes to State law, policy, and practice that would aid in preventing elder abuse.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Task Force on Preventing and Countering Elder Abuse in Maryland to study existing laws and practices, and recommend updates to improve protections for older adults.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults in Maryland, elder care providers, legal and law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated task force to review and recommend legal and policy reforms, with focus on modernizing elder abuse prevention and response strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on elder abuse prevention and does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Town of Sharpsburg - Parking of Vehicles - Restrictions
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from parking certain vehicles in the Town of Sharpsburg, Washington County, subject to a certain exception.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits certain types of vehicles from parking on streets or highways in the Town of Sharpsburg, Washington County, unless they are being used immediately.
responsible_party: Town of Sharpsburg, Washington County
stakeholders: Vehicle owners of the specified vehicle classes in Sharpsburg
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific parking restrictions for certain vehicle classes in a small town setting, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is not related to child poverty and likely has no direct impact on it.

Title: Elections - Election Judges - Minimum Compensation
Synopsis: Establishing a minimum training course compensation of $50 and minimum daily compensation of $250 for election judges for each election day and each early voting day actually served; requiring the State Board of Elections to reimburse each local board elections for $50 of the extra compensation that is paid to each returning election judge; and requiring the State Board to develop and implement a marketing campaign to assist in the recruitment of individuals to serve as election judges.
bill_summary: The bill establishes minimum compensation rates for election judges, including training and daily work pay, and requires the Maryland State Board of Elections to reimburse local boards for certain expenses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Election judges, voters, local election boards
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes compensation for election judges and enhances recruitment efforts through a state-led marketing campaign, with some reimbursements for returning judges.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting election judge compensation and recruitment.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Required Coverage for Biomarker Testing
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, and managed care organizations to provide coverage for biomarker testing that is supported by medical and scientific evidence; establishing requirements for deductibles, copayments, and coinsurance for biomarker testing; and requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the impact of providing biomarker testing.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain health insurance carriers provide coverage for biomarker testing that is supported by medical and scientific evidence. It establishing rules for deductibles, copayments, and utilization review, effective from January 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients and private insurance policyholders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces coverage for biomarker testing supported by scientific evidence, integrating genomic and molecular diagnostics into standard insurance coverage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by improving health outcomes and treatment options, especially for vulnerable populations.

Title: Maryland Educator Shortage Reduction Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for early childhood education teacher certification completed through an alternative teacher preparation program; requiring the State Department of Education, in consultation with the Maryland Higher Education Commission, to establish specific goals for the recruitment and retention of teachers in teacher preparation programs; requiring that "high staff qualifications" for publicly funded eligible prekindergarten providers must be implemented by the 2027-2028 school year; etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Educator Shortage Reduction Act of 2023 aims to improve teacher recruitment, retention, and diversity through establishing new programs, scholarships, and data dashboards. It also includes measures to expand eligibility and qualifications for various educator certifications and to support mental health professionals in schools.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Future teachers, current educators, elementary and prekindergarten students, underrepresented populations in the teaching profession, mental health professionals in schools
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches such as a comprehensive data dashboard, expanded alternative certification pathways, targeted scholarships, and a service obligation incentive system, incorporating data-driven and outreach strategies to address the teacher shortage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing quality teaching in high-needs schools and expanding access to early childhood education.

Title: Real Estate Brokers - Disability or Death and Termination of Employment of a Broker
Synopsis: Requiring an adult family member to submit a death certificate or evidence of disability to the State Real Estate Commission before the family member may carry on the business of a disabled or deceased licensed real estate broker; permitting a certain business to designate a licensed real estate broker to provide real estate brokerage services under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: This bill changes rules concerning the handling of real estate broker business continuity after the death, disability, or job termination of a licensed real estate broker. It allows family members and designated brokers to carry on the business under specific conditions, including surrendering licenses and documentation, with certain time limits and procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Licensed real estate brokers, their families, real estate businesses, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program uses existing licensing infrastructure to facilitate business continuation in the event of a broker's death, disability, or termination, with some provisions for designation and reissuance of licenses, emphasizing administrative flexibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty, but may indirectly support economic stability for families involved in real estate.

Title: Special Education - Judicial Actions - Attorney's Fees and Related Costs
Synopsis: Authorizing a court to award reasonable attorney's fees and related costs to the parent of a child with a disability who is the prevailing party in a certain special education proceeding; prohibiting a court from awarding attorney's fees and related costs to certain parents in a certain proceeding under certain circumstances; and authorizing an award of attorney's fees and related costs to a parent of a child with a disability who is a prevailing party under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes courts in Maryland to award attorney's fees and related costs to parents of children with disabilities who win in special education legal proceedings. It also sets conditions under which fees can or cannot be awarded, including rules around settlement offers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Parents of children with disabilities, children receiving special education services, schools, and public agencies involved in special education decisions
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal approach to incentivize fair and timely resolution of special education disputes, reinforcing rights under federal law, but does not introduce new technologies or novel government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could directly impact child poverty by reducing legal barriers and costs for parents seeking appropriate education for their disabled children, potentially enabling better educational outcomes.

Title: Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to annually proclaim January 27 as Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day; and requiring the proclamation to include a declaration of the purposes of Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day.
bill_summary: The bill establishes January 27th as Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day, requiring the Governor to annually proclaim this day with a declaration emphasizing reflection, remembrance, and a pledge to educate future generations about the Holocaust.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents, educators, religious communities, political bodies, and media
innovative_summary: The bill mainly formalizes a commemorative day and does not introduce new technological or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Insurance Commissioner Enforcement - Specialty Mental Health Services and Payment of Claims - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the termination date by 2 years for certain provisions of law relating to Maryland Insurance Commissioner enforcement duties regarding administrative services organizations that administer a certain delivery system for specialty mental health services.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for provisions related to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner enforcement duties concerning specialty mental health services and payment of claims from 2 years to 4 years.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Providers and insurers of specialty mental health services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends existing enforcement provisions; it does not involve new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may impact children with mental health needs.

Title: Employees' Retirement and Pension Systems - Reemployment Earnings Limitation - COVID-19 Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting a certain retiree of the Employees' Retirement and Pension Systems from a certain earnings limitation when the retiree is reemployed by a certain previous employer for a certain time period to assist with the administration of federally funded grants or projects related to the COVID-19 pandemic; and providing for the retroactive application of the Act to January 1, 2020.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain retired employees of Maryland's pension systems from earnings restrictions if they are rehired by the Maryland Department of Health to assist with COVID-19 related grants or projects, for up to 5 years, starting retroactively from January 1, 2020.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Retired employees of Maryland's pension systems, Maryland Department of Health, COVID-19 response efforts
innovative_summary: The bill offers a temporary exemption from retirement earnings restrictions to allow retired employees to contribute to COVID-19 related efforts without penalties, which supports rapid deployment of experienced personnel during the pandemic.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing primarily on COVID-19 response.

Title: Video Lottery Employee Licenses - Crimes of Moral Turpitude - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission is required to disqualify an applicant who committed a crime involving moral turpitude from holding a video lottery employee license.
bill_summary: This bill amends the rules for disqualifying applicants from obtaining a video lottery employee license in Maryland. It relaxes certain disqualification clauses related to crimes involving moral turpitude or gambling, particularly allowing individuals who participated in and completed a problem-solving court program for nonviolent crimes to be eligible.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Applicants seeking employment as video lottery employees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates the use of problem-solving courts to potentially reinstate eligibility for certain applicants, which is a novel approach in licensing regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may improve employment opportunities for individuals with criminal histories, which can indirectly support families.

Title: Prior Authorizations of State Debt - Alterations
