Synopsis: Amending certain prior authorizations of State Debt to alter the requirement that certain grantees provide certain matching funds; extending the termination date of certain grants; altering the authorized uses of certain grants; and changing the names of certain grantees.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funding for various local initiatives including community development, infrastructure, cultural, educational, and health projects across multiple counties in Maryland, extending program durations until June 1, 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management or designated agencies for each project
stakeholders: Residents of affected counties, local governments, community organizations, and targeted populations such as children, veterans, and healthcare patients
innovative_summary: The bill primarily allocates funding for infrastructure, health, cultural, and community projects, without employing new technologies or novel government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect, through local development and service projects that could improve socio-economic conditions.

Title: Family Law - Child Care - Criminal Background Investigations
Synopsis: Altering provisions relating to criminal background investigations for certain individuals who care for or supervise children; and requiring certain facilities to apply to the Central Repository for a national and State criminal history records check for each employee, employer, individual, or volunteer.
bill_summary: The bill requires child care facilities and related organizations to conduct criminal background checks on employees, volunteers, and other individuals who care for or have access to children, including applying through the Central Repository for both state and federal criminal records. It specifies procedures for applying, submitting fingerprints, and handling background check results, as well as provisions for emergency placements and contests of criminal records. The bill aims to enhance child safety by tightening background check requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Children in child care, foster care, and educational environments, their families, child care providers, and related organizations.
innovative_summary: The program utilizes integrated federal and state criminal background checks and cross-referencing procedures, including updates and contesting mechanisms, to improve background screening in child care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing safety in child care environments, which can support economic stability and well-being.

Title: Locating the New Federal Bureau of Investigation Headquarters in Maryland
Synopsis: Urging the U.S. General Services Administration to select for the new Federal Bureau of Investigation headquarters one of the two finalist sites located in Maryland.
bill_summary: This resolution urges the U.S. General Services Administration to select a site in Maryland, specifically Greenbelt or Landover, for the new FBI headquarters, citing Maryland's strategic location, existing federal agencies, and diversity considerations.
responsible_party: U.S. General Services Administration and Maryland state government
stakeholders: Maryland residents, Maryland government, federal agencies, FBI employees, local communities in Greenbelt and Landover
innovative_summary: The bill mainly focuses on advocacy and political support for the FBI headquarters location, not on deploying new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, as it is about FBI headquarters site selection.

Title: Criminal Law - Wearing, Carrying, or Transporting Firearms - Restrictions (Gun Safety Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly wearing, carrying, or transporting a firearm in certain locations; prohibiting a person from wearing, carrying, or transporting a firearm onto certain property unless the owner or owner's agent has given certain permission; altering certain provisions of law relating to the authority of the Secretary of State Police to limit the wearing, carrying, or transporting of a handgun at certain times and locations; etc.
bill_summary: The Gun Safety Act of 2023 imposes restrictions on wearing, carrying, and transporting firearms in certain locations, establishes permit requirements and training for handgun carriers, and enhances legal penalties for violations to improve public safety.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals who carry firearms, law enforcement, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining restrictions, permits, training, and enforcement to improve firearm safety, with some use of technology for permit management and reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but contributes to community safety.

Title: Department of Natural Resources – Documents – Digital or Electronic Issuance
Synopsis: Expanding the requirement that the Department of Natural Resources make available and issue certain licenses and stamps in a digital or electronic format; and providing that, if the Department cannot issue certain licenses, stamps, permits, registrations, or certificates in a digital or electronic format because of federal restrictions, it is the intent of the General Assembly that the Department issue certain licenses, stamps, permits, registrations, or certificates in a digital or electronic format whenever the federal restrictions are eliminated.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to provide and issue almost all of its licenses, permits, stamps, registrations, and certificates in a digital or electronic format, with some exceptions listed.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Residents and visitors who need licenses, permits, and certificates related to natural resource activities in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill promotes the use of digital and electronic formats for government documents, increasing efficiency, accessibility, and reducing paper use.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have an indirect impact on child poverty by improving access to licensing and permits, potentially reducing barriers to outdoor activities and resource management.

Title: Department of Transportation - Financing and Commission on Transportation Revenue and Infrastructure Needs (State and Federal Transportation Funding Act)
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the Capital Debt Affordability Committee include certain debt that is secured by future federal aid within its review of State tax supported debt; altering the calculation of the maximum amount of debt secured by future federal aid that the Department of Transportation may issue; providing that the maximum amount of debt that may be issued is calculated as of June 30; establishing the Maryland Commission on Transportation Revenue and Infrastructure Needs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Maryland Commission on Transportation Revenue and Infrastructure Needs to review funding sources, infrastructure needs, and emerging trends in transportation. It also revises rules around transportation debt, including federal aid-backed bonds.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: State transportation agencies, policymakers, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill includes a comprehensive review of transportation funding options, including exploring new revenue sources and promoting public-private partnerships, which represents a modern approach to infrastructure finance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve transportation infrastructure, which can enhance mobility and access to services, potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Property Tax - Exemption for Dwellings of Disabled Veterans - Application
Synopsis: Altering the application requirements for a certain property tax exemption for a dwelling house owned by a disabled veteran or surviving spouse of a disabled veteran by adding a rating decision of the disabled veteran's disability from the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs to the type of supporting documents that may be included with application.
bill_summary: This bill alters the application process for property tax exemptions for dwellings owned by disabled veterans, active duty service members, or their surviving spouses in Maryland. It clarifies the requirements for eligibility and application for such exemptions and specifies procedures for applying for exemptions before purchasing a property.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Disabled veterans, active duty service members, and their surviving spouses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates existing rules and requirements; it does not introduce new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns property tax exemptions for specific populations.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Expungement of Records (REDEEM Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Providing that any unpaid court fees or costs are not a bar to a certain expungement; requiring a court to waive certain court fees and costs when ordering or effecting a certain expungement; adding malicious destruction of property to the list of misdemeanor convictions that may be expunged; and altering the waiting periods applicable to the filing of petitions for expungement of convictions of certain crimes.
bill_summary: This bill, known as the REDEEM Act of 2023, updates Maryland's expungement laws by removing unpaid court fees as a barrier to expungement, requiring courts to waive fees when expunging records, and expanding the list of misdemeanor offenses (including malicious destruction of property) eligible for expungement. It also alters the waiting periods before one can file for expungement, generally reducing the time requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland judiciary and courts
stakeholders: Individuals seeking expungement of criminal records in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal reform approach to criminal record management by removing financial barriers and broadening eligibility, which can more effectively promote rehabilitation and social reintegration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential to impact child poverty directly is moderate, as clearing criminal records can improve employment prospects for individuals, indirectly benefiting their children.

Title: Disaster Service and Uniformed Services Leave Modernization Act of 2023
Synopsis: Adding certain State employees to certain provisions of law authorizing disaster service leave with pay; authorizing certain appointing authorities to waive certain requirements for disaster service leave and to increase the number of days of disaster service leave under certain circumstances; defining "uniformed services" for the purpose of adding certain individuals to certain provisions of law relating to certain paid leave and military administrative leave; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modernizes disaster service leave and uniformed services leave laws for Maryland State employees. It clarifies definitions, expands eligible employees, authorizes waivers and increases in leave days during emergencies, and provides paid leave options for military duty and other authorized activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management and Maryland State Personnel and Pensions Office
stakeholders: Maryland State employees, emergency responders, military personnel, and volunteers involved in disaster and emergency response
innovative_summary: The bill introduces expanded paid leave options for military and disaster service, and clarifies procedures and definitions, with technological support for online databases and reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has indirect potential to support child welfare by enabling essential emergency responses and relieving staff shortages during crises.

Title: Maryland Nonprofit Development Center Program - Nonprofit, Interest-Free, Micro Bridge Loan (NIMBL) Account - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2024 or fiscal year 2025 an appropriation of $1,000,000 to the Maryland Nonprofit Development Center Program Fund to be used for loans under the Nonprofit, Interest-Free, Micro Bridge Loan (NIMBL) Account; and repealing a requirement that 5% of proceeds from video lottery terminals go to the NIMBL Account.
bill_summary: The bill allocates $1 million annually starting in fiscal year 2024 from the proceeds of video lottery terminals to a new Nonprofit, Interest-Free, Micro Bridge Loan (NIMBL) Account within the Maryland Nonprofit Development Center Program to support nonprofit organizations through interest-free micro loans.
responsible_party: Maryland Nonprofit Development Center, Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations in Maryland, particularly those seeking interest-free micro loans
innovative_summary: The program employs an innovative approach by providing interest-free micro loans to nonprofits through a dedicated fund, supported by a portion of video lottery terminal proceeds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by supporting nonprofit organizations that serve children and families, through providing necessary funding tools.

Title: Property Tax Credit - Public Safety Officer
Synopsis: Repealing the definition of "public safety officer" for purposes of a certain credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on a dwelling owned by a public safety officer; repealing a certain limitation on the amount of the credit; requiring the governing body of a county or municipal corporation that authorizes the credit to establish, by law, the definition of "public safety officer" for purposes of eligibility for the credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill revises the property tax credit for public safety officers in Maryland by allowing local governments to define 'public safety officer' and remove previous restrictions on the credit amount.
responsible_party: County or municipal governments in Maryland
stakeholders: Public safety officers who own property in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill grants local governments flexibility to define eligibility and program details for the property tax credit, which is a common approach but allows for more tailored local policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect and minimal, focusing on property tax credits for public safety officers.

Title: Clerks of the Circuit Courts - Civil Commissions - Presentation and Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring an appointee for a civil commission to contact the clerk of the circuit court to which the commission was delivered by the Governor to coordinate a time and place for the administration of the oath of office and presentation of the commission; altering the frequency with which the clerk of a circuit court must report to the Secretary of State the name and office of each officer who has taken the oath of office; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures for appointing civil commission officials, requiring appointees to coordinate with circuit court clerks for oath administration, and revises reporting obligations for clerks of courts to report officers who have taken oaths and publish related taxes.
responsible_party: Clerks of the circuit courts and the Secretary of State of Maryland
stakeholders: Appointed civil officers, clerks of the circuit courts, and the Maryland Secretary of State
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing legal procedures for oath administration and reporting, without employing new technology or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal or no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Labor and Employment - Apprenticeship 2030 Commission and Representation on the Apprenticeship and Training Council
Synopsis: Requiring that the Apprenticeship and Training Council and consultants to the Council include representation by individuals who are Asian, Black, and Latino; establishing the Apprenticeship 2030 Commission to examine and make recommendations to expand access to apprenticeships to reduce skill shortages in high-demand occupations and provide affordable training for career pathways for young people; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Apprenticeship 2030 Commission to expand access to apprenticeships, reduce skill shortages, and increase the number of registered apprentices by 2030. It also requires representation of Asian, Black, and Latino individuals on the Apprenticeship and Training Council and its consultants.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Legislative Services
stakeholders: Unemployed and underemployed individuals, high school students, workers in high-demand occupations, minority and diverse communities, and industry sectors with skill shortages.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a strategic, comprehensive approach through a dedicated commission, diverse stakeholder representation, and goal-driven strategies to scale apprenticeships across industries and education levels.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to career pathways and reducing skill shortages, thereby improving economic opportunities for youth and families.

Title: Property Tax - Real Property Tax Assessment and Tax Rate Increases - Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring certain notices relating to increases in property assessments; altering certain notice requirements relating to the intention of a county or municipal corporation to set a certain real property tax rate that exceeds the constant yield tax rate and requiring instead certain notice when a county or municipal corporation intends to increase its real property tax rate.
bill_summary: The bill updates notice requirements related to property assessment increases and the setting of real property tax rates, including provisions for public notices and hearings when tax rates are proposed to increase beyond the constant yield rate.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Property owners and local taxing authorities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily refines legal notice and communication procedures for property tax rate changes, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on procedural transparency in property tax assessments.

Title: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center - Student FAFSA Data - Reporting Requirement
Synopsis: Altering a reporting requirement to require the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to report certain student Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) data to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 15 each year, beginning in 2023 and ending in 2028; and requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to provide the Center with access to student FAFSA data.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to report student FAFSA data to legislative committees by December 15 each year from 2023 to 2028. It also mandates the Maryland Higher Education Commission to provide access to this FAFSA data to the Data System Center.
responsible_party: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students in Maryland who apply for federal or state financial aid
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an integrated reporting system for FAFSA data that involves disaggregating and reporting detailed student aid application data to legislative committees and enhancing data sharing between agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve data collection and analysis on financial aid application rates, which could inform initiatives to reduce child poverty by increasing college access.

Title: State Police Retirement System and Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Deferred Retirement Option Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum number of years of eligibility service that certain members of the State Police Retirement System or Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System may have to participate in the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP) from 30 to 32; increasing the number of years that certain members of the State Police Retirement System or Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System may participate in the DROP from 5 to 7; and authorizing certain individuals to elect to extend their participation in the DROP.
bill_summary: This bill amends the Maryland law governing the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP) for members of the State Police Retirement System and the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System. It increases the maximum participation period from 5 to 7 years, allows certain individuals to extend their participation, and modifies eligibility criteria based on years of service and age.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency and Department of State Police
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Police Retirement System and Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System
innovative_summary: The program primarily updates existing retirement benefit rules and extends program participation limits; it introduces a process for extending participation but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Electricity - Net Energy Metering and Virtual Net Energy Metering - Accrual of Net Excess Generation (Net Metering Flexibility Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain eligible customer-generator to accrue net excess generation for an indefinite period; requiring the Public Service Commission to establish a method for calculating the value of certain accrued net excess generation; and requiring that a subscriber of a community solar energy generating system accrue virtual net excess generation in the same manner as a certain eligible customer-generator.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes eligible customer-generators to accrue net excess electricity generation for an indefinite period and establishes procedures for calculating and paying for this excess, including a new method for corporations to carry forward and be compensated for surplus energy. It also creates a pilot community solar energy program with specific rules for virtual net energy metering.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric utility customers, especially those with solar and renewable energy systems, and community solar subscribers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an indefinite accrual option for net excess generation and a pilot community solar program with virtual net metering, employing innovative approaches for energy credits and community participation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce energy costs for low-income households by allowing more flexible net metering and community solar options.

Title: State Board of Social Work Examiners - Conditional Licenses to Practice Social Work
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Social Work Examiners, under certain circumstances, to issue a conditional license to practice social work to an applicant who, except for passing a required examination, has met the appropriate education and experience requirements for a certain license if the required examination was unavailable to the applicant for a period of at least 15 business days; providing that a conditional license is valid until 180 days after the examination becomes readily available to the applicant; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners to issue temporary conditional licenses to practice social work under certain circumstances, especially when the licensing examination is unavailable due to administrative delays or other unforeseen issues. It also clarifies the scope, validity, and renewal processes for temporary licenses and conditional licenses, and requires annual reporting on examination availability.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners
stakeholders: Social workers seeking licensure, social work students, and the public served by licensed social workers
innovative_summary: The program introduces a structured approach for issuing temporary licenses during examination delays, utilizing emergency measures and regular reporting, employing a proactive and adaptive licensing process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve access to social work services, which can directly impact child poverty by increasing the availability of qualified social workers.

Title: Public Health - Mental Health Advance Directives - Awareness and Statewide Database
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop and implement a public awareness campaign to encourage the use of mental health advance directives in the State; and requiring the Behavioral Health Administration and the Maryland Health Care Commission jointly to study how first responders and behavioral health crisis providers can access a certain advanced directive database when responding to a behavioral health crisis and to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on their findings on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to run a public awareness campaign promoting the use of mental health advance directives, and mandates a study by the Behavioral Health Administration and the Maryland Health Care Commission on the feasibility of creating a statewide, accessible database of mental health advance directives for use by first responders and behavioral health providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Individuals with mental health conditions, families, healthcare providers, first responders, behavioral health crisis providers
innovative_summary: The bill proposes developing a statewide mental health advance directive database integrated with the health information exchange, which is a new approach to managing and accessing mental health care preferences.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program potentially improves mental health support, which could help reduce child poverty by improving mental well-being and access to services.

Title: Prince George's County - Prince George's County Reentry Employment Incentive Program - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor, for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028, to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $500,000 to the Prince George's County Office of the County Executive to be used for the Prince George's County Reentry Employment Incentive Program; and requiring that funds made available by the Act are supplemental to, and may not supplant, funds otherwise available for the reentry employment incentives in Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Governor to include $500,000 annually from 2025 to 2028 in the state budget for the Prince George's County Reentry Employment Incentive Program, aimed at supporting employment opportunities for individuals reentering the community.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland / Maryland State Budget Office
stakeholders: Individuals reentering the community in Prince George's County, local employment agencies, and related service providers
innovative_summary: The program allocates dedicated funding for reentry employment incentives in Prince George's County, integrating county-level initiatives with state budget priorities, which is a strategic approach to support reintegration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly reduce child poverty by increasing employment opportunities for reentering individuals, thus improving family economic stability.

Title: Maryland Aviation Commission - Duties, Composition, and Member Orientation
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Aviation Commission to consider information and advice from certain additional stakeholders when carrying out the Commission's duties; requiring the Commission to consider the aviation, economic, business, environmental, health, and community-related impacts or any other impacts the Commission finds relevant; requiring that certain members of the Commission appointed by the Governor are to be recommended by the Anne Arundel County and Howard County Senate delegations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Aviation Commission to establish policies to mitigate negative impacts of the local aviation and airport industries, consider additional stakeholders' input, and requires members to receive orientation. It also details the composition, appointment process, and meeting procedures of the Commission, and mandates an annual report on airport activities and health/livability impacts.
responsible_party: Maryland Aviation Commission
stakeholders: Residents living near airports, aviation industry workers, environmental and public health communities, and local governments.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces structured stakeholder engagement, mandated orientation for members, enhanced transparency through open meetings, and regular reporting, integrating diverse community and industry input into aviation policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for direct impact, as it focuses on mitigating health and community impacts that can indirectly influence child well-being.

Title: Maryland State Arts Council - Funding
Synopsis: Clarifying the calculation for certain funding for the Maryland State Arts Council for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter; repealing a certain requirement for certain funds distributed to the Maryland State Arts Council to be included in the Council's prior fiscal year appropriation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the calculation method for funding allocated to the Maryland State Arts Council from state revenues and repeals a previous requirement for certain funds to be included in the previous year's appropriation. It also adjusts the distribution of revenue from the state admissions and amusement tax to various cultural and arts entities.
responsible_party: Maryland State Arts Council
stakeholders: Arts organizations, cultural programs, and the general public interested in arts and culture funding in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves clarifying funding calculation procedures and revenue distributions, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, mainly focusing on arts funding.

Title: Task Force to Study Crime Classification
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Crime Classification to study and make recommendations regarding a method for classifying crimes and civil offenses under State law and to identify and logically categorize all crimes and civil offenses that exist under State law; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and General Assembly on or before December 31, 2023.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Task Force to Study Crime Classification and Penalties to review and recommend changes to the classification and penalties of crimes in Maryland.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: criminal justice system, victims, offenders, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive review and recommendation approach, including studying other states' classifications, legislative history, and proposing reforms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The impact on child poverty is indirect; potential improvements in the criminal justice system could affect families and children.

Title: Environment - Statewide Recycling Needs Assessment and Producer Responsibility for Packaging Materials
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "organics recycling" to include the processing of certain compostable packaging materials in a certain manner; requiring the Department of the Environment to approve a single producer responsibility organization to represent the interests of producers by October 1, 2023; establishing a producer responsibility advisory council to provide advice and make recommendations regarding establishing and implementing a producer responsibility program in the State for packaging materials; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a statewide producer responsibility program for packaging materials in Maryland. It requires producers to submit responsibility plans, creates an advisory council, conducts regular statewide recycling needs assessments, and sets up a recycling trust fund to support these initiatives.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Producers, local governments, recyclers, and residents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs modern approaches such as extended producer responsibility, regular statewide assessments, and stakeholder advisory councils to improve recycling infrastructure and policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially reduces child poverty by promoting recycling and waste reduction, which can lead to economic opportunities and cleaner environments for children.

Title: Criminal Law - Child Pornography - Accessing and Intentionally Viewing
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly or intentionally accessing and intentionally viewing a certain visual representation of a child under the age of 16 years.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland criminal law regarding child pornography, specifically prohibiting the knowingly or intentionally accessing and viewing visual representations of children under 16 that are indistinguishable from actual children, with certain exceptions. It increases penalties for repeat offenders, clarifies legal definitions, and provides defense options.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of State Police or relevant law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in the possession, viewing, or distribution of child pornography, as well as the general public and victims of child exploitation
innovative_summary: The bill mainly focuses on legal clarifications and increased penalties; it does not establish a new innovative program or service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program – Domestic Partnerships
Synopsis: Establishing that the terms "spouse", "family", "immediate family", "dependent", and any other terms that denote a spousal relationship shall be construed to include a party to a domestic partnership for purposes of the State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program; and establishing that the provisions of the Program that apply to spouses shall apply to parties who have entered into a domestic partnership.
bill_summary: This bill extends the benefits of the State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program that are available to spouses to also include parties in a legally recognized domestic partnership. It defines domestic partnership and adjusts relevant legal language to recognize these relationships. The bill takes effect on July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: State employees, retirees, and their domestic partners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal recognition approach to extend existing employee benefits to domestic partners, aligning legal terms with contemporary relationship arrangements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly expands legal recognition and benefits for domestic partnerships.

Title: Income Tax – Out–of–State Taxes Paid by Pass–Through Entities – Addition Modification
Synopsis: Providing, for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022, an addition modification under the Maryland income tax for the amount of a certain tax credit claimed for certain taxes paid to another state by a pass-through entity under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's income tax rules regarding pass-through entities, providing specific rules for claiming tax credits for taxes paid to other states by these entities and their members.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Members of pass-through entities and residents who own shares in such entities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a specific approach to crediting taxes paid to other states by pass-through entities, but it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Commercial Law – Abandoned Property – Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, as Administrator of abandoned property in the State, to determine the value of certain nonmonetary abandoned property; and authorizing the Administrator, if it is determined the property has no commercial value and need not be offered for sale, to return the property to the holder, destroy the property, or dispose of the property.
bill_summary: The bill amends the commercial law regarding abandoned property in Maryland. It requires the Comptroller to determine the value of certain nonmonetary abandoned property, and specifies procedures for disposing of property with or without commercial value, including offering for sale and other disposal methods.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Owners of abandoned property in Maryland, consumers, and the general public involved in property disposal processes.
innovative_summary: This bill updates the procedures for handling abandoned property, particularly in assessing value and disposal methods, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly pertains to property management and disposal.

Title: Income Tax - Work Opportunity Tax Credit - Technical Correction
Synopsis: Correcting a certain incorrect cross-reference to the federal Internal Revenue Code relating to the federal work opportunity credit.
bill_summary: This bill corrects a legal cross-reference in the Maryland tax code related to the federal work opportunity tax credit.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Taxpayers and employers claiming the federal work opportunity tax credit in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill involves a technical correction to existing tax law, not the creation of new programs or initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not establish or modify a program directly impacting child poverty.

Title: Income Tax - Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering eligibility for the State child and dependent care tax credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the eligibility and calculation rules for Maryland's child and dependent care tax credit, including income limits, income thresholds for reduction of credits, and refund claims.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Taxpayers claiming child and dependent care credits in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly adjusts tax credit eligibility rules; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could indirectly impact child poverty by providing tax credits to families, potentially increasing disposable income for child care.

Title: National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund - Annual Appropriation and Authorized Uses
Synopsis: Altering the amount of a certain appropriation the Governor is required to make for the National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund; and repealing a provision of law requiring 100% of the National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund to be used for community enhancement projects in sustainable communities located, at least in part, within the boundary created by Interstate 495 in the State and the District of Columbia beginning in fiscal year 2024.
bill_summary: The bill alters the funding levels for the National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund, specifying appropriations from 2021 to 2025, and changes the requirements for how the funds are used, removing the previous 100% community enhancement project restriction to certain sustainable communities in specific geographic boundaries.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Communities within Prince George's County and Montgomery County, Maryland, especially those in sustainable communities near Interstate 495 and related boundaries.
innovative_summary: The program primarily modifies funding allocations and geographic restrictions, which are standard procedures; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential to directly impact child poverty is limited as the program focuses on community enhancement projects outside specific targets for poverty alleviation.

Title: Real Property - Sheriff's Sales - Procedures and Subordinate Interests
Synopsis: Establishing that a sheriff's sale of real property extinguishes subordinate liens on the land being sold; providing that certain provisions of the Act do not impair a lien on land affected by a judgment in favor of a local government for real property maintenance violations or nuisance condition violations that is indexed and recorded in accordance with the Maryland Rules; and authorizing the Judiciary to transfer up to $12,000,000 of a General Fund appropriation to a certain special fund on or before June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: This bill updates procedures for sheriff's sales of real property, establishes requirements for notices and affidavits in foreclosure processes, clarifies that sheriff's sales extinguish subordinate liens, and authorizes the transfer of funds to improve property records in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Property owners, mortgage holders, lienholders, and residents involved in real estate transactions
innovative_summary: The bill employs improved notification procedures and data management, including the use of assessment records in lieu of valuations, as a new approach to streamline foreclosure and sale processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by clarifying property sale procedures, which may influence housing stability and asset transfer for impacted families.

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Independent Investigations Division - Authority to Prosecute
Synopsis: Expanding the investigative jurisdiction of the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General to include a police-involved incident resulting in serious bodily injury to an individual that is not otherwise within the jurisdiction of the Division; requiring the Division to submit an annual report on its activities in the prior calendar year to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before January 31; authorizing the Attorney General to prosecute certain criminal matters under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: This bill expands the investigative authority of the Independent Investigations Division of the Maryland Office of the Attorney General for police-involved incidents resulting in death or serious injury, requires annual reporting on its activities, and clarifies prosecution authority for criminal matters related to police misconduct.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals involved in police-involved incidents, law enforcement agencies, and the public interested in police accountability
innovative_summary: The bill enhances the oversight and investigative capabilities of the Independent Investigations Division, including expanded jurisdiction, powers to seek injunctive relief, and coordination with other agencies, utilizing a specialized division for police misconduct investigations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct approach to reducing child poverty but may contribute indirectly through improved police accountability and community trust.

Title: Corrections - Incarcerated Individuals
Synopsis: Altering the term "inmate" to be "incarcerated individual" meaning an individual who is actually or constructively detained or confined in a correctional facility.
bill_summary: The bill changes the terminology in Maryland law and official documents from 'inmate' to 'incarcerated individual' across all laws, rules, and policies, and requires publishers to correct references accordingly.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services and publishers of the Annotated Code of Maryland
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals and the agencies that manage correctional facilities and laws affecting them.
innovative_summary: This bill mainly updates terminology and references in laws and official documents without establishing new programs or services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly relate to programs impacting child poverty.

Title: Carroll County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Carroll County to borrow not more than $65,600,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Carroll County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Carroll County to issue bonds up to $65.6 million to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and fire department facilities, including loans for emergency equipment and land easements. It specifies how bonds can be issued, used, and repaid, emphasizing that the bonds are backed by the county’s full faith and taxing power.
responsible_party: Carroll County Government
stakeholders: Residents of Carroll County, volunteer fire departments, and public facility users
innovative_summary: The bill primarily sets borrowing rules and authorization for traditional public debt issuance; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on infrastructure funding and does not directly target child poverty reduction.

Title: Natural Resources - Black Bear Damage Prevention and Reimbursement Fund - Uses
Synopsis: Altering the Black Bear Damage Reimbursement Fund to authorize grants from the Fund to be made for projects that prevent damages caused by black bears and reduce conflicts between black bears and humans; renaming the Fund to be the Black Bear Damage Prevention and Reimbursement Fund; increasing the maximum amount of reimbursement from the Fund per person annually authorized for damage caused by black bears to $5,000; authorizing the Governor to include at least $50,000 in the annual budget bill for the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Black Bear Damage Reimbursement Fund to allow grants for projects that prevent damages caused by black bears and reduce conflicts with humans, renames the fund, adjusts reimbursement limits, and allocates funding.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Residents, farmers, landowners, local governments, nonprofits, and businesses in Maryland affected by black bear conflicts and damages.
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes prevention and conflict reduction through grants for nonlethal, innovative solutions and community-supported projects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by enhancing community safety and preventing property and pet damages caused by black bears.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class 4 Limited Winery License - Food Service
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a Class 4 limited winery license to prepare, sell, or serve any food under certain conditions; altering certain requirements for off-premises and on-premises consumption at a limited winery; and removing the 14-day notice requirement for certain planned promotional events at a limited winery.
bill_summary: This bill updates regulations for Class 4 limited winery licenses in Maryland, allowing licenseholders to prepare, sell, or serve certain foods, and making changes to promotional event notices and operational hours.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office and Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Winery owners, consumers, and regulatory agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates licensing rules and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Washington County - Sheriff's Salary - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the salary of the Washington County Sheriff to be 90% of the salary of the State's Attorney of Washington County; and repealing the requirement for the Washington County Salary Study Commission to study and issue a report that contains recommendations relating to the salary of the Sheriff of Washington County.
bill_summary: The bill adjusts the salary of the Washington County Sheriff to be 90% of the salary of the Washington County State’s Attorney, and repeals previous salary study requirements.
responsible_party: Washington County government or local government bodies
stakeholders: Washington County residents, county officials, and public safety personnel
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward percentage-based method to determine the sheriff's salary, rather than a complex study or report.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Law Enforcement - Body-Worn Cameras (Body-Worn Camera Appropriation and Financing Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of General Services, in coordination with the Department of Information Technology, to negotiate certain contracts with third parties for the acquisition or maintenance of body-worn cameras, equipment, or technology for certain law enforcement agencies; requiring the Department of Information Technology, in coordination with the Department of General Services, to study the cost and feasibility of implementing a statewide uniform storage and access system for law enforcement body-worn camera data; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of General Services, in coordination with the Department of Information Technology, to negotiate contracts to acquire and maintain body-worn cameras and related equipment for law enforcement agencies. It also mandates a study on the cost and feasibility of implementing a statewide uniform storage and access system for body-worn camera data, with a report due by December 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Department of General Services and Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies and the public served by them
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated contracting approach for body-worn cameras and initiates a study on centralized data storage, which reflects a modern approach to data management and interoperability for law enforcement technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is indirectly related to public safety and community trust, which can affect child poverty, but does not have a direct targeted impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City – West North Avenue Development Authority – Membership and Procurement
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the West North Avenue Development Authority; exempting the Authority from certain provisions of State procurement law; and altering the report on the Authority's comprehensive neighborhood revitalization strategy the Authority is required to submit to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly to be due by December 15, 2023, to include any procurement activities undertaken by the Authority, and to be also submitted to the House Health and Government Operations Committee.
bill_summary: This bill alters the membership, reporting requirements, and legal provisions of the West North Avenue Development Authority in Baltimore City, including exemptions from certain procurement laws, and extends certain provisions until September 30, 2026.
responsible_party: Baltimore City - West North Avenue Development Authority and affiliated Maryland state agencies
stakeholders: Residents and communities impacted by the West North Avenue area in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill makes special exemptions from procurement laws for the authority, which is a common regulatory change, not employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty, but revitalization efforts could indirectly benefit impoverished communities.

Title: Maryland Achieving a Better Life Experience (ABLE) Program - Account Establishment - Procedures
Synopsis: Establishing certain procedures regarding the persons who may establish or receive distributions from an ABLE account in the Maryland ABLE Program for a certain eligible individual; and requiring the Maryland 529 Board to adopt certain procedures regarding the establishment and operation of an ABLE account by a person other than a certain designated beneficiary.
bill_summary: The bill establishes procedures for the Maryland ABLE Program, including how accounts can be established and operated by individuals other than the designated beneficiary, and clarifies the roles of various parties involved in establishing ABLE accounts for eligible individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland 529 Board
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces procedures for establishing ABLE accounts by persons other than the designated beneficiary, including guardians, agents under power of attorney, and relatives, which enhances the flexibility and accessibility of the program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact as it facilitates savings for individuals with disabilities, potentially reducing financial hardship and associated child poverty.

Title: Maryland Legal Services Corporation - Affordable Life, Wills, and Estate Planning for Seniors Grant Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Affordable Life, Wills, and Estate Planning for Seniors Grant Program in the Maryland Legal Services Corporation to provide eligible seniors access to affordable civil law-related services; and requiring the Governor to provide an appropriation of $225,000 in the annual budget for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Affordable Life, Wills, and Estate Planning for Seniors Grant Program within the Maryland Legal Services Corporation, aimed at providing legal services to seniors, particularly in rural areas, to help them with estate planning and related legal needs.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation
stakeholders: Eligible seniors in Maryland, especially those with limited income and in rural communities.
innovative_summary: The program employs outreach, intake screening, and establishes a legal services grant initiative to expand access to estate planning legal services for seniors, including targeted outreach to rural areas.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to impact child poverty indirectly by supporting seniors and their families in estate planning, potentially reducing burdens on social services.

Title: Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics - Planning Grant Funds and Demonstration Application
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to apply to the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration at the Center for Mental Health Services for federal planning, development, and implementation grant funds related to certified community behavioral health clinics for fiscal year 2025; and requiring the Department to apply to the Administration for inclusion in the state certified community behavioral health clinic demonstration program for fiscal year 2026.
bill_summary: The bill directs the Maryland Department of Health to apply for federal grants to develop and implement Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics, which provide comprehensive mental health and substance use services. It outlines steps for submitting state plan amendments, establishing standards, and creating payment and quality systems for these clinics, with the aim of enhancing mental health services in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals needing mental health and substance use services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill adopts a federally recognized model for integrated behavioral health clinics and implements prospective payment and quality incentive systems, utilizing federal grants and standards to improve service delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to mental health and substance use treatment, which can support better educational and economic outcomes for children and families.

Title: Baltimore City - Commercial Use - Definition
Synopsis: Defining "commercial use" in Baltimore City to include multifamily residential development if the development is located within a waterfront commercial zoning district and within a 0.50-mile radius of a commuter rail station.
bill_summary: The bill redefines 'commercial use' in Baltimore City to include certain multifamily residential developments located within a waterfront commercial zoning district and within 0.5 miles of a commuter rail station.
responsible_party: Baltimore City planning and zoning agencies
stakeholders: residents, developers, and businesses in Baltimore City, particularly in waterfront and transit-oriented areas
innovative_summary: The bill moderately expands the definition of 'commercial use' to include multifamily residential development in specific waterfront and transit zones, which could influence development decisions and urban planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty, as it mainly affects land use definitions and zoning.

Title: State Board of Physicians – Inactive and Emeritus Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Physicians to place a licensee on emeritus status under certain circumstances; requiring the Board, under certain circumstances, to reinstate the license of an individual who is on inactive or emeritus status; exempting licensees who are on inactive status or emeritus status from continuing medical education requirements; repealing the requirement that the Board issue a license to an individual who is on inactive status under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Physicians to place licensees on emeritus status under certain conditions, allow them to reinstate licenses while on inactive or emeritus status, and clarifies restrictions on practicing medicine or representing oneself as a physician while on these statuses. It also establishes conditions and fees for emeritus and inactive status, and specifies that licensees on these statuses are exempt from certain continuing education requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Licensed physicians, medical professionals, and the public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a formal emeritus status for physicians, allowing a structured way for retired physicians to maintain a license while not practicing, with specific criteria and exemptions from continuing education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may indirectly improve healthcare stability by maintaining experienced physicians in the system.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Benefits - Offset and Study
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the payment of a benefit by a governmental unit or quasi-public corporation to a covered employee offsets the liability for benefits under the workers' compensation law; and stating that it is the intent of the General Assembly that the Maryland Association of Counties and the Professional Fire Fighters of Maryland jointly research and report data and analysis on the effects of the Act by December 1, 2024, to interested parties and certain committees of the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill modifies workers' compensation law to clarify how offsets from governmental benefit payments are handled, considers tinnitus as part of hearing loss, standardizes audiometric measurement criteria, and requires a joint research report on the effects of these changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or the relevant workers' compensation commission
stakeholders: Workers receiving workers' compensation for hearing loss or tinnitus, governmental entities, fire departments, and counties in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes audiometric testing criteria, integrates tinnitus into hearing loss calculations, and commissions a joint research report, reflecting a comprehensive and modern approach to workers' compensation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Economic Development - Upper Shore Regional Council - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of certain voting and nonvoting members of the Upper Shore Regional Council.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the membership composition of the Upper Shore Regional Council, including voting and nonvoting members, to reflect current regional and local representatives.
responsible_party: Upper Shore Regional Council or Maryland Department of Economic Development
stakeholders: Members of the Upper Shore Regional Council, regional governments, local officials, and the residents of the Eastern Shore region of Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill does not involve new technologies or innovative approaches; it primarily updates the membership structure of an existing regional council.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill mainly concerns regional governance structure and does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Judges of the Orphans' Court - Compensation
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Executive and County Council of Prince George's County to determine the compensation for the judges of the Orphans' Court for Prince George's County.
bill_summary: This bill allows the Prince George’s County authorities to set the annual compensation for judges of the Orphans' Court, replacing a fixed salary with a determination made by the County Executive and County Council.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Executive and County Council
stakeholders: Judges of the Orphans' Court in Prince George’s County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces flexibility for the county to determine judges' salaries, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Commission to Advance and Strengthen Fire Fighting and Emergency Medical Services Within Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Advance and Strengthen Fire Fighting and Emergency Medical Services Within Maryland to study and make recommendations regarding the effectiveness and viability of certain incentives, offerings, or practices employed in other states to attract, support, and retain individuals in fire fighting and emergency medical services roles; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission to Study and Make Recommendations on Incentives and Practices to Support Firefighting and Emergency Medical Services in Maryland, focusing on attracting and retaining personnel.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Firefighting and emergency medical services personnel, communities relying on fire and EMS services, volunteer and career firefighters
innovative_summary: The program aims to evaluate and recommend enhanced incentive practices based on models from other states, potentially employing new approaches in incentive structuring.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by strengthening emergency services, although its primary focus is on personnel support.

Title: University System of Maryland - Board of Regents - Quasi-Endowment Funds
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland to make transfers of not more than $150,000,000 subject to certain conditions to establish quasi-endowment funds; and authorizing the Board to use investment income produced by quasi-endowment funds in accordance with the University System of Maryland Policy on Endowment Fund Spending Rule to provide need-based student financial aid.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the University System of Maryland's Board of Regents to establish and fund quasi–endowment funds through transfers of up to $150 million from the State Treasurer. The investment income generated by these funds can be used to support need–based student financial aid, with specific restrictions and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland, Board of Regents
stakeholders: Students attending the University of Maryland, especially those receiving need–based financial aid
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a quasi–endowment fund model that allows the university to leverage investment income from transferred funds specifically for need-based financial aid, which is a relatively innovative financial strategy among public university funding models.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By funding need–based financial aid through investment income from quasi–endowment funds, the bill has the potential to significantly reduce child poverty by increasing financial access to higher education.

Title: Business Regulation - Home Improvement Commission - Guaranty Fund and Award Limits
Synopsis: Increasing the funding level of the Home Improvement Guaranty Fund that is administered by the Home Improvement Commission from $250,000 to $1,000,000; increasing a certain Fund threshold that determines whether a fee is assessed to each contractor; and increasing the limit, from $100,000 to $250,000, on the amount of money the Commission may award from the Fund to all claimants for the acts or omissions of a single contractor, subject to a certain reimbursement to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill increases the funding level and award limits of the Home Improvement Guaranty Fund, which provides compensation to owners harmed by licensed home improvement contractors. It raises the minimum fund balance, modifies assessment fees for contractors, and increases the maximum payouts for claims.
responsible_party: Maryland Home Improvement Commission
stakeholders: Homeowners, licensed home improvement contractors, and claimants seeking compensation for contractor misconduct.
innovative_summary: This program mainly involves regulatory adjustments to funding levels, fees, and limits, with no introduction of new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill’s focus is on contractor regulation and fund management, with no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Restorative Aquaculture Pilot Program
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to establish a Restorative Aquaculture Pilot Program to provide financial incentives to holders of aquaculture leases who maintain the lease in accordance with certain criteria, maintain the restorative conditions for at least 4 years, and meet certain other criteria the Department considers necessary; authorizing a holder of an aquaculture lease who is participating in the Pilot Program to meet certain requirements by shellfish seed planting only; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Restorative Aquaculture Pilot Program in Maryland to provide financial incentives to aquaculture leaseholders who engage in shellfish planting and meet specific environmental and operational criteria over at least four years, aiming to enhance water quality and habitat.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Aquaculture leaseholders, water quality, habitat, and Chesapeake Bay ecosystem
innovative_summary: The program employs financial incentives to promote restorative aquaculture practices focused on environmental benefits, using criteria and metrics aligned with large-scale oyster restoration projects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is primarily environmental and ecological, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Economic Development – Sports Entertainment Facilities – Financing and Construction
Synopsis: Altering the amount of taxable or tax exempt bonds that the Maryland Stadium Authority may issue for certain sports entertainment facilities from $200,000,000 to $220,000,000; altering the entities from which the Authority is required to have received a request for financing and construction management services concerning a sports entertainment facility; altering the entities with which the Authority is required to enter into an agreement before issuing bonds to finance a sports entertainment facility; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the limits on bonds issued for sports entertainment facilities in Maryland, updates the entities required to request and agree upon financing, and details requirements for funding agreements and annual reporting related to these facilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority and the Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Organizations involved in financing, owning, or operating sports entertainment facilities, and the general public who utilize these facilities.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal and procedural rules for financing sports entertainment facilities. It does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty, as it mainly focuses on financing bonds for sports facilities.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages – Manufacturer’s Licenses and Off–Site Permits
Synopsis: Extending the termination date, to June 30, 2024, for provisions relating to the authorization of holders of certain manufacturer's licenses to sell and deliver and to directly ship their own alcoholic beverages products to certain individuals under certain circumstances; establishing the maximum amount of beer and liquor that holders of certain manufacturer's licenses may directly ship to consumers in a calendar year; delaying the effective date for the authorization of certain manufacturer off-site permits to July 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the expiration date of certain laws allowing manufacturer license holders to ship their alcohol directly to consumers, sets limits on the amount of alcohol that can be shipped annually, and implements reporting requirements for these shipments.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol and Tobacco Commission
stakeholders: Manufacturer license holders, consumers who receive shipped alcohol, state regulatory agencies
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates direct-to-consumer alcohol shipping with specific quantity limits and reporting requirements, which is an evolving approach in alcohol regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is primarily regulatory and licensing, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Film Production Activity Income Tax Credit - Alterations and Maryland Entertainment Council
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for the credit against the State income tax for certain film production activities to include documentaries and talk, reality, and game shows; increasing the percentage of total direct costs that qualify for the tax credit; increasing the aggregate amount of tax credit certificates that the Secretary of Commerce may issue for fiscal years 2024 through 2026; establishing the Maryland Entertainment Council to study and make recommendations regarding Maryland's film, television, and entertainment industry; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands and modifies Maryland's film production tax credit to include a wider range of production types, such as documentaries, talk shows, reality shows, and live events, and increases the percentage of costs that qualify for the credit. It also establishes the Maryland Entertainment Council to study and promote the industry, and sets timelines for reporting.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Film, television, and entertainment industry participants, independent film community, local businesses, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill creates a new industry council to develop a strategic plan for Maryland's entertainment industry and expands the film tax credit to include new categories, along with alternative promotional opportunities, leveraging emerging technologies and industry trends.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to create jobs and economic activity in Maryland, which can help reduce child poverty, especially through workforce development.

Title: St. Mary's County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of St. Mary's County, from time to time, to borrow not more than $56,000,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in St. Mary's County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes St. Mary's County to borrow up to $56 million through general obligation bonds to finance various public facilities, including schools, roads, parks, and community buildings, and to issue refunding bonds. It specifies the procedures for issuing, selling, and managing these bonds and mandates that the bonds be repaid through property taxes.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County Commissioners or local government
stakeholders: Residents of St. Mary’s County, including children, families, and local organizations benefiting from the public facilities
innovative_summary: The bill employs traditional bonding and tax funding mechanisms; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by funding essential public facilities that support children's education, health, and recreational needs.

Title: Task Force to Study Solar Incentives
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Solar Incentives to study the types and impact of solar energy incentives and make recommendations regarding measures and incentives needed to ensure that the State meets the solar energy goals established in the State's renewable energy portfolio standard, minority business participation, the creation of good quality jobs, equitable access to renewable energy, and efficient use of land; and requiring the Task Force to submit its report to the General Assembly on or before December 15, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to Study Solar Incentives in Maryland to evaluate various financial incentives and their impact on meeting the state's renewable energy goals, with a focus on equitable access, job creation, and land use.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Solar energy industry, environmental groups, local governments, minority communities, energy consumers
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive task force approach to analyze and recommend incentives, integrating federal and state policies, equity considerations, and land use strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on equitable access and community solar may indirectly benefit low-income communities and reduce child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Land Conservation - Establishment of Goals and Programs (Maryland the Beautiful Act)
Synopsis: Establishing certain goals and programs related to land conservation; establishing the Local Land Trust Revolving Loan Program to provide loans to land trusts to purchase land for conservation purposes; authorizing the Maryland Environmental Trust to exercise certain remedies under certain circumstances; prohibiting a person from making any false statements affecting a Local Land Trust Revolving Loan Program loan; establishing the 40 x 40 Land Conservation Implementation Grant Program to support land conservation goals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes land conservation goals, creates the Local Land Trust Revolving Loan Program and Fund to support land trusts in purchasing land for conservation, and sets programs and funding to advance these goals and other environmental initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Environmental Trust and State of Maryland
stakeholders: Land trusts, local governments, environmental organizations, communities, and landowners involved in land conservation
innovative_summary: The bill employs a revolving loan program and sets ambitious land conservation targets with a dedicated funding structure, using innovative financial mechanisms and strategic planning to meet conservation goals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has moderate potential to influence child poverty through environmental and community benefits resulting from conservation and engagement programs.

Title: Sediment Control Plans, Discharge Permits for Stormwater Associated With Construction Activity, and Notice and Comment Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to review and update specifications for sediment control plans in a certain manner on or before December 1, 2025, and every 5 years thereafter; prohibiting the Department from authorizing the discharge of stormwater associated with construction activity under a general discharge permit unless certain requirements are satisfied; and requiring the Department to take certain public notice and comment actions if a person makes a written request within the public notification period of the permit.
