bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of the Environment to update sediment control plan standards periodically, restricts the use of general permits for stormwater discharges from construction sites over 5 acres unless specific conditions are met, and enhances enforcement and permit requirements to prevent illegal runoff and erosion from construction activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Construction companies, developers, environmental agencies, and residents near construction sites
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a proactive review and update process for sediment control standards and improves permit enforcement measures, integrating stakeholder consultation and periodic evaluations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly benefits children by protecting water quality and reducing environmental hazards associated with construction runoff.

Title: Charles County - Task Force to Study School Bus Operator Contracts and Wages
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study School Bus Operator Contracts and Wages in Charles County; requiring the Task Force to study issues related to student transportation, bus driver wages, and multiyear contracts for bus contractors in Charles County and to research best practices in surrounding jurisdictions related to the facilitation of student transportation; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the members of the Charles County Delegation to the General Assembly on or before September 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a task force to study school bus operator contracts and wages in Charles County, and considers the Charles County Board of Education as a joint employer of school bus contractor employees for certain matters.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: School bus contractors, their employees, Charles County Public Schools students and families, and transportation workers in Charles County.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative, multistakeholder approach and considers shared employment responsibilities, which is somewhat innovative in transportation labor relations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving transportation conditions and wages for bus drivers, which can benefit students.

Title: Local Procurements - Minority Business Enterprise Utilization Programs - Certification
Synopsis: Requiring that a county or municipality that operates a minority business enterprise utilization program for county or municipal procurements and has a process for the certification of minority business enterprises shall accept as certified a person that holds a certification as a minority business enterprise by the State certification agency.
bill_summary: The bill requires counties and municipalities in Maryland that have minority business enterprise programs to accept certifications from the state certification agency as valid for their programs.
responsible_party: Maryland State Certification Agency and local government procurement offices
stakeholders: Minority business enterprises and local government procurement departments
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes certification acceptance across local governments by recognizing state certifications, streamlining the process for minority businesses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Port of Deposit State Historical Park - Planning
Synopsis: Altering composition of the stakeholder advisory committee to advise the Department of Natural Resources on the scope and management of Port of Deposit State Historical Park; requiring the Department to make a certain report to the General Assembly on or before September 1, 2024; extending the deadline for the Bainbridge Development Corporation to transfer certain property to the Department to June 1, 2025; authorizing the Governor to include in the State budget an appropriation of at least $400,000 for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Port of Deposit State Historical Park as a partnership park focused on educating the public about Black American history and preserves significant archaeological and historical sites within a designated area transferred from the Bainbridge Development Corporation, including conducting archaeological surveys and soil studies.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Residents, historians, archaeologists, and the general public interested in Maryland's history and cultural preservation
innovative_summary: The program employs a partnership model for park management and includes new archaeological surveys, soil studies, and community advisory committees to shape the historic site.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, but it promotes cultural heritage and education which can have a long-term positive societal impact.

Title: Fire, Rescue, or Emergency Medical Services Entities - Peer Support Programs
Synopsis: Altering the defined term "peer support counseling program" for peer services offered to fire, rescue, or emergency medical services members to be "peer support program"; and requiring peer support programs to be evidence-based.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the terminology, requirements, and confidentiality rules for peer support programs provided to fire, rescue, and emergency medical services members. It mandates the development of a report on best practices and standards for these programs.
responsible_party: Behavioral Health Administration, Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Fire, rescue, and emergency medical services personnel in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes evidence-based peer support programs, training standards, and confidentiality measures, but does not introduce entirely new technological approaches or innovative service models.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill directly targets mental health support for emergency services personnel, which can indirectly impact child poverty by improving family well-being.

Title: Insurance – Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund – Assessments
Synopsis: Altering the formula for the calculation of certain assessments by the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund; requiring the Board of Trustees of the Fund, under certain circumstances, to authorize the Fund to withdraw certain amounts from the money held by the Fund from a prior overassessment; prohibiting members of the Industry Automobile Insurance Association from being subject to an annual assessment under certain circumstances; requiring in a certain fiscal year that additional funds be allocated to the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the assessment process and funding allocations for the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund, including establishing procedures for withdrawing surplus funds and adjusting assessments for insurance industry members.
responsible_party: Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund and its Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Automobile insurance industry members, policyholders, and uninsured motorists in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new procedures for assessing industry surcharges, managing overassessment surplus funds, and allocating penalties, enhancing financial management and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on insurance assessment reforms does not directly target child poverty, but could indirectly affect households through insurance industry financial stability.

Title: Preserve Telehealth Access Act of 2023
Synopsis: Extending to June 30, 2025, the inclusion of certain audio-only telephone conversations under the definition of "telehealth" for the purpose of certain provisions of law relating to reimbursement and coverage of telehealth by the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations; requiring the Maryland Medical Health Care Commission to study and make recommendations regarding the delivery of health care services through telehealth by December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the inclusion of audio-only telephone conversations under the definition of telehealth for Maryland's Medicaid and insurance reimbursements until 2025, mandates reimbursement for telehealth services at the same rate as in-person services, and requires a state agency to study the delivery and payment of telehealth services for future recommendations.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients, health care providers, insurance companies, residents utilizing telehealth services
innovative_summary: The bill promotes expanded access to telehealth by extending reimbursement to audio-only telehealth and studying payment parity issues, integrating technology to improve health care delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By expanding telehealth access and reimbursement, the program could improve health outcomes for low-income and underserved populations, potentially reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Video Lottery Operation License - Renewal
Synopsis: Altering the number of years before the end of the term of a video lottery operation license that a licensee is required to provide certain notice of intent to renew the license and is authorized to apply for renewal; providing for the term of a renewed license; requiring the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to renew a certain license unless the Commission makes a certain finding; requiring the Commission, under certain circumstances, to provide a licensee a certain hearing; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the renewal process for video lottery operation licenses in Maryland. It adjusts notice and application periods, renewal terms, and fee payments, and specifies the distribution of proceeds from video lottery terminals, including allocations to the Education Trust Fund.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Video lottery licensees and the Education Trust Fund
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing and revenue distribution policies; it does not employ new technologies or novel approaches to government service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect, mainly through funding allocations to the Education Trust Fund.

Title: Human Relations - Civil Rights Enforcement - Powers of the Attorney General
Synopsis: Authorizing the Attorney General to investigate, prosecute, and remediate certain civil rights violations under certain circumstances and in a certain manner; authorizing the Attorney General to intervene in certain causes of action under certain circumstances; establishing certain penalties and authorizing the Attorney General to obtain certain relief in certain civil actions, conciliation agreements, and settlement agreements; authorizing the Attorney General to recover certain investigation and litigation costs in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Attorney General to investigate, prosecute, and remediate civil rights violations, establish enforcement and coordination procedures with the Maryland Commission on Civil Rights, and create a Civil Rights Enforcement Fund to support these activities.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, particularly individuals affected by civil rights violations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces enhanced authority for the Attorney General to proactively enforce civil rights laws, establish a dedicated enforcement fund, and coordinate with the civil rights commission, employing a comprehensive and collaborative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by ensuring civil rights protections and promoting equitable treatment, which can benefit children and families.

Title: Towing or Removal of Vehicles - Reclamation Hours
Synopsis: Limiting, to at a minimum from 6 a.m. to midnight, the hours during which a certain person in possession of a vehicle that has been towed or removed from a parking lot is required to provide an opportunity for the vehicle owner or the owner's agent to retake possession of the vehicle; and altering a certain signage requirement imposed on the owner or operator of a parking lot relating to hours during which a towed vehicle may be reclaimed.
bill_summary: The bill limits the hours during which vehicle owners or their agents can retake possession of a towed vehicle to between 6 a.m. and midnight, 7 days a week, and adjusts signage requirements for parking lot owners regarding reclamation hours.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local parking authority
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, parking lot operators, towing companies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces updated regulations on towing and vehicle reclamation hours, emphasizing customer access and signage requirements, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly modifies towing and reclamation regulations for parking lots.

Title: Department of Service and Civic Innovation and Maryland Corps Program Service Year Option Pathways - Established (Serving Every Region Through Vocational Exploration Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing the Department of Service and Civic Innovation; providing that the purpose of the Department is to promote service and volunteerism in the State; establishing the Secretary of Service and Civic Innovation and the duties and responsibilities of the Secretary; altering the provisions of the Maryland Corps Program, including requiring the Department to administer the Program; establishing the Young Adult Service Year Option Pathway Fund; providing for the purposes, use, administration, and contents of the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Department of Service and Civic Innovation, creates the Maryland Service Year Program with two pathways (Young Adult Service Year and Maryland Service Year), allocates funds for stipends, scholarships, and program growth, and involves agencies and organizations in promoting service opportunities to address community challenges.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Service and Civic Innovation
stakeholders: Recent high school graduates, young adults, community organizations, state and local governments, and underrepresented populations in education and employment
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive framework for a statewide service year programs with focus on workforce development, community impact, and diversification, including new pathways, coordinated funding, and evaluation mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by providing service opportunities, training, and support for vulnerable youth and underrepresented communities.

Title: Maryland National Guard - Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program - Establishment (Health Care for Heroes Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing the Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program in the Military Department for the Department to award grants to reimburse certain members of the National Guard for the cost of premiums for certain health care and dental care plans; and requiring the Department to adopt regulations to administer and implement the program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program for members of the Maryland National Guard, providing grants to reimburse certain health and dental care premiums.
responsible_party: Maryland Military Department
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland National Guard and their families
innovative_summary: The program introduces a financial assistance initiative specifically targeting health and dental premium costs for National Guard members, utilizing government grants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct potential to impact child poverty.

Title: Fair Wage Act of 2023
Synopsis: Increasing the State minimum wage rate; repealing the authority of the Board of Public Works to temporarily suspend an increase in the minimum wage rate; and repealing the requirement that the Governor's budgets for certain fiscal years include certain provider rate increases.
bill_summary: The bill increases the Maryland minimum wage over several years based on consumer price index growth, adjusts the rates for community service and behavioral health providers, and revises procedures for wage adjustments and rate suspensions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (or equivalent agency responsible for wages and community services)
stakeholders: Low-wage workers, community service workers, behavioral health providers, and the populations they serve
innovative_summary: The bill employs automated, index-based adjustments to minimum wages and provider rates, and establishes a comprehensive rate-setting and review process, integrating economic data and stakeholder input.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing wages for low-income workers and support providers.

Title: Recovery Residence Grant Program – Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Recovery Residence Grant Program within the Maryland Department of Health to award competitive grants to recovery residences to support operations, services, and programs; requiring the Department to establish certain procedures; requiring the annual budget bill to include $500,000 for the Program in each of fiscal years 2024 through 2027; and requiring the Department to submit an annual report to the Governor and General Assembly about the number of grants and the program's grant recipients by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Recovery Residence Grant Program within the Maryland Department of Health to provide funding to support nonclinical, alcohol- and drug-free recovery residences that serve individuals with substance-related and addictive disorders.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Recovery residences, individuals with substance-use disorders, and their support networks in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program uses a structured grant process with specific requirements for recovery residences, including peer support, sobriety policies, and regular testing, combined with annual reporting, which represents a coordinated approach to supporting recovery environments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by supporting stable recovery environments that can benefit families, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Education - Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program - Annual Appropriation
Synopsis: Increasing the appropriation required by the Governor in the annual budget bill for the Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program from $7,550,000 to $12,050,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual funding appropriated for the Maryland Meals for Achievement In–Classroom Breakfast Program from $7,550,000 to $12,050,000, supporting in-classroom breakfast programs in schools across Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students in participating schools, schools implementing the program
innovative_summary: The program provides additional funding to support in-classroom breakfast programs, which is an established approach to increasing access to school meals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By increasing access to breakfast, the program has the potential to reduce child hunger, which can help decrease child poverty.

Title: Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the name of a recipient from the Goodwill Excel Center to the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City; and requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $500,000 to the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City for each of fiscal years 2024 and 2025.
bill_summary: The bill provides a $500,000 appropriation in the annual budget for each of fiscal years 2024 and 2025 to support the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Students and job trainees at the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill mainly allocates funding for an existing center; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a potential to reduce child poverty by supporting workforce development and educational opportunities.

Title: Residential Property - Service Agreements - Prohibitions
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain service agreement for maintenance, purchase, or sale of residential property from containing certain provisions; and prohibiting the recordation of service agreements prohibited under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill restricts the duration of exclusive listing agreements in real estate to one year, prohibits certain service agreements related to residential property from being recorded if they violate new rules, and establishes reporting requirements for the Real Estate Commission on these topics.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate owners, buyers, sellers, and service providers involved in residential property transactions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new legal restrictions on the duration of agreements and recordation of service contracts, and introduces reporting on their use and impact, which can be seen as a new approach to regulating real estate transactions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential to impact child poverty is indirect and limited, primarily through stabilizing housing arrangements.

Title: Behavioral Health Care Coordination Value-Based Purchasing Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Behavioral Health Value-Based Purchasing Pilot Program in the Maryland Department of Health to establish and implement an intensive care coordination model using value-based purchasing in the specialty behavioral health system; requiring the Governor, for fiscal years 2025 through 2027, to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $600,000 for the Pilot Program; and requiring the Department to report by November 1, 2027 on the findings and recommendations from the Pilot Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a 3-year pilot program in Maryland to improve behavioral health care through intensive care coordination and value-based purchasing, aiming to reduce hospital and emergency department utilization for individuals at risk.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Adults with behavioral health conditions at risk of hospitalization or emergency visits in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program uses a new approach by integrating value-based purchasing with care coordination for behavioral health, utilizing electronic health records and data exchange.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve behavioral health outcomes and reduce crises, which can help mitigate factors contributing to child poverty, though its direct impact is indirect.

Title: Public Health - Parkinson's Disease - Advisory Committee and Website
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Parkinson's Disease Registry Advisory Committee; requiring the Committee to meet quarterly beginning on July 1, 2023; requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in collaboration with the State-designated health information exchange, to establish and maintain a website with certain information related to Parkinson's disease by October 1, 2023; and requiring the Committee to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on recommendations for establishing a fully functional State Parkinson's Disease Registry.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Parkinson's Disease Advisory Committee and a public website to collect and disseminate data on Parkinson's Disease and related disorders in Maryland. It mandates data collection, sets confidentiality protocols, and requires regular reporting on the prevalence of Parkinson's Disease in the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease and related disorders, healthcare providers, researchers, and the general public in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive state-level registry and a public, accessible website for tracking Parkinson's Disease prevalence, with data privacy measures and collaboration with national and local entities, leveraging health information exchanges and online dissemination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on disease data collection and public awareness.

Title: Labor and Employment - Noncompete and Conflict of Interest Provisions - Application of Prohibition
Synopsis: Altering the application of the prohibition on including a noncompete or conflict of interest provision in an employment contract or similar document or agreement that restricts the ability of an employee to enter into employment with a new employer or to become self-employed in the same or similar business or trade.
bill_summary: The bill restricts the use of noncompete and conflict of interest provisions in employment contracts for employees earning up to 150% of the Maryland minimum wage, rendering such provisions null and void.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees earning up to 150% of the minimum wage in Maryland and their employers
innovative_summary: This bill introduces a legal restriction on noncompete clauses for a large portion of the workforce, potentially expanding workers' mobility and reducing employer restrictions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could help reduce child poverty by increasing employment flexibility and opportunities for low- to moderate-income workers.

Title: Surplus Military Equipment Reporting - Extension
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of State Police to submit a report to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before February 1 each year relating to the acquisition of equipment by law enforcement agencies through surplus programs; and requiring the Department of State Police to include on its public website in a prominent location a link to a certain report.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of State Police to report annually on law enforcement agencies' acquisition of surplus military equipment and to publicly share a link to a federal report detailing such transfers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes reporting and public transparency regarding military surplus equipment transferred to law enforcement, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education - Virtual Education
Synopsis: Requiring a teacher preparation program to include certain training related to teaching in a virtual learning environment as a component of instruction; providing that a county board of education may authorize a county superintendent of schools, under certain circumstances, to provide virtual education days to students instead of closing the public schools in the county because of severe weather conditions; altering the requirements for virtual schools established by a county board of education; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates virtual education training for teachers, authorizes virtual education days during severe weather, and establishes standards and plans for virtual schools and emergencies, including during prolonged states of emergency. It also requires the expansion of digital infrastructure and study of virtual education best practices.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, teachers, school districts, families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive standards, planning, and infrastructure support for virtual education, as well as a study group to improve online learning quality, making it a significant step in digital government and education innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on equitable access, online learning supports, and community engagement has high potential to reduce child poverty by improving educational opportunities for underserved populations.

Title: Gaming - Sports Wagering - Independent Evaluation of Sports Wagering Content and Sports Wagering Facility Application Amendments
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to identify and license certain independent evaluators to evaluate and rate certain sports wagering content provided by sports wagering experts, sports wagering influencers, and content partners; authorizing the Commission and the Sports Wagering Application Review Commission to consider a request to amend a Class B-2 sports wagering facility license application for the purpose of altering the proposed location of the facility under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for evaluating sports wagering content in Maryland by licensing independent evaluators, setting standards for sports wagering content, and requiring licensed operators to contract with these evaluators. It also modifies application amendment considerations for certain sports wagering licenses.
responsible_party: Maryland Lottery and Gaming Control Commission and the Sports Wagering Application Review Commission
stakeholders: Sports wagering licensees, sports wagering content creators, consumers of sports betting content in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the licensing and regulation of independent evaluators to assess and rate sports wagering content, employing a structured, standardized process to ensure content integrity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's focus on content evaluation does not directly impact child poverty but may improve the integrity of sports wagering content within the state.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Members - Appointment
Synopsis: Requiring that the members of the Health Services Cost Review Commission be appointed with the advice and consent of the Senate of Maryland.
bill_summary: This bill requires that the members of the Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission be appointed with the advice and consent of the Maryland Senate.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission and the health care industry in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes appointment procedures, with no new services or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Historic St. Mary's City Commission Reform Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law governing the Historic St. Mary's City Commission, including laws relating to membership of the Commission, appointment of certain officers, Commission meeting times, and duties; and specifying the process for the Commission to collaborate with an affiliated nonprofit organization.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the governance, membership, and collaboration processes of the Historic St. Mary’s City Commission, including establishing policies for collaboration with the affiliated nonprofit organization, the Historic St. Mary’s City Foundation, and sets reporting and auditing requirements.
responsible_party: Historic St. Mary’s City Commission and St. Mary’s College of Maryland
stakeholders: Historians, archaeologists, educators, local community, students, and visitors to Historic St. Mary’s City
innovative_summary: The bill promotes collaboration between government and nonprofit organizations through formal policies and joint programs, and enforces transparency and auditing measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly support educational and community development initiatives.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System – City of Bowie Police Department – Transfers and Purchases of Service
Synopsis: Authorizing a transfer of service credit to, and a purchase of service credit in, the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for local law enforcement officers of the City of Bowie Police Department hired on or after January 1, 2007, and not later than December 31, 2015, under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill allows certain police officers of the City of Bowie hired between 2007 and 2015 to transfer or purchase service credit in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, under specific conditions, by December 31, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Law enforcement officers of the City of Bowie hired between 2007 and 2015
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a temporary window for service credit transfer and purchase, with some provisions allowing flexibility outside usual requirements, which is somewhat innovative for pension management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal, as it primarily concerns pension service credits of police officers.

Title: Maternal Mortality Review Program - Local Teams - Access to Records
Synopsis: Requiring certain health care providers and health care facilities to provide to the local team, on request of the chair, prompt access to all relevant medical records associated with a case under review by the Maternal Mortality Review Program without undue delay; and providing that certain provisions of law related to the confidentiality of medical records do not apply to certain disclosures made to a local team.
bill_summary: The bill enhances access to medical records and information for local maternal mortality review teams, allowing them immediate access to relevant records and information from healthcare providers, facilities, and government agencies to facilitate the review of maternal deaths.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Healthcare providers, health care facilities, local maternal mortality review teams, women whose deaths are reviewed
innovative_summary: The bill employs a more direct and immediate access approach for review teams to gather essential information, streamlining the review process and potentially improving maternal health outcomes through better data access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program indirectly supports maternal health and can help reduce child poverty by improving maternal mortality review processes, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Electronic Health Networks and Electronic Medical Records - Nursing Homes - Release of Records
Synopsis: Authorizing a nursing home that contracts with or uses an electronic health information network or electronic medical record vendor to direct the network or vendor to release electronic medical records and electronic health care transactions to a business associate of the nursing home.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes nursing homes that contract with or use electronic health networks or medical record vendors to direct those vendors to release electronic medical records and health care transactions to their business associates, with the patient or their representative's consent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or designated health information exchange
stakeholders: Nursing homes, patients, healthcare providers, electronic health record vendors
innovative_summary: The bill facilitates data sharing between nursing homes and their business associates by allowing direct release of records in standardized electronic formats, enhancing health information exchange and data accessibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily deals with electronic health record sharing and privacy rules.

Title: Public Safety - State Disaster Recovery Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the State Disaster Recovery Fund to provide disaster recovery assistance to units of local government for individuals and families and for the repair, restoration, reconstruction, or replacement of public facilities, low-interest or no-interest loans to businesses and nonprofits when a federal disaster declaration is not received, and disaster-related assistance for the unmet needs of individuals and families after a federal disaster declaration or in the event of a certain denial of federal assistance; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the State Disaster Recovery Fund as a nonlapsing fund to provide disaster-related assistance when federal disaster declarations are not received, and modifies related accounts to support disaster response and recovery efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Residents, local and state government entities, businesses, and non-profits affected by disasters
innovative_summary: The program introduces a dedicated, perpetual state-funded disaster recovery fund that operates independently of federal disaster aid and includes provisions for transparent reporting and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to reduce child poverty by providing timely disaster assistance to vulnerable families and communities, especially when federal aid is unavailable.

Title: Real Estate - Real Estate Brokerage Services and Termination of Residential Real Estate Contracts (The Anthony Moorman Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a real estate broker or an escrow agent, if a purchaser terminates a certain transaction under certain circumstances, to distribute trust money to the purchaser within 30 days after a certain written notice of the termination is sent; requiring a holder of trust money who makes a certain distribution to notify the seller and purchaser of the distribution within a certain period of time, subject to a certain exception; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules for the distribution of trust money in real estate transactions, including rights of purchasers to reclaim funds upon termination of a transaction, and creates procedures for disputes over trust money. It also clarifies responsibilities of escrow agents and real estate brokers in holding and distributing trust funds.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing and Regulation or relevant real estate regulatory authority
stakeholders: Real estate buyers, sellers, real estate brokers, escrow agents, and the general public involved in residential real estate transactions
innovative_summary: The program employs a detailed dispute resolution process involving written notices, mediation, and court actions for the handling of trust money, as well as clear rules for trust fund distribution upon transaction termination, making use of structured notification and dispute mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily improving transaction transparency and dispute resolution in real estate.

Title: Annual Corrective Bill
Synopsis: Correcting certain errors or omissions in certain articles of the Annotated Code; clarifying language; correcting certain obsolete references; reorganizing certain sections of the Annotated Code; providing that this Act is not intended to affect any law other than to correct technical errors; and providing for the correction of certain errors and obsolete provisions by the publishers of the Annotated Code.
bill_summary: This bill is an annual correction bill that primarily makes technical and grammatical corrections, updates cross-references, and clarifies language in various articles of the Maryland Annotated Code to ensure accuracy and consistency.
responsible_party: Publishers of the Annotated Code of Maryland and the Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Government agencies, legal professionals, and the general public relying on accurate legal references and language
innovative_summary: The bill employs a standard legal housekeeping approach, focusing on technical corrections rather than creating new services or programs, with limited innovation in government processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not include programs or initiatives directly targeting child poverty, but may have indirect benefits through improved legal and administrative clarity.

Title: Home Amenity Rentals - Sales and Use Tax Imposed and Local Tax Authorized
Synopsis: Applying the sales and use tax to a sale or use of certain home amenity rentals; and authorizing a county or municipality to impose a certain home amenity rental tax under certain circumstances and subject to certain limitations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to impose a local tax on home amenity rentals, which are short-term rentals of certain parts of residential properties occupied for no more than 15 hours at a time. It defines key terms, sets maximum tax rates, and establishes procedures for implementing these taxes, effective from July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and municipalities implementing the home amenity rental tax
stakeholders: Residents, property owners, and visitors using home amenity rentals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a localized tax on short-term home rentals, leveraging existing digital platforms and local governance to generate revenue.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty, but it could potentially increase local revenue that may be used for social programs.

Title: Department of Natural Resources' Real Property - Exchange With Private Real Property
Synopsis: Authorizing the State to exchange real property owned by the State for the use and benefit of the Department of Natural Resources with private real property under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to exchange certain real properties owned by the State with private real properties under specific conditions, avoiding some usual procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: State-owned land, private landowners, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined process for certain land exchanges between the State and private owners, potentially increasing efficiency in land management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or related social issues.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Military Service Credit
Synopsis: Authorizing members of the State Retirement and Pension System to receive service credit at the rate of 4 months for each full year of attendance at a United States service academy that interrupts the member's employment, not to exceed a total of 16 months.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes members of the Maryland State Retirement System to receive credit for military service, including attendance at U.S. service academies, and specifies rules for credit transfer and application.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement System who have military service or attended U.S. service academies
innovative_summary: The program employes existing systems of military service credit recognition, with specific rules for attendance at U.S. service academies, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting retirement benefits of individual members.

Title: Vehicle Laws – Certificate of Title – Surviving Spouse
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Motor Vehicle Administration from charging a fee for the issuance of a new certificate of title to a surviving spouse under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration from charging a fee for issuing a new certificate of title to a surviving spouse of a vehicle owner, in certain circumstances, when ownership is transferred due to the owner's death.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Surviving spouses of vehicle owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy change to eliminate a fee for a specific group, which is a straightforward legal adjustment rather than an innovative program employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily affects estate and vehicle title transfer procedures for surviving spouses.

Title: Public Safety - Deputy State Fire Marshal - Probationary Status and Promotion
Synopsis: Requiring a certain deputy State fire marshal to be on probation for a period of 2 years after the date of appointment to the Office of the State Fire Marshal under certain circumstances; and specifying the pay that a certain deputy State fire marshal is entitled to on promotion.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a probation period of 2 years for deputy State fire marshals after their appointment, and clarifies the pay and steps for promotions within the police and fire marshal ranks.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Deputy State Fire Marshals, police employees, State Police communications staff, and the public they serve
innovative_summary: The bill mainly makes rule changes regarding probation and pay designations; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Public Health - Youth Camps, Development Organizations, and Programs - Criminal History Records Checks
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to apply to the Criminal Justice Information System Central Repository for criminal history records checks for certain youth camp applicants; requiring that the Department issue a certain written determination to a youth camp within 3 business days; repealing the authority of youth development organizations and programs to request from the Department a determination of whether the results of a criminal history records check would prohibit the hiring of a job applicant; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that the Maryland Department of Health conduct criminal record checks for youth camp applicants and provide determinations on whether their criminal history would prevent employment. It also repeals some previous authorities of organizations to request such determinations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Youth camp applicants, youth camps, and organizations involved in youth development
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a formal process for criminal background checks and determinations for youth camp staff, integrating federal, state, and Maryland data sources to ensure safer environments for minors.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly impact child poverty by improving safety and stability in youth environments, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Commercial Driver's Licenses and Instructional Permits - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the expiration date for a commercial driver's instructional permit held by certain individuals; and exempting a holder of a commercial driver's license who applies for renewal from the requirement to pass a vision test if the holder has a current certificate of physical examination on file with the Motor Vehicle Administration.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland regulations for commercial driver’s licenses and instructional permits, including extending expiration periods and exemptions from vision tests for renewal if certain conditions are met.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Commercial drivers and applicants for commercial driving licenses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill makes specific exemptions for commercial drivers from vision testing requirements if they have a current physical exam on file, which is a targeted regulatory update.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns driver licensing regulations.

Title: State Board of Architects - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Architects in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2028, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Architects in Maryland from 2023 to 2028, ensuring the board continues to operate and regulate architects in the state until then.
responsible_party: Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (or equivalent Maryland agency overseeing the Board of Architects)
stakeholders: Architects and related professionals in Maryland, and the general public seeking architectural services
innovative_summary: This bill primarily focuses on extending existing regulatory authority and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Certified Interior Designers - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Certified Interior Designers in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date of the State Board of Certified Interior Designers from 2024 to 2034, continuing its authority and regulations.
responsible_party: State Board of Certified Interior Designers in the Department of Maryland
stakeholders: Certified interior designers and related industry professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Foresters - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Foresters in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2035, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the termination date of the State Board of Foresters from 2025 to 2035, continuing its existence and regulatory authority.
responsible_party: State Board of Foresters
stakeholders: Foresters and related professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly involves a sunset extension without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2034, ensuring its regulatory authority continues.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects
stakeholders: Landscape architects, prospective landscape architects, and the public receiving landscape architecture services
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body's sunset date, with no new innovative techniques or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Stationary Engineers - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Stationary Engineers in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Stationary Engineers, postponing its termination until July 1, 2034.
responsible_party: State Board of Stationary Engineers
stakeholders: Stationary engineers and related industries in Maryland
innovative_summary: This is primarily a procedural extension with no new technological innovations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Voluntary Cleanup Program - Determination and Recordation Deadlines
Synopsis: Altering determination and recordation deadlines for the Voluntary Cleanup Program.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Voluntary Cleanup Program to extend certain deadlines related to application review, recordation of determinations, and completion certifications from 45 days to 60 days.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Property owners, environmental agencies, and communities involved in environmental cleanup processes
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates procedural deadlines within established environmental cleanup programs without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Public Safety - State Fuel Security Program
Synopsis: Establishing the State Fuel Security Program to be administered and enforced by the Maryland Energy Administration; applying the Program to motor gasoline, middle distillate, propane, certain residential fuel oil, and aviation gasoline; authorizing the Administration, in coordination with the Department of Emergency Management and the Department of Information Technology, to collect, store, and disseminate certain energy-related data for a certain purpose and subject to certain requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the State Fuel Security Program in Maryland to manage energy resources during emergencies, set fuel percentage requirements, and regulate assignments of fuel during energy crises, involving coordination between government departments and energy suppliers.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Energy suppliers, emergency services, public, and essential energy users during energy emergencies.
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured approach to energy emergency management, including data collection, supply prioritization, and enforcement mechanisms, employing technological and regulatory innovations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential exists for improved energy security and supply stability, which may help mitigate impacts on vulnerable populations, but direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Horse Racing - Extension of Maryland Horse Racing Act and Establishment of Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority
Synopsis: Extending the termination date of the Maryland Horse Racing Act from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2034; establishing the Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority; establishing the Maryland Racing Operations Fund to assist the Authority in financing the acquisition, construction, rehabilitation, or other expenses for thoroughbred racetracks in the State; authorizing the Maryland Stadium Authority to transfer money from the Racing and Community Development Facilities Fund to the Maryland Racing Operations Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the Maryland Horse Racing Act's termination date to 2034, establishes the Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority, creates the Maryland Racing Operations Fund, and makes provisions for funding, development, and regulation of horse racing facilities in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority
stakeholders: Thoroughbred horse racing industry, racetrack operators, horse trainers, local communities near racetracks, and state government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the creation of a new state authority to oversee and promote thoroughbred racing and establish dedicated funds and development initiatives, representing a coordinated approach to modernizing the industry.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to reduce child poverty through industry growth and community development initiatives associated with racetrack improvements.

Title: Income Tax - Credit for Federal Security Clearance Costs - Alterations
Synopsis: Reestablishing a time period of taxable years from December 21, 2022, to January 1, 2028, for a credit against the Maryland income tax for certain costs incurred by employers to obtain federal security clearances for employees, rent certain spaces, and construct or renovate certain sensitive compartmented information facilities in the State; limiting eligibility for the income tax credit to individuals or corporations that employ not more than 500 employees; and applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: This bill reestablishes and modifies a tax credit program for employers who incur expenses related to federal security clearances, including costs for securing clearances, renting space, and constructing or renovating sensitive facilities, with a focus on small businesses and companies with up to 500 employees.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Employers seeking federal security clearances and related facilities in Maryland, especially small businesses and security contractors.
innovative_summary: The program provides targeted tax credits for security clearance-related expenses, which is a traditional approach to incentivizing business activities, with no indication of employing new technologies or novel government methodologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty, as it is focused on specific business and security clearance costs.

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation – Mandatory Retirement Age – Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the mandatory retirement age for the Director of the State Department of Assessments and Taxation and the supervisor of assessments for a county.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the mandatory retirement age of 70 for the Director of the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and for county assessors, allowing them to serve beyond age 70.
responsible_party: State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Assessors, tax professionals, and the public relying on assessments and tax services
innovative_summary: The bill removes a long-standing mandatory retirement age, allowing experienced tax officials to continue working beyond age 70.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may influence public service continuity.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Electronic Copies Fee - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a $1-per-page fee for electronic copies of certain documents recorded or filed with the State Department of Assessments and Taxation.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the $1 per page fee previously charged for electronic copies of documents filed with the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Companies, organizations, and individuals obtaining electronic copies of filed documents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill eliminates a fee for electronic copies of documents, simplifying access to information and reducing costs for the public and businesses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns fees for document copies.

Title: Health Insurance Carriers - Requirements for Internal Grievance Process - Modification
Synopsis: Altering the process by which a health insurance carrier is required to provide notice of an adverse decision in nonemergency cases under the internal grievance process established by the carrier for its members.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the internal grievance process for health insurance carriers in Maryland, requiring them to inform members of adverse decisions via phone or other expedited means and to provide detailed written notices within five days, including specific reasons, references, and contact information.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Health insurance members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new communication methods such as text, email, online portals, and expedited means to inform members of adverse decisions, enhancing transparency and responsiveness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill likely has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on improving insurance grievance processes.

Title: Insurance - Product and Service Offerings
Synopsis: Authorizing certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to offer and provide certain products or services in conjunction with a policy at no charge or at a discounted price under certain circumstances; and prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from increasing a premium or denying a claim of a policyholder if the policyholder accepts, rejects, uses, or fails to use a certain product or service.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to offer products or services at no charge or discounted prices under certain conditions, and prohibits increasing premiums or denying claims based on the acceptance or use of these products or services. It establishes rules around offering health-related products to educate or improve health, and ensures they are available to all policyholders.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Insurance policyholders in Maryland, particularly those purchasing health insurance products
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an approach to integrate health-related educational and wellness services directly with insurance policies, allowing for discounted or free products aimed at health promotion, without adverse premium or claims effects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving health outcomes through preventive services and educational products included with insurance policies.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date of the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists from July 1, 2023, to July 1, 2026, thereby continuing its existence and functions.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in the Department of Health
stakeholders: Psychologists and licensure applicants in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill does not introduce new technology or innovative approaches; it mainly extends the existing authority of the Board.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners in Maryland to July 1, 2025, thereby continuing its authority and functions.
responsible_party: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners in the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Physical therapists and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: This is a regulatory extension without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Examiners in Optometry - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners in Optometry in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners in Optometry in Maryland, delaying its termination to July 1, 2026.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners in Optometry, Department of Health
stakeholders: Optometrists, patients needing optometry services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves administrative renewal and continuation of an existing regulatory body, with no new technologies or approaches employed.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals from 2024 to 2027, thereby continuing its authority and functions.
responsible_party: State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals in the Department of Health
stakeholders: Residential child care professionals and children in Maryland's residential care programs
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential indirect impact through improved quality of residential child care services but limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Department of Disabilities - State Coordinator for Autism Strategy and Maryland Commission on Disabilities - Alterations
Synopsis: Transferring the State Coordinator for Autism Strategy to the Department of Disabilities; requiring the Department to provide staff for the Advisory Stakeholder Group on Autism-Related Needs; and altering the membership of the Maryland Commission on Disabilities to add one individual with a traumatic brain injury.
bill_summary: The bill transfers the State Coordinator for Autism Strategy from the Governor's Office to the Department of Disabilities, modifies staffing and membership for relevant disability advisory groups, and aligns program administration.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, autism communities, advocacy organizations, and related public and private service providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill consolidates and streamlines disability and autism services under the Department of Disabilities, promoting better coordination and administration, which can be considered an innovative approach to disability service management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is indirect, as improved disability services can help reduce hardship for families, but the bill primarily focuses on administrative reorganization.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Manufacturers and Dealers - Allocation of Vehicles
Synopsis: Requiring that any system operated by a vehicle manufacturer, distributor, or factory branch or its affiliate for allocating new vehicles to dealers be reasonable and fair.
bill_summary: This bill requires vehicle manufacturers, distributors, and their affiliates to ensure their vehicle allocation systems to dealers are reasonable and fair. It also mandates that, upon request, these manufacturers disclose their allocation methods to dealers and places the burden of proof for compliance on the manufacturers in disputes.
responsible_party: Vehicle manufacturers, distributors, and their affiliates
stakeholders: Vehicle dealers and manufacturers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency and fairness requirements into the vehicle allocation process, promoting fair business practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Access to Counsel in Evictions - Funding
Synopsis: Extending through fiscal year 2027 a requirement that the Comptroller distribute $14,000,000 of certain abandoned property funds to the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund; and extending through fiscal year 2027 a requirement that the Governor include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $14,000,000 from the Fund to the Maryland Legal Services Corporation.
bill_summary: The bill extends funding for the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund, including additional appropriations from the Maryland State budget to support legal representation in eviction proceedings, and clarifies the administration and funding sources of the program.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC)
stakeholders: Individuals facing eviction in Maryland, legal aid organizations, and local jurisdictions implementing access to counsel programs
innovative_summary: The program employs dedicated state funding and integration of settlement funds and unclaimed restitution money to sustainably finance legal access for tenants facing eviction, leveraging state investments and legal processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly reduce child poverty by preventing evictions and stabilizing housing for low-income families.

Title: Security Guard Agencies, Security Guard Employers, and Security Guards – Standards and Certifications
Synopsis: Requiring an individual who provides security guard services to the individual's employer to be certified as a security guard, subject to a certain exception; regulating certain security guard employers; altering the certification and renewal standards for security guards; requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to identify or establish certain training programs for the certification and renewal of certification of security guards; requiring security guards to complete certain security training programs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new certification and training requirements for security guards and agencies in Maryland, including mandatory security guard certification, training programs, and reporting of use of force incidents.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission
stakeholders: Security guards, security guard agencies, security guard employers, and the public receiving security services
innovative_summary: The bill employs new training standards, certification processes, and reporting requirements, integrating law enforcement and private security regulation with technology-based record keeping and training.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to impact child safety and security, indirectly affecting child poverty by improving safety standards.

Title: State Procurement - Liquidated Damages - Policies and Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Public Works, in consultation with the Procurement Improvement Council, to publish a model policy on or before January 1, 2024, concerning the inclusion and use of liquidated damages provisions in procurement contracts; requiring a unit of State government to adopt a written policy that is substantially similar to the Board's policy; requiring a unit that decides not to include a liquidated damages clause under certain circumstances to obtain the approval of the head of unit; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Board of Public Works to publish a model policy on liquidated damages in procurement contracts, and mandates state agencies to adopt policies similar to the model. It defines procedures for including, approving, and reporting on liquidated damages provisions in large procurements, particularly those exceeding certain monetary thresholds, and establishes reporting requirements and documentation processes.
responsible_party: Board of Public Works and State procurement units
stakeholders: State government agencies, contractors, and vendors involved in Maryland state procurements
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a standardized, consultative approach to incorporating liquidated damages in procurement contracts with guidance, reporting, and oversight, leveraging policy development to promote transparency and consistency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily involves procurement policies and contract management procedures.

Title: Offshore Wind Energy - State Goals and Procurement (Promoting Offshore Wind Energy Resources Act)
Synopsis: Requiring an application for any new qualified offshore wind project and a certain proposal for an offshore wind transmission facility to be subject to a certain community benefit agreement; requiring the Public Service Commission to request that PJM Interconnection conduct a certain analysis of transmission system upgrade and expansion options; altering the requirements for a certain report on offshore wind projects; requiring the Commission, by a certain date each year starting in 2024, to report on its Supplier Diversity Program; etc.
bill_summary: This bill sets goals and procedures for developing offshore wind energy in Maryland, including programs for permitting, transmission, procurement, community benefit agreements, workforce participation, and environmental considerations.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission in coordination with the Maryland Department of General Services and other state agencies
stakeholders: Offshore wind project developers, local businesses, minority and veteran-owned businesses, residents, environmental groups, and state agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs an integrated approach including community benefit agreements, regional transmission analysis, competitive solicitations, and workforce and minority business participation, which are innovative approaches in government programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could significantly impact child poverty by promoting local economic development, job creation, and community benefits associated with offshore wind projects.

Title: Preservation and Reuse of Historic Complexes Study and Alterations to the Income Tax Credit for Catalytic Revitalization Projects
Synopsis: Allowing multiple final tax certificates to be issued for a catalytic revitalization project in certain circumstances; and requiring the Smart Growth Subcabinet to study Maryland's historic complexes and make recommendations about an implementation plan to address the preservation and reuse of historic complexes in the State on or before December 31, 2023.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Historic Properties Disposition and Preservation Team within the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, extends the income tax credit for catalytic revitalization projects, and commissions a study on historic complex preservation and reuse in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Owners and developers of historic properties, local communities, and state agencies involved in historic preservation
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated team within the state to manage historic property disposition and support tax credits for revitalization projects, including assessing historic properties and providing a structured approach to preservation and reuse.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited immediate direct impact on child poverty but may contribute to community revitalization and economic development, which can benefit low-income families.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Registered Domestic Partnerships
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for the registration and termination of domestic partnerships with the register of wills; repealing provisions on legitimacy and illegitimacy of children and providing for the parentage of a child born or conceived by registered domestic partners; requiring the register of wills to recognize as domestic partnerships relationships established under the laws of other jurisdictions if the laws are substantially similar to the provisions of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for registering and terminating domestic partnerships, recognizes such relationships for estate and inheritance purposes, and outlines rights and benefits for surviving domestic partners, including inheritance and estate distribution rights.
responsible_party: Maryland Register of Wills and related estate departments
stakeholders: Individuals in registered domestic partnerships, estate beneficiaries, legal system and government agencies involved in probate and inheritance
innovative_summary: The bill uses legal recognition and registration of domestic partnerships to extend estate and inheritance rights, integrating relationships recognized in other jurisdictions into Maryland law.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly deals with estate laws and domestic partnerships.

Title: Economic Development - Cybersecurity - Cyber Maryland Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Cyber Maryland Program in the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to create and execute a talent pipeline that materially reduces workforce vacancies by July 1, 2026, build an advanced cybersecurity workforce, and carry out other purposes related to the cybersecurity workforce in the State; establishing the Cyber Maryland Fund; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 for the Fund in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Cyber Maryland Program to enhance the cybersecurity workforce in Maryland through workforce development, research, and education initiatives, including the creation of a specific fund and a governing board.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Cybersecurity workforce, students in cybersecurity programs, employers in Maryland
