innovative_summary: The program employs a strategic and research-informed approach, with a focus on diversity, innovative workforce development, and industry collaboration. It includes new, coordinated efforts leveraging data analysis and partnerships.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by creating job opportunities and increasing economic stability through workforce development.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and Maryland Department of Health - Health Care and Dental Care Coverage for Undocumented Immigrants - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and the Maryland Department of Health to develop a report comparing options for offering affordable health care and dental care coverage to State residents who are ineligible for the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children's Health Program, qualified health plans, or stand-alone dental plans due to the individuals' immigration status; and requiring the Exchange and the Department to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by October 31, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and the Maryland Department of Health to develop a report comparing options for providing affordable health and dental coverage to undocumented immigrants who are ineligible for existing state health programs due to their immigration status, including different potential populations such as all eligible individuals, those under 21, those over 65, and low-income individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Undocumented immigrants and other residents who are ineligible for current health care programs due to immigration status
innovative_summary: The bill employs a research and policy analysis approach, which is a typical government planning process, rather than a new technology or innovative intervention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on providing new health coverage options could indirectly impact child poverty by improving access to healthcare for vulnerable populations.

Title: Natural Resources - Annual State Park Pass - Discounts for Law Enforcement Officers and First Responders
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to provide a discount of at least $40 on annual State park passes for all first responders and law enforcement officers who are Maryland residents.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to offer at least a $40 discount on annual State park passes to Maryland-resident first responders and law enforcement officers.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: First responders and law enforcement officers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill implements a straightforward discount program for first responders and law enforcement officers, which is a traditional approach and not employing new technologies or novel strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly support child well-being by providing benefits to responders and officers, but it does not have a direct focus on child poverty.

Title: Environmental Health Specialists and Well and Septic Systems Permitting - Studies (Environmental Health Systems Support Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment and the Maryland Department of Health, in conjunction with the Board of Environmental Health Specialists, to conduct a study on staffing needs for environmental health specialists in local health departments; requiring the Department of the Environment, in consultation with the Department of Legislative Services and the University of Maryland Agriculture and Food Systems Extension Program, to study the delegation of well and septic systems permitting authority; etc.
bill_summary: The bill develops standardized permit forms for on-site sewage systems, enhances staffing and tracking systems, and establishes a loan forgiveness program for environmental health specialists, along with studies on staffing needs and permitting delegation.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Environmental health specialists, local health departments, residents requiring sewage systems, students in environmental health programs
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology by creating an online tracking system for permits and provides loan forgiveness to support staffing and recruitment, representing innovative approaches to environmental health management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's impact on child poverty is indirect but potentially positive through improved environmental health services and recruitment of specialists.

Title: Public Safety - Protecting Against Hate Crimes Grant Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Protecting Against Hate Crimes Grant Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund to make grants to nonprofit organizations, including faith-based organizations, to provide security enhancements to protect against hate crimes; requiring the Executive Director of the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to administer the Fund; and authorizing, for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter, the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Protecting Against Hate Crimes Grant Fund to provide grants to nonprofit and faith-based organizations for security enhancements to prevent hate crimes. It sets aside at least $1,000,000 annually for faith-based organizations and states the program begins in fiscal year 2025 with an allocated budget of $5,000,000.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Nonprofit and faith-based organizations vulnerable to hate crimes, and their communities
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted grants specifically aimed at security for faith and nonprofit organizations, with a dedicated annual funding stream and reporting requirements, representing a proactive approach to hate crime prevention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty indirectly by improving community safety and cohesion, but it is primarily focused on anti-hate crime security enhancements.

Title: Local School Systems - Student Field Trips - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill of $500,000 for the State Department of Education to provide grants to local school systems for expenses related to student field trips to museums of cultural import.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Governor to allocate $500,000 annually in the state budget to provide grants to local school systems for expenses related to student trips to specific museums of cultural import, with reporting requirements on the use of the grants.
responsible_party: State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, schools, and local communities involved in field trips to designated museums
innovative_summary: The bill encourages educational trips to museums of cultural and historical significance, promoting cultural awareness and understanding through government-funded field trips.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve educational experiences for students from diverse backgrounds, which may contribute to reducing disparities and aiding child development.

Title: Libraries - Circulation Records - Inspection, Use, or Disclosure Requirement Revision
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which public, school, college, or university libraries must permit the inspection, use, or disclosure of the circulation record of an individual.
bill_summary: The bill revises laws regarding the circumstances under which libraries in Maryland can permit inspection, use, or disclosure of individual circulation records, including requiring consent or legal order.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education or Libraries
stakeholders: Library users and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing privacy rules for circulation records in libraries; it does not introduce new technologies or unique approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing a Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development to provide vouchers and housing assistance payments for low-income families that are currently on a waiting list under the federal Housing Choice Voucher Program for housing in units approved by the Department or a public housing agency, in accordance with guidelines under the federal program; and requiring the Department and public housing agencies to administer the State Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a statewide rental assistance voucher program in Maryland to provide housing vouchers and payments for low-income families on federal housing program waitlists, managed by the Department of Housing and Community Development and local agencies.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development and public housing agencies
stakeholders: Low-income families, elderly, disabled individuals, foster children, military veterans, and other vulnerable populations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs existing federal guidelines while expanding access to housing assistance for families on waitlists, with enhanced data reporting and coordination between state and local agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for reducing child poverty by providing stable housing to low-income families and vulnerable populations.

Title: Baltimore City - Property Tax - In Rem Foreclosure of Vacant or Nuisance Property
Synopsis: Authorizing certain vacant property or nuisance property located in Baltimore City to be subject to a certain in rem foreclosure process; requiring certain procedures for an in rem foreclosure; requiring Baltimore City to take certain actions to compensate the interested parties in property that has value and is acquired through an in rem foreclosure; specifying the title acquired in an in rem foreclosure; specifying the circumstances under which an in rem foreclosure judgment may be reopened; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Baltimore City to use in rem foreclosure processes to address vacant or nuisance properties. It establishes procedures for filing complaints, notifying interested parties, and conducting sales or transfers of foreclosed properties, including provisions for handling surplus proceeds and potential reopens of foreclosure judgments.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Government or Baltimore City Department of Housing or equivalent agency
stakeholders: Property owners, residents, and community members in Baltimore City, especially those affected by vacant or nuisance properties
innovative_summary: The program employs specialized in rem foreclosure processes for vacant and nuisance properties, including detailed procedures for notices, sales, and distribution of proceeds, integrating legal, administrative, and auction approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to reduce child poverty by revitalizing neighborhoods and improving housing conditions.

Title: Firearm Safety - Storage Requirements and Youth Suicide Prevention (Jaelynn's Law)
Synopsis: Altering a certain provision relating to the storage of firearms and ammunition in a location that can be accessed by an unsupervised child; and requiring the Deputy Secretary for Public Health Services to develop a youth suicide prevention and firearm safe storage guide, with recommendations from a stakeholder committee.
bill_summary: The bill enhances firearm storage laws to prevent access by children and prohibited persons, establishes a youth suicide prevention and firearm safe storage guide, and allocates funds for education and enforcement related to firearm safety.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Public Safety agencies
stakeholders: Families, minors, gun owners, law enforcement, schools, health and social service providers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new state-developed guide on youth suicide prevention and firearm safe storage, and provides grants for related education, incorporating current best practices and stakeholder input to promote safe firearm storage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by reducing firearm-related injuries and suicides among minors, which are linked to economic and social suffering.

Title: State Administrator of Elections - Removal From Office
Synopsis: Altering requirements for the removal from office of the State Administrator of Elections; and repealing the authority of the State Administrator to continue to serve in office until a successor is appointed and confirmed following a certain vote for removal of the State Administrator.
bill_summary: The bill amends the procedures for removing the State Administrator of Elections in Maryland by clarifying the voting requirements and removing the possibility for the Administrator to serve until a successor is confirmed after a removal vote.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Maryland voters and election officials
innovative_summary: The bill updates existing removal procedures without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Social Workers - Sunset Extension, Notification of Complete Application, and Workgroup on Social Worker Requirements for Licensure
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Social Work Examiners in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; establishing the Workgroup on Social Worker Requirements for Licensure to make certain findings and recommendations regarding examination and licensure of social workers in the State; requiring the Workgroup to submit its final report to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Social Work Examiners and establishes a workgroup to review and recommend alternative methods to examinations for social worker licensure, with a focus on reducing bias and increasing fairness.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Social workers, social work students, and applicants seeking licensure in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill includes the formation of a diverse workgroup to explore bias-free assessment alternatives and potentially establish a new state-based competency exam, utilizing innovative approaches for fair licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for reducing barriers to social worker licensure could help address child poverty by increasing access to social services.

Title: Annual Curative Bill
Synopsis: Generally curing previous Acts of the General Assembly with possible title defects; and generally repealing and reenacting without amendments certain Acts of the General Assembly that may be subject to possible title defects in order to validate those Acts.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Fund to provide legal representation in eviction proceedings and authorizes funding and administrative details for the program. It also corrects references in previous legislation and includes a provision regarding fraudulent conduct in driver's license testing.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC) and the Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction, legal service providers, and local governments implementing access to counsel programs.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated legal fund and infrastructure to enhance access to legal representation in eviction cases, which is a progressive approach to legal aid and housing stability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by stabilizing housing for families through legal support.

Title: Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program – Definitions – Therapy Horse
Synopsis: Altering the definition of a "therapy horse" under the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program by changing the definition of a 'therapy horse' to include horses appropriate for interactions with veterans, typically from licensed stables or certified professionals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs or relevant state agency
stakeholders: Veterans in Maryland, therapy horse providers, nonprofit organizations supporting veterans
innovative_summary: The bill broadens the recognized types of therapy horses for veterans, potentially increasing accessibility and personalized therapy options, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to indirectly impact child poverty by supporting veteran well-being, but this effect is not explicit.

Title: Natural Resources - Fishing Licenses and Stamps - Exemptions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to issue an annual fishing license and stamp exemption to governmental entities and nonprofit organizations to provide fishing clinics and instructional opportunities to certain individuals; and altering certain reporting requirements for governmental entities and nonprofit organizations that are issued certain fishing license and stamp exemptions.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue exemptions from fishing license requirements to certain organizations for activities like fishing clinics, events for veterans and underserved populations, and fishing by individuals with disabilities, and specifies reporting and regulatory procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, veterans, underserved communities, organizations conducting fishing clinics, and scientific researchers
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach by enabling organizations to conduct inclusive fishing activities through licensing exemptions, supporting community engagement and scientific research.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially increases access to outdoor activities for underserved and vulnerable populations, which could help mitigate some factors associated with child poverty, but does not directly target child poverty reduction.

Title: Maryland Construction Education and Innovation Fund - Funding - Alteration
Synopsis: Increasing the mandated appropriation that the Governor is required to include for the Maryland Construction Education and Innovation Fund in the annual budget bill from $250,000 to $625,000 for fiscal years 2025 through 2029.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the funding appropriation amounts for the Maryland Construction Education and Innovation Fund, increasing the annual budget for fiscal years 2018 through 2024 and 2025 through 2029. It specifies funding levels to support the operation of the Center associated with the fund.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (Governor's Office and Department of Labor)
stakeholders: Construction industry professionals, students, educational institutions, and communities involved in construction education and innovation
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on adjusting funding levels and does not introduce new or innovative technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it is focused on construction education and innovation funding.

Title: Insurance – Credit for Reinsurance Model Law – Reciprocal Jurisdictions
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Maryland Insurance Commissioner from removing from a certain list of reciprocal jurisdictions created and published by the Commissioner certain jurisdictions located outside the United States and certain jurisdictions in the United States that meet certain accreditation requirements.
bill_summary: The bill restricts the Maryland Insurance Commissioner's ability to remove certain jurisdictions from the list of reciprocal jurisdictions for reinsurance purposes, specifically prohibiting removal of jurisdictions outside the US that meet certain accreditation or international agreements.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Reinsurance companies and insurers operating in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies existing rules and restrictions around the maintenance of the list of reciprocal jurisdictions, rather than establishing new innovative programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Historical Trust - Warner Manor in the Town of Kensington - Extinguishment or Termination of Easement
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Historical Trust, on or before July 1, 2023, to extinguish or terminate a certain easement the Trust holds in the parcel of land known as Warner Manor (also known as Brainard Warner House and/or Circle Manor) in the Town of Kensington, Montgomery County; and requiring the Trust to complete certain necessary recordings and filings to complete the extinguishment or termination of the easement.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Historical Trust to extinguish or terminate a specific easement on Warner Manor in Kensington by July 1, 2023, and to complete necessary legal recordings and filings.
responsible_party: Maryland Historical Trust
stakeholders: Property owners, historical preservation agencies, local government, and the community interested in Warner Manor
innovative_summary: The bill involves legal and administrative procedures to formally terminate a historical easement, which is a standard legal process, not a new technological or innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unrelated to child poverty; it pertains to property law and historical preservation.

Title: Higher Education - Maryland 529 Program - Reform
Synopsis: Abolishing and repealing the Maryland 529 Board; specifying that the State Treasurer is the successor to the Maryland 529 Board; transferring to the Office of the State Treasurer the responsibility for administering the Maryland 529 Program, including the Maryland Prepaid College Trust, the Maryland College Investment Plan, the Maryland Broker-Dealer College Investment Plan, and the Maryland ABLE Program; authorizing and requiring the State Treasurer to take certain actions in administering the Maryland 529 Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms Maryland's higher education savings programs by transferring administration from the Maryland 529 Board to the Office of the State Treasurer, abolishing the Board, and establishing a workgroup to improve the Maryland 529 Prepaid College Trust. It also consolidates and clarifies the operation, funding, and oversight of various college savings plans, including prepaid and investment plans, as well as the ABLE program.
responsible_party: Office of the State Treasurer of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents, including families saving for higher education and individuals with disabilities for the ABLE program
innovative_summary: The bill centralizes and streamlines multiple higher education savings programs under the State Treasurer, introduces new oversight and transparency measures, and establishes a workgroup to improve operations and resolve issues, employing new organizational approaches in government administration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by providing access to affordable higher education savings options and improving program accessibility and transparency.

Title: Anne Arundel County – Alcoholic Beverages Licenses – Residency Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring a certain applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Anne Arundel County to be a resident of the State, rather than the county, when an application for a license is filed; and providing that a certain license is valid only for as long as the resident applicant remains a resident of the State.
bill_summary: The bill requires applicants for alcoholic beverage licenses in Anne Arundel County to be residents of the state of Maryland, and their license is valid only as long as they remain residents of the state.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and licensee businesses in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: This program introduces a residency requirement for license applicants, linking license validity to continued residency, which is a new approach in licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Income Tax - Captive Real Estate Investment Trusts - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "captive REIT" for purposes of a certain addition modification under the Maryland income tax in the amount of the federal dividends paid deduction for captive real estate investment trusts to exclude, under certain circumstances, corporations, trusts, or associations owned or controlled by certain qualified foreign entities and certain trusts owned or controlled by a listed Australian property trust.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland income tax law to specify the definition of "captive REIT" and to modify the calculation of taxable income for certain real estate investment trusts, particularly by excluding certain foreign-controlled trusts and Australian property trusts from specific tax provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office or Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Real estate investment trusts (REITs), foreign entities involved in real estate, and Maryland taxpayers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces targeted modifications to the tax treatment of foreign-controlled real estate investment trusts, including the definition of qualified foreign entities, but does not employ new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily pertains to tax definitions and modifications for specific types of trust entities.

Title: State-Owned Nursing Homes - Deficiencies, Citations, and Fines - Contractor Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring contractors operating State-owned nursing homes to promptly provide notice of certain deficiencies, enforcement actions, citations, and fines to the Governor, the State agency overseeing the nursing home, certain committees of the General Assembly, and members of the General Assembly who represent the district in which the nursing home is located; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires contractors operating State–owned nursing homes in Maryland to promptly inform the state government and relevant committees about deficiencies, citations, and enforcement actions. It mandates annual reporting by the Maryland Department of Health on survey activities and enforcement actions related to these nursing homes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents of State–owned nursing homes, their families, state government officials, and contractors operating the nursing homes.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency requirements for contractors managing State–owned nursing homes by mandating early notification of deficiencies and enforcement actions, and annual public reporting, which enhances governmental oversight and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on oversight of nursing home operations.
